column2: We were deployed here from headquarters to support the Knights of Kaliss.{nl}If you want to know more, head over to our headquarters at Verkti Square.
column3: 칼리스 기사단을 지원하기 위해 본부에서 떨어져 나와 이런 곳에 있습니다.{nl}궁금한 것이 있다면 베르크티 광장에 있는 본부 쪽으로 알아보시기 바랍니다.
column4: Kami dikerahkan ke sini dari headquarters untuk membantu Knights of Kaliss.{nl} Jika Kamu ingin tahu lebih banyak, pergilah ke headquarters kami di Verkti Square.

column2: I've been a merchant all my life. {nl}After Medzio Diena, this seemed like the safest place to be, so I settled here... {nl}But I guess I was wrong.
column3: 전 원래 행상인이었습죠.{nl}신수의 날 이후 여기가 제일 안전한 것 같아서 정착했는데.. 아니었나봅니다요.
column4: Aku sudah menjadi merchant sepanjang hidupku. Setelah Medzio Diena, tampak ini adalah tempat yang paling aman, jadi saya menetap di sini.. Namun perkiraan saya salah.

column2: I've met many Revelators during my travels.{nl}In my opinion... there is something special about them, and it's not just their strength.
column3: 여기저기 떠돌아다니면서 계시자라는 사람들을 많이 만나 봤습죠.{nl}제 생각엔.. 계시자님이 특별한 건 단지 강하기 때문만은 아닐 거라는 겁니다요.
column4: Saya telah bertemu banyak Savior selama perjalanan.{nl} Menurut saya.. ada sesuatu yang spesial mengenai mereka, namun itu bukan hanya semata-mata mereka kuat.

column2: I'm not blaming the goddesses and the priests.{nl}But I think it's too much when they tell us to just trust them and wait.
column3: 여신과 사제님들을 탓하자는 건 아니야.{nl}하지만 무작정 믿고 기다리라는 건 좀 너무한 것 같아.{nl}
column4: Aku tidak menyalahkan Goddess dan para priest.{nl} Tapi kurasa itu terlalu berlebihan ketika mereka mengatakan untuk mempercayai dan menunggu mereka.

column2: The seals in the village are supposed to be sealed - that's why they're called seals, {nl}so what's the big deal? The priests are just trying to scare us for no reason.
column3: 마을에 있는 봉인이 닫혀 있으니까 봉인이지 무슨 대수겠어?{nl}사제님들이 괜히 겁을 주는 거라고 생각해.
column4: Segel di desa seharusnya tersegel - Itu sebabnya mereka disebut segel, jadi apa masalahnya? {nl} Para priest hanya mencoba untuk menakut-nakuti kami tanpa alasan.

column2: The priests don't want everyone to know how important the seals in the village are.{nl}They think that they can just take the burden upon themselves, {nl}and then everything will be alright.
column3: 사제님들은 마을에 있는 봉인이 얼마나 중요한 건지 알게 되길 원치 않으세요.{nl}자신들이 희생하면 그걸로 된 거라면서요.
column4: Para priest tidak ingin semua orang tahu betapa pentingnya segel di desa itu.{nl} Mereka pikir bahwa mereka bisa membebani diri mereka sendiri, dan kemudian semuanya akan baik-baik saja.

column2: Some of the priests want to be truthful and open with the villagers.{nl}At this rate, if something really bad happens...
column3: 사제님들이 마을사람들과 좀 더 솔직한 이야기를 나누었으면 하는 마음도 있어요.{nl}이러다 정말 큰일이라도 벌어진다면..
column4: Beberapa priest ingin jujur dan terbuka kepada warga desa.{nl}Pada saat ini, jika sesuatu yang sangat buruk terjadi..

column2: The evil energy is making this forest decay into a lifeless place.{nl}It is easily the biggest problem this village is facing.
column3: 사악한 기운은 숲을 썩게 만들어 생명이 살아갈 수 없는 땅으로 만들어 버립니다.{nl}저희 마을이 품고 있는 가장 큰 문제이기도 하지요.
column4: Energi jahat membuat hutan rusak dan menjadi tempat tak berpenghuni.{nl} Hal ini adalah masalah terbesar yang desa ini hadapi.

column2: Goddess...{nl}Please tell me the village's seal is really okay...
column3: 여신이시여..{nl}마을의 봉인은 정말 괜찮은 걸까요..
column4: Goddess...{nl} Tolong beritahu saya segel dari desa akan baik-baik saja…

column2: Demons will continue to target the seal and attack endlessly.{nl}With Goddess Austeja still missing, how long will we be able to last...
column3: 앞으로도 봉인을 노리고 마족들이 끊임없이 공격해오겠지요.{nl}아우스테야 여신께서 부재중이신 상태로 언제까지 버틸 수 있을지..
column4: Para demon akan terus mengincar segel dan menyerang tanpa henti.{nl} Dengan Goddess Austeja yang masih menghilang, berapa lama kita akan dapat bertahan..

column2: It was a mistake for us to try to handle this by ourselves.{nl}From now on, we will tell the villagers the whole truth and include them in a {nl}deliberate discussion on how to handle the matter.
column3: 사제들끼리만 일을 해결하려고 했던 저희의 잘못도 큽니다.{nl}이제부턴 마을 사람들에게 모든 사실을 고하고 천천히 논의해 볼 생각입니다.
column4: Ini adalah sebuah kesalahan bagi kami karena kami mencoba menangani hal ini sendiri.{nl} Mulai sekarang, kami akan memberitahu warga desa seluruh kebenaran dan melibatkan mereka dalam diskusi mengenai bagaimana cara menangani masalah ini.

column4: Notice/!/Ketika Kamu menyentuh device, rasanya seolah-olah soul Kamu tersedot keluar!{nl} Kamu mulai merasa lemah dan lebih lemah!

column2: Inspect the Detector
column3: 탐지기 작동 점검
column4: Check the Detector's Functionality

column2: Talk to Kupole Meile
column3: 큐폴 메일레와 대화
column4: Bicara Kepada Kupole Meile

column2: Talk to the Kupole whom you saved from the Petrifying Frost.
column3: 석화서리로부터 구해 준 큐폴과 대화해 보세요.
column4: Bicara kepada Kupole, yang Kamu selamatkan dari Stone Frost.

column2: Examine the Petrification Detectors
column3: 석화 탐지기들을 살펴 보기
column4: Memeriksa Petrification Detectors

column2: Check the detectors in areas you haven't been to yet to help Kupole Meile guide the souls safely from the Petrifying Frost.
column3: 큐폴 메일레가 석화서리로부터 안전하게 영혼들을 인도할 수 있도록 이 지역의, 아직 가보지 않은 곳의 탐지기를 모두 점검 하세요.
column4: Periksa detektor di sekitar, Kamu belum pernah membantu Kupole Meile memandu para soul dari  Stone Frost.

column2: Return to Kupole Meile
column3: 큐폴 메일레에게 돌아가기
column4: Kembali ke Kupole Meile

column2: You checked all 4 detectors except the one at the entrance. Now return to Kupole Meile.
column3: 입구 쪽에 있던 탐지기를 제외한 4개의 탐지기를 모두 조사했습니다. 이제 큐폴 메일레에게 돌아가서 상황을 전해 주세요.
column4: Kamu telah memeriksa ke 4 detektor kecuali satu di entrance. Sekarang kembali ke Kupole Meile.

column2: You have something to say about reactivating the malfunctioning detector. Talk to Kupole Meile again.
column3: 고장난 탐지기를 다시 작동 시키기 위해 전할 말이 있습니다. 큐폴 메일레와 다시 대화하세요.
column4: Kamu memiliki sesuatu untuk mengaktifkan detektor rusak. Bicara kembali dengan Kupole Meile.

column2: Meet with Royal Army Guard Retia
column3: 왕국군 레티아 만나기
column4: Temui Royal Army Guard Retia

column2: Kupole said that the Royal Army installed the petrification detectors. Meet Royal Army Guard Retia at Verkti Square.
column3: 석화탐지기를 설치 한 것은 왕국군이라는 큐폴의 말에 따라 베르크티 광장의 왕국군 장교 레티아를 찾아가 봅시다.
column4: Kupole mengatakan bahwa Kingdom Army memasang petrification detectors. Temui Royal Army Guard Retia di Verkti Square.

column2: Talk some more with Royal Army Guard Retia about the malfunctioning detector at the Coastal Fortress.
column3: 연안요새의 작동하지 않는 석화탐지기에 대해 왕국군 레티아와 대화를 더 나눠보세요.
column4: Bicara lagi dengan Royal Army Guard Retia mengenai detektor yang rusak di Coastal Fortress.

column2: Find a part for the petrification detector
column3: 석화 탐지기 부품 구하기
column4: Cari komponen dari petrification detector

column2: Listen to Royal Army Guard Retia and look for the soldiers that were dispatched to the Coastal Fortress. If something has happened to them, you'll have to retrieve the part for the detector from their corpses. Also, try hunting the monsters in the area.
column3: 왕국군 레티아의 말에 따라, 연안요새로 파견 나간 병사들을 찾아 봅시다. 혹시라도 그들이 사고를 당했다면 시신에서라도 부품을 얻어야 할 것입니다. 또는 그 주변의 몬스터들도 사냥 해 봅시다.
column4: Dengarkan Royal Army Guard Retia dan cari para tentara yang dikirim ke Coastal Fortress. Jika sesuatu terjadi pada mereka, Kamu harus mengambil komponen detektor dari mayat mereka. Dan juga coba buru para monster di area itu.

column2: Meet with Kupole Meile
column3: 큐폴 메일레 만나기
column4: Temui Kupole Meile

column2: Unfortunately, the Royal Army soldiers did not survive, but you were able to collect all the necessary parts for the detector. Now, go tell Kupole what has happened, and then go repair the petrification detector.
column3: 왕국군 병사들은 안타깝게도 변을 당했지만 부품들은 무사히 모두 구했습니다. 이제 석화탐지기를 수리하러 가기 전에 이 사실을 큐폴에게 알려 주세요.
column4: Sayangnya, para prajurit Kingdom Army tidak selamat, namun Kamu dapat mengumpulkan semua komponen yang diperlukan untuk detektor. Sekarang, pergi beritahu Kupole apa yang telah terjadi disini, kemudian pergi perbaiki petrification detector.

column2: Before you go to repair the petrification detector, talk to Kupole Meile about the situation at hand.
column3: 석화 탐지기를 수리하러 가기 전에, 이런 상황에 대해 큐폴 메일레와 대화 해 봅시다.
column4: Sebelum Kamu pergi untuk memperbaiki petrification detector, bicara dengan Kupole Meile tentang situasi yang terjadi.

column2: Repair the Petrification Detector
column3: 석화 탐지기 수리
column4: Memperbaiki Petrification Detector

column2: Repair the first petrification detector that wasn't working.
column3: 작동하지 않았던 첫 번째 석화 탐지기를 수리 하세요.
column4: Memperbaiki First Petrification Detector yang tidak bekerja.

column2: You have defeated all of the monsters that began to attack when you tried to repair the petrification detector. Now you can go back to repairing the petrification detector in peace.
column3: 석화 탐지기를 수리 하려고 하자 달려 든 몬스터들을 모두 물리쳤습니다. 이제 안심하고 석화 탐지기를 수리 할 수 있을 것 같습니다.
column4: Kamu telah mengalahkan semua monster yang menyerang Kamu ketika mencoba untuk memperbaiki petrification detector. Sekarang Kamu bisa kembali memperbaiki petrification detector dengan tenang.

column2: Repair the Third Petrification Detector
column3: 세 번째 석화 탐지기 수리
column4: Memperbaiki Third Petrification Detector

column2: Now go repair the third petrification detector.
column3: 이제 세 번째 석화 탐지기를 수리하러 가세요.
column4: Sekarang pergi perbaiki Third Petrification Detector.

column2: Find Fastening String
column3: 고정할 끈 구하기
column4: Cari Fastening String

column2: You'll need some string to attach and secure the part to the detector. Try hunting some from monsters.
column3: 탐지기의 부품을 달고 잘 고정 시켜 줄 노끈이 필요 할 것 같습니다. 몬스터들로부터 구해 봅시다.
column4: Kamu akan memerlukan beberapa string untuk mengikat dan mengamankan komponen ke detektor. Coba buru beberapa string dari para monster.

column2: You have collected enough string to fasten the part. Now repair the third petrification detector.
column3: 고정 할 끈을 모두 구했습니다. 이제 세 번째 석화 탐지기를  수리 하세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengumpulkan cukup string untuk mengikat komponen. Sekarang perbaiki third petrification detector.

column2: Hunt monsters and collect %s
column3: 몬스터를 사냥하여 %s 구하기
column4: Buru Monster dan kumpulkan %s

column2: Hunt monsters and collect string
column3: 몬스터를 사냥하여 노끈 구하기
column4: Buru Monster dan kumpulkan string

column2: Go let Kupole Meile know that you have repaired all of the petrification detectors.
column3: 석화 탐지기를 모두 수리했습니다. 이 사실을 큐폴 메일레에게 알려 주세요.
column4: Pergi beritahu Kupole Meile bahwa Kamu telah memperbaiki semua petrification detectors.

column2: Examine the Mysterious Device
column3: 수상한 장치 살펴 보기
column4: Memeriksa Device Misterius

column2: As you approach the unknown device, you feel strangely drawn to it and can't help but inch closer. What could this device be? Maybe you'd find out if you try touching it?
column3: 알 수 없는 장치에 다가가면 무언가에 이끌리듯이 그 앞으로 이동하게 됩니다. 과연 이 장치는 무엇일까요. 만져 보면 알 수 있지 않을까요?
column4: Saat Kamu mendekati device yang tidak dikenal, Kamu merasa tertarik dan mencoba untuk mendekatinya. Device apakah ini? Mungkin Kamu akan mengetahuinya bila Kamu menyentuhnya?

column2: Find Svitrigaila
column3: 쉬트리가일라 찾아 가기
column4: Cari Svitrigaila

column2: You begin to feel weaker and weaker, as if your soul is being drained from your body. Find someone who can help you out of this situation.
column3: 영혼이 빠져 나가고 있는 것인지, 점점 기운이 없어지는 것 같습니다. 이 상황을 풀어 줄 누군가를 찾아 보세요.
column4: Kamu mulai merasa lemah dan semakin lemah, seolah-olah soul Kamu terkuras dari tubuh Anda. Cari seseorang yang dapat membantu Kamu keluar dari situasi ini.

column2: His Only Desire
column3: 바라는 것은 오직
column4: His Only Desire

column2: Talk with Svitrigaila
column3: 쉬트리가일라와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Svitrigaila

column2: It looks like you're going to have to listen to Svitrigaila's story.
column3: 아무래도 쉬트리가일라의 사연을 들어봐야 할 것 같습니다.
column4: Sepertinya Kamu harus mendengarkan cerita Svitrigaila.

column2: Gather Poisonous Weeds
column3: 독초 구하기
column4: Kumpulkan Poisonous Weeds

column2: Svitrigaila tells you that, as a Revelator, it wouldn't be bad for you to help him commit suicide, and he asks you to gather some poisonous herbs for him.
column3: 쉬트리가일라는 계시자로서 자신의 죽음에 도움을 주는 것도 나쁘지 않을 것이라면서 독초를 구해다 달라고 하고 있습니다. 그가 말한 곳으로 가서 독초를 구해 오세요.
column4: Svitrigaila memberitahu Kamu bahwa sebagai Savior, tidak akan buruk jika Kamu membantunya bunuh diri, dan dia meminta Kamu untuk mengumpulkan beberapa tumbuhan beracun untuknya.

column2: Give Svitrigaila the Poisonous Herbs
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 독초 갖다 주기
column4: Berikan Svitrigaila tumbuhan beracun

column2: You have gathered all of the poisonous herbs that Svitrigaila asked you to get. Now return to Svitrigaila and give him the poisonous herbs you've collected.
column3: 쉬트리가일라가 말한 독초를 모두 구한 것 같습니다. 이제 돌아가 이 독초들을 쉬트리가일레에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengumpulkan semua tumbuh-tumbuhan beracun yang Svitrigaila minta kepada Anda. Sekarang kembali ke Svitrigaila dan berikan tumbuhan beracun yang telah Kamu kumpulkan.

column2: Talk to the Cleric Master to get the holy water that Svitrigaila needs.
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 필요한 성수를 얻기 위해 클레릭 마스터와 대화 하세요.
column4: Bicara dengan Cleric Master untuk mendapatkan holy water yang diperlukan Svitrigaila.

column2: Return to Svitrigaila
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 돌아가기
column4: Kembali ke Svitrigaila

column2: The Cleric Master stubbornly refused your request. That's unfortunate. Well anyhow, go tell Svitrigaila what happened.
column3: 클레릭 마스터는 완강하게 거절 했습니다. 아쉽지만 어쨌든 이 사실을 쉬트리가일라에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Cleric Master terus menolak permintaan Anda. Itu sangat disayangkan. Hmm, pergi beritahu Svitrigaila mengenai apa yang terjadi.

column2: You gave Svitrigaila the poisonous herbs, and it appears that he ate them, but you don't see any change in him. Try speaking to him again.
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 독초를 건네주었고, 그가 그 독초를 먹는 것 같았지만 효과는 보이지 않습니다. 다시 그에게 말을 걸어 보세요.
column4: Kamu memberi Svitrigaila tumbuhan beracun, dan tampaknya ia memakannya, tetapi Kamu tidak melihat perubahan pada dirinya. Cobalah bicara dengannya lagi.

column2: Seeing as there was no effect on Svitrigaila when he ate the poisonous herbs, it must be that he needs to mix them with holy water first, and then eat them to get the desired result. Find the Cleric Master and get the holy water from him.
column3: 독초를 먹어도 효과가 없자, 아무래도 독초를 성수에 섞어 먹으면 쉬트리가일라가 바라는 바를 이룰 수 있을 것 같습니다. 클레릭 마스터를 찾아 가 성수를 얻어 오세요.
column4: Karena melihat Svitrigaila tidak mengalami perubahan ketika ia memakan tumbuh-tumbuhan beracun, itu pasti mengapa ia harus mencampurnya dengan holy water terlebih dahulu, dan kemudian memakannya untuk mendapatkan hasil yang diinginkan. Temui Cleric Master dan dapatkan holy water darinya.

column2: Destroy the Terminal
column3: 단말기 파괴
column4: Hancurkan Terminal

column2: Talk with Svitrigaila some more.
column3: 쉬트리가일라와 더 대화해 보세요.
column4: Berbicara dengan Svitrigaila lagi.

column2: Destroy the Soul Compactor Terminal
column3: 영혼 집약 단말기 파괴하기
column4: Hancurkan Soul Compactor Terminal

column2: In order to help Svitrigaila, you'll have to destroy the Soul Compaction Device. You'll need to gather some tools to help you destroy the Soul Compaction Device terminal, and then its the mainframe, beforehand. First things first, destroy the first terminal.
column3: 쉬트리가일라를 도와주기 위해서는 일단 영혼 집약 장치를 파괴 해야 할 것 같습니다. 그 이전에 영혼 집약 장치의 단말기를 차례로 파괴해서 영혼 집약 장치 본체를 파괴할 도구의 재료를 구해야 한다고 합니다. 먼저 첫 번째 단말기를 파괴 하세요.
column4: Untuk membantu Svitrigaila, Kamu harus menghancurkan Soul Compaction Device. Kamu harus mengumpulkan beberapa alat untuk menghancurkan Soul Compaction Device terminal, dan kemudian mainframenya. Hal pertama yang harus dilakukan, hancurkan first terminal.

column2: Inform Svitrigaila
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 알려 주기
column4: Memberitahu Svitrigaila

column2: You have destroyed the terminal. And you successfully retrieved the Terminal Core. Give the core to Svitrigaila.
column3: 단말기를 파괴 했습니다. 또한 단말기의 핵도 무사히 구했습니다. 이 핵을 쉬트리가일라에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Kamu telah menghancurkan terminal. Dan Kamu berhasil mengambil core terminal. Berikan core kepada Svitrigaila.

column2: Destroy the Terminal and retrieve its core
column3: 단말기를 파괴하고 핵 구하기
column4: Hancurkan Terminal dan Ambil Core-nya

column2: Ask Svitrigaila how to destroy the terminal in the next area.
column3: 두 번째 지역의 단말기를 파괴 하기 위해서는 어떻게 해야 하는지 쉬트리가일라와 이야기 해 보세요.
column4: Tanyakan Svitrigaila bagaimana menghancurkan terminal di area berikutnya.

column2: Scrape off and collect Petrification Particles
column3: 석화물 가루 긁어 모으기
column4: Kikis dan Kumpulkan Petrification Particles

column2: According to Svitrigaila, you need to amplify the power of the explosive powder in order to destroy the next terminal, and for that, you'll need to scrape off and collect particles from petrified objects in this area.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 말에 따라, 단말기를 파괴 하기 위한 폭약가루의 효과 증폭을 위한 재료로 그 일대의 석화물에서 석화가루를 긁어 모아 봅시다.
column4: Menurut Svitrigaila, Kamu perlu untuk memperkuat daya dari bubuk peledak untuk menghancurkan terminal berikutnya, dan untuk itu, Kamu harus mengikis dan mengumpulkan partikel dari benda petrified di area ini.

column2: Blow up the Terminal
column3: 단말기 폭파하기
column4: Meledakkan Terminal

column2: Use the explosive powder Svitrigaila gave you and the petrification particles you collected to blow up the second terminal.
column3: 쉬트리가일라가 준 폭약가루와 채취한 석화물 가루로 두 번째 단말기를 폭파 시키세요.
column4: Gunakan bubuk peledak yang Svitrigaila berikan dan petrification particles yang Kamu kumpulkan untuk meledakkan second terminal.

column2: Ask Svitrigaila what you need to do to destroy the next terminal.
column3: 다음 단말기를 파괴 하기 위해 어떻게 해야 하는지 쉬트리가일라와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Tanyakan Svitrigaila apa yang harus Kamu lakukan untuk menghancurkan terminal berikutnya.

column2: Destroy the Terminal
column3: 단말기 파괴 하기
column4: Hancurkan Terminal

column2: Svitrigaila says that the third terminal will get knocked out if anything comes near it. Retrieve the core from the petrified monsters nearby and throw it at the terminal to destroy it.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 말 대로 세 번째 단말기에 접근하면 넉다운 됩니다. 세 번째 단말기 근처의 석화 된 몬스터로부터 코어를 구해 단말기를 향해 던져서 단말기를 파괴 하세요.
column4: Svitrigaila mengatakan bahwa third terminal akan menghancurkan apapun yang datang mendekatinya. Ambil core dari petrified monster terdekat dan lemparkan ke terminal itu untuk menghancurkannya.

column2: And Eternal Repose
column3: 그리고 영원한 안식
column4: And, Eternal Repose

column2: Now that you've gotten rid of all the terminals, return to Svitrigaila.
column3: 단말기들을 모두 없앴으니, 이제 쉬트리가일라에게 돌아가 보세요.
column4: Kamu telah berhasil menyingkirkan semua terminal, kembali ke Svitrigaila.

column2: Find materials to craft the Magic Orb
column3: 마법 오브의 재료 구하기
column4: Cari Material untuk membuat Magic Orb

column2: Svitrigaila gave you a manual to create a magic orb that can free the trapped souls from the Soul Compactor. Gather the necessary crafting materials that Svitrigaila  was unable to get from monsters and then use the manual to craft Svitrigaila's Orb.
column3: 쉬트리가일라로부터 영혼 집약 장치에서 영혼을 모두 빠져 나가게 할 오브를 만들 수 있는 제작서를 받았습니다. 쉬트리가일라가 미쳐 구하지 못한 재료를 몬스터로부터 구한 뒤 제작서를 사용하여 쉬트드가일라의 마법 오브를 만들어 보세요.
column4: Svitrigaila memberi Kamu manual untuk membuat magic orb yang bisa membebaskan para soul yang terperangkap di Soul Compactor. Kumpulkan material yang Svitrigaila tidak bisa dapatkan dari monster dan kemudian gunakan manual untuk membuat Svitrigaila's Magic Orb.

column2: Destroy the Soul Compactor
column3: 영혼 집약 장치 파괴하러 가기
column4: Pergi ke Hancurkan Soul Compactor

column2: You have crafted Svitrigaila's Orb. Now take the orb to the Soul Compactor.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 마법 오브를 만들었습니다. 이제 오브를 영혼 집약 장치에 가져가세요.
column4: Kamu telah membuat Svitrigaila's Magic Orb. Sekarang bawa orb ke Soul Compactor.

column2: Destroy the Soul Compactor
column3: 영혼 집약 장치 파괴
column4: Hancurkan Soul Compactor

column2: Destroy the Soul Compactor with Svitrigaila's Orb.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 가지고, 영혼 집약 장치를 파괴 하세요.
column4: Hancurkan Soul Compactor dengan Svitrigaila's orb.

column2: Once you placed Svitrigaila's Orb, monsters started turning wild and rushing towards you! {nl}Fight off the monsters!
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 설치 했더니, 엄청난 반응을 일으키면서 몬스터들이 몰려들었습니다! 몬스터들을 물리치세요!
column4: Setelah Kamu menempatkan Svitrigaila's orb, para monster mulai menjadi liar dan bergegas ke arah Anda! Lawan para monster!

column2: The Soul Compactor has been destroyed. Now return to Svitrigaila.
column3: 영혼 집약 장치가 파괴되었습니다. 이제 쉬트리가일라에게 돌아가 보세요.
column4: Soul Compactor telah dihancurkan. Sekarang kembali ke Svitrigaila.

column2: Say your final farewell to Svitrigaila
column3: 쉬트리가일라와 마지막 인사 하기
column4: Berikan kata-kata Perpisahan kepada Svitrigaila

column2: It looks like it's time to grant Svitrigaila's wish.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 소원을 들어 줄  시간인 것 같습니다.
column4: Tampaknya sudah waktunya untuk mengabulkan keinginan Svitrigaila

column2: If you help me die, I'll release you from that curse.
column3: 나의 죽음에 협조하면 그 저주를 풀어 주겠다.
column4: Jika Kamu membantu saya untuk mati, Aku akan membebaskan Kamu dari kutukan itu.

column2: Who cares what happens to this body that I can't move, or even escape from.{nl}I just want to rest a little.
column3: 움직이지도, 떠나지도 못하는 몸 따위 어찌 된 들 무슨 상관인가.{nl}그냥 좀 쉬고 싶을 뿐.
column4: Siapa yang peduli akan apa yang terjadi pada tubuh ini, saya tidak bisa bergerak atau bahkan melarikan diri.{nl} Aku hanya ingin beristirahat sebentar.

column2: You just need to gather the poisonous weeds from the area above us.
column3: 저 위쪽의 독초를 구해 오면 된다.
column4: Kamu hanya perlu mengumpulkan poisonous weeds dari area di atas kita.

column2: That area's known for its Bluebane...
column3: 이 곳의 풀은 맹독으로 유명하지..
column4: Area itu terkenal dengan Bluebane..

column2: Thank you. Let me try eating these one by one...
column3: 고맙네. 하나씩 먹어볼까..
column4: Terima kasih. Biarkan aku mencoba memakannya satu per satu..

column2: Just as I feared... I'm still here.{nl}I heard the Cleric Master has holy water that, when mixed with Bluebane, {nl}can easily kill any demon.
column3: 예상대로.. 그대로군.{nl}클레릭마스터가 들고 있다는 성수에 섞어 먹으면 마족의 몸은 쉽게 죽을 수 있지 않을까.
column4: Seperti yang aku takutkan.. aku masih ada di sini.{nl} Saya dengar Cleric Master memiliki holy water, bila dicampur dengan Bluebane, dapat dengan mudah membunuh demon apapun.

column2: Cleric Master!{nl}Go to him and get some holy water.
column3: 클레릭 마스터!{nl}그에게로 가서 성수를 얻어와 주게.
column4: Cleric Master!{nl} Pergilah ke padanya dan dapatkan beberapa holy water.

column2: Have a safe journey to Klaipeda.
column3: 클라페다까지 무사하길.
column4: Semoga perjalananmu aman sampai ke Klaipeda.

column2: ...?{nl}The soulkeeper of Dingofasil District?{nl}Isn't he a demon?
column3: ..?{nl}딩고파실 지구의 영혼 관리자?{nl}그 자는 마족 아닙니까?
column4: ..?{nl} Soulkeeper dari Dingofasil District?{nl} Bukankah ia demon?

column2: Are you helping a demon?{nl}I won't pry into your personal affairs, but as a master serving the goddess, {nl}I cannot get involved in this. Please leave this place.
column3: 계시자님이 마족의 일을 돕고 있다구요?{nl}개인적인 일들이야 관여하지 않겠습니다만, 여신을 섬기는 마스터로서 그 일에 협조할 수는 없습니다. 돌아가 주십시오.
column4: Kamu membantu demon?{nl} Saya tidak ingin mencampuri urusan pribadi Anda, namun sebagai Master yang melayani Goddess, saya tidak bisa terlibat dalam hal ini. Silakan tinggalkan tempat ini.

column2: I will never involve myself in a demon's work.
column3: 마족의 일에는 앞으로도 협조하지 않을 것입니다.
column4: Saya tidak akan pernah melibatkan diri dengan demon.

column2: I see... I should have expected that...{nl}I was a fool to hope otherwise.
column3: 과연.. 그러했군..{nl}괜한 기대를 한 것인가.
column4: Aku mengerti.. Saya sudah menduganya.. {nl} Aku bodoh untuk berharap sebaliknya.

column2: If it comes down this, I guess I'll have to try that method now.{nl}Destroying the Soul Compactor that's here... The beings that sent me here told me.{nl}The Soul Compactor and I are one and the same. Why didn't I remember this until now?
column3: 이렇게 되면 이제는 그 방법을 시도 해 봐야겠는걸.{nl}이 곳에 있는 영혼 집약기를 파괴 하는 것..{nl}나를 여기 보낸 이들이 말했지.{nl}나와 영혼 집약기는 하나라고. 왜 그 말을 지금껏 잊고 있었을까.
column4: Bila begitu, saya kira saya harus mencoba metode itu sekarang.{nl} Hancurkan Soul Compactor yang ada di sini..{nl} Makhluk yang mengirim saya ke sini mengatakannya kepadaku.{nl} Soul Compactor dan saya adalah satu kesatuan. Mengapa aku tidak mengingat hal ini sampai sekarang?

column2: Somewhere in this area is a Soul Compactor that absorbs human souls.{nl}It condenses their energy and uses it.{nl}This is a really suitable location for the Soul Compactor because, {nl}even after the Petrifying Frost blew through, it's still bustling with the activity of the {nl}Knights of Kaliss, grave robbers, and the soldiers of the Royal Army.
column3: 이 곳 어딘가에 있는 영혼집약기는 인간의 영혼을 흡수하는 장치라네.{nl}그 에너지를 어딘가에 모아서 사용하고 있지.{nl}이렇게 석화서리가 불어오고 난 뒤에도 칼리스 기사단과 도굴꾼들, 왕국군이 활동하는 이 곳은 영혼 집약기가 있기에는 정말 적당한 장소겠지..
column4: Di suatu tempat di area ini terdapat Soul Compactor yang menyerap jiwa manusia.{nl} Itu mengkonversi energi mereka dan menggunakannya.{nl} Lokasi ini sangat cocok untuk Soul Compactor bahkan setelah Stone Frost datang melewatinya, dan masih ramai dengan aktivitas Kaliss Knights, grave robbers, dan Kingdom Army soldiers.

column2: {nl}{nl}If I think about it, the beings that sent me here must have linked my life with the Soul Compactor so that I could collect souls for them forever. So if the Soul Compactor is destroyed, wouldn't I die with it?
column3: {nl}{nl}생각해 보면 나를 이 곳에 보낸 이들은 그렇게 영원히 영혼을 모으기 위해 나를 영혼집약기와 생명으로 연결해 놓은 것이 아닐까. 영혼 집약기가 파괴 되면 나도 죽을 수 있지 않을까.
column4: {nl}{nl} Jika saya memikirkannya, makhluk yang mengirim saya ke sini pasti menghubungkan hidupku dengan Soul Compactor sehingga saya bisa mengumpulkan soul dari itu selamanya. Jadi jika Soul Compactor hancur, Akankah aku mati bersamanya?

column2: The Soul Compactor has 3 terminals from which it absorbs souls.{nl}That bad feeling you had earlier was also a terminal trying to absorb your soul.{nl}For now, try to wipe out those terminals.
column3: 영혼 집약기는 3개의 단말기로부터도 영혼을 흡수하지.{nl}조금 전의 네가 느꼈던 그 나쁜 기운도 단말기가 영혼을 흡수하는 과정이었어.{nl}일단 그 단말기들을 차례로 없애 보도록 하세.
column4: Soul Compactor memiliki 3 terminal yang menyerap soul.{nl} Hal buruk yang sebelumnya Kamu rasakan terjadi karena terminal mencoba untuk menyerap soul Anda.{nl} Untuk saat ini, cobalah untuk melenyapkan seluruh terminal itu.

column2: {nl}If you succeed in destroying a terminal, you should be able to retrieve its core.{nl}You need to collect those cores to craft an orb that will help you destroy the Soul Compactor.
column3: {nl}파괴하는데 성공하면 단말기의 핵을 구할 수 있을거야.{nl}그 핵을 모아서 집약기의 파괴를 도와 줄 오브를 만들어야지.
column4: {nl} Jika Kamu berhasil menghancurkan terminal, Kamu harus mengambil core-nya.{nl} Kamu perlu mengumpulkan core itu untuk membuat sebuah orb yang bisa membantumu menghancurkan Soul Compactor.

column2: Good job. This core will be used to make an orb that will overload the mainframe of the Soul Compactor.{nl}Now I can feel my death drawing near.
column3: 잘 했군. 이 핵은 영혼 집약기 본체의 과부하를 일으킬 오브의 재료가 될 거야.{nl}이제 점점 죽음이 다가온다.
column4: Kerja bagus. Core ini akan digunakan untuk membuat orb yang akan membebani mainframe dari Soul Compactor.{nl} Sekarang saya bisa merasakan kematian saya semakin dekat.

column2: Try blowing up the second terminal.{nl}Here, I'll give you some explosives, but you'll need to scrape off some particles from petrified{nl}objects in this area to amplify the power of the explosives.{nl}Since the Petrifying Frost blows through here often, there are plenty of petrified objects {nl}everywhere.
column3: 두 번째 단말기는 터뜨려 보도록 하게.{nl}여기 내가 폭약을 줄 테니, 이 폭약의 효과를 증폭시키도록 그 지역에서 석화물가루를 긁어가 봐.{nl}석화서리가 수시로 불어오는 지역 답게 석화물은 어디에나 있어.
column4: Coba ledakkan terminal kedua.{nl} Ini, saya berikan beberapa bahan peledak, tetapi Kamu harus mengikis beberapa partikel dari objek petrified di daerah ini untuk memperkuat daya dari bahan peledak.{nl} Sejak Stone Frost melalui sering tempat ini, ada banyak objek petrified di mana-mana.

column2: Again, you'll need to retrieve the core from this terminal too.
column3: 역시 이번에도 단말기의 핵을 구해 와야 해.
column4: Sekali lagi, Kamu harus mengambil core dari terminal ini juga.

column2: Now there's only one terminal left.. I feel myself getting weaker...{nl}The last terminal is probably short-circuiting.{nl}Try getting cores from petrified monsters in the area and throwing them at the terminal.{nl}That should be enough to make it collapse.
column3: 이제 마지막 단말기군.. 서서히 기운이 빠지고 있어..{nl}아마 마지막 단말기는 폭주하고 있을지도 모르겠어.{nl}주변의 석화된 몬스터들로부터 석화된 몬스터의 코어를 얻어서 단말기에 던져 봐.{nl}서서히 무너질걸세.
column4: Sekarang hanya tinggal satu terminal yang tersisa.. Aku merasa diriku semakin lemah.. {nl} Terminal terakhir mungkin memiliki arus pendek.{nl} Cobalah mendapatkan core dari petrified monsters di area itu dan lemparkan ke terminal.{nl} Itu seharusnya cukup untuk membuatnya runtuh.

column2: And of course, bring back the core from the last terminal.{nl}Condensed souls are concentrated within those cores... {nl}We just need to use them to craft an orb that will overload the Soul Compactor.
column3: 그리고 역시 그 핵을 가져와야겠지.{nl}그 핵들에는 영혼들이 응축되어 있어서.. 그걸 모아 영혼 집약기의 과부하를 일으킬 오브를 만들면 돼.
column4: Dan tentu saja, bawa kembali core dari terminal terakhir.{nl} Soul akan terkonsentrasi ke dalam core itu.. Kita hanya perlu menggunakannya untuk membuat sebuah orb yang akan membebani Soul Compactor.

column2: Now you've collected them all. Here, I'll give you the manual.{nl}Use this to craft the orb to overload the Soul Compactor.{nl}
column3: 이제 모두 구했군. 내가 제작서를 주겠네.{nl}이걸로 영혼 집약기에 과부하를 일으키는 오브를 만들어야 해.{nl}그 전에, 일단 내가 주는 영혼의 정수로 몬스터를 유인해서 뇌관을 뽑아내게.{nl}그러면 제작서로 오브를 제작할 수 있어.
column4: Sekarang Kamu telah mengumpulkan semuanya. Ini, Aku akan memberikanmu manual.{nl} Gunakan ini untuk membuat orb itu membebani Jiwa Compactor.{nl}

column2: I just want to rest...
column3: 그저 쉬고 싶을 뿐..
column4: Aku hanya ingin beristirahat saja..

column2: Is this the last time? Really.
column3: 이제 마지막인가. 정말로.
column4: Apakah sekarang yang terakhir. Sungguh.

column2: Let's see if we have all the detonators.
column3: 뇌관은 모두 구했는지 보게.
column4: Coba kulihat apakah semua detonator telah kau dapatkan.

column2: You've come... but it's already time for me to go.
column3: 와 주었군.. 이제 안녕일세.
column4: Kau telah datang rupanya.. Sekarang selamat tinggal.

column2: I feel drained.
column3: 기운이 빠진다. 기분은 좋군.
column4: Energi melemah. Senang rasanya.

column2: Yes. That's it. Give it to me.
column3: 그래. 그거야. 이리 줘.
column4: Oke. Itu dia. Cepat berikan.

column2: Notice/!/When you touch the device, it feels like your soul is being drained!{nl}You must find someone who can fix this situation!
column3: Notice/!/장치를 만지자 영혼이 빠져 나가는 기분입니다!{nl}이 상태를 풀어 줄 누군가를 찾아야 합니다!
column4: Notice/!/Setelah menyentuh perangkat, rasanya roh ini terbang lepas keluar!{nl} Harus mencari seseorang yang dapat menyelesaikan keadaan ini!

column2: I'll cooperate
column3: 협조 하겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan membantu

column2: Relationship between the Spirit Integration Device and Svitrigaila
column3: 영혼 집약기와 쉬트리가일라의 관계
column4: Hubungan antara Soul Compactor dan Svitrigaila

column2: Perhaps your soul is draining, you are gradually losing energy and stamina!! Hurry and search for anyone who fix this situation!!
column3: 영혼이 빠져 나가고 있는 것인지, 점점 기운이 없어지면서 스태미나가 빠져 나가고 있습니다!! 어서 움직여서 이 상황을 풀어 줄 누군가를 찾아 보세요!!
column4: Mungkin soul Kamu terkuras, Secara bertahap Kamu kehilangan energi dan stamina!! Bergegaslah dan cari siapapun yang bisa memulihkan Anda!!

column2: Obtain %s by destroying the Terminal
column3: 단말기를 파괴하고 %s 구하기
column4: Dapatkan %s dengan menghancurkan terminal

column2: Bring the Terminal Core
column3: 단말기 핵 갖다 주기
column4: Bawa Core Terminal

column2: Bring the Terminal Core to Svitrigaila.
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 단말기의 핵을 가져다 주세요.
column4: Bawakan Core Terminal kepada Svitrigaila.

column2: Craft %s
column3: 제작으로 %s 만들기
column4: Membuat %s

column2: As I expected, we have to get the Terminal Core again.{nl}Hmm... I'll cast a protection spell on you so the terminal won't defeat you like before.{nl}I have enough strength left for that, at least.
column3: 역시 이번에도 단말기의 핵을 구해 와야 돼.{nl}음.. 방금 전 처럼 단말기에 당하지 않도록 보호 마법을 걸어 주지.{nl}아직 그런 정도의 힘은 있어.
column4: Seperti yang saya duga, kita harus mendapatkan core Terminalnya lagi.{nl} Hmm.. Aku akan merapalkan spell protection kepadamu sehingga terminal tidak dapat mengalahkanmu seperti sebelumnya.{nl} Saya masih memiliki cukup kekuatan.

column2: I guide petrified souls in accordance with the will of the goddess.
column3: 여신의 뜻을 받들어 석화된 영혼들을 인도하고 있어요.
column4: Aku akan memandu petrified souls sesuai dengan kehendak Goddess.

column2: The Petrifying Frost will blow here soon. But we don't know when...{nl}I wonder if the Petrification Detector is working properly at Supply Route.{nl}Could you please check it?
column3: 석화서리가 불어올 거예요. 하지만 알 수가 없으니..{nl}보급로의 석화탐지기는 제대로 작동을 하고 있는 걸까요?{nl}한 번 봐 주셔야 될 거 같은데..
column4: Stone Frost akan segera mengara ke sini. Namun kita tidak tahu kapan..{nl} Aku ingin tahu apakah Petrification Detector bekerja dengan baik di supply route.{nl} Bisakah Kamu memeriksanya?

column2: Craft %s
column3: 제작스킬을 사용하여 %s 만들기
column4: Membuat %s

column2: They might get killed since there's no word from them.{nl}If you find their bodies... please bring them with their mementos.
column3: 아직 소식이 없는 것을 보면.. 어떤 변을 당했을 수도 있겠습니다.{nl}혹시 그들의 시신들이라도 발견한다면.. 번거롭더라도 시신을 수습해서 유품들을 가져와 주시면 감사하겠습니다.
column4: Mereka mungkin telah terbunuh karena tidak ada kabar dari mereka.{nl} Jika Kamu menemukan tubuh mereka.. Tolong bawa mereka bersama dengan barang kenangannya.

column2: Entire troops were killed. Thank you for the help.{nl}There should be a part in the mementos.
column3: 지원 병력이 모두 당했군요. 수습해 주셔서 감사합니다.{nl}건네 주신 유품 중에.. 부품이 있을 겁니다.
column4: Seluruh Pasukan telah tewas. Terima kasih atas bantuanmu{nl} Disana seharusnya ada barang kenangan mereka.

column2: You need to move on to repair.{nl}Be careful of the Petrifying Frost.
column3: 이제 수리하러 가셔야겠네요.{nl}석화 서리를 조심하세요.
column4: Kamu harus pergi untuk melakukan perbaikan.{nl} Hati-hati terhadap Stone Frost.

column2: Holy water?{nl}What do you need it for?
column3: 성수 말입니까?{nl}어디에 쓰시게요?
column4: Holy water?{nl} Mengapa kamu membutuhkannya?

column2: There is a demon who needs holy water at Dingofasil District?{nl}...
column3: 딩고파실 지구에서 성수를 필요로 하는 마족이 있다구요?{nl}..
column4: Ada demon yang membutuhkan holy water di Dingofasil District?{nl}..

column2: I won't concern myself with your personal matters, but I can't help demons as a cleric.
column3: {nl}계시자님의 개인적인 일에는 관여하지 않겠습니다만, 성직자로서 마족의 일에 도움을 드릴 수는 없습니다.
column4: {nl}Saya tidak akan mencampuri permasalahan pribadi Anda, namun sebagai Cleric saya tidak bisa membantu demon.

column2: Maybe this is the only way...{nl}Destroying the Spirit Integration Device...{nl}The ones who sent me here told me that the Spirit Integration Device and I are one. {nl}{nl}How could I forget that?
column3: 이제는 이 방법 뿐인가..{nl}이 곳에 있는 영혼 집약기를 파괴 해 보는 것..{nl}나를 여기 보낸 이들이 말했지.{nl}나와 영혼 집약기는 하나라고. 왜 그 말을 지금껏 잊고 있었을까.
column4: Mungkin ini adalah satu-satunya cara..{nl} Hancurkan Soul Compactor....{nl} Makhluk yang mengirim saya ke sini mengatakannya kepadaku{nl} Soul Compactor dan saya adalah satu kesatuan. Kenapa aku bisa melupakannya?

column2: The Spirit Integration Device absorbs souls from 3 terminals.{nl}The curse from a while ago was the process to absorb souls.{nl}Let's destroy the terminals one by one.
column3: 영혼 집약기는 3개의 단말기로부터도 영혼을 흡수하지.{nl}조금 전의 그 저주도 단말기가 영혼을 흡수하는 과정이었어.{nl}일단 그 단말기들을 차례로 파괴해 보도록 하세.
column4: Soul Compactor menyerap soul dari 3 terminal.{nl} Curse yang sebelumnya itu adalah proses penyerapan soul.{nl} Mari kita hancurkan terminal itu satu per satu.

column2: Then bring the core.{nl}Oh, I'll cast a spell on you so you won't be cursed again.
column3: {nl}그리고 그 핵을 구해 와.{nl}아, 다시 그 저주에 걸리지 않도록 주문을 걸어 주도록 하지.
column4: {nl} Kalau begitu bawakan core-nya.{nl} Ah, aku akan merapalkan spell kepadamu sehingga Kamu tidak akan terkena curse lagi.

column2: We should destroy the second terminal. {nl}I will give you some bombs, but to amplify the effects of the bombs, {nl}you will need some petrified water powder.
column3: 두 번째 단말기는 폭파시켜야 해.{nl}여기 내가 폭약을 줄 테니, 이 폭약의 효과를 증폭시키도록 그 지역에서 석화물가루를 긁어가 봐.{nl}석화서리가 수시로 불어오는 지역 답게 석화물은 어디에나 있어.
column4: Harus meledakkan terminal nomor dua.{nl} Ini kuberikan explosive, cobalah cari petrification liquid powders di area itu agar dapat memperkuat efek peledak ini.{nl} petrification liquid powders ada dimana pun di area yang sering terjadi Petrification Frost.

column2: We should get the core of the terminal this time as well.{nl}Hmm... the spell has been released so that we won't get hurt by the spell. I will lock it again.
column3: 역시 이번에도 단말기의 핵을 구해 와야 돼.{nl}음.. 단말기에 당하지 않도록 하는 주문이 풀렸군. 다시 걸어주도록 하지.
column4: Pasti kali ini harus kembali dengan membawa Nucleus dari Terminal.{nl}Emm.. Kau telah melepaskan mantra agar tidak terkena pada terminal itu rupanya. Mari gunakan mantra itu lagi.

column2: Here it is.{nl}The broken detector can be easily fixed with these parts.{nl}If the parts don't stay in place very well, get some strings from the nearby monsters and {nl}use them.
column3: 여기 있네요.{nl}고장난 탐지기는 이 부품 정도로 간단히 수리 할 수 있을 겁니다.{nl}혹시, 부품이 잘 고정되지 않거든 주변 몬스터들이 갖고 있는 노끈 같은 걸로 고정해 보세요.
column4: Ada disini ya.{nl} Detector yang rusak dapat diperbaiki dengan mudah dengan sparepart ini.{nl} Hmm, sepertinya sparepart ini tidak terpasang dengan benar, cobalah cari strap dari monster yang ada di sekitar, agar bisa memasangnya dengan benar.

column2: The repair, itself, isn't that hard. It is hard to obtain necessary parts.
column3: 사실 부품 구하기가 어려워서 그렇지, 수리 자체는 어렵지 않습니다.
column4: Sebenarnya yang sulit adalah mencari spare part, proses perbaikan tidaklah sulit.

column2: You've come back from a long journey. So these are the parts.
column3: 먼 길 다녀오느라 수고했어요. 그것이 그 부품들이군요.
column4: Terima kasih banyak karena sudah pergi jauh. Ini adalah spare part itu.

column2: Let's go repair it now.
column3: 이제 수리하러 가셔야죠.
column4: Sekarang harus pergi untuk melakukan perbaikan

column2: The demons and the goddesses, and about the Petrified City
column3: 마족과 여신들, 그리고 석화된 도시에 대해
column4: Demon dan Para Goddess, lalu mengenai kotak yang membatu

column2: The reason why the goddesses weren't able to save the Petrified City
column3: 여신들이 석화도시를 구하지 못한 이유
column4: Alasan Para Goddess tidak dapat menyelamatkan kota yang membatu

column2: Send the words of appreciation
column3: 감사의 말을 전한다
column4: Menyampaikan ucapan terima kasih

column2: Check the Detector's Functionality (6)
column3: 탐지기 작동 점검(6)
column4: Periksa Fungsi Detector (6)

column2: Notice/The curse has been released#5
column3: Notice/저주가 풀렸습니다#5
column4: Notice/Kutukan telah terlepas#5

column2: Collect the corpses of the guards
column3: 병사들의 시신 수습하기
column4: Merapikan mayat dari para prajurit

column2: By the words of the Royal Army Guard Retia, let's look for the other guards who had been {nl}dispatched to the Coastal Fortress. If they got into an accident, please collect their keepsakes. {nl}The monsters might have taken them so it would be a good idea to hunt for the monsters{nl}at the Coastal Fortress.
column3: 왕국군 레티아의 말에 따라, 연안요새로 파견 나간 병사들을 찾아 봅시다. 혹시라도 그들이 사고를 당했다면 시신의 유품을 수습해 오세요. 몬스터들이 약탈해 갔을 지도 모르니 연안 요새의 몬스터들을 사냥 해 보는 것도 좋습니다.
column4: Sesuai perkataan dari Kingdom Army Retia, mari coba mencari para pasukan yang pergi berdinas ke Coastal Fortress. Jika terjadi sesuatu terhadap mereka, tolong rapikanlah memento dari mayat mereka. Karena ada kemungkinan memento itu dirampas oleh monster di sekitar, alangkah baiknya jika kamu juga menghabisi monster di Coastal Fortress.

column2: Return to Royal Army Guard Retia
column3: 왕국군 레티아에게 돌아가기
column4: Kembali pada Kingdom Army Retia

column2: The guards of the Royal Army have unfortunately died. {nl}You've collected their corpses so go back to Retia.
column3: 왕국군 병사들은 안타깝게도 변을 당했습니다. 시신을 모두 수습하였으니 레티아에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Para pasukan kerajaan sayangnya telah terkena mutasi. Karena kamu telah merapikan seluruh mayat, kembalilah pada Retia.

column2: Since you've collected all the corpses of the guards who left to the Coastal Fortress to {nl}fix the detector, it seems that you will be able to obtain some parts of the detector from Retia. {nl}Talk with her.
column3: 연안 요새의 탐지기를 수리하러 떠났던 병사들의 시신을 모두 수습해 주었으니, 레티아로부터 탐지기의 부품을 얻을 수 있을 것 같습니다. 그녀와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Karena kamu telah merapikan seluruh mayat dari para prajurit yang pergi untuk memperbaiki Detector di Coastal Fortress, sekarang akan kau bisa mendapat sparepart detector dari Retia. Cobalah bicara dengannya.

column2: Obtain some parts
column3: 부품 얻기
column4: Mendapatkan Spare Part

column2: Obtain some parts from Retia
column3: 왕국군 레티아로부터 부품을 얻어 보세요.
column4: Cobalah dapatkan Sparepart dari Kingdom Army Retia.

column2: You've obtained some parts from Retia. Now, go back to Kupole Meile at the Coastal Fortress.
column3: 레티아로부터 부품을 얻었습니다. 이제 연안요새의 큐폴 메일레에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Telah mendapatkan Sparepart dari Retia. Sekarang kembalilah pada Kupole Meile di Coastal Fortress.

column2: Repairing
column3: 수리 중
column4: Sedang memperbaiki

column2: The detector started to activate!
column3: 탐지기가 작동하기 시작합니다!
column4: Detector mulai berfungsi!

column2: The parts aren't well secured.{nl}You need some kind of strap!
column3: 부품이 잘 고정되지 않습니다{nl}끈 같은 것이 필요할 것 같습니다!
column4: Sparepart tidak terpasang dengan benar{nl} Sepertinya membutuhkan Strap!

column2: You should obtain some straps.
column3: 끈을 구해와야 합니다
column4: Harus menemukan Strap

column2: Looking at the device
column3: 장치를 살펴 보는 중
column4: Sedang memeriksa Device

column2: You feel like your spirit is moving out from your body as you touch the device!{nl}You should look for someone who can help you!
column3: 장치를 만지자 영혼이 빠져 나가는 기분입니다!{nl}이 상태를 풀어 줄 누군가를 찾아야 합니다!
column4: Setelah menyentuh perangkat, rasanya roh ini terbang lepas keluar!{nl} Harus mencari seseorang yang dapat menyelesaikan keadaan ini!

column2: The curse has been released
column3: 저주가 풀렸습니다
column4: Kutukan telah terlepaskan

column2: Avoid the monsters' attacks and destroy the terminal!
column3: 몬스터의 공격을 피해 단말기를 파괴하세요!
column4: Hancurkanlah Terminal dengan menghindari serangan monster!!

column2: Placing the ignition for the explosive powder
column3: 폭약가루를 놓고 점화하는 중
column4: Sedang menaruh dan menyalakan Explosive Powder

column2: The terminal has exploded and disappeared!
column3: 단말기가 폭발하면서 사라졌습니다!
column4: Terminal meledak dan menghilang!

column2: Placing the Orb
column3: 오브를 설치 하는 중
column4: Sedang memasang Orb

column2: It seems that what Svitrigaila wanted has been fulfilled
column3: 쉬트리가일라가 원하는 것이 이루어 진 것 같습니다
column4: Sesuatu yang diinginkan Shetrigailla sepertinya telah terwujud

column2: Collecting
column3: 수습 중
column4: Sedang mengumpulkan

column2: You've collected the corpses and obtained their keepsakes!
column3: 시신을 수습하고 유품을 구했습니다!
column4: Telah mendapatkan memento dan merapikan Dead Body!

column2: You've collected the corpses!
column3: 시신을 수습했습니다!
column4: Telah merapikan Dead Body!

column2: You've extracted the poisonous flowers!
column3: 독초를 채취 했습니다!
column4: Telah mengumpulkan Poisounous Plant!

column2: You've failed to extract anything!
column3: 아무 것도 채취하지 못했습니다!
column4: Tidak berhasil mengumpulkan apapun!

column2: Collecting the petrification powder
column3: 석화물 가루 채취 중
column4: Sedang mengumpulkan petrification liquid powder

column2: You've collected petrification powder!
column3: 석화물 가루를 채취하였습니다!
column4: Telah mengumpulkan petrification liquid powder!

column2: You've failed to collect pertification powder!
column3: 석화물 가루 채취에 실패 하였습니다!
column4: Telah gagal mengumpulkan petrification liquid powder!

column2: Extracting the core of the monster
column3: 몬스터 코어 빼내는 중
column4: Sedang mecabut Monster Core

column2: You've obtained the core!
column3: 코어를 획득했습니다!
column4: Telah mendapatkan Core!

column2: You obtained nothing
column3: 아무 것도 얻지 못했습니다
column4: Tidak berhasil mendapatkan apapun

column2: Revelator! Are you okay?{nl}The Petrifying Frost, it's really dangerous.{nl}
column3: 계시자님! 괜찮으세요?{nl}석화서리라니, 정말 위험했어요.{nl}
column4: Tuan Savior! Apakah kamu tidak apa-apa?{nl} Petrification Frost, sungguh berbahaya.{nl}

column2: I am guiding the spirits that suffered from the Petrifying Frost long ago.{nl}
column3: 전 오래 전에 석화서리에 당한 영혼들을 인도하고 있어요.{nl}
column4: Aku sejak lama mengarahkan para jiwa yang terkena Petrification Frost.{nl}

column2: But the Petrifying Frost is the curse of the Demon Queen Gesti...{nl}It make us Kupoles turn into stone.{nl}
column3: 하지만 이 석화서리는 마왕 제스티의 저주.. {nl}저희 큐폴들까지 돌로 만들어 버리지요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi Petrification Frost ini adalah kutuan dari Demon King Gesti.. {nl} Ia sampai membuat kami para Kupole juga membatu.{nl}

column2: We should at least find out when the Petrifying Frost will blow.{nl}There are some petrification detectors which humans left behind, but some seem to be broken.{nl}Can you help me?
column3: 적어도 석화서리가 언제 불어오는지만 알면 돼요.{nl}인간들이 놓고 간 석화 탐지기가 있긴 한데 어떤 건 고장 난 것 같거든요.{nl}절 도와주실 수 있을까요?
column4: Walaupun sedikit, cukup jika mengetahui kapan Petrification Frost berjalan.{nl} Terdapat sesuatu Mineral Detector yang dibuat oleh Para Manusia, {nl}tetapi sepertinya benda itu rusak. Bisakah kamu membantuku ?

column2: The detector you saw seems to be working well.{nl}Please look at how the other detectors are working.
column3: 아까 보셨던 탐지기는 작동을 잘 하는 것 같아요. {nl}나머지 탐지기는 어떤지 부탁드릴게요.
column4: Detector yang tadi dilihat, sepertinya dapat beroperasi dengan baik. {nl} Tolong periksa bagaimana dengan Detector lainnya.

column2: The Petrifying Frost turns everything into stone. Even spirits.{nl}We, Kupoles, are no exception.
column3: 석화서리는 모든 것을 돌로 만들어버려요. 영혼까지도요.{nl}우리 큐폴들도 예외는 아니지요.
column4: Petrification Frost membuat semua benda menjadi batu. Sampai ke jiwa pun.{nl} Kami para Kupole pun bukan pengecualian.

column2: Ah, that's it.{nl}Two of them are broken.
column3: 아, 그렇군요.{nl}두 개가 고장이 나 있다고요.
column4: Ah, Begitu rupanya.{nl} dua buah sedang mengalami kerusakan ya.

column2: We better ask about the soldiers who created the detectors about them.{nl}I heard the person named Retia is the officer so we may receive some help from her.
column3: 탐지기 문제는 이걸 만든 왕국군에게 물어 보는 게 좋을 것 같아요.{nl}레티아라는 사람이 왕국군 장교라던데 혹시 도움을 받을 수 있지 않을까요?
column4: Masalah detector sepertinya lebih baik jika ditanyakan kepada {nl}Pasukan Kerajaan yang membuatnya. Terdapat seorang pasukan yang bernama Retia,{nl} mungkin saja dia dapat memberi bantuan?

column2: He is at Verkti Square.{nl}Human matters cannot be resolved by the Kupoles, so we are counting on you.
column3: 그 분은 베르크티 광장에 있어요.{nl}인간의 일은 큐폴이 나서기 어려우니 잘 부탁드리겠습니다.
column4: Orang itu ada di Verkti Square.{nl} Mohon bantuannya, karena sulit bagi Kupole untuk muncul dan melakukan pekerjaan manusia secara langsung.

column2: Are you talking about the petrification detector at the Coastal Fortress?{nl}We are already aware of that.
column3: 연안요새 지역의 석화 탐지기에 문제 말씀이십니까.{nl}그건 이미 알고 있습니다. 그럴 만도 하지요.
column4: Apakan kamu berkata ada masalah pada Mineral Detectoor di Coastal Fortress area.{nl} Kalau hal itu saya sudah mengetahuinya.

column2: It hasn't arrived yet? {nl}I've already dispatched the soldiers there.{nl}
column3: 그런데 아직 도착하지 않았습니까? {nl}제가 이미 수리할 병력을 그 쪽에 파견하였습니다만.{nl}
column4: Tetapi masih saja belum tiba ? {nl} Aku telah mengirimkan Pasukan untuk melakukan perbaikan berkeliling di sekitar sana.{nl}

column2: I don't have a good feeling about this.{nl}Due to numerous monster attacks here, we don't have additional forces to send.{nl}Can I ask you to follow the guards who were dispatched for the repair?
column3: 느낌이 좋지 않습니다.{nl}허나 이 쪽은 잦은 몬스터의 습격으로 추가 병력을 보낼 여력이 없습니다.{nl}계시자님께 수리 병력의 추적을 부탁드려도 되겠습니까?
column4: Perasaan ini tidak baik.{nl} Tetapi kami tidak ada kemampuan untuk mengirimkan kekuatan tambah akibat {nl} serangan monster disekitar area ini. Apakah boleh jika meminta bantuan Savior untuk melacak Repair Troops?

column2: Maybe they have been attacked at the Coastal Fortress.{nl}But, they are the guards of the kingdom. Their dead bodies should be brought here.
column3: 어쩌면 연안요새에서 습격에 당했을지도 모르겠습니다.{nl}하지만 그들은 왕국의 병사. 유해만이라도 반드시 이 곳에 있어야 합니다.
column4: Kami tidak pernah tahu bahwa akan mengalami serangan di Coastal Fortress.{nl} Tetapi mereka adalah pasukan dari kerajaan. Walaupun berbahaya, kami tetap harus berada di tempat ini.

column2: The Petrifying Frost is reported frequently at the entrance of the Coastal Fortress,{nl}so I think they will be around there. In case you find some corpses, please collect them.{nl}
column3: 연안요새의 입구 쪽에 석화서리가 자주 보고되고 있으니 그 인근이 아닐까 싶습니다.{nl}행여 시신이라도 발견하신다면 번거롭지만 유품의 수습을 부탁드리겠습니다.{nl}
column4: Dilaporkan bahwa terdapat kutukan Petrification Frost di sekitar pintu masuk Coastal Fortress, sepertinya itu terlalu dekat.{nl} Maaf merepotkan, jika menemukan mayat di sana maka tolong rapikan memento yang ada.{nl}

column2: I guess it was too late. Thanks for collecting the corpses.{nl}
column3: 이미 너무 늦어 버렸단 말입니까.{nl}유품이라도 수습해 주셔서 감사합니다. 여신의 품에서 편히 잠들길..
column4: Apakah itu artinya semua sudah terlalu terlambat.{nl} Terima kasih karena telah merapikan memento. Semoga mereka dapat tertidur tenang di pelukan Goddess..

column2: Please come back after fixing the petrification detector.{nl}I have something to say.
column3: 계시자님께서 석화 탐지기를 고치시고 나면, 제게 다시 들러 주세요.{nl}꼭 드리고 싶은 이야기가 있거든요.
column4: Setelah Tuan Savior memperbaiki Mineral Detector, kembalilah lagi kepada saya.{nl} Saya memiliki sesuatu yang ingin kuceritakan.

column2: I am counting on you to guide all the spirits to the goddesses.
column3: 모든 영혼들을 여신의 곁으로 인도할 수 있도록 잘 부탁드리겠습니다.{nl}여신의 가호가 함께 하길..
column4: Mohon bantuannya agar dapat mengarahkan seluruh jiwa ini ke sisi Goddess.{nl} Semoga Goddess selalu melindungi jalanmu..

column2: Lastly, there's some story that they want to tell to the Revelator.{nl}You will want to know why humans are suffering from this.{nl}
column3: 마지막으로, 계시자님께 꼭 들려드리고 싶은 이야기가 있었다고 했지요.{nl}무엇 때문에 인간들이 이런 일을 당해야 하는지 궁금하실 거예요.{nl}
column4: Terakhir kali saya berkata bahwa ada sesuatu yang ingin kuberitahukan kepadamu.{nl} Tidakkah kamu ingin mengetahuinya, beberapa hal yang membuat para manusia mengalami kejadian seperti ini.{nl}

column2: The rumor that the Petrifying Frost is the sin of the revolt is just a made-up story.{nl}The curse came after the revolt so they may well think so.{nl}
column3: 사실 석화서리가 반란의 벌이다 같은 건 지어진 이야기일 뿐이예요.{nl}반란이 끝나고 때 마침 불어온 저주였으니 인간들은 그리 생각하는게 당연하겠죠.{nl}
column4: Sebenarnya Petrification Frost adalah hukuman dari pemberontakan, dan merupakan cerita{nl} yang dikhayalkan saja. Ketika pemberontakan selesai, kutukan ini muncul tentunya mereka berpikir seperti itu bukan.{nl}

column2: No, however. {nl}Everything was their plot.
column3: 하지만 아니예요. {nl}모든 건 그들의 계략이었어요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi bukan begitu adanya. {nl} Ini semua merupakan mereka yang menghendaki.{nl}

column2: The ones who broke it first were the demons, however.{nl}That's the Petrifying Frost... they died and their spirits have become stone.{nl}
column3: 하지만 먼저 깬 건 마족이였어요.{nl}그것이 이 석화서리.. 죽음을 넘어서 영혼까지 돌이 되어 버렸지요.{nl}
column4: Tetapi yang terbangun terlebih dahulu adalah Demon.{nl} Itu adalah Petrification Frost ini..Melewati kematian, sampai jiwapun berubah menjadi batu.{nl}

column2: Demon Queen Gesti brought the curse of the petrification on this land,{nl}and the goddesses tried to save the humans. But, the demons asked us whether {nl}we had forgotten not to interfere with each other's matters and...{nl}
column3: 마왕 제스티는 이 일대에 석화의 저주를 내렸고 여신들은 인간을 구원하려고 했어요.{nl}하지만 마족은 서로의 일에 관여하지 않겠다는 규칙을 잊었냐며 그 곳에..{nl}
column4: Demon Gesti mengutuk tempat ini dengan Petrification dan Goddess{nl}bermaksud untuk menyelamatkan manusia. Tetapi Demon bertanya pada para Goddess,{nl}Apakah mereka melupakan janjinya untuk tidak ikut campur{nl} urusan masing-masing di tempat itu..

column2: Wait. This memory is too horrible..{nl}A horrible catastrophe has landed.{nl}
column3: 잠시만요. 너무 괴로운 기억이라서요..{nl}끔찍한 재앙을 내렸어요. {nl}
column4: Tunggu sebentar. Ingatan ini sungguh mengganggu..{nl} Bencana yang menakutkan telah datang. {nl}

column2: Like a big disaster that the goddess might abandon to save this petrified place.{nl}The Petrifying Frost... All of that... This is what we must suffer through to save that which {nl}we abandoned.
column3: 여신들이 석화된 이 곳의 구원을 포기해야 할 만큼 엄청난 재앙을요.{nl}이 석화서리들.. 전부 이게 다.. 저희가 구원을 포기한 대가입니다.{nl}
column4: Ketika Para Goddess menyerah untuk menyelamatkan tempat ini, itu adalah bencana besar.{nl}Petrification Frost ini.. Ini semua adalah..segalanya karena kami menyerah kepada para penyelamat.{nl}

column2: I will try to save the spirits from now on.{nl}Since you fixed all the detectors, we will be able to guide the spirits to eternal sleep.
column3: 지금이라도 그 영혼들을 전부 구원하려고 해요.{nl}계시자님께서 석화 탐지기를 전부 고쳐 주셨으니 반드시 영혼들을 안식으로 인도하겠어요.
column4: Aku bermaksud untuk menyelamatkan seluruh jiwa ini sekarang juga,{nl} Karena kamu telah membantuku untuk memperbaiki seluruh Mineral Detector itu.

column2: We will do our best to guide each and every one of them.{nl}I hope the goddesses bless you.
column3: 정성을 다해 한 분씩 인도할 예정입니다.{nl}계시자님의 앞길에 여신의 은총이 가득하길.
column4: Aku berencana mengarahkan satu per satu dengan tulus.{nl} Semoga perjalanan tuan Savior kedepannya dipenuhi berkat Goddess.

column2: I guess you can't trust me since a demon like me is asking you a favor.{nl}But, look at me closely. It doesn't matter if you laugh at me.{nl}
column3: 마족이 인간인 네게 이런 부탁을 한다는 걸 쉽게 믿을 수 없겠지.{nl}하지만 날 똑똑히 보거라. 이 비참한 꼴을 보며 비웃어도 상관 없다.{nl}
column4: Kamu sebagai manusia tidak bisa mempercayai permohonan bantuan dari seorang Demon.{nl} Bukankah begitu, Perhatikanlah aku dengan baik.Jika kamu menertawakan aku yang menyedihkan ini,{nl}Sungguh menyakitkan.{nl}

column2: I've tried my best to escape for hundreds of years.{nl}But, the curse of the petrification is the power of the Demon Queen. {nl}This endless depression is suffocating me.{nl}
column3: 수 백년 간, 수도 없이 탈출하려 애썼다.{nl}하지만 석화의 저주는 마왕의 힘이다. 계속되는 절망만이 내 목을 조였다.{nl}
column4: Selama ratusan tahun, aku mencoba untuk melarikan diri.{nl} Tetapi kutukan Petrification ini memiliki kekuatan jahat yang sangat besar. Aku merasa putus asa, ini membelenggu tubuhku.{nl}

column2: Even if you escape, you're still a traitor.{nl}You'll be called a "traitor" while at the feet of the colleagues who mocked you...{nl}
column3: 설령 벗어난다 해도 의무를 다 하지 못하고 도망친 자일 뿐. {nl}배신자의 올가미가 씌워지겠지. 날 조롱한 동료들의 발 밑을 기며..{nl}
column4: Bahkan jika berhasil terlepaspun, Aku hanya menjadi seorang pelarian yang{nl}tidak dapat menyelesaikan tugasnya. Hanya akan dianggap sebagai pengkhianat yang memohon belas kasihan{nl}di bawah kaki teman-teman yang menghinaku..{nl}

column2: If you cooperate towards my death, I will definitely remove your curse.{nl}I promise in the name of Giltine.
column3: 나의 죽음에 협조하면 반드시 네 저주를 풀어 주겠다.{nl}길티네님의 이름을 걸고 약속하마.
column4: Jika membantuku menuju kematianku, maka akan aku bebaskan kamu dari Kutukan itu.{nl} Aku berjanji atas nama Giltine.

column2: It doesn't matter what happens to my body.{nl}I just want to rest...
column3: 움직이지도, 떠나지도 못하는 몸 따위 어찌 된 들 무슨 상관인가.{nl}그냥 좀 쉬고 싶을 뿐..
column4: Tidak masalah apapun itu, bagi tubuh yang tidak dapat bergerak dan berpergian seperti ini.{nl} Aku hanya ingin beristirahat saja..

column2: The poisonous plant that grows up there would be able to take my life away.
column3: 저 위쪽에 무성히 자라는 독초라면 내 목숨을 거둘 수 있을 것이다.
column4: Dengan Poisonous Plant yang ada di atas, maka dapat menghabisi nyawaku.

column2: I will pray that a plant that is poisonous to humans brings me eternal rest.
column3: 인간의 독초가 마족인 내게 안식을 가져다 줄 수 있길 빌어야겠지.
column4: Aku berdoa Poisonous Plant milik manusia dapat membuatku Demon ini beristirahat.

column2: Thanks. Now, I will pray for the end of my agonizing life.
column3: 고맙군. 이 고된 삶을 끝낼 수 있길 빌어볼까..
column4: Terima kasih. Apakah aku harus berdoa agar dapat menyelesaikan hidup yang sulit ini..

column2: So nothing occurs as I expected.{nl}If that's the case... We can't say we are in distress. We just have to rely on the one{nl}that we demons want to eliminate.
column3: 역시 아무런 일도 일어나지 않는군.{nl}그렇다면.. 비참하다만 할 수 없겠지. 그토록 없애버리고 싶은 이름에게 기대는 수 밖에.
column4: Tidak ada satupun yang aku harapkan. Jika itu yang terjadi..{nl} Kami tidak bisa mengatakan kesulitan ini. Kami hanya bergantung pada salah satu demon yang ingin disingkirkan.

column2: Please bring the holy water from the one who follows the call of the goddesses.{nl}That sacred power will lead me to death.
column3: 여신의 부름을 따르는 이에게 성수를 얻어 다오.{nl}그 신성한 힘이라면 좋든 나쁘든 날 죽음으로 이끌어 줄 수 있을 것이다.
column4: Dapatkanlah Holy Water dari seorang yang mengikuti perintah Goddess.{nl}Dengan kekuatan sucinya, Aku dapat mengakhiri hidupku dengan kematian.

column2: I heard the Cleric Master handles the holy water.{nl}I don't know if he's going to give me any.
column3: 클레릭 마스터라는 자가 그 성수를 다룬다고 들었다.{nl}마족인 날 위해 쉬이 내줄 수 있을지.
column4: Aku dengar seseorang itu adalah Cleric Master yang mengontrol Holy Water.{nl} Mungkin dia dapat memberikannya untuk Demon sepertiku.

column2: Are you talking about holy water?{nl}I am sorry, but may I ask you where you are going to use it.
column3: 성수 말입니까?{nl}죄송하지만, 어디에 쓰실 것인지 여쭈어 봐도 되겠습니까.
column4: Holy Water yang kamu maksud?{nl} Katakanlah kepadaku, siapa yang akan menggunakan suci ini.

column2: There are demons who need the holy water?{nl}I am sorry, but I can't help you.{nl}
column3: 성수를 필요로 하는 마족이 있다고요?{nl}죄송하지만, 도와드릴 수 없습니다.{nl}
column4: Ada seorang demon yang membutuhkan Holy Water ini?{nl}Oh maafkan aku, Aku tidak dapat membantu.{nl}

column2: I am not going to be involved in your personal matter.{nl}No matter what the reasons are, I can't help a demons' matters as a priest.
column3: 계시자님의 개인적인 일애는 관여하지 않겠습니다만.{nl}어떤 이유이건, 성직자로서 마족의 일에 도움을 드릴 순 없습니다.
column4: Aku tidak ingin mencampuri urusanmu.{nl} Aku sebagai seorang Cleric tidak bisa membantu  apapun untuk para Demon.

column2: As a priest, I can't cooperate on the tasks of the demons.{nl}I hope you understand this as well.
column3: 성직자로서 마족의 일에는 앞으로도 절대 협조할 수 없습니다.{nl}계시자께서도 부디 이해해 주시길 바라겠습니다.
column4: Sebagai Cleric aku tidak ingin bekerjasama dengan rencana Demon.{nl} Aku harap kamu bisa mengerti hal ini.

column2: So... that's it.{nl}Maybe, we came to expect something that we shouldn't expect.
column3: 과연.. 그렇군.{nl}괜한 기대를 한 것인가.
column4: Tentu saja.. Begitu rupanya.{nl} Aku terlalu banyak berharap sepertinya.

column2: The people who I believed to be my colleagues betrayed me. {nl}Then, there is no reason for me to hold on to this.{nl}
column3: 동료라고 믿었던 녀석들은 날 버렸다. {nl}그렇다면 내가 이걸 붙들고 있을 이유도 이젠 없어.{nl}
column4: Orang-orang yang aku percaya sebagai teman telah menghianatiku. {nl}Sekarang aku tidak memiliki alasan  untuk berpercayai masalah ini.{nl}

column2: The demon lord has ordered me to collect the spirits of humans that will be dedicated to the god.{nl}That's why we began working on creating the integrator which would collect the spirits.{nl}
column3: 마군주께선 신에게 바칠 인간의 영혼을 모으라고 명령하셨다.{nl}그래서 우린 이 곳에 영혼을 모을 집약기를 만들었지.{nl}
column4: Demon Lord telah memerintahkan untuk mengumpulkan jiwa manusia yang akan{nl}dihukum oleh Dewa. Kami telah membuat Soul Integrator untuk mengumpulkan jiwa tersebut.{nl}

column2: The process was smooth, but I suffered from the curse of the Petrifying Frost.{nl}Frozen freak, they said while laughing.{nl}
column3: 과정은 순조로웠지만 그만 내가 석화서리의 저주에 당하고 말았다.{nl}꼼짝도 못하던 날 녀석들이 비웃으며 말했다.{nl}
column4: Prosesnya berjalan lancar, Namun semua berhenti karena aku terjebak pada Petrification Frost.{nl} Mereka menertawakan aku yang tidak berdaya ini.{nl}

column2: That I will be the soure of magic of the integrator.{nl}How did I come to forget this...
column3: 이제 난 영혼 집약기의 마력원이 될 거라고.{nl}왜 그 말을 지금껏 잊고 있었을까..
column4: Sekarang aku akan menjadi sumber kekuatan dari Soul Integrator.{nl} Kenapa aku melupakan perkataan itu belakangan ini..

column2: You must know by now.{nl}The curse that has been put on the barrier stone... we use it to pull spirits from humans.{nl}
column3: 너도 당해봐서 알 것이다.{nl}결계석에 걸린 저주.. 인간을 끌여들어 영혼을 뽑아내지.{nl}
column4: Kamu pasti mengetahuinya, karena kamu pernah mengalami hal ini.{nl} Kutukan yang ada pada Barrier Stone.. Menarik para manusia dan mencabut jiwanya.{nl}

column2: The spirits that were pulled will be gathered to the integrator and dedicated to the god.{nl}The god... it is like me.
column3: 그렇게 뽑힌 영혼은 영혼 집약기에 모여 신께 바쳐진다.{nl}그래, 신이라.. 나와 같은 처지나 다름 없지.
column4: Jiwa yang diambil seperti itu dikumpulkan pada Soul Integrator untuk dihukum oleh Dewa.{nl}Begitulah, Dewa.. Tidak ada perbedaan kondisinya denganku.

column2: The integrator is being protected by three barrier stones.{nl}Destroy the barrier stones down there and obtain the cores from them.{nl}
column3: 영혼 집약기는 세 개의 결계석의 보호를 받고 있다.{nl}아래쪽의 결계석부터 파괴하고 그 핵을 가져와 다오.{nl}
column4: Soul Integrator mendapat perlindungan dari tiga buah Barrier Stone.{nl} Hancurkanlah mulai dari Barrier Stone bagian bawah dan bawakanlah Nucleus itu.{nl}

column2: I will cast a spell on you so that you won't get cursed again.{nl}The integrator moves by consuming my vitality so it's easy for me.
column3: 다시 그 저주에 걸리지 않도록 주문을 걸어 주도록 하지.{nl}영혼 집약기는 내 생명력을 빨아들여 움직이니 쉬운 일이다.
column4: Gunakanlah mantra itu agar tidak terkena kutukan kembali.{nl} Soul Integrator sangat mudah menyerap kekuatan manusia dari tubuhnya.

column2: The guys who abandoned me and laughed at me can't be called our colleagues.{nl}I will get my revenge by killing them. I will make them regret that they treated me {nl}like a source of magic.
column3: 날 버리고 비웃던 그 녀석들은 동료라고 불릴 자격도 없다.{nl}죽음으로 복수할 것이다. 날 한낯 동력원따위로 만든 걸 후회하게 해 주지.
column4: Mereka yang membuang dan menertawakanku tidak pantas dipanggil sebagai kawan.{nl} Akan terbalaskan dengan kematian. Akan kubuat mereka menyesal, karena telah membuatku menjadi semacam sumber energi.

column2: Well done. My death is near.
column3: 잘 했다. 점점 죽음이 다가오는구나.{nl}이 핵은 영혼 집약기의 과부하를 일으킬 오브의 재료가 될 것이다.
column4: Bagus. Perlahan kematian datang menghampiriku.{nl} Nucleus ini akan menjadi bahan dari Orb yang membangkitkan besarnya kekuatan dari Soul Integrator.

column2: The next barrier stone is up there. {nl}We have to put in great power all at once. Like an explosion.{nl}
column3: 다음 결계석은 위쪽에 있다. {nl}한 번에 큰 힘을 불어 넣어야 하지. 폭발 같은 것 말이다.{nl}
column4: Barrier Stone berikutnya ada di sebelah atas. {nl} Harus menggunakan kekuatan besar sekaligus. Yang aku maksud adalah seperti ledakan besa.{nl}

column2: Okay... there was a grave robber among the ones who were sacrificed.{nl}I tried to lead myself into death using a bomb, but it was useless.
column3: 그래.. 희생자 중에 도굴꾼이 생각나는군.{nl}폭약으로 날 죽음에 이르게 해 주려고 했었지만, 소용 없었지.
column4: Oke.. Aku teringat akan Grave Robber sebagai korban.{nl} DIa ingin membunuhku dengan peledak, tetapi tidak ada gunanya.

column2: We should not forget about the core of the barrier stone.{nl}To avoid being cursed again, I will cast a spell.
column3: 결계석의 핵을 잊지 말아야 한다.{nl}저주에 걸리지 않도록 주문은 다시 걸어두도록 하지.
column4: Janganlah lupa akan Nucleus dari Barrier Stone.{nl} Gunakanlah kembali mantra menghindari kutukan.

column2: How come I never thought about this.{nl}Maybe my loyalty has surpassed the fear of loneliness.
column3: 왜 진작 이 방법을 떠올리지 못했을까.{nl}나의 충성이 고독의 공포를 앞질렀던 것인지도 모르지.
column4: Kenapa sudah lapa tidak dapat mengingat teknik ini.{nl} Tiada yang tahu Ketaatanku melewati rasa horor akan kesepian.

column2: The last barrier stone must be exploding by now.{nl}
column3: 이쯤 되면 가장 구석에 있는 마지막 결계석은 폭주하고 있을 것이다.{nl}
column4: Jika berada disekitar area ini, maka Barrier Stone terakhir akan berada disana akan meledak.{nl}

column2: As the monsters were being petrified, their last breaths were also solidified... {nl}Throw those against barrier stones.{nl}They will gradually collapse.
column3: 몬스터가 석화되면서 함께 굳어진 마지막 숨결.. 그걸 결계석에 던져라.{nl}서서히 무너질 것이다.
column4: Lemparkanlah itu pada Barrier Stone. Ini akan hancur secara perlahan.

column2: The core of the barrier stone is composed of condensed spirits.{nl}We will make orbs by collecting those that would destroy the integrator.
column3: 결계석의 핵은 응축된 영혼으로 이루어져 있다.{nl}그걸 모아 영혼 집약기를 터뜨릴 오브를 만들 것이다.
column4: Nucleus dari Barrier Stone muncul sebagai Condensed Soul.{nl} Kumpulkanlah itu dan buatlah Orb untuk meledakkan Soul Integrator.

column2: I will put the last of my power into the cores of the barrier stones which you've collected.{nl}Pull out monsters' detonators with this and make an orb.{nl}
column3: 네가 모아온 결계석의 핵에 내 마지막 힘을 실어 주겠다.{nl}이것으로 몬스터의 뇌관을 뽑아 오브를 만들어라.{nl}
column4: Nucleus dari Barrier Stone yang kau kumpulkan, akan menambahkan kekuatan terakhirku.{nl} Buatlah Orb menggunakan ini dengan mengambil detonator dari monster.{nl}

column2: Of course, I will give you a method to make the orb.{nl}The orb that would destroy the integrator.{nl}
column3: 물론 오브를 만들 방법도 주마.{nl}영혼 집약기를 터뜨릴 오브 말이다.{nl}
column4: Tentu saja aku akan memberitahukan cara membuat Orb.{nl} Maksudku adalah Orb yang dapat meledakkan Soul Integrator itu.{nl}

column2: And, please fulfill my last wish.
column3: 그리고 내 마지막 소원을.. 이루어다오.
column4: Lalu kabulkanlah permintaan.. terakhirku.

column2: I've handed over the method to make the orb with my power.{nl}It will be easy to make an orb.
column3: 내 힘과 함께 오브를 만들 방법도 넘겼다.{nl}오브를 만드는 건 쉬운 일일 것이다.
column4: Aku telah memindahkan cara membuat Orb bersamaan dengan kekuatanku.{nl} Membuat Orb adalah hal yang mudah.

column2: Succeeded...{nl}
column3: 성공했군.. {nl}
column4: Telah berhasil rupanya.. {nl}

column2: Do you know the meaning of the name Giltine?{nl}Her name means death. The only thing that I can rely on at the moment.
column3: 길티네님의 이름의 의미를 아는가.{nl}그 분의 뜻은 죽음. 지금 내가 오로지 기댈 수 있는 곳이다.{nl}
column4: Apakah kau mengerti arti dari nama Goddess Giltine.{nl} Artinya adalah kematian. Satu-satunya tempatku bisa bersandar saja.{nl}

column2: I once thought that I didn't care what I turn myself into if it was for the demons long ago.{nl}But, only the Petrifying Frost blew to me.{nl}
column3: 예전의 나는 마족을 위해서라면 무엇이 되어도 상관 없다고 생각했다.{nl}하지만 그런 내게 돌아오는건 재차 불어오는 석화서리뿐이었다.{nl}
column4: Dulu aku berpikir tidak ada masalah apapun yang terjadi jika berkorban untuk Demon.{nl} Tetapi yang kembali padaku lagi hanyalah Petrification Frost saja.{nl}

column2: I started to slowly harden over hundreds of years.{nl}My name has been erased from everyone's minds.{nl}
column3: 수 백년을 천천히 굳어갔다.{nl}모두의 머릿 속에 내 이름은 지워졌다.{nl}
column4: Mengeras perlahan selama ratusan tahun.{nl} semua nama yang ada dikepalaku telah terhapus.

column2: Even if she doesn't bring me eternal rest, it will be better than now.{nl}I just want to rest...
column3: 비록 그 분께서 내게 안식을 내려 주지 않아도 지금보다는 나을 것이다.{nl}그저 쉬고 싶을뿐..
column4: Walau darinya tidak ada perintah untuk beristirahat, kondisinya lebih baik{nl}dibandingkan sekarang. Aku hanya ingin beristirahat..

column2: Death is coming to me.{nl}I feel good.
column3: 죽음이 내게로 다가오고 있다.{nl}기분은 좋군.
column4: Kematian sedang menghampiri diriku.{nl} Senang rasanya.

column2: Yes. That's it. Give it to me.
column3: 그래. 그거야. 이리 다오.
column4: Ok, ini dia cepatlah.

column2: Within the keepsakes you've found for me...{nl}There must be some parts that will fix the detector at the Coastal Fortress.{nl}
column3: 찾아 주신 유품 중에.. 연안요새의 탐지기를 수리할 부품이 있을 겁니다.{nl}
column4: Diantara memento yang kau temukan.. Akan ada sparepart untuk memperbaiki Detector Coastal Fortress.{nl}

column2: Here it is. {nl}The repair shouldn't be that hard.
column3: 여기 있군요. {nl}수리 자체는 어렵지 않을 겁니다.
column4: Ada disini rupanya. {nl} Pengerjaan perbaikan tidaklah sulit.

column2: The Royal Army was taught that they should be loyal and honorable to the kingdom.{nl}And to be committed to due diligence when engaging in their duties.
column3: 왕국군은 왕국에 충성하고 주어진 임무를 다 하는 것이 명예로운 길이라고 배웁니다.{nl}그들의 마지막 임무를 계시자께서 마쳐 주십시오.
column4: Royal Army diajarkan agar mereka harus setia dan menghormati kerajaan. {nl} Dan berkomitmen untuk menekuni pekerjaan mereka dengan sepenuh hati.

column2: You came back a long way.{nl}So these are the parts to fix the petrification detector.
column3: 먼 길 다녀오시느라 수고하셨어요.{nl}이게 석화 탐지기를 수리할 부품들이군요.
column4: Kamu telah bekerja keras karena pergi ke tempat yang jauh.{nl} Ini rupanya adalah sparepart untuk memperbaiki Mineral Detector ya.

column2: It must have been hard to obtain the parts, but the repair itself shouldn't be that hard.{nl}Let's return.
column3: 사실 부품 구하기가 어려워서 그렇지, 수리 자체는 어렵지 않을 겁니다.{nl}어서 돌아가 보시지요.
column4: Sebenarnya itu terjadi karena sulit untuk mendapatkan sparepart perbaikan, pengerjaan perbaikan tidaklah sulit.{nl} Cepatlah kembali.

column2: Pillar
column3: 기둥
column4: Pillar

column2: (It seems like something is written on the pillar.)
column3: 어떤 글귀가 적혀 있는 것 같습니다.
column4: Sepertinya tertulis sesuatu.

column2: [Chelorose's Background]
column3: [클레로스의 배경]
column4: [Chelorose's Background]

column2: N/A
column3: {nl}클레로스는 어느 영주 가문의 장자로 태어났으나 계모의 자식에게 계승권을 빼앗기고 영지밖으로 쫓겨남으로 그의 인생의 첫 실패라 할 일을 기록하였습니다.
column4: {nl}Chelorose terlahir sebagai anak lelaki keluarga bangsawan, tetapi ibu angkatnya mengambil alih hak waris darinya, lalu mengusirnya keluar dari perbatasan, dan hal itu tercata sebagai kegagalan pertamanya di dalam hidup.

column2: N/A
column3: {nl}방황하던 그는 지인의 권유로 변방으로 일자리를 찾아 떠났으나 그것은 사기였고, 강제로 잡힌 채로 죽도록 일만 하는 고생을 하였습니다.
column4: {nl} Ia yang berkelana, pergi mencari pekerjaan sebagai penjaga dengan tawaran dari seorang kenalan, tetapi itu semua adalah tipuan, lalu ia ditangkap paksa, dan diharuskan bekerja mati-matian.

column2: N/A
column3: {nl}그 후에 루클리스의 구원을 받아 반노예의 강제된 삶에서는 벗어나 잠시 무예도 익히며 평화로운 시기를 보냈으나 루클리스가 토벌당함으로 그의 잠시의 안식은 다시 재난으로 변했습니다.
column4: {nl} Setelah itu dengan mendapatkan penyelamatan dari Ruklys dan terlepas dari kehidupan paksa seperti budak, ia menjalani era kedamaian dan sedikit mempelajari ilmu bela diri, tetapi akibat mendapat tekanan dari Ruklys, sehingga istirahatnya sebentar itu berubah kembali menjadi bencana.

column2: (It seems that some letters are visible, but I can't clearly see them.)
column3: 뭔가 적혀 있는 것 같은데, 잘 보이지 않는다.
column4: Sepertinya bertuliskan sesuatu, tapi tidak terlihat jelas.

column2: To be able to read the letters, you must have a piece of the symbol.
column3: 글귀를 읽을 수 있으려면 문양 조각이 있어야 합니다.
column4: Jika ingin membaca huruf ini, maka harus memiliki potongan pola itu.

column2: {nl}You can obtain the piece of the symbol somewhere in Galeed Plateau.
column3: {nl}문양 조각은 갈르엣 평야의 어딘가에서 얻을 수 있습니다.
column4: {nl} Potongan pola bisa didapat di suatu tempat pada Galeed Plateau.

column2: (Something is written, but is not legible.)
column3: 뭔가 씌여 있긴 하지만 읽을 수 없다.
column4: Sesuatu tertulis disini, tetapi tidak dapat dibaca.

column2: (It seems that something is written on it, but it can't be read in this condition.)
column3: 무언가 적혀 있는 것 같지만 이 상태로는 읽을 수 없다.
column4: Entah sepertinya tertuliskan sesuatu, tetapi tidak dapat dibaca dalam kondisi ini.

column2: That ring was given to me by my mom. {nl}She told me to help Ruklys and win.{nl}
column3: 그 반지는 어머니께서 내게 주신 반지다.{nl}루클리스님을 도와 꼭 승리해서 돌아오라고 하셨지.{nl}
column4: Cincin itu adalah cincin yang diberikan oleh Ibu kepadaku.{nl} Aku harus membantu Ruklys dan kembali setelah memenangkan pertarungan.{nl}

column2: Although Ruklys has passed away, this long lasting war doesn't look like it's going to end.{nl}He... Where is Eminent?{nl}
column3: 하지만 루클리스님이 돌아가셨어도 이 긴 전쟁은 끝날 기미가 보이질 않는군.{nl}그는.. 에미넌트는 어디에 있는 거지?{nl}
column4: Walaupun Ruklys telah kembali, belum terlihat ujung dari pertempuran yang panjang ini.{nl} Eminent sekarang ada dimana ya?{nl}

column2: I don't care what happens now.{nl}I want to return to the house where my mom is with this ring.
column3: 뭐가 어떻게 되든 이젠 상관 없어.{nl}난 이 반지와 함께 어머니가 계신 집으로 돌아가고 싶어..
column4: Sekarang apapun yang terjadi tidak ada hubungannya.{nl} Aku ingin kembali ke rumah ibuku berada bersama dengan cincin ini..

column2: Our house is in the inner castle district...{nl}Please... I want to go back home with the ring...
column3: 우리 집은 내성곽지구에 있었지..{nl}부탁이다. 제발 집으로 돌아가고 싶어. 반지와 함께..
column4: Rumahku berada di Inner Enceinte District..{nl}Mohon bantuannya. Aku sungguh ingin kembali ke rumah. Bersama cincin ini..

column2: Yes. Gailus Legwyn is my old friend...{nl}But even an old friend shouldn't just take a precious object and not return it.{nl}
column3: 그래 가일류스 르귄, 내 오랜 친구지.{nl}오랜 친구는 공짜로 남에 귀한 물건을 가져다 쓰고 안 돌려줘도 되나?{nl}
column4: Gailryus Legwyn adalah teman lamaku.{nl} Apakah boleh seorang teman lama mengambil barang berharga milik orang lain, dengan gratis begitu saja?{nl}

column2: If her father is dead, then she should pay for the debt!{nl}Besides, I didn't even see that lady named Justina.{nl}
column3: 아버지가 죽었으면 딸이라도 빚을 갚아야지!{nl}게다가 난 그 유스티나라는 아가씨는 본 적도 없단 말이야.{nl}
column4: Jika ayah telah mati, maka sebagai anak perempuannya harus membayarkan hutangnya!{nl} Lalu aku pun tidak pernah melihat nona muda yang bernama Yustina itu.{nl}

column2: I don't care who she is. It doesn't matter as long as she brings back my object.{nl}I don't care if that woman really is his daughter or not.
column3: 솔직히 이녀석이 누구건 내 물건만 가져다 주면 상관없어!{nl}그 딸이라는 여자가 진짠지 가짠지도 내 알바 아니고 말이야.
column4: Sebenarnya tidak ada masalah jika orang itu hanya membawakan benda milikku!{nl} Aku tidak peduli apakan wanita yang disebut anak perempuannya itu benar atau tidak.

column2: I'm not doing any more trades.{nl}Why do I have to experience this kind of shame?
column3: 이제 거래같은 건 안 하겠어.{nl}내가 왜 이런 수모를 당해야하지?
column4: Sekarang aku tidak akan melakukan transaksi apapun.{nl} Kenapa aku mengalami penghinaan seperti ini?

column2: I want to see Justina...
column3: 유스티나가 보고 싶네..
column4: Ingin bertemu dengan Yustina ya..

column2: I feel like I age a hundred years whenever I deal with Pardoners.
column3: 파드너들을 상대하고 있으면 100살은 더 먹는 기분이에요.
column4: Jika sedang menghadapi Para Pardoneer sepertinya terasa memakan waktu 100 tahun ya.

column2: If I can get back what's mine, I won't return to this place.{nl}His daughter is a successful woman, so she can take care of it.{nl}You better not get involved with these guys.
column3: 내 것만 돌려받으면 여긴 다신 안 오겠어.{nl}딸이 출세 했으니 알아서 하겠지!{nl}너도 이런 녀석들과 얽히지 않는 게 좋을거야.
column4: Kalau aku mendapatkan hal itu kembali, aku tidak akan datang kembali kesini.{nl} Karena anak perempuanku telah sukses, dia akan melakukannya sendiri kan!{nl}

column2: Mesafasla Assistant Commander Gomen
column3: 메사파슬라 부대장 고먼
column4: Mesaphella Team Leader Gorman

column2: This place is a military strategic point and it is also a dangerous area.{nl}You should be careful.
column3: 이 곳은 군사 요충지면서 동시에 위험지역이기도 하지.{nl}아무쪼록 조심하는 것이 좋을 거요.
column4: Tempat ini adalah pusat militer, tetapi juga daerah yang berbahaya juga kan.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika berhati-hati akan apapun

column2: It is hard to maintain the army after the supplies stopped coming from the lower land.{nl}The problem is that the circumstances down there are more severe.
column3: 산 아래로부터 보급이 끊긴 후로는 부대를 유지하는 것조차 힘들다오.{nl}문제는 아래쪽 상황은 더 안좋을 것 같단 말이지.
column4: Setelah Persediaan terhenti sampai di bawah gunung, sungguh sulit untuk menjaga pasukan.{nl} Yang menjadi masalah adalah dibawah sana kondisinya terlihat lebih tidak baik lagi.

column2: We better do our duty fast...{nl}We just have to hang tight a little longer...{nl}
column3: 어서 임무를 수행해야 하는데..{nl}조금만 더 버텨 볼까..{nl}
column4: Harus segera menjalankan misi..{nl} Apakah sebaiknya mencoba bertahan sedikit lagi..

column2: I am not sure how to return to the army.
column3: 부대 복귀를 어떻게 해야할지 막막하군요.
column4: Tidak tahu apa yang harus kulakukan untuk kembali ke pasukan.

column2: Soldier Baskez
column3: 고원병사 바스케즈
column4: Plateau Soldier Vasquez

column2: It will be our end if we sleep here.{nl}We better move our unit a little bit.
column3: 이 곳에서는 잠들면 끝이지.{nl}조금씩이라도 계속 몸을 움직여야 해.
column4: Jika tertidur di tempat seperti ini maka habislah sudah.{nl} Harus terus menggerakan tubuh walaupun sedikit saja.

column2: We are going to freeze to death instead of dying from hunger.{nl}Are there any better options?
column3: 배고픈 것보다도 얼어 죽겠어.{nl}뭐 좋은 방법이 없으려나.
column4: Dibandingkan mati kelaparan, sepertinya akan mati membeku.{nl} Apakah tidak ada cara yang bagus.

column2: Thank you so much for saving me last time.{nl}I want to help you, but I am tied to the army...
column3: 일전에 구해주신 것은 정말로 감사드립니다.{nl}뭐든지 도와드리고 싶지만 부대에 묶인 몸이라...
column4: Sungguh terima kasih banyak, karena telah menyelamatkan waktu yang lalu.{nl} Aku ingin dapat membantu apapun, tetapi tubuh ini terikat pada pasukan...

column2: This place is too cold.{nl}You can clearly see that I can't even move my neck an inch.
column3: 여기는 추워도 너무 춥습니다.{nl}지금 제가 고개도 못 돌리는 게 보이시죠?
column4: Disini sungguh dingin sekali.{nl} Sekarang  tahu kenapa aku tidak dapat mengangguk kan?

column2: Military Courier Rochez
column3: 연락병 로체스
column4: Messenger Roches

column2: I have an important duty to do, but those guys are troubling me.
column3: 중요한 임무를 수행해야 하는데 저 녀석들이 방해를 하는군요.
column4: Aku harus melakukan misi yang penting, tetapi mereka itu terus mengganggu.

column2: Mesafasla is suffering because of the monsters, though this place is also harsh.
column3: 메사파슬라도 몬스터들로 고생 중이겠지만 이 곳도 만만치 않습니다.
column4: Mesaphella pun sedang kesulitan oleh para monster, tetapi di tempat ini pun tidaklah mudah.

column2: I was able to return to the army because of you. Thanks.
column3: 덕분에 부대에 돌아올 수 있었습니다. 감사합니다.
column4: Berkat anda, saya dapat kembali ke pasukan. Terima kasih.

column2: I don't know why I volunteered myself to be a military courier.{nl}My tasks are becoming harder ever since the monsters went crazy.
column3: 제가 왜 연락병을 자처했는지 모르겠습니다.{nl}몬스터들이 극성이라 갈 수록 일이 힘들어지는군요.
column4: Entah kenapa saya menganggap diri sendiri adalah pasukan pengirim pesan.{nl} Para monster sungguh ganas, semakin lama saya pergi semakin sulit rupanya.

column2: Supply Officer Ronda
column3: 보급병 론다
column4: Supply Office Ronda

column2: Supplies are running out, but we still have many people.{nl}You know, I actually rather wish that they would all run away.
column3: 보급물자는 바닥을 보이는데 아직도 식구는 많습니다.{nl}차라리 죄다 도망이나 쳐버렸으면 좋겠어요.
column4: Persediaan material sudah mulai habis, tapi masih banyak orang yang membutuhkannya.{nl} Mungkin juga lebih baik jika semua kabur secara bersamaan.

column2: We get some supplies from hunting the monsters nearby... It's not enough, though...
column3: 임기응변으로 주변 몬스터들을 사냥해 물자를 조달하고는 있지만... 많이 부족합니다.
column4: Dengan beradaptasi pada kondisi, aku sedang mendapatkan material dengan memburu monster di sekitar...  Tetapi masih banyak kurangnya.

column2: There are some potatoes that are growing at Skaika Supply Route.{nl}It's not hard to pick them up...{nl}
column3: 스카이카 보급로 쪽에 고원 감자가 자라고 있어요.{nl}캐는 거야 일도 아닙니다만..{nl}
column4: Plateau Potatoes tumbuh di sekitar Skaika Supply Route.{nl} Menggalinya tidak kuanggap seperti bekerja..{nl}

column2: I am the only supply officer on duty, so I don't have time to pick those potatoes.{nl}If by any chance you visit that place, I would appreciate if you got me some potatoes.
column3: 보급병은 저 혼자라서 감자를 캘 시간도 허락하질 않는군요.{nl}그 쪽으로 가실 일이 있다면 감자를 조금만 부탁드립니다.
column4: Karena Supply Army hanya ada aku seorang, maka tidak akan diijinkan untuk menggali kentang.{nl} Jika kamu ada urusan di arah sana, mohon bantuannya untuk mengambil kentang.

column2: I feel embarassed to have asked you this...{nl}I'm sorry, but I don't have any other choice.
column3: 처음 뵌 분께 이런 부탁을 드리는 건 정말 죄송하지만.. {nl}상황이 이러니 어쩔 수 없네요.
column4: Maaf sekali, karena meminta tolong seperti ini pada orang yang baru ditemui pertama kalinya.. {nl} tetapi karena kondisinya seperti ini, tiada pilihan lain.

column2: I won't have any strength to fight by just eating meat.{nl}Everyone knows it's important to eat a variety of food.
column3: 고기만 먹어선 제대로 싸울 힘이 나지 않습니다.{nl}골고루 먹는 게 중요하지요.
column4: Kalau makan daging saja, kekuatan untuk bertarung tidak akan muncul dengan tepat.{nl} Memakan secara merata sangatlah penting.

column2: Since this place is colder than other areas, it is important to consume nutritious food.{nl}As a supply officer, I am having a hard time.
column3: 여긴 다른 곳보다 춥기 때문에 배는 먹어야 버틸 수 있습니다.{nl}보급병인 제 입장에선 정말 머리가 지끈거리지요.
column4: Karena disini lebih dingin dibandingkan tempat lain, maka harus banyak makan untuk bisa bertahan.{nl} Untuk saya sebagai Pasukan Supply, kepala ini cenut cenut rasanya.
