column2: An outsider is better at going down the mountains.{nl}You will either freeze to death or die from hunger.
column3: 외부인은 어서 산 아래로 내려가는 것이 좋을 거요.{nl}여기 있어봤자 얼어죽거나, 굶어죽기 십상일테니.
column4: Orang luar sebaiknya cepat turun ke bawah gunung.{nl} Kalau berada disini bisa mati membeku atau kedinginan.

column2: Although the kingdom has become famous, we are still soldiers.{nl}This is a military zone. Please leave you are not an official.
column3: 왕국이 유명무실해졌어도 우린 아직 군인이오.{nl}여긴 군사지역이고. 관계자가 아니라면 떠나 주시오.
column4: Walaupun kerajaan menjadi terkenal, kami hanyalah prajurit biasa.{nl} dan disini adalah daerah militer. Jika tidak berkepentingan, silahkan pergi dari tempat ini.

column2: I heard that this place was used as a workshop.{nl}We are able to find old materials easily, but the problem is the food shortage.
column3: 이 곳은 먼 옛날에 노역장으로 쓰인 적이 있다더군요.{nl}그래서인지 낡은 자재 같은 것은 손쉽게 구할 수 있습니다만 문제는 먹을 것이군요.
column4: Tempat ini dahulu pernah dipakai sebagai tempat kerja paksa.{nl} Maka dari itu material tua dapat dengan mudah ditemukan disini, yang menjadi masalah adalah makanan.

column2: I am worried since the number of my men who are running away is increasing.{nl}Our supplies will last longer, but I am worried that I may become the only one left.
column3: 도망치는 부하놈들이 갈 수록 늘어서 걱정입니다.{nl}그만큼 비축물자는 절약되겠지만 이러다가는 나 혼자 남는 건 아닌지 모르겠군요.
column4: Aku jadi khawatir karena jumlah anak buah yang kabur terus bertambah.{nl}그만큼 비축물자는 절약되겠지만 이러다가는 나 혼자 남는 건 아닌지 모르겠군요.

column2: Injured People in the Tent
column3: 텐트 속의 부상자
column4: Orang terluka di dalam Tenda

column2: Rrr... Master...{nl}The pain is too much for me..
column3: 으윽... 스승님...{nl}너무 괴로워요...
column4: Eughh… Guru..{nl} Sungguh menyakitkan…

column2: Mom... I miss you... Urgg...
column3: 엄마... 보고싶어요... 으으으...
column4: Ibu… aku kangen.. Huuu huu…

column2: Mage Horace
column3: 마법사 호라스
column4: Wizard Horace

column2: Thanks for saving me.{nl}But, if we don't act now, we won't be able to hold out much longer.
column3: 덕분에 살았습니다.{nl}하지만 그런 극단적인 선택이라도 하지 않는다면 저나 이분들은 오래 버틸 수 없을 겁니다.
column4: Berkat kamu saya selamat.{nl}Tetapi jika bukan karena pilihan ekstrim seperti ini, mungkin saya dan juga orang lainnya tidak dapat bertahan lama.

column2: I am still an apprentice, so there isn't much I can do.{nl}I'd have to utilize my knowledge that I gained from reading books.
column3: 아직 견습인 몸이라 할 수 있는게 많지 않네요.{nl}그간 독서로 얻은 잡지식이라도 활용해봐야죠.
column4: Karena tubuh ini masih dalam masa penyesuaian, maka belum banyak hal yang dapat dilakukan.{nl} Harus coba menggunakan pengetahuan yang didapat dari bacaan selama itu ya.

column2: Soldier Motimer
column3: 고원병사 모티머
column4: Plateau Soldier Mortimer

column2: If he didn't have a firm control on the workshop's warehouse, {nl}we wouldn't have suffered so much.
column3: 그 녀석이 노역 관리소의 창고만 틀어쥐지 않았어도 덜 고생했을 겁니다.
column4: mungkin akan lebih sedikit mudah baginya jika ia  tidak mengambil alih hanya gudang dari Work Management Office.

column2: Are they suffering like us because of the monsters down there?
column3: 산 아래쪽도 우리처럼 몬스터로 고생하고 있을까요?
column4: Apakah di bagian bawah gunung juga sedang mengalami kesulitan karena monster seperti kita?

column2: Where has Goddess Zemyna gone to...
column3: 제미나 여신께선 어디에 계실까..
column4: Dimanakah Zemyna Goddess berada..

column2: We came this far so it must not be wrong.
column3: 여기까지 왔는데 설마 틀린 건 아니겠지.
column4: Sudah datang sampai kesini, tidak mungkin salah kan.

column2: Avoiding the Petrifying Frost
column3: 석화서리를 피해
column4: Avoiding the Petrifying Frost

column2: Ask what happens if we help
column3: 무엇을 도우면 되는지 물어 본다
column4: Bertanya apa yang terjadi bila kami membantu

column2: Thanks for saving me, but I will leave now
column3: 구해준 건 감사하지만 이만 떠나겠다고 한다
column4: Terima kasih telah menolongku, namun aku harus pergi sekarang

column2: Look for another way
column3: 너무 머니 다른 방법을 찾자고 한다
column4: Mencari cara lain

column2: I can't help you
column3: 도울 여력이 없다고 한다
column4: Aku tidak bisa membantu

column2: I will stay here for a while
column3: 잠시 여기에 머물다 가겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan tinggal disini sementara waktu

column2: I will go fix the petrification detector
column3: 석화 탐지기를 수리하고 오겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan memperbaiki petrification detector

column2: I need a moment to prepare more
column3: 잠시 준비가 더 필요하다고 한다
column4: Aku membutuhkan waktu untuk melakukan pesiapan lebih

column2: The detector starts to activate!
column3: 석화 탐지기가 작동하기 시작합니다!
column4: Mineral Detector mulai beroperasi!

column2: The parts aren't well secured.{nl}We should obtain some kind of straos from monsters nearby
column3: 부품이 잘 고정되지 않습니다{nl}주변의 몬스터로부터 끈 같은 것을 구해야 할 것 같습니다
column4: Spare part tidak layak digunakan{nl} Sepertinya harus merncari sesuatu seperti Strap dari monster di sekitar

column2: Something that will hold the parts together is needed
column3: 부품을 고정할만한 것이 필요합니다
column4: Membutuhkan spare part yang layak

column2: Ask her to guide the spirits
column3: 영혼의 인도를 부탁한다고 한다
column4: Berkata meminta tolong Soul Guidance

column2: Listen closely
column3: 이야기를 다시 듣는다
column4: Mendengar kembali cerita

column2: Looking at the barrier stone
column3: 결계석을 살펴 보는 중
column4: Sedang memeriksa Barrier Stone

column2: You feel like your spirit is being pulled into the barrier stone!{nl}We should look for someone who can fix this quickly!
column3: 결계석으로 영혼이 빨려 들어가는 느낌입니다!{nl}이걸 해결해 줄 누군가를 빨리 찾아야 합니다!
column4: Perasaan seperti jiwa ini terhisap masuk oleh Barrier Stone!{nl} Harus cepat mencari seseorang yang bisa menyelesaikan hal ini!

column2: I can't help the demons
column3: 마족을 도울 수는 없다고 한다
column4: Berkata tidak dapat membantu Demon

column2: I will go back
column3: 어쩔 수 없으니 돌아가겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata harus kembali karena tiada pilihan lain

column2: I will think about it for a while
column3: 잠시 생각 좀 해 보겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata akan mencoba memikirkannya sebentar

column2: I will go get some holy water
column3: 성수를 얻어 오겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata akan kembali dengan mendapatkan Holy Water

column2: I can't cooperate with that
column3: 이제 협조할 수 없다고 한다
column4: Berkata sekarang tidak dapat bekerja sama

column2: For Death (1)
column3: 죽음을 위하여(1)
column4: For Death (1)

column2: I will destroy the integrator
column3: 영혼 집약기를 파괴하겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata akan menghancurkan Soul Integrator

column2: I will stop helping
column3: 그만 돕겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata akan berhenti membantu

column2: About the integrator
column3: 영혼 집약기에 대해
column4: Mengenai Soul Integrator

column2: You hear the movement of monsters!{nl}Destroy the barrier stones by avoiding the monster's attacks!
column3: 인기척을 느낀 몬스터들이 몰려옵니다!{nl}몬스터의 공격을 피해 결계석을 파괴하세요!
column4: Para monster yang merasakan kehadiran kamu datang menyerbu!{nl} Menghindarlah dari serangan monster, dan hancurkanlah Barrier Stone!

column2: For Death (2)
column3: 죽음을 위하여(2)
column4: For Death (2)

column2: I will go collect some explosives
column3: 폭약을 모아 오겠다고 한다
column4: Berkata akan mengumpulkan Explosive

column2: Lighting up the explosive
column3: 폭약에 불 붙이는 중
column4: Sedang menyalakan Explosive

column2: The barrier stone has been destroyed due to a great explosion!
column3: 강력한 폭발로 결계석이 파괴되었습니다!
column4: Barrier Stone telah dihancurkan dengan ledakan yang kuat!

column2: For Death( 3)
column3: 죽음을 위하여(3)
column4: For Death (3)

column2: Putting the orb in place
column3: 오브를 놓는 중
column4: Sedang menaruh Orb

column2: Say Farewell
column3: 작별 인사를 건넨다
column4: Memberikan Salam perpisahan

column2: Examining the Soldier's Grave
column3: 병사의 무덤 확인 중
column4: Sedang memeriksa Makam Prajurit

column2: Let's help
column3: 도와주자
column4: Bantulah Aku

column2: Putting down the ring
column3: 반지 놓는 중
column4: Meletakkan Ring

column2: Look at the petrification detector at the entrance of the Coastal Fortress
column3: 연안요새 입구의 석화 탐지기를 살펴 보세요.
column4: Cobalah memeriksa Mineral Detector di Coastal Fortress

column2: Escape from the Petrifying Frost
column3: 석화서리로부터 탈출
column4: Melarikan diri dari Petrification Frost

column2: The Petrifying Frost blows against you as you try to check the detector. {nl}Get to a safe place to avoid the Petrifying Frost!
column3: 탐지기를 살펴보려 하자 공교롭게도 석화서리가 불어오는 것 같습니다. 석화서리를 피해 안전한 곳으로 달리세요!
column4: Ketika bermaksud memeriksa detector, sepertinya secara kebetulan Petrification Frost bertiup. Berlarilah ke tempat aman untuk menghindari Petrification Frost!

column2: You were able to escape safely from the Petrifying Frost thanks to Kupole Meile. {nl}Talk with Kupole Meile.
column3: 큐폴 메일레 덕분에 석화서리로부터 무사히 피신할 수 있었습니다. 큐폴 메일레와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Berkat Kupole Meile, dapat menghindari Petrification Frost dengan selamat. Bicaralah dengan Kupole Meile.

column2: In order for Kupole Meile to guide the spirits safely from the Petrifying Frost, {nl}check all the detectors that you haven't been to in this region.
column3: 큐폴 메일레가 석화서리로부터 안전하게 영혼들을 인도할 수 있도록 이 지역에 아직 가보지 않은 곳의 탐지기를 모두 점검하세요.
column4: Cobalah periksa semua detector di tempat yang belum periksa, agar Kupole Meile dapat mengarahkan para jiwa dengan selamat dari Petrification Frost.

column2: Discuss the circumstances with Kupole Meile
column3: 큐폴 메일레에게 상황 전달
column4: Menyampaikan keadaan kepada Kupole Meile

column2: You've checked all four detectors except for the detector at the entrance. {nl}Now, go back to Kupole Meile and tell her about the circumstances.
column3: 입구 쪽에 있던 탐지기를 제외한 4개의 탐지기를 모두 확인했습니다. 이제 큐폴 메일레에게 돌아가서 상황을 전해 주세요.
column4: Telah memeriksa 4 buah detector seluruhnya, diluar detector yang ada di pintu masuk. Sekarang kembalilah pada Kupole Meile dan beritahukan kondisinya.

column2: It seems that Kupole Meile will be able to guide the spirits safely after repairing the detector. {nl}Talk with Kupole Meile again.
column3: 고장난 탐지기를 고쳐야 큐폴 메일레가 안전하게 영혼을 인도할 수 있을 것 같습니다. 큐폴 메일레와 다시 대화해 보세요.
column4: Harus memperbaiki Detector yang rusak, agar Kupole Meile dapat mengarahkan jiwa dengan aman. Cobalah bicara lagi dengan Kupole Meile.

column2: Meet Soldier Retia
column3: 왕국군 레티아 찾아가기
column4: Pergi mencari Royal Army Guard Retia

column2: Kupole Meile told you that the kingdom soldiers would know the most since they set the {nl}detectors. Go meet Retia at Verkti Square.
column3: 큐폴 메일레는 왕국군이 석화 탐지기를 설치했으니 그들이 제일 잘 알 것이라고 합니다. 베르크티 광장의 왕국군 장교 레티아를 찾아가 보세요.
column4: Kupole Meile berkata karena pasukan kerajaan telah memasang Mineral Detector, maka merekalah yang paling mengetahui hal itu. Pergilah mencari General Royal Army Guard Retia di Verkti Square.

column2: It seems that Retia knows that the detector at the Coastal Fortress is already broken. {nl}Talk with Retia about the detector that is not activating.
column3: 왕국군 레티에는 연안요새의 석화 탐지기가 이미 고장나 있다는 것을 알고 있는 것 같습니다. 작동하지 않는 석화탐지기에 대해 왕국군 레티아와 대화를 더 나눠보세요.
column4: Royal Army Guard Retia sepertinya sudah tahu bahwa mineral detector yang ada di Coastal Fortress telah rusak.  Cobalah berbagi cerita dengan Royal Army Guard Retia untuk membicarakan mengenai Mineral Detector yang tidak berfungsi.

column2: Look for the reinforcement's whereabouts at the Coastal Fortress
column3: 연안요새의 지원 병력 행방 수색
column4: Mencari jejak kekuatan bantuan dari Coastal Fortress

column2: Chase after the volunteers who had been dispatched to the Coastal Fortress. {nl}If there are no survivors, then we should at least collect their keepsakes. {nl}There's a possibility that monsters stole them so you better hunt the monsters nearby.
column3: 연안요새로 파견 나간 지원병들을 추적하세요. 생존자가 없다면 그들의 유품이라도 수습해야 합니다. 몬스터가 약탈할 가능성도 있으니 근처의 몬스터를 사냥해 보는 것도 좋습니다.
column4: Lacaklah Para pasukan bantuan yang keluar bertugas ke Coastal Fortress. Jika tidak ada yang selamat, maka harus mengumpulkan benda-benda peninggalan milik mereka.  Alangkah baiknya jika kamu juga menghabisi monster yang ada di sekitar, karena ada kemungkinan barang tersebut dirampas monster.

column2: Hand them over to the soldier, Retia
column3: 왕국군 레티아에게 전달
column4: Menyampaikan kepada  Royal Army Guard Retia

column2: Unfortunately, there aren't any survivors. Go back to Retia since you've collected all keepsakes.
column3: 왕국군 병사들은 안타깝게도 생존자가 없었습니다. 유품을 모두 수습하였으니 레티아에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Sayangnya para pasukan kerajaan tidak ada yang selamat. Karena telah mengumpulkan seluruh barang peninggalan mereka, kembalilah pada Retia.

column2: Go meet Retia and talk about the repair of the detector at the Coastal Fortress.
column3: 왕국군 장교 레티아에게 연안요새의 석화 탐지기 수리에 대해 대화해 보세요.
column4: Cobalah bicara mengenai perbaikan Detector kepada Royal Army Guard Retia di Coastal Fortress.

column2: Go meet Retia and talk about the repair of the detector at the Coastal Fortress.
column3: 왕국군 장교 레티아에게 연안요새의 석화 탐지기 수리에 대화해 보세요.
column4: Cobalah bicara mengenai perbaikan Detector kepada Royal Army Guard Retia di Coastal Fortress.

column2: Return to Kupole Meile
column3: 큐폴 메일레에게 복귀
column4: Kembali pada Kupole Meile

column2: You are now ready to fix the detector. Talk with Kupole Meile.
column3: 석화 탐지기를 수리할 준비를 마쳤습니다. 큐폴 메일레와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Telah selesai mempersiapkan Mineral Detector. Cobalah bicara dengan Kupole Meile.

column2: Repair the detector at the dock
column3: 선착장의 석화 탐지기 수리
column4: Memperbaiki Detector di Dock

column2: Help Kupole Meile to guide the spirits safely by repairing the detector at the dock.
column3: 큐폴 메일레가 영혼을 안전하게 인도할 수 있도록 작동하지 않았던 선착장의 석화 탐지기를 수리 하세요.
column4: Perbaikilah Detector di Dock yang tidak berfungsi, agar Kupole Meile dapat mengarahkan jiwa dengan aman.

column2: You've defeated all the monsters that suddenly appeared. Now, you will be able to repair the detector.
column3: 갑자기 몰려든 몬스터를 모두 물리쳤습니다. 이제 안심하고 석화 탐지기를 수리 할 수 있을 것 같습니다.
column4: Telah berhasil mengalahkan seluruh monster yang datang menyerang mendadak. Sekarang sepertinya kondisi sudah tenang dan dapat memperbaiki Detector.

column2: Repair the detector at Skida Bastion
column3: 스키다 보루의 석화 탐지기 수리
column4: Memperbaiki Detector dari Skida Fortress

column2: Go repair the detector at Skida Bastion in order for Kupole Meile to guide the spirits safely.
column3: 큐폴 메일레가 안전하게 영혼을 인도할 수 있도록 스키다 보루의 석화 탐지기를 수리하러 가세요.
column4: Perbaikilah Detector di Skida Fortress agar Kupole Meile dapat mengarahkan jiwa dengan aman.

column2: Collect the straps
column3: 고정할 끈 수집
column4: Cari Fastening String

column2: In order to fix the detector, you will need some kind of strap that will hold the parts well in place. Obtain some straps from the monsters.
column3: 석화 탐지기를 고치려면 부품을 잘 고정 시켜 줄 만한 것이 필요 할 것 같습니다. 몬스터에게 노끈 같은 것을 구해 보세요.
column4: Jika ingin memperbaiki Detector, maka sepertinya perlu memasang sparepart dengan baik dan tepat. Cobalah mencari sesuatu seperti tali dari Monster.

column2: You've obtained all the straps that will be used to hold the parts. To help Kupole Meile to guide the spirit safely, repair the detector at Skida Bastion.
column3: 고정 할 끈을 모두 구했습니다. 이제 큐폴 메일레가 안전하게 영혼을 인도할 수 있도록 스키다 보루의 석화 탐지기를 수리하세요.
column4: Telah mendapatkan semua Fastening String. Sekarang perbaikilah Mineral Detector di Skida Fortress agar Kupole Meile dapat mengarahkan jiwa dengan aman.

column2: Look at the suspicious barrier stone
column3: 수상한 결계석 살펴 보기
column4: Mencoba memeriksa Barrier Stone yang mencurigakan

column2: It seems like an unknown barrier stone keeps calling me. {nl}Are we going to know more if we look at it more carefully?
column3: 알 수 없는 결계석이 자꾸만 나를 부르는 느낌입니다. 살펴 보면 알 수 있지 않을까요?
column4: Aku merasakan panggilan yang sering datang dari Barrier Stone yang tidak diketahui. Apakah tidak bisa ditahui dengan memeriksanya?

column2: Look for someone who will be helpful
column3: 도움을 줄 만한 누군가를 찾기
column4: Mencari seseorang yang layak untuk membantu

column2: Your stamina keeps decreasing as if you are losing your spirit. Quickly find someone who can fix this situation.
column3: 영혼이 빠져 나가고 있는 것인지, 점점 기운이 없어지면서 스태미나가 빠져 나가고 있습니다. 어서 움직여서 이 상황을 풀어 줄 누군가를 찾아 보세요.
column4: Entah apakah Jiwa ini terbang keluar, atau perlahan energi ini menghilang, staminapun juga habis. Cepat carilah seseorang yang tau cara untuk mengatasi kondisi ini.

column2: Talk with Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Demon Shetrigailla

column2: Demon Svitrigaila is muttering something that that is difficult to understand. I hope you somehow heard his story.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 선뜻 이해하기 힘든 혼잣말을 하고 있습니다. 아무래도 사연을 들어 보는 것이 좋겠습니다.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla sedang berbicara sendiri dan sulit untuk dimengerti. Ada baiknya jika coba mendengarkan alasannya apapun itu.

column2: Collect the Poisonous Plant growing in the Zinios Survey Office
column3: 지니오스 측량소에 자라는 독초 수집
column4: Mengumpulkan Poisonous Plants di Ginios Survey Office

column2: Demon Svitrigaila told you that he will remove the curse from you if you help him die. Obtain Poisonous Plant from the Zinios Survey Office.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 자신이 죽는 것을 도와준다면 저주를 풀어 주겠다고 합니다. 지니오스 측량소에 자라는 독초를 구해 오세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla jika membantunya untuk mati, maka ia akan melepaskan kutukan katanya. Datanglah membawa Poisonous Plant yang tumbuh di Ginios Survey Office.

column2: Hand over the Poisonous Plant to Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라에게 독초 전달
column4: Memberikan Poisonous plants kepada Demon Shetrigailla

column2: It seems like you've obtained all the Poisonous Plant Demon Svitrigaila wanted. Hand them over to Svitrigaila.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라가 원하는 독초를 모두 구한 것 같습니다. 이 독초들을 쉬트리가일라에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Sepertinya kamu telah mendapatkan seluruh Poisonous Plant yang diinginkan Demon Shetrigailla. Berikanlah Poisonous Plant ini kepada Shetrigailla.

column2: Talk with the Cleric Master on how to obtain the crystal that Svitrigaila needs
column3: 쉬트리가일라에게 필요한 성수를 얻기 위해 클레릭 마스터와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Bicaralah dengan Cleric Master untuk mendapatkan Holy Water yang dibutuhkan oleh Shetrigailla.

column2: Return to Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라에게 돌아가기
column4: Kembali pada Demon Shetrigailla

column2: The Cleric Master has told you that he can't help the demons. It is unfortunate, but please tell this to Demon Svitrigaila.
column3: 클레릭 마스터는 어떤 이유이건 마족을 도울 순 없다고 합니다. 아쉽지만 어쨌든 이 사실을 마족 쉬트리가일라에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Cleric Master berkata dia tidak bisa membantu Demon. Sayang sekali, tetapi bagaimanapun beritahukan kebenaran ini kepada Demon Shetrigailla.

column2: It seems that the Poisonous Plant isn't effective on Demon Svitrigaila. Talk to him again.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라에게 독초는 효과가 없는 것 같습니다. 다시 그와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Sepertinya tidak ada Efek dari Poisonous Plant kepada Demon Shetrigailla. Bicaralah kembali dengannya.

column2: Demon Svitrigaila wants to die using the crystal since the Poisonous Plant isn't effective. {nl}Meet with the Cleric Master and obtain the holy water.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 독초가 효과가 없기에 성수를 이용하여 죽음에 이르려 합니다. 클레릭 마스터를 찾아 가 성수를 얻어 오세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla berkata karena tidak ada efek dari Poisonous Plant, dengan menggunakan Holy Water akan berakibat kematian. Pergilah mencari Cleric Master dan dapatkanlah Holy Water.

column2: For Death
column3: 죽음을 위하여
column4: For Death

column2: It seems that Demon Svitrigaila already knows about it. Talk to him again what he should do.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 이미 알고 있었다는 눈치입니다. 이제 어떻게 해야 할 지 그와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla sudah mengetahui hal itu. Sekarang bicaralah dengannya apakah yang harus dilakukan.

column2: Destroy the barrier stone at Dvus Street
column3: 드부스 거리의 결계석 파괴
column4: Menghancurkan Barrier stone di Dubus Street

column2: Demon Svitrigaila will die when you destroy the integrator using the barrier stone. Destroy the barrier stone that is protecting the integrator and collect the cores.
column3: 결계석을 이용하여 영혼 집약기를 파괴하면 마족 쉬트리가일라가 죽음에 이르게 된다고 합니다. 영혼 집약기를 지키고 있는 드부스 거리의 결계석을 파괴하고 그 핵을 수집하세요.
column4: Jika menghancurkan Soul Integrator dengan menggunakan Barrier Stone, Demon Shetrigailla berkata akan berakhir dengan kematian. Hancurkanlah Barrier Stone yang menjagai Soul Integrator di Dubus Street, dan kumpulkanlah Nucleus  itu.

column2: You've collected the cores by destroying the barrier stones at Dvus Street. and over the core to Svitrigaila.
column3: 드부스 거리의 결계석을 파괴하여 핵을 수집햇습니다. 이 핵을 쉬트리가일라에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Telah mengumpukan Nucleus  dengan menghancurkan Barrier Stone di Dubus Street. Berikanlah Nucleus  ini kepada Shetrigailla.

column2: Destroy the barrier stone and collect %s
column3: 결계석을 파괴하고 %s 수집
column4: Menghancurkan Barrier Stone dan mengumpulkan %s

column2: Destroy the barrier stone and collect the cores
column3: 결계석을 파괴하고 핵 수집
column4: Menghancurkan Barrier Stone dan mengumpulkan Nucleous

column2: Talk with Svitrigaila what you should do to destroy the next barrier stone.
column3: 다음 결계석을 파괴하기 위해서는 어떻게 해야 하는지 쉬트리가일라와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Cobalah bicara dengan Shetrigailla apa yang harus dilakukan untuk menghancurkan Barrier Stone berikutnya.

column2: Collect the bombs from the petrified grave robbers
column3: 석화된 도굴꾼에게서 폭약 수집
column4: Mengumpulkan Explosive dari Petrified Tomb Robber

column2: Demon Svitrigaila told you that the next barrier stone can be destroyed using the bomb. Collect the bombs from the petrified grave robbers.
column3: 마족 쉬트가일라는 다음 결계석은 폭약으로 파괴할 수 있다고 합니다. 석화된 도굴꾼에게서 폭약을 수집하세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla berkata dapat menghancurkan Barrier stone berikutnya dengan Explosive. Kumpulkanlah Explosive dari Petrified Tomb Robber.

column2: Destroy the barrier stone at Bakaleja Market Lot.
column3: 바카레자 시장 터의 결계석 폭파
column4: Meledakkan Barrier Stone di Bakareza Market Lot

column2: It seems like you would be able to destroy the barrier stone using those bombs. Destroy the barrier stone using the bombs at Bakaleja Market Lot.
column3: 이 정도 양의 폭약이면 결계석을 파괴할 수 있을 것 같습니다. 폭약으로 바카레자 시장 터의 결계석을 폭파하세요.
column4: Dengan jumlah Explosive sebanyak ini, sepertinya dapat menghancurkan Barrier Stone. Ledakkanlah Barrier Stone yang ada di Bakareza Market Lot dengan Explosive.

column2: Talk with Svitrigaila about what you should do to destroy the last barrier stone.
column3: 마지막 결계석을 파괴하기 위해 어떻게 해야 하는지 쉬트리가일라와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Cobalah bicara dengan Shetrigailla apa yang harus dilakukan untuk menghancurkan Barrier Stone terakhir.

column2: Destroy the barrier stone at the surveillance watch tower
column3: 경비 망루의 결계석 파괴
column4: Menghancurkan Barrier Stone di Watch Tower

column2: In order to destroy the last barrier stone, Svitrigaila has told you that she needs the last breath of the monsters. Obtain the last breath that turned into a stone from the petrified monsters and throw it against the barrier stone at the surveillance watch tower.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 마지막 결계석을 파괴하려면 몬스터의 마지막 숨결이 필요하다고 합니다. 석화 된 몬스터에게서 돌이 된 마지막 숨결을 구해 경비 망루의 결계석에 던져 넣어 파괴하세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla berkata jika ingin menghancurkan Barrier Stone terakhir, maka membutuhkan Last Breath dari Monster. Dapatkan Last Breath dari monster kemudian melemparkannya pada Watchtower's Barrier Stone untuk memusnahkannya.

column2: Hand over the core of the barrier stone to Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트가일라에게 결계석의 핵 전달
column4: Memberikan Barrier Stone Nucleous kepada Demon Shetrigailla

column2: You've destroyed all the barrier stones and obtained the cores. Hand over the cores of the barrier stones to Svitrigaila.
column3: 마지막 결계석이 파괴되고 핵을 수집했습니다. 쉬트리가일라에게 결계석의 핵을 가져다 주세요.
column4: Barrier Stone terakhir telah dihancurkan dan sudah mengumpulkan Nucleus . Bawalah Barrier Stone Nucleus  kepada Shetrigailla.

column2: You've destroyed all the barrier stones and obtained the cores so talk with Demon Svitrigaila about what you should do next.
column3: 모든 결계석을 파괴하고 그 핵을 구했으니 이제 어떻게 해야 할지 마족 쉬트리가일라와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Karena telah mengumpulkan Nucleus  itu dan menghancurkan semua Barrier Stone, sekarang bicaralah kepada Demon Shetrigailla apakah yang harus dilakukan sekarang.

column2: Craft Svitrigaila's Orb
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 오브 제작
column4: Membuat Shetrigailla's Orb

column2: Demon Svitrigaila has asked you to create the orbs that would destroy the integrator. Obtain detonators from the petrified monsters and use the craft manuals to create Svitrigaila's Orbs.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라는 영혼 집약기를 터뜨릴 오브를 만들라고 합니다. 석화된 몬스터로부터 뇌관을 구한 뒤 제작서를 사용하여 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 만드세요.
column4: Demon Shetrigailla bermaksud untuk membuat Orb yang menghancurkan Soul Integrator. Setelah mendapatkan Detonator dari Monster yang membatu, maka dengan menggunakan Production Scroll buatlah Shetrigailla's Orb.

column2: Destroy the integrator at the Collapsed Temple Lot
column3: 무너진 사원 터의 영혼 집약기 파괴
column4: Menghancurkan Soul Integrator di Collapsed Temple Lot

column2: You've created Svitrigaila's Orb. Take this orb to the integrator.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 만들었습니다. 이 오브를 영혼 집약기로 가져가세요.
column4: Telah membuat Shetrigailla's Orb. Bawalah Orb ini ke Soul Integrator.

column2: Destroy the integrator
column3: 영혼 집약기 파괴
column4: Menghancurkan Soul Integrator

column2: The time to destroy the integrator has come. {nl}Take Svitrigaila's Orb and destroy the integrator.
column3: 영혼 집약기를 파괴할 때가 왔습니다. 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 가지고 영혼 집약기를 파괴하세요.
column4: Waktu untuk menghancurkan Soul Integrator telah tiba. Bawalah Shetrigailla's Orb dan hancurkan Soul Integrator.

column2: As Svitrigaila puts down the orb, the monsters who felt the power are gathering near it. {nl}Defeat the monsters.
column3: 쉬트리가일라의 오브를 놓자, 그 힘을 느낀 몬스터들이 마구 몰려들기 시작했습니다. 몰려온 몬스터를 물리치세요.
column4: Ayo taruh Shetrigailla's Orb, Para monster yang merasakan kekuatan itu sudah mulai datang menyerang. Habisi monster yang menyerangmu.

column2: The integrator has been destroyed. Return to Svitrigaila.
column3: 영혼 집약기가 파괴되었습니다. 이제 쉬트리가일라에게 돌아가 보세요.
column4: Soul Integrator telah dihancurkan. Sekarang kembalilah kepada Shetrigailla.

column2: Listen to the last words of Demon Svitrigaila
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라 마지막 말 들어 주기
column4: Mendengarkan kalimat terakhir Demon Shetrigailla

column2: Now is the time to listen to the wishes of Demon Svitrigaila. Listen to his words.
column3: 마족 쉬트리가일라의 소원을 들어 줄 시간인 것 같습니다. 그의 말을 들어 주세요.
column4: Ini sepertinya adalah waktu dari Demon Shetrigailla mengabulkan permintaan. Cobalah dengarkan perkataannya.

column2: Examine the Soldier's Grave
column3: 병사의 무덤 확인
column4: memeriksa Kuburan para prajurit

column2: There is a grave of a soldier that looks very old. Take a look at it.
column3: 아주 오래되어 보이는 병사의 무덤이 있습니다. 한 번 살펴 보세요.
column4: Terdapat sebuah kuburan prajurit yang terlihat sudah lama sekali. Cobalah periksa sekali.

column2: Defeat the resentment that rushed in
column3: 급습한 원한 처치
column4: Kalahkan Necroventer yang datang

column2: Suddenly a monster came to attack the soldier's spirit. You better destroy it.
column3: 갑자기 병사 영혼이 몬스터가 되어 공격해 옵니다. 일단 처치하는 것이 좋겠습니다.
column4: Oh tidak, Jiwa Prajurit berubah menjadi Demon dan datang menyerang. Kalahkan Necroventer yang menyerangmu.

column2: The Resentful Soldier's Spirit seems to be somewhat calm. {nl}Talk with the Resentful Soldier's Spirit.
column3: 원한 서린 병사 영혼이 어느 정도 진정되는 것 같습니다. 원한 서린 병사 영혼과 대화하세요
column4: Resentful Soldier's Spirit sepertinya telah menjadi cukup tenang. Bicaralah dengan Resentful Soldier's Spirit

column2: The spirit seems to have some story. Talk with the Resentful Soldier's Spirit.
column3: 뭔가 사연이 있어 보이는 영혼입니다. 원한 서린 병사 영혼과 대화하세요.
column4: Jiwa yang terlihat memiliki suatu alasan tertentu. Bicaralah dengan Resentful Soldier's Spirit.

column2: The Resentful Soldier's Spirit wants to go back to the house where his mother is with the ring. Go to the soldier's house which is located inside the castle walls with the ring.
column3: 원한 서린 병사 영혼은 반지와 함께 어머니가 계신 집으로 가고싶어 합니다. 반지를 들고 내성곽지구에 있는 병사의 집을 찾아가세요.
column4: Resentful Soldier's Spirit berkata ia ingin pergi ke rumah tempat ibunya berada dengan membawa Ring. Pergilah ke rumah dari prajurit yang berada di Inner Enceinte District, dengan membawa Ring-nya.

column2: You've pulled out the Poisonous Plant!
column3: 독초를 채취했습니다!
column4: Telah mengumpulkan Poisounous Plant!

column2: Collect the last breath
column3: 마지막 숨결 수집 중
column4: Sedang mengumpulkan Last Breath

column2: You've obtained the last breath!
column3: 마지막 숨결을 획득했습니다!
column4: Telah mendapatkan Last Breath!

column2: This city... is very sad.{nl}I am guiding the spirits that were attacked by the {nl}Petrifying Frost with the wishes of the goddesses.
column3: 이 도시는 참.. 안타깝죠.{nl}전 여신의 뜻을 받들어 석화서리에 당한 영혼들을 인도하고 있어요.
column4: Kota ini sungguh.. disayangkan.{nl} Aku menerima pencerahan dari Goddess, dan sedang mengarahkan para jiwa yang terkena Petrification Frost.

column2: The sound of sighs from the spirits that weren't able to {nl}go near the goddesses breaks my heart.
column3: 여신의 품으로 가지 못한 영혼들의 한숨소리가 제 가슴을 너무 아프게 해요.
column4: Mendengar suara menghela napas Para Jiwa yang tidak dapat pergi ke pangkuan Goddess, membuat dadaku sakit.

column2: (It seems that something is written on it.)
column3: (어떤 글귀가 적혀 있는 것 같다.)
column4: (Sepertinya tertulis sesuatu.)

column2: (It seems that something is written on it, but you can't see it clearly due to a shadow.){nl}
column3: (뭔가 새겨져 있는 것 같은데, 이상한 그림자 때문에 어두워서 잘 보이지 않는다.){nl}
column4: (Sepertinya terukirkan sesuatu, Gelap karena bayangan yang aneh, menjadi tak terlihat.){nl}

column2: (If I can get something that shines brightly, will I be able to read what's written on it?)
column3: (이 주변에서 밝은 빛을 낼 만한 걸 구하면 알아 볼 수 있지 않을까?)
column4: (Jika menemukan cahaya yang cukup terang di sekitar sini, apakah dapat diketahui?)

column2: (You can see a hole which you can insert something into.){nl}
column3: (뭔가 끼워넣을 수 있는 홈이 보인다.){nl}
column4: (Terlihat lubang yang sepertinya dapat dimasuki sesuatu.){nl}

column2: (Are we going to look for it somewhere around here?)
column3: (이 주변 어딘가에서 구할 수 있지 않을까?)
column4: (Bisakah mendapatkannya di suatu tempat di sekitar sini?)

column2: (Something is written on it, but it is too vague.)
column3: (무언가 새겨져 있긴 하지만 너무 희미하다.)
column4: (Terukirkan sesuatu tetapi sangat kabur.)

column2: (Something is written on it, but you can't see it clearly.)
column3: (무언가 새겨져 있지만, 잘 보이지 않는다.)
column4: (Terukirkan sesuatu disini, tetapi tak terlihat jelas.)

column2: If you meet someone who is related to the kingdom, please tell him this.{nl}We are still diligently working on our duties.{nl}
column3: 나중에라도여정 도중 왕국 관계자를 만날 수 있다면 부디 전해주시오.{nl}여기 우리가 아직도 성실히 임무를 수행 중이라고.{nl}
column4: Jika nanti kamu dapat bertemu dengan orang yang mengatur kerajaan, tolonglah sampaikan.{nl} Kami disini masih menjalankan misi dengan baik.{nl}

column2: May the goddesses protect you.
column3: 그럼 여신의 가호를 빌겠소.
column4: Kalau begitu kudoakan agar Berkat Goddess bersamamu.

column2: You are a rude, arrogant man.{nl}I suffered a loss, why can't you understand this?
column3: 이 당돌하고 버릇없는 것 같으니.{nl}내가 손해본 거나 다름 없는데, 왜 주제 파악을 못하는 거지?
column4: Karena kasar dan tidak sopan.{nl} Tidak ada bedanya dengan aku mengalami kerugian, Kenapa tidak dapat berlaku baik?

column2: You are a shameless swindler.{nl}I don't know why Justina's father has a friend like him.
column3: 사기꾼 주제에 뻔뻔스럽기까지 하다니.{nl}유스티나 아버님은 왜 대체 저런 사람을 친구로 뒀담.
column4: Untuk ukuran seorang penipu, ia sungguh kurang ajar.{nl} Ayah Yustina bertanya kenapa orang seperti itu bisa dijadikan teman.

column2: It is so fortunate that we found the Justina's family treasures.{nl}However I have a few things to say to that Pardoner!
column3: 유스티나의 가보를 되찾아서 정말 다행이에요.{nl}하지만 전 저 파드너에게 몇 마디 더 해야겠어요!
column4: Sungguh beruntung karena dapat menemukan kembali Yustina's Family Treasure.{nl} Tetapi aku harus menyampaikan beberapa kata lagi kepada Pardoner!

column2: Who really was that girl.{nl}Justina though... should we tell her the truth?.
column3: 정말 그 소녀는 누구였을까요.{nl}유스티나에겐.. 사실대로 말해줘야 할까요?
column4: Siapakah sebenarnya gadis kecil itu.{nl} Apakah harus berbicara sebenarnya… kepada Yustina?

column2: Be careful. Soon, the Petrifying Frost will blow. {nl}But, we don't know when...{nl}
column3: 조심하세요. 곧 석화서리가 불어올 거예요. {nl}하지만 알 수가 없으니..{nl}
column4: Waspadalah. Petrification Frost akan segera datang. {nl} Tetapi tidak dapat diketahui..{nl}

column2: Is the detector at the supply route working alright?
column3: 보급로의 석화탐지기는 제대로 작동을 하고 있는 걸까요?{nl}
column4: Petrification Detector dari Supply Way apakah sedang beroperasi dengan baik?{nl}

column2: We may receive some help from Retia at Verkti Square.{nl}It's hard for us, Kupoles, to be related in human matters so I am counting on you.
column3: 베르크티 광장에 있는 레티아라는 장교에게 도움을 받을 수 있을지도 몰라요.{nl}인간의 일은 큐폴이 나서기 어려우니 잘 부탁드리겠습니다.
column4: Entah apakah kita bisa mendapatkan bantuan dari Jendral Retia yang ada di Verkti Square.{nl} Kupole sulit untuk muncul secara langsung melakukan pekerjaan manusia, maka dari itu mohon bantuannya.

column2: We've already given up one salvation, and we couldn't do anything on Medzio Diena.{nl}We can't give up anymore.
column3: 이미 한 번 구원을 포기했고, 신수의 날엔 아무것도 할 수 없었지요.{nl}이제 더 이상 포기할 순 없어요.
column4: Aku telah menyerah pada penyelamatan sekali, Kita tidak dapat melakukan apapun pada hari Medzio Diena kan.{nl} Sekarang kita tidak boleh menyerah lagi.

column2: Are you the Revelator?{nl}
column3: 네가 그 계시자인가.{nl}
column4: Apakah kamu seorang Savior.{nl}

column2: That's sad. So sad.{nl}You are like me. They can't get out of it even if they are tied up.
column3: 참으로 애처롭군. 애처로와.{nl}너도 나와 같다. 묶여있다 한들 절대로 헤어나올 수 없지.
column4: Sungguh menyedihkan. {nl} Sepertinya nasibmu juga sama denganku. Sesuatu yang terikat sama sekali tidak dapat terlepas.

column2: Don't be afraid.{nl}I can't hurt you and you can't hurt me.
column3: 겁내지 말거라.{nl}이 몸은 달리 널 해할 수도, 네가 날 해할 수도 없으니.
column4: Janganlah takut.{nl}Tubuh ini berbeda, aku dapat melukaimu, tetapi kamu tidak dapat melukaiku.

column2: If your friend really is a Bokor, he might be able to identify {nl}the true nature of that sacred object.{nl}I want to find out what this is.
column3: 아마 네 친구 보코르라면 그 성물이라는 것의 정체를 알아볼 수 있을 거야.{nl}나도 그게 도대체 뭔지 알아나 보자.
column4: Mungkin jika temanku adalah Bokor, maka dapat mengetahui identitas dari sesuatu yang disebut benda suci.{nl} Aku juga ingin mencari tahu apakah benda itu.

column2: The Order of the Tree of Truth went into Carlyle's Mausoleum.{nl}Be careful. They're not crazy as you might think.
column3: 진리의 나무 교단은 칼라일의 영묘로 들어갔어.{nl}조심해. 아무리 생각해도 그들은 제정신이 아니야.
column4: Organisasi Tree of Truth telah memasuki Carlyle's Mausoleum.{nl} Berhati-hatilah. Bagaimanapun sepertinya mereka sedang tidak sadarkan diri.

column2: They are making fun of it by using the name of the goddesses. {nl}They shouldn't insult the dead like this.{nl}
column3: 여신의 이름을 팔아서 이런 장난을 치다니, 고인을 모욕하는 것도 정도가 있지.{nl}
column4: Mereka bermain-main seperti ini dengan menjual nama dari Goddess, itu setara dengan menghina yang telah mati kan.{nl}

column2: We want to find that regious body and punish them.. {nl}The eternal rest of the deads is the first thing that we should do.
column3: 그 진리의 나무 교단인지 뭔지 찾아가서 혼쭐을 내주고 싶지만.. {nl}망자들의 안식이 먼저야.
column4: Aku ingin pergi mencari organisasi Tree of Truth atau apapun itu dan memarahinya.. {nl} tetapi peristirahatan mereka yang sudah mati lebih diutamakan.

column2: Margiris is on the way to Carlyle's Mausoleum.{nl}If you take the proof of the truth I gave to you to Margiris,{nl}he will acknowledge your achievements.
column3: 마르기리스님은 칼라일의 묘소로 가는 길에 계십니다.{nl}제가 드린 진리의 증표를 마르기리스님께 가지고 가면 당신의 공을 인정해주실 겁니다.
column4: Tuan Marugiris berada di jalan menuju ke Carlyle's Mausoleum.{nl} Jika membawa Truth Token yang kuberikan kepada tuan Marugiris, maka ia akan menghargai jasamu.

column2: Margiris is one of the greatest leaders in our Order.{nl}He is the one who raised me.
column3: 마르기리스님은 저희 교단의 훌륭한 지도자 중 한 분이십니다.{nl}부족한 절 일깨워 주셨지요.
column4: Tuan Marugiris adalah seorang pemimpin luar biasa dari organisasi kami.{nl} Ia telah banyak mengajariku yang berkekurangan ini.

column2: The Order of the Tree of Truth has already relieved {nl}the spirits whose bodies have rotted away.{nl}Relieve the sins of Carlyle. {nl}
column3: 우리 진리의 나무 교단은 이미 육신이 썩어 없어진 영혼까지도 구제하지.{nl}어서 칼라일의 죄를 구제하게. {nl}
column4: Kami organisasi Tree of Truth menyelamatkan sampai para jiwa yang tidak memiliki tubuh.{nl} Segeralah hilangkan dosa dari Karail. {nl}

column2: The documents with his sins written on it would lead his spirit to the Divine Tree.
column3: 그의 죄가 적힌 문서만이 그의 영혼을 신수께 인도할 걸세.
column4: Dosanya akan mengarahkan para jiwa itu kepada Medzio Diena dengan dokumen yang tertulis saja.

column2: Carlyle is a sinful spirit.{nl}Similarly sinful spirits will soon become one with the Divine Tree.
column3: 칼라일 또한 죄 많은 영혼일 뿐일세.{nl}죄를 사한 영혼은 곧 신수와 하나가 될 게야.
column4: Karail adalah sebuah jiwa yang memiliki banyak dosa.{nl} Jiwa yang memaafkan dosa, akan segera menjadi satu dengan Medzio Diena.

column2: Damn, what was that explosion?
column3: 젠장, 아까 그 폭발음은 도대체 뭐지?
column4: Sial, suara ledakan apakah itu tadi?

column2: Suddenly, an explosion was heard from somewhere and the monsters started to go crazy.{nl}You didn't cause those, right?
column3: 갑자기 웬 폭발음이 들리더니 그때부터 몬스터들이 날뛰더군요.{nl}설마 당신들이 저지른 짓은 아니겠지요?
column4: Karena mendadak terdengar suara ledakan, para monster bermunculan sejak saat itu.{nl} Jangan bilang itu adalah hasil perbuatan kalian ?

column2: Thank you so much for helping me back then.{nl}But, an outsider should not enter this place.
column3: 아깐 도와주셔서 정말 감사했습니다.{nl}하지만 여긴 외부인은 절대 들어와선 안되는 곳입니다.
column4: Sungguh terima kasih atas bantuannya tadi.{nl} Tetapi disini adalah tempat yang tidak boleh dimasuki oleh orang luar.

column2: Originally outsiders were chased out of here...{nl}Since Delus needs your help, theres nothing we can do.
column3: 원래대로라면 외부인은 당장 내쫓아야 합니다만..{nl}델루스님께서 당신들의 도움이 필요하다 하시니 어쩔 수 없군요.
column4: Sebenarnya aku harus mengusir orang luar yang datang..{nl} tetapi karena tuan Dellus membutuhkan bantuan kalian, aku tidak ada pilihan lain.

column2: The monsters suddenly rushed out so we lost the post and many of our colleagues were hurt.{nl}There hasn't been anything like this before...
column3: 몬스터가 한꺼번에 몰려 나오면서 주둔지도 잃고 동료들도 많이 다쳤습니다.{nl}여태껏 한 번도 이런 일은 없었는데..
column4: Monster muncul dan menyerang dalam sekejap, sehingga kami kehilangan markas dan banyak kawan-kawan yang terluka.{nl} Sebelumnya hal yang seperti ini belum perna terjadi loh..

column2: While I was protecting the Fortress of the Land, this thing never occurred even once.{nl}I was scouted as an elite from my kingdom, but my pride was hurt.
column3: 대지의 요새를 지키면서 여태껏 이런 일은 한 번도 없었습니다.{nl}나름 왕국군 중에서도 정예병으로 뽑힌 건데 자존심에 금이 가는군요.
column4: Sambil menjaga Earth Castile, tidak pernah terjadi hal seperti ini sebelumnya.{nl} Tetapi diantara pasukan kerajaan pun, terdapat mereka yang terluka harga dirinya dengan dipilih sebagai pasukan elite.

column2: This is the first time that I receive help from outsiders.{nl}We have to drive them out, but I don't know how I can accept this..
column3: 외부인의 도움을 받아보긴 처음입니다.{nl}원래대로라면 당장 내쫓아야되지만, 이를 어떻게 받아들여야 할지..
column4: Ini adalah pertama kalinya mendapat bantuan dari orang luar.{nl} Sebenarnya aku harus mengusir orang luar, tetapi entah bagaimana harus menerima ini..

column2: Delus must have some ideas.{nl}Thanks for saving me, but I don't know what I should do in this situation.
column3: 델루스님께서 분명 무슨 생각이 있으시겠지요.{nl}구해주신 건 감사하지만, 이럴 땐 어떻게 해야 하는지 저도 잘 모르겠습니다.
column4: Tuan Dellus pasti memiliki suatu pemikiran kan.{nl} Terima kasih telah menyelamatkanku, tetapi aku tidak tahu harus berbuat apa pada saat seperti ini.

column2: If I take little more rest, I can move fast.{nl}I can fight little more even if I don't receive help from you.
column3: 조금만 쉬면 금방 움직일 수 있습니다.{nl}당신들 도움 따윈 받지 않아도 아직 더 싸울 수 있단 말입니다.
column4: Kalau beristirahat sebentar maka akan dapat segera bergerak lagi.{nl} Walaupun tidak mendapat bantuan dari kalian, aku masih dapat bertempur maksudku.

column2: Are the guys at the outpost really patrolling?{nl}Letting in an outsider... I say you don't need any help.
column3: 도대체 전초구역에 있는 녀석들은 제대로 순찰중인건가?{nl}외부인이나 들이고.. 당신들 도움 따윈 필요 없었단 말입니다.
column4: Omong-omong mereka yang ada di Sentry Bailey apakah sedang berpatroli dengan baik?{nl}Sampai orang luar pun masuk.. Kami tidak butuh bantuan dari kalian maksudku.

column2: I know that you've saved me. However, an outsider is an outsider.{nl}I don't know what Delus is thinking, but please leave quickly.
column3: 아무리 구해주셨다 한들 외부인은 외부인입니다.{nl}델루스님이 무슨 생각인진 모르겠지만, 빨리 나가주십시오.
column4: Walaupun kalian telah menolong, orang luar adalah tetap orang luar.{nl} Aku tidak mengerti apa yang dipikirkan tuan Dellus, tetapi bergegaslah keluar.

column2: If I a get little more rest, this wound will be fine.{nl}I don't need your help so please go after you finish the task Delus requested.
column3: 조금만 쉬면 이딴 상처쯤은 문제 없습니다.{nl}도움은 필요 없으니 델루스님이 요청하신 일만 마치고 빨리 나가주십시오.
column4: Kalau istirahat sebentar, maka tidak ada masalah dengan sedikit luka.{nl} Silahkan lakukan hal yang diminta tuan Dellus, lalu segeralah keluar karena aku tidak membutuhkan bantuan.

column2: We are ready to charge into the enemy's position.{nl}If you're scared, you better back out.
column3: 돌격할 준비는 다 됐습니다.{nl}겁이 난다면 뒤에 물러서 계셔도 좋습니다.
column4: Persiapan untuk menyerbu telah selesai.{nl} Jika takut, alangkah baiknya jika bersembunyi di belakang.

column2: Now is the time to get our revenge on those guys.{nl}We will charge in as soon as we receive the order!
column3: 녀석들에게 복수할 시간입니다.{nl}명령만 내려지면 바로 돌격할 겁니다!
column4: Ini adalah waktunya untuk membalaskan dendam kepada mereka.{nl} Jika perintah sudah diberikan, maka akan segera menyerbu!

column2: I was careless due to the sudden attack.{nl}I am not scared of those kind of monsters!
column3: 아깐 기습때문에 방심했을 뿐.{nl}저런 몬스터 따위 하나도 겁나지 않습니다!
column4: Karena serangan mendadak tadi hampir saja menjadi lengah.{nl} Kami tidak takut sedikit pun akan monster seperti tadi!

column2: My injuries don't hurt much now that I've gotten enough rest.{nl}I just want to reclaim the outpost quickly!
column3: 다친 것 쯤이야 조금 쉬었으니 문제 없습니다.{nl}빨리 주둔지를 되찾고 싶을 뿐입니다!
column4: Karena hanya terluka sedikit, tidak akan ada masalah jika istirahat sejenak.{nl} Aku hanya ingin cepat mengambil alih kembali markas!

column2: We can reclaim the outpost ourselves without your help.{nl}I don't know what Delus is worried about.
column3: 당신의 도움 없이도 우리끼리 주둔지를 되찾을 수 있습니다.{nl}델루스님은 대체 뭐가 걱정이신지.
column4: Walau tanpa bantuan kamu pun, kami dapat mengambil kembali markas sendiri.{nl} Entah apa yang dikhawatirkan oleh tuan Dellus.

column2: If we begin to think about losing, then we will lose.{nl}We are going reclaim the outpost!
column3: 진다는 생각을 하면 벌써 지는 겁니다.{nl}저흰 꼭 주둔지를 되찾을 겁니다!
column4: Sekali berpikir kalah, maka akan sungguh mengalami kekalahan.{nl} Kami pasti akan mengambil kembali markas!

column2: I am waiting for Delus' orders.{nl}Now is the time to get our revenge!
column3: 델루스님의 명령만 기다리고 있습니다.{nl}이제 복수할 시간입니다!
column4: Kami hanya sedang menunggu perintah dari tuan Dellus.{nl} Sekarang adalah waktunya membalas dendam!

column2: I am not going to lose the outpost again.{nl}For the honor of the Royal Army!
column3: 다신 주둔지를 빼앗기지 않을 겁니다.{nl}왕국군의 명예를 걸고!
column4: Markas tidak akan pernah dirampas lagi.{nl} Mempertaruhkan kehormatan pasukan kerajaan!

column2: You fight better than I expected.{nl}I'm a bit surprised.
column3: 생각보다 꽤 잘 싸우시더군요.{nl}솔직히 좀 놀랐습니다.
column4: Kau bertarung cukup baik dibandingkan perkiraan.{nl} Sesungguhnya aku sedikit terkejut.

column2: I feel good, but I also feel uncomfortable since we've received help from an outsider.{nl}Now, please get going.
column3: 속은 시원합니다만, 외부인의 도움을 빌리다니 찜찜한 건 마찬가지입니다.{nl}이제 어서 나가주십시오.
column4: Perasaan ini sudah tenang, tetapi karena meminjam bantuan orang luar jadi merasa tidak enak.{nl} Sekarang cepatlah keluar.

column2: Delus said he won't ask why you came here so we aren't going to say anything.{nl}However please leave now since we've reclaimed the outpost.
column3: 델루스님이 여기에 들어온 이유는 묻지 않겠다고 하시니 저희도 아무 말 않겠습니다.{nl}하지만 주둔지를 되찾았으니 이제 그만 나가십시오.
column4: Karena tuan Dellus tidak akan bertanya apa alasan masuk ke sini, maka kami juga tidak akan berkata apapun.{nl} Tetapi karena markas ini telah diambil alih kembali, silahkan bergegas keluar.

column2: It starts now.{nl}We can't be relaxed since we don't know when they will come again.
column3: 이제부터가 시작입니다.{nl}언제 또 다시 쳐들어올지 모르니 방심할 수 없습니다.
column4: Permulaan dimulai sekarang.{nl} Entah mereka kapan akan datang menyerang kembali, sehingga kita tidak boleh lengah.

column2: Outsiders are forbidden to enter this place due to the king's command.{nl}We really appreciate for your help, but there is nothing we can about it.{nl}
column3: 원래 여긴 왕명으로 외부인의 출입이 금지된 곳입니다.{nl}감사한 건 감사한 것이지만, 저희도 이젠 어쩔 수가 없습니다.{nl}
column4: Sebenarnya tempat ini terlarang bagi orang luar atas perintah Raja.{nl} Walaupun kami harus berterima kasih banyak, tetapi kami tidak ada pilihan lain.{nl}

column2: Now, you better go to the outpost area.{nl}Or how long are you planning to stay at the Fortress of the Land?
column3: 이제 전초구역으로 나가시면 됩니다.{nl}아니면 언제까지 대지의 요새에 계실 셈입니까?
column4: Sekarang kamu boleh pergi keluar ke Sentra Bailey.{nl} Kalau tidak apakah kamu ingin berada sampai kapan di Earth Castile?

column2: That outpost was to be recovered without your help.{nl}However, you fought well.
column3: 당신 도움 없이도 되찾을 주둔지였습니다.{nl}하지만, 잘 싸우시더군요.
column4: Markas ini dapat diambil alih kembali walau tanpa bantuan anda.{nl} Tetapi, kamu telah bertarung dengan hebat.

column2: We are not going to lose the outpost anymore.{nl}There won't be anymore instances where we would receive help from an {nl}outsider like you again.
column3: 두 번 다신 주둔지를 빼앗기지 않을 겁니다.{nl}당신 같은 외부인에게 도움 받을 일도 두 번 다신 없겠죠.
column4: Markas ini tidak akan dirampas untuk kedua kalinya.{nl} Sehingga tidak ada kesempatan kedua kalinya untuk mendapatkan bantuan dari orang luar seperti kamu bukan.

column2: I'm thinking of suggesting plans to Delus about strengthening our outpost.{nl}I don't want to experience such shames again.
column3: 주둔지 방어를 더 강화하도록 델루스님께 건의할 생각입니다.{nl}다시는 이런 치욕스러운 일은 겪고 싶지 않습니다.
column4: Aku sedang berpikir untuk menyarankan agar memperkuat pertahanan markas kepada tuan Dellus.{nl} Aku tidak ingin menghadapi hal memalukan seperti ini lagi.

column2: I can't just sit around forever.{nl}All because we don't know when the monsters will attack again while having to {nl}block outsiders like you.
column3: 언제까지고 쉬고 있을 순 없지요.{nl}몬스터가 다시 공격해 올 지도 모르고 당신같은 외부인들도 막아야 하니까요.
column4: Kita tidak dapat terus beristirahat kan.{nl} Entah kapan monster datang menyerang lagi, dan orang luar seperti kalian harus menghalanginya.

column2: Damn, theres nothing we can do.{nl}We better just follow their instructions for now.
column3: 칫, 어쩔 수 없지.{nl}일단 저들이 하라는 대로 따르는 게 좋을 것 같아.
column4: Ckkk, tiada pilihan lain.{nl} Sepertinya bagus jika mengikuti sesuai yang mereka perintahkan.

column2: That thing is giving me a headache.{nl}However, I can't just leave someone who is in danger.
column3: 골치 아프게 됐어.{nl}하지만 나도 위험에 처한 사람을 그냥 두고 보는 건 원하지 않는다고.
column4: Membuat kepala pusing ya.{nl} Tetapi aku tidak ingin tinggal diam melihat orang yang menghadapi kesulitan.

column2: Those soldiers just don't listen to us.{nl}We've helped them so far, are they just going to cast us away?
column3: 병사들이랑은 말도 안 통해.{nl}이렇게까지 도와줬는데 설마 내쫓겠어?
column4: Pembicaraan tidak nyambung dengan para prajurit.{nl} Padahal sudah membantu sebanyak ini, mana mungkin diusir?

column2: I've listened to him as much as I can... now what do we do?
column3: 일단 하라는 대로 다 들어주긴 했는데.. 이젠 어떡하지?
column4: Pertama-tama, aku telah melakukan sesuai yang diperintahkan.. Sekarang bagaimana?

column2: My god... How could this happen...{nl}
column3: 세상에.. 어떻게 이럴수가..{nl}
column4: Wah… Bagaimana mungkin hal ini bisa terjadi..{nl}

column2: No. We should get a grip on ourselves. {nl}We would have never entered here if we were going to lose our energy like this.{nl}Let's enter the portal for now.
column3: 아냐. 정신 차려야지. {nl}이 정도로 넋빠질 거라면 애초에 여길 들어오지도 않았어.{nl}일단 포탈로 들어가 보자.
column4: Hmmm. Harus menyadarkan diri. {nl} Jika tidak sadarkan diri seperti ini, maka tidak akan masuk ke tempat ini sejak awal.{nl} Pertama-tama mari masuk ke Portal.

column2: What is this terrible curse?{nl}And that demon earlier... What the hell is going on here?{nl}
column3: 끔찍한 저주란게 대체 뭐지?{nl}그리고 아까 그 마족은.. 도대체 여긴 뭐가 어떻게 된 거지?{nl}
column4: Apakah yang dimaksud dengan kutukan yang mengerikan?{nl} Lalu iblis yang tadi itu.. Entah apa yang sedang terjadi disini?{nl}

column2: Although I've seen the Petrifying Frost many times, {nl}seeing something like this for the first time was really surprising.{nl}Let's get in the portal for now. We can't stop for things like this.
column3: 석화 서리는 많이 봐 왔지만, 이런 건 처음이라 너무 놀랐어.{nl}일단 포탈로 들어가 보자. 이런 걸로 멈출 순 없어.
column4: Aku telah banyak melihat Petrification Frost, tetapi yang seperti ini adalah pertama kalinya, sungguh mengejutkan.{nl} Pertama-tama ayo masuk ke Portal. Tidak dapat menghentikannya dengan yang seperti ini.

column2: It was something ridiculously huge and powerful.{nl}I'm sure this time.
column3: 뭔가 말도 안되게 엄청나고 거대한 힘이었어.{nl}이번엔 확실하다고.
column4: Itu adalah suatu kekuatan yang sangat luar biasa sehingga tidak bisa diungkapkan.{nl} Kali ini sangat jelas.

column2: That was a fearful amount of power.{nl}What is this Monocle seeing...
column3: 그 힘은 너무 거대해서 두렵기까지 할 정도였어.{nl}도대체 이 모노클은 무엇을 보는 걸까..
column4: Kekuatan itu sungguh luar biasa, sampai terasa menakutkan.{nl} Entah apa yang Monocle ini lihat..

column2: Don't forget to leave a message about creating a verification ticket.{nl}If you don't have that then I'll have to pointlessly wait for you.
column3: 꼭 인증표 만드는 방법 쪽지로 남기는 것 잊지 마.{nl}그게 없으면 난 네가 올 때까지 하염없이 기다려야 한 단 말야.
column4: Pastikan jangan lupa meninggalkan pesan cara untuk membuat tanda.{nl} Kalau tidak ada itu, aku harus menunggu sampai kau datang tanpa melakukan apapun.

column2: Please get the attention of that old man.{nl}I have something else I'd like to know. {nl}
column3: 네가 그 노인의 시선 좀 끌어 줘.{nl}나는 따로 좀 알아볼 게 있어. {nl}
column4: Cobalah kau arahkan penglihatan dari manula itu.{nl} Aku ada sedikit urusan lainnya. {nl}

column2: Let's go our separate ways, but we'll keep in touch. Alright?
column3: 중간중간 서로 연락하면서 당분간 따로 움직이자. 알았지?
column4: Mari lakukan kontak di tengah-tengah, dan bergeraklah secara terpisah saat ini. Oke?

column2: You told me that you will meet someone called Eminent at the battlefield right?{nl}Let's go together. We'll be sure when we see the Monocle.
column3: 에미넌트라는 사람과 결전지에서 다시 만나기로 했댔지?{nl}같이 가 보자. 모노클로 직접 보면 확실해 질 거야.
column4: Kau berkata sudah berjanji untuk bertemu dengan orang yang bernama Eminent di Final Battle Field?{nl} Ayo pergi bareng. Jika melihat langsung menggunakan Monocle akan lebih jelas.

column2: The person who used to live 600 years ago may be alive? and He has allied with demons?{nl}These facts are so unbelievable that its giving me a headache.
column3: 600년 전의 사람이 아직도 살아있는 것도 모자라 마족과 한패일지도 모른다니.{nl}너무 엄청난 사실들이 쏟아지니까 머리가 다 아파와.
column4: Orang yan hidup 600 tahun lalu masih juga berkekurangan, dan tidak tahu bahwa ia bagian dari demon.{nl} Karena terlalu banyak kebenaran yang muncul dalam sekejap, kepala menjadi sakit rasanya.

column2: Just listen to whatever Eminent has to say for now.{nl}Then we'll meet at the Paramiso Battle Field in secret. Okay?
column3: 일단 넌 에미넌트의 요구를 대충 들어주는 게 좋겠어.{nl}그러다가 몰래 파라미조 격전지에서 만나는 거야. 알겠지?
column4: Pertama-tama alangkah baiknya jika melakukan permintaan dari Eminent sedikit saja.{nl} Setelah itu bertemu secara diam-diam di Paramizo Battle Field. mengerti?

column2: I'm really glad Eminent doesn't know that I'm here.{nl}I will prepare it so please don't forget to come to Paramiso Battle Field.
column3: 에미넌트가 내 존재를 모르고 있다는 게 정말 다행이야.{nl}준비는 내가 해 놓을테니 잊지 말고 파라미조 격전지로 와.
column4: Sungguh beruntung karena Eminent tidak mengetahui keberadaanku.{nl} Karena aku akan menyiapkan segalanya, jangalah lupa dan datanglah ke Paramizo Battle Field.

column2: Me? I'm about to start my work.{nl}We've found some clues so we should be able to find it quickly.{nl}
column3: 나? 난 이제 본격적으로 내 일을 시작해야지.{nl}덕분에 실마리도 좀 얻었으니까 금방 찾을 수 있을 거야.{nl}
column4: Aku?  Sekarang aku harus memulai pekerjaanku secara penuh.{nl} Berkat kamu aku sedikit mendapatkan petunjuk, sehingga akan dapat segera menemukannya.{nl}

column2: Thanks to Eminent, we found a lot of things that the Knights of Kaliss may like.{nl}I haven't gotten my share yet, so I'll stay here little longer.
column3: 에미넌트 덕분에 칼리스 기사단이 좋아할 만한 걸 잔뜩 알아냈어.{nl}하지만 아직 내 몫은 챙기지 못했으니까, 난 조금 더 남아 있으려고.
column4: Berkat Eminent aku berhasil mencari tahu banyak hal yang disukai oleh Knight Members of Kalis.{nl} Tetapi aku masih belum bisa sadarkan diri sepenuhnya, aku bermaksud untuk tinggal lebih lama lagi.

column2: We should retreat...{nl}Or else we'll get wiped out...
column3: 퇴각해야 한다..{nl}그렇지 않으면 전멸이야..
column4: Harus cepat mundur..{nl} Kalau tidak begitu akan termusnahkan..

column2: Come blow the horn to retreat...
column3: 어서 퇴각 나팔을 불어야..
column4: Cepat beritahukan untuk mundur..

column2: We need to destroy all these tombstones.{nl}Now, we should stop looking for the goddesses and look at the reality.
column3: 이런 하등 도움도 안 되는 비석들은 다 파괴해 버려야 해요.{nl}이젠 여신은 그만 찾고 현실을 봐야죠.
column4: Bantuan dari monumen tak berguna rendahan seperti ini, sepertiinya harus dihancurkan semuanya.{nl} Sekarang aku harus berhenti mencari Goddess dan melihat kenyataan.

column2: That's disgusting. There must be more people who've crossed paths with these hooligans.{nl}They're not trying to use brute force, but rather take it apart from the inside...
column3: 괘씸하군. 분명 우리 말고도 이런 이간질에 넘어간 사람들이 있을 게요.{nl}힘으로 눌러찍는 것 뿐만 아니라 속에서부터 점점 무너뜨리려는 게지..
column4: Memalukan. Sudah jelas, selain kita pun ada orang-orang yang melakukan kebohongan seperti ini.{nl} Bukan hanya melakukan tekanan dengan kekuatan, tetapi merubuhkan secara perlahan dari dalam kan..

column2: The demon's control over the area is getting weaker.{nl}No, it's not prominent, but I smell something very dangerous.
column3: 마족의 농간이 점점 고약해지고 있소.{nl}아니, 고약한 수준이 아니라 아주 위험한 냄새가 나오.
column4: Tipuan Demon perlahan semakin berbau busuk.{nl}Hmm, bukan bau busuk, tetapi bau yang sangat berbahaya.

column2: Unless we hear from Damiyonas again, we'll be stopping here.{nl}Don't break the tombstones anymore.
column3: 다미요나스에게 이미 한 소리 들었을 테니 여기까지만 해 두는 거예요.{nl}다신 절대로 비석은 부수지 마세요.
column4: Karena kemungkinan kamu sudah mendengarkan sesuatu dari Damiyonas, maka kutinggalkan sampai disini saja.{nl} Janganlah pernah menghancurkan monumen lagi.

column2: When someone has an emptiness in their heart,{nl}it makes it very easy for evil to force themselves in.{nl}To prevent this you must have strong faith.
column3: 사람의 마음에 빈 틈이 생기면 나쁜 마음이 비집고 들어가기 쉬워지지요.{nl}이런 때일수록 더 굳건한 믿음을 가져야 해요.
column4: Jika terdapat ruang kosong pada hati seseorang, maka akan mudah untuk diselipi oleh perasaan jahat kan.{nl} Pada saat seperti ini dibutuhkan hati yang sangat kokoh.

column2: That's really creepy.{nl}Now those demons are blending in with the humans and causing trouble...
column3: 정말, 소름돋아요.{nl}이젠 하다하다 마족이 사람 틈에 섞여서 이간질까지 하다니..
column4: Sungguh, menakutkan.{nl} Sekarang Demon perlahan mulai bercampur dengan orang, dan mulai mengadu domba..

column2: Next time, don't ever destroy the tombstones. {nl}How were these tombstones even created...
column3: 다음부턴 절대로. 비석을 부수는 일 따윈 하지 마세요.{nl}어떻게 만든 비석인데..
column4: Lain kesempatan pastinya jangan. Janganlah menghancurkan monumen lagi.{nl} Monumen buatan itu..

column2: We should look for another way while we wait for Fabijus.{nl}Can you ask Barte for me?
column3: 파비유스를 기다리면서 우리도 따로 알아보는 게 좋겠어요.{nl}당신은 바르테에게 물어 봐 주시겠어요?
column4: Alangkah baiknya kita juga mencari tahu secara terpisah, sambil menunggu Fabius.{nl} Maukah kamu menanyakan kepada Barete?

column2: I've heard the name Albinas before.{nl}Moreover, Nestoses and Anstoses still respect each other.
column3: 확실히 알비나스라는 이름은 저도 들은 적이 없어요.{nl}게다가 우리 네스토스파와 아나스토스파는 서로를 존중한다고요.
column4: Sudah pasti saya juga tidak pernah mendengar nama Albinas.{nl} Ditambah lagi kami saling menghormati Nestopa dan Anastopa.

column2: Fabijus...{nl}I hope nothing happens to him...
column3: 파비유스..{nl}제발 무슨 일이 생기지 않았으면 좋겠는데..
column4: Fabius..{nl} Sebaiknya jika tidak terjadi apapun padamu..

column2: Nestoses knows how to face the demons.{nl}If you explain your situation, he'll help for sure!
column3: 네스토스파 사람들이 마족을 상대하는 방법을 확실히 알아요.{nl}사정을 설명하면 분명 도와줄 거예요!
column4: Orang-orang Nestopa sudah jelas mengetahui cara menghadapi Demon.{nl} Jika menjelaskan keadaannya, maka mereka pasti akan membantu!

column2: It would have been really dangerous without you.{nl}Demons... If we don't get any help we won't be able to advance from my position.
column3: 당신이 아니였으면 정말 위험했어요.{nl}마족.. 지지 않으려면 저희도 언제까지 입장만 내세우는 건 그만 두어야겠지요.
column4: Sungguh berbahaya tadi, jika bukan kamu yang menolong.{nl}Demon.. Jika tidak ingin kalah dari mereka, kami pun harus memperjelas posisi kami disini.

column2: The symbol of Vaiga, that symbol is being used by the demons' minions.{nl}I've never seen any human use that symbol.
column3: 바이가의 문장이라니, 그런 건 마족의 하수인들이나 쓰는 문장이에요.{nl}인간이 그런 문장을 쓰는 건 한 번도 본 적이 없었다고요.
column4: Vaiga's Sentence, hal itu adalah merupakan kalimat yang dipake oleh para Demon kelas rendah.{nl} Aku tidak pernah melihat ada manusia yang pernah menggunakan kalimat itu.

column2: The demons among the humans, what can we rely on now?{nl}What can we trust outside of the goddesses...
column3: 인간의 틈에 섞인 마족이라니, 우린 이제 무얼 의지해야 하죠?{nl}여신 말고는 도대체 무얼 믿을 수 있을까요..
column4: Demon yang bercampur dengan kekosongan manusia katamu, Apa yang kita ingin capai sekarang ini?{nl} Selain Goddess apakah yang dapat dipercaya..

column2: Have you ever seen the Great Cathedral or the Mage Tower before?{nl}How about a gigantic goddess statue like the one in Fedimian.{nl}
column3: 자네 혹시 대성당이라던가 마법사의 탑을 본 적이 있나?{nl}아니면 페디미안의 거대 여신상 같은 것 말이다.{nl}
column4: Apakah kau pernah melihat Mage Tower atau Cathedral?{nl} Atau mungkin Giant Goddess Statue di Fermidian.{nl}

column2: Do you think construction of that size can be completed by one individual?{nl}Of course not. Even if the kingdom does it, it's going to be difficult acquiring all the materials.
column3: 그렇게 큰 공사를 일개 개인이 할 수 있을 것 같나?{nl}물론 아니지. 왕국이 나서더라도 그런 엄청난 자재들을 대는 건 힘든 일이야.{nl}
column4: Konstruksi sebesar itu apakah bisa dilakukan sendirian saja?{nl} Tentu saja tidak. Walaupun keluar dari kerajaan, mencari material yang sangat banyak adalah pekerjaan sulit.{nl}

column2: There's a famous merchants' organization that used to supply the {nl}materials of the great construction
column3: 그 역사적인 대공사의 자재를 공급해 온 유서 깊은 상단이 있지.{nl}바로 그게 우리 케도라 상단이라는 말씀!{nl}
column4: Terdapat suatu Merchant Alliance yang memiliki sejarah panjang, menyedikan material konstruksi besar yang bersejarah kan.{nl} Itu tidak lain adalah yang disebut Kedora Merchant Alliance kita!{nl}

column2: Until now, we've been secretly helping the kingdom in the shadows {nl}in the name of the goddesses...{nl}From now on, we are going to help the world as much as we can.
column3: 여태껏 여신의 뜻에 따라 그림자 뒤에서 몰래 왕국을 도왔지만..{nl}이제부터라도 세상을 돕는 일에 적극적으로 나설 거야.
column4: Belakangan, aku membantu kerajaan diam-diam dari belakang bayangan sesuai dengan perintah Goddess..{nl} tetapi mulai sekarang aku akan muncul secara langsung dan aktif untuk menolong hal-hal di dunia.

column2: Well, now that we've been revealed, it will be nothing but awful and tough times ahead.{nl}Such as becoming a target of the demons, for example.{nl}
column3: 뭐, 우리 정도나 되는 상단이 표면 밖으로 나왔으니 앞으로 엄청 힘든 일만 가득하겠지.{nl}가령 마족의 표적이 된다거나.{nl}
column4: Yah, karena Merchant Alliance kita telah keluar hingga permukaan, maka akan dipenuhi oleh pekerjaan yang sangat sulit saja kedepannya.{nl} Misalkan menjadi Demon Sign.{nl}

column2: However that's a common thing. We've done it once in danger before.{nl}Let's do well comrades, for the goddess.
column3: 하지만 그런 건 흔한 일이야. 예전에도 위험했던 건 마찬가지거든.{nl}같은 여신의 동지끼리 잘 해 보자고.
column4: Tetapi hal seperti itu adalah sesuatu yang umum. Dahulu hal yang berbahaya pun juga sama loh.{nl} sebagai penganut Goddess yang sama, mari kita berusaha yang terbaik.

column2: The rest can be easily done, so we'll take care of it.{nl}Thank you for helping me so far.
column3: 나머진 쉽게 처리할 수 있는 일이니 저희가 할게요.{nl}그 동안 도와주셔서 감사했어요.
column4: Karena sisanya dapat dibereskan dengan mudah, maka kami yang akan melakukannya.{nl} Terima kasih karena telah membantu selama ini.

column2: There are lots of objects to retrieve here, aside from Manahas.{nl}Some objects should not fall into the hands of demons so I am worried.
column3: 여기 마나하스 말고도 회수해야 할 물건이 많아요.{nl}어떤 건 마족의 손에 들어가면 큰일나는 물건이라 걱정이네요.
column4: Disini banyak benda yang harus diambil kembali selain Manahas.{nl} Beberapa benda akan menjadi masalah besar jika jatuh ke tangan Demon, maka dari itu aku jadi khawatir.

column2: There will be more newcomers from now on, so I am planning to make more manuals.{nl}We've obtained all we could so we don't have to worry anymore.
column3: 앞으로 신입이 더 많이 들어올 테니까 교육서를 더 잔뜩 만들 생각이야.{nl}자네 덕분에 구할 건 다 구했으니 이제 걱정 없지 뭐.
column4: Karena kedepannya akan ada banyak anggota baru, aku sedang berpikir untuk membuat dokumen pelatihan.{nl} Berkat kau, hal yang diperlukan telah didapatkan sehingga tidak perlu khawatir akan apapun.

column2: It's good that the merchants are coming out to the world, {nl}but I am not sure if they would be able to keep their lives.{nl}But, even so, we are not doing something that we are not familiar with so it doesn't matter.{nl}
column3: 상단이 세상에 나선다는 게 좋은 뜻이란 건 알겠는데 목숨이 남아날 지는 모르겠어.{nl}뭐, 그렇다고 해서 안하던 일을 하게 된 건 아니니까 상관 없어.{nl}
column4: Aku tahu bahwa memang baik jika Merchant Alliance muncul secara langsung di umum, tetapi tidak diketahui apakah akan ada nyawa yang tersisa atau tidak.{nl} Yah, walau begitu karena bukan jadi melakukan hal yang tidak dilakukan, maka tidak ada hubungannya.{nl}

column2: The kingdom hasn't been fallen to the demons yet.{nl}If we do our best, we will find peace again.
column3: 왕국은 아직 마족에게 무너지지 않았소.{nl}정성을 다하면 언젠간 예전같은 평화를 찾을 수 있을 게요.
column4: Kerajaan masih belum hancur oleh Demon.{nl} Jika telah melakukan dengan tulus, maka dapat menemukan kembali kedamaian seperti dulu.

column2: The rest of the work is in Orsha.{nl}Thank you so much for helping me.
column3: 나머지는 오르샤에서 작업할 거예요.{nl}도와주셔서 정말 감사했습니다.
column4: Sisanya akan dikerjakan di Orsha.{nl} Terima kasih banyak atas bantuannya.

column2: Nestoses are making tombstones without countermeasures.{nl}When the corrupted tombstones are corrupted, it'll start attracting monsters too.
column3: 네스토스파들이 대책없이 비석만 세워놓고 있어요.{nl}비석이 오염되어서 몬스터들을 끌어들이고 있는데도요.
column4: Para Nestopa mendirikan monumen tanpa persiapan khusus apapun.{nl} Monumen itu telah terkontaminasi sehingga memancing monster-monster untuk datang.

column2: That's not us, and I am sure there isn't such name in Anastoses.{nl}Though, who is Albinas anyways?
column3: 우린 당연히 아닐 테고, 아나스토스파에도 그런 이름은 없을 게 분명하고.{nl}그렇다면 알비나스라는 여자는 도대체 누구람?
column4: Kalau kami sudah pasti tidak,  Nama seperti itu sudah pasti tidak ada di Anastopa.{nl} Kalau begitu, siapakah wanita yang bernama Albinas itu?

column2: She is so disgraceful. The woman named Albinas...{nl}I don't know why she broke the tombstone.
column3: 아무리 생각해도 괘씸하군. 그 알비나스라는 여자..{nl}도대체 무슨 생각으로 비석을 부수는 거지?
column4: Dipikirkan bagaimanapun sungguh memalukan. Wanita yang disebut Albinas itu..{nl} Entah apa yang ia pikir hingga menghancurkan monumen itu?

column2: We were making a tombstone that would help the goddesses.{nl}We are going to collect the sacred energy and {nl}send it to the goddesses through the tombstone.
column3: 여신께 힘을 보탤 비석을 만들고 있어요.{nl}성스러운 기운을 비석에 모아 여신께 보내는 것이지요.
column4: Goddess sedang membuat Monumen yang menambahkan tenaga.{nl} Goddess mengirimkan energi suci dengan mengumpulkannya pada Monumen.

column2: We're going to collapse easily if we don't have something to rely on.{nl}That's why the belief of the goddesses is more important.
column3: 이렇게 힘든 때일수록 마음에 기댈 곳이 없으면 쉽게 무너져버려요.{nl}그러니 여신의 믿음이 더욱 중요하지요.
column4: Pada saat sulit seperti ini, jika tidak ada tempat bernaung di hati, maka akan dengan mudah rubuh.{nl} Maka dari itu kepercayaan akan Goddess lebih penting.

column2: I don't have any energy.{nl}I am investigating about the differences in views between Nestoses and Anastoses... {nl}I miss my research room.
column3: 정신이 하나도 없어요.{nl}네스토스파와 아나스토스파의 견해 차이를 연구하고 있는데.. 제 연구실이 그립네요.
column4: Aku tidak dapat fokus sama sekali.{nl} Aku sedang mempelajari perbedaan pendapat Nestopa dan Anastopa.. Aku merindukan laboratoriumku.

column2: There is only one belief, but the views can be diverse.{nl}Like Nestoses and Anastoses there.{nl}
column3: 믿음은 하나일지언정 견해는 여러 갈래로 나뉠 수 있죠.{nl}저 쪽의 네스토스파나 저희 아나스토스파 처럼요.{nl}
column4: Kepercayaan hanya ada satu, tetapi pandangannya bisa terbagi menjadi beberapa.{nl} Seperti Anastopa di sebelah sana atau kami Anastopa.{nl}

column2: Even so, this won't cause a big difference or an argument.
column3: 그렇다고 해서 이게 큰 차이나 다툼이 되지는 않아요.
column4: Karena begitu katanya, perbedaan besar ini tidak menjadi pertengkaran.

column2: I am on a pilgrimage to the former kingdom.{nl}I recently arrived to this camp.
column3: 전 왕국을 순례하는 중이에요.{nl}이 캠프에 온 지는 얼마 안되었네요.
column4: Aku sedang mengunjungi kerajaan.{nl}Kedatanganku di Camp ini belum berapa lama.

column2: When I first started my pilgrimage, I would hear the sounds of sighs wherever I go...{nl}It seems things look a little more hopeful now thanks to the reveletors.
column3: 처음 순례를 시작했을 땐, 가는 곳 마다 한숨소리만 가득했었는데..{nl}지금은 계시자님들 덕분인지 희망이 조금은 보이는 것 같아요.
column4: Ketika Pilgrim dimulai pertama kalinya, Setiap tempat yang ada hanya dipenuhi oleh suara menghela napas saja..{nl} Sekarang, sepertinya berkat tuan Saviour mulai terlihat sedikit harapan.

column2: Everyone misses the peaceful world four years ago.{nl}Anastoses told us that we should look more into reality if we want to go back to those days.
column3: 누구나 4년 전의 평화로운 세상을 그리워하죠.{nl}아나스토스파는 그 때로 다시 되돌아가려면 현실을 좀 더 직시해야 한다곤 하지만..{nl}
column4: Siapapun pasti merindukan dunia yang damai seperti 4 tahun lalu.{nl} Anastopa berkata harus menghadapi kenyataan dengan tegar apabila ingin kembali ke saat sepreti itu, tetapi..{nl}

column2: If we don't believe in the goddesses, then who else is going to trust the goddesses.{nl}Us Nestoses think this is the reality.
column3: 우리가 여신을 믿지 않으면 누가 믿겠어요.{nl}우리 네스토스는 여신 또한 현실이라고 생각해요.
column4: Kalau kami tidak percaya Goddess, siapakah yang harus kami percaya.{nl} Kami Nestos berpikir akan kenyataan dan juga Goddess.

column2: Are you the one who broke the tombstone?{nl}Is it really...
column3: 당신이 비석을 부쉈다는 그 분인가요?{nl}정말이지..
column4: Apakah kamu adalah orang yang telah menghancurkan Monumen itu?{nl} Benarkah..

column2: I've heard that the demons are impersonating Anastoses.{nl}But, we are not going to argue for such matters.
column3: 마족이 아나스토스파를 사칭했다고 들었어요.{nl}하지만 우린 그런 일로 서로 다툰다거나 하지 않을 거예요.
column4: Aku mendengar Demon menirukan Anastopa.{nl} Maaf tetapi kami tidak akan saling bertengkar hanya karena hal seperti itu.

column2: We Anastoses are focusing more on the realities than Nestoses.{nl}We can't just do nothing while waiting for the goddesses.{nl}
column3: 우리 아나스토스는 네스토스파보단 좀 더 현실에 집중하고 있어요.{nl}두 손 다 놓고 하염없이 여신만을 기다릴 순 없는 거잖아요?{nl}
column4: Kami Anastopa lebih berfokus pada kenyataan lebih banyak dibandingkan Nestopa.{nl} Kami tidak dapat berdiam diri dengan kedua tangan ini, hanya menunggu Goddess saja kan?{nl}

column2: However we all serve the goddesses and focus on our faith.{nl}That's why we are on our pilgrimage.
column3: 하지만 모두 여신을 섬기고 신앙에 집중하는 사람들이예요.{nl}그러니 이렇게 순례의 길도 나선 것이지요.
column4: Tetapi kami adalah orang yang menghormati semua Goddess dan berfokus pada kepercayaan kami.{nl} Maka dari itu kami berada pada jalan Pilgrim seperti ini.

column2: It was so scary when Albinas turned into a Fire Lord and started to attack me.{nl}Thank you so much for helping us returning to the camp.
column3: 알비나스란 여자가 파이어로드로 변해서 절 공격해 올 때는 정말 아찔했어요.{nl}무사히 캠프로 돌아올 수 있게 도와주셔서 정말 감사드려요.
column4: Wanita yang bernama Albinas berubah menjadi Fire Lord dan menyerang saya, sungguh menakutkan sekali.{nl} Terima kasih telah membantu sehingga saya dapat kembali dengan selamat ke Camp.

column2: Kedora Merchants welcome you.{nl}If you have anything to ask, come to me anytime!
column3: 케도라 상단은 언제나 여러분을 환영한답니다.{nl}물어 볼 것이 있으면 언제든 오세요!
column4: Kedora Merchant Commite selalu menerima saudara-saudari sekalian kapanpun itu.{nl} Jika ada yang ingin ditanyakan, datanglah kapanpun itu!

column2: Ah, is this the first time you've seen our merchants?{nl}I fully understand. It's because we've only done our business in secret.{nl}
column3: 어머, 저희 상단은 처음 보시나 보죠?{nl}그럴 수 밖에요. 여태껏 음지에서만 활동해 왔으니까요.{nl}
column4: Aduh, Sepertinya baru pertama kali melihat kami Merchant Alliance ya?{nl}Memang begitu. Hingga saat ini hanya melakukan aktivitas di tempat berbayang.{nl}

column2: More details can be heard from Leopoldas.{nl}I'm very busy so I will take my leave...
column3: 자세한 건 레오폴다스 아저씨께 들을 수 있어요.{nl}전 일이 바빠서 이만..
column4: Untuk lebih detailnya bisa didengarkan langsung dari paman Leopoldas.{nl} Karena saya sibuk, bye..

column2: We, of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance, follow the will of the goddesses, {nl}but we only acted behind the scenes.{nl}Now that the world is in chaos, we can't just stand still.{nl}
column3: 원래 우리 케도라 상단은 여신의 뜻을 받들기는 해도 나서지 않고 뒤에서만 움직였거든.{nl}그런데 세상이 이 모양이니 가만히 있을 수가 있나.{nl}
column4: Awalnya kami Kedora Merchant Alliance menjalankan perintah Goddess tetapi tidak muncul ke dunia, hanya bergerak di belakang saja.{nl} Tetapi kami tidak bisa diam saja melihat dunia yang seperti ini.{nl}

column2: That's why we've decided to be more engaged in it.{nl}Even if we become a target of the demons.
column3: 그래서 적극적으로 나서기로 했어.{nl}마족의 표적이 되는 한이 있어도 말이야.
column4: Maka dari itu kuputuskan untuk muncul secara aktif.{nl} Ketika ada yang menjadi target dari Demon maksudku.

column2: We, of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance, will actively recruit newcomers.{nl}Are you interested?
column3: 우리 케도라 상단에서는 신입을 본격적으로 받을 생각이야.{nl}혹시 자네도 관심 있나?
column4: Kami dari Kedora Merchant Alliance berpikir untuk menerima anggota baru secara aktif.{nl} Apakah kamu juga tertarik?

column2: There are many things to learn since we are still newcomers.{nl}Although, Leopoldas only insists on the pride...
column3: 케도라 상단의 신입이라 아직 많이 부족해요.{nl}레오폴다스님은 그냥 자부심만 강조하시지만요..
column4: Saya masih belum pandai, karena anggota baru dari Kedora Merchant Committe.{nl} Tetapi Tuan Leopoldas hanya menekankan Harga dirinya saja..

column2: There are still many notice boards to set, but I can do the rest myself.{nl}I can do it. Probably...
column3: 아직 설치 해야 할 알림판이 많지만, 나머진 혼자 해낼 거예요.{nl}할 수 있을 거예요. 아마도요..
column4: Masih banyak papan pemberitahuan yang harus dipasang, tetapi sisanya akan kulakukan sendiri.{nl} Pasti bisa kok. Mungkin juga.

column2: I am a newcomer of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance. I will serve them well!{nl}I decided to join as soon as I heard that the Kedoran Merchant Alliance {nl}was recruiting newcomers.
column3: 케도라 상단의 신입입니다. 잘 부탁드려요!{nl}말로만 듣던 케도라 상단이 신입을 모집한다고 해서 바로 입단했어요.
column4: Saya adalah anggota baru dari Kedora Merchant Alliance. Mohon bantuannya0!{nl} Setelah mendengar Kedora Merchatn sedang melakukan rekrut, aku segera mendaftar untuk bergabung.

column2: It is my duty to help the Revelators in the name of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance.{nl}From now on, I will be keep doing this task until I become more experienced.
column3: 케도라 상단의 이름으로 계시자들을 돕는 게 제 일입니다.{nl}앞으로도 신입 꼬리를 뗄 때 까지는 이 일을 계속 하게 될 것 같아요.
column4: Menolong para Saviour dengan nama Kedora Merchant Alliance adalah pekerjaanku.{nl} Kedepannya pun sampai aku terlepas dari level anggota baru, sepertinya aku akan terus melakukan pekerjaan ini.

column2: Collection Member
column3: 회수 조원
column4: Mengumpulkan material

column2: The Kedoran Merchant Alliance is retrieving the objects that were lost on Medzio Diena.{nl}Jurate is in charge of this.
column3: 케도라 상단이 이 곳에서 신수의 날에 잃어버렸던 물건들을 회수하는 작업을 하는 중입니다.{nl}이 일은 유라테 조장이 맡아서 하고 있어요.
column4: Kedora Merchant Alliance sedang melakukan pekerjaan mengumpulkan benda-benda yang hilang pada hari Medzio Diena di tempat ini.{nl} Pekrejaan ini diserahkan kepada Yurate Team Leader saat ini.

column2: Record Member
column3: 기록 조원
column4: Group Member Record

column2: I do all the work related to the Kedoran Merchant Alliance records.{nl}Such as identifying the quantities of the things that need to be recorded.
column3: 케도라 상단의 기록 관련한 실무를 진행하고 있습니다.{nl}기록에 필요한 것들의 수량을 파악하는 등등이지요.
column4: Sedang menjalankan pekerjaan yang berhubungan catatan dari Kedora Merchant Alliance.{nl} dibutuhkan pengecekan jumlah dari hal-hal yang dibutuhkan pada catatan.

column2: I am managing the manuals that will be used to teach the newcomers.{nl}This too, is part of the Kedoran Merchant Alliance records.
column3: 신입들을 교육시킬 교육지침서를 관리합니다.{nl}이것도 케도라 상단의 기록의 일종이거든요.
column4: Aku mengelola surat perintah pendidikan untuk melatih anggota baru.{nl} Ini adalah sejenis catatan dari Kedora Merchant Alliance.

column2: I am praying all the time for the return of the goddesses.{nl}Although I am old, I am trying to do everythig I can.
column3: 여신이 돌아오시기를 기다리며 늘 기도를 드리고 있소.{nl}늙은 몸이라도 할 수 있는 건 다 해보려 한다오.
column4: Aku selalu berdoa dan menunggu agar Goddess kembali.{nl} Walau tubuh ini sudah tua, aku ingin mencoba melakukan hal yang kubisa.

column2: I've never heard of it, but it doesn't matter that much.{nl}They concentrate on their religious belief quietly.
column3: 뭐, 들어본 적 없어도 별로 상관은 없소.{nl}본디 조용하게 자기의 신앙에만 충실한 사람들이니까.
column4: Yah, walaupun tidak pernah mendengarnya tidak ada masalah.{nl} Karena mereka orang-orang setia yang berkukuh pada iman sendiri awalnya.

column2: I couldn't stand anymore so I came out to look for the materials of the scriptures.{nl}The goddesses would... come back one day right?
column3: 너무 답답해서 경전 재료를 찾으러 나왔어요.{nl}여신께선 언젠가는.. 돌아오시겠죠?
column4: Aku keluar untuk mencari material scripture karena kesal.{nl} Goddess kapankah engkau.. Akan kembali?

column2: I want to go back to Fasika Plateau fast after finding what I lost...
column3: 잃어버렸던 걸 찾아서 얼른 파사카 협곡으로 가고 싶어..
column4: Ingin cepat menemukan yang hilang, dan pergi segera ke Pasaka Hll..

column2: When I talk to him, I feel like I'm aging 100 years.{nl}I don't know what to say.
column3: 이 사람이랑 얘기하고 있으면 100살은 더 먹는 기분이에요.{nl}나 참.
column4: Kalau bicara dengan orang ini, rasanya memakan waktu 100 tahun lamanya.{nl} Hadeh.

column2: If I only got mine back, I would've never come back here.{nl}He can go do whatever he wants since his daughter's career is so successful!{nl}
column3: 내 것만 돌려받으면 여긴 다신 안 오겠어.{nl}딸이 출세 했으니 알아서 하겠지!{nl}
column4: Kalau aku mendapatkan hal itu kembali, aku tidak akan datang kembali kesini.{nl} Karena anak perempuanku telah sukses, dia akan melakukannya sendiri kan!{nl}

column2: You better not get involved with those guys.
column3: 너도 이런 녀석들과 얽히지 않는 게 좋을거야.
column4: Sebaiknya kau tidak ikut campur dengan mahluk seperti mereka.

column2: This is a strategic military point and it is a dangerous place.{nl}You better be cautious.
column3: 여긴 군사 요충지면서 동시에 위험지역이기도 하지.{nl}뭐든 조심하는 것이 좋을 거요.
column4: Karena disini adalah markas militer, merupakan daerah yang berbahaya ya.{nl} Sebaiknya berhati-hati atas segala hal.

column2: After the supplies stopped coming from the mountain below, {nl}it became harder to maintain the army.{nl}However, the bigger problem is that the situation down there seem worse.
column3: 산 아래로부터 보급이 끊기고 나선 부대를 유지하는 것 조차 힘들다오.{nl}문제는 아래 쪽 상황은 더 안 좋을 것 같단 말이지.
column4: Setelah Persediaan terhenti sampai di bawah gunung, sungguh sulit untuk menjaga pasukan.{nl} Yang menjadi masalah adalah dibawah sana kondisinya terlihat lebih tidak baik lagi.

column2: We better get to our mission fast...{nl}Just a little bit more...
column3: 어서 임무를 수행해야 하는데..{nl}조금만 더 버텨 볼까..
column4: Harus segera menjalankan misi..{nl} Apakah sebaiknya mencoba bertahan sedikit lagi..

column2: It is so freezing cold.{nl}I am not sure how long we can stand...
column3: 진짜 뼛속까지 얼어붙도록 춥군요.{nl}언제까지 버틸 수 있을지..
column4: Sungguh dingin sekali, sampai rasanya membeku ke tulang-tulang.{nl} Entah sampai kapan dapat bertahan..

column2: This will be the end if we fall asleep here.{nl}We better move our bodies constantly.
column3: 이런 곳에선 잠들면 끝입니다.{nl}조금씩이라도 계속 몸을 움직여야 하죠.
column4: Jika tertidur di tempat seperti ini maka habislah sudah.{nl} Harus terus menggerakan tubuh walaupun sedikit saja.

column2: We do our task everyday amidst life and death.{nl}But, if I hadn't met you today... I can only say that I was lucky.
column3: 저희는 매일 생사를 넘나들며 임무를 수행합니다.{nl}하지만 오늘은 당신을 만나지 못했다면.. 정말 운이 좋았다고 밖엔 표현할 수가 없군요.
column4: Setiap hari kami menjalankan tugas antara hidup dan mati.{nl} Tetapi untung saja hari ini dapat bertemu dengan anda.. Tidak ada cara lain untuk mengungkapkan hal itu.

column2: The unfinished mission is still bothering me.{nl}The assistant commander says it's okay, but I don't think it is.
column3: 완수하지 못한 임무가 자꾸 마음에 걸리는군요.{nl}부대장님께선 괜찮다곤 하시지만, 전 아닙니다.
column4: Aku sering teringat akan misi yang tidak dapat kuselesaikan.{nl} Walaupun kepala pasukan, berkata tidak apa-apa. Tetapi aku tak berpikir demikian.

column2: Shh, please lower your voice.{nl}I'm hiding to avoid getting detected by monsters.
column3: 쉿, 목소리를 낮추세요.{nl}몬스터에게 들키지 않도록 숨어있는 중입니다.
column4: Sstt, Kecilkan suaramu.{nl} Aku sedang bersembunyi agar tidak tertangkap oleh monster.

column2: If I take a quick rest, I should be able to move out...{nl}What to do with this letter...
column3: 조금만 쉬면 금방 움직일 수 있을 것 같은데..{nl}이 서신은 어쩐다..
column4: Kalau beristirahat sebentar saja, agar segera pulih lagi sepertinya..{nl} Aduh, pesan ini bagaimana yah..

column2: I was able to complete the mission and return to the camp safely.{nl}I knew the goddesses haven't abandoned me yet.
column3: 덕분에 임무도 완수하고 무사히 부대로 돌아올 수 있었습니다.{nl}이럴 땐 정말 여신께서 아직 절 버리지 않으셨구나 하는 생각이 듭니다.
column4: Berkat anda, aku dapat menyelesaikan misiku dan kembali ke pasukan dengan selamat.{nl} Pada saat ini lah, dimana aku berpikir bahwa Goddess tidak pernah melupakan diriku.

column2: I don't know why I applied to become a messenger.{nl}Regardless of the weather, the monsters are going crazy so my task is getting harder.
column3: 제가 왜 연락병을 지원했는지 모르겠습니다.{nl}날씨는 둘째치고 몬스터가 점점 극성이라 갈수록 임무가 힘들어지는군요.
column4: Aku tidak  tahu mengapa aku membantu pasukan penghubung.{nl} Ketika cuaca semakin ekstrem dan monster menjadi semakin ganas, saat itulah misiku jadi semakin sulit.

column2: The supplies are running out, but I haven't received any contact from the kingdom yet.{nl}But, since I am a supply officer, I am thinking how we would endure more.
column3: 보급 물자는 바닥을 보이는데 왕국에선 아직도 연락이 없군요.{nl}하지만 전 보급병이니까, 어떻게든 버텨 보려고 궁리 중입니다.
column4: Supply barang sudah menipis, tetapi masih juga belum ada kabar dari kerajaan.{nl} Tetapi karena aku adalah Supply Office, Aku sedang berpikir bagaimanapun aku harus coba bertahan.

column2: We're really lacking a lot. In everything.{nl}Although, we are self-sufficient enough from hunting monsters nearby...
column3: 정말 많이 부족합니다. 모든 게요.{nl}주변 몬스터라도 사냥해서 자급자족으로 버티곤 있지만.. {nl}
column4: Sungguh berkekurangan sekali. Semua hal.{nl} walau dapat bertahan sendirian dengan berburu monster di sekitar pun.. {nl}

column2: Oh, I shouldn't think about negative things.
column3: 에이, 나쁜 생각은 그만 두렵니다.
column4: Weh, berhentilah berpikir buruk.

column2: Civilians better go down the mountains.{nl}If they stay here, they would either die of hunger or freeze to death.
column3: 민간인은 어서 산 아래로 내려가는 것이 좋을 겁니다.{nl}여기 있어봤자 얼어죽거나, 굶어죽기 십상일테니.
column4: Warga sipil alangkah baiknya jika segera turun ke bawah gunung.{nl} Kalau tetap berada disni, dapat mati membeku atau kelaparan.

column2: Although the kingdom has become ineffective, we are still soldiers.{nl}This is a military zone and if you are not related to the military, please leave.
column3: 왕국이 유명무실해졌어도 저흰 아직 군인입니다.{nl}여긴 군사지역이고. 관계자가 아니라면 떠나 주십시오.
column4: Walaupun kerajaan menjadi terkenal, kami hanyalah prajurit biasa.{nl} dan disini adalah daerah militer. Jika tidak berkepentingan, silahkan pergi dari tempat ini.

column2: Thanks to you, Horace's condition has improved.{nl}I hope he can relax a bit now.
column3: 덕분에 호라스님의 상태가 많이 좋아진 것 같습니다.{nl}이제 그만 무리하셨으면 좋겠는데요.
