column4: Berkat kamu kondisi dari tuan Horas telah banyak membaik.{nl} Alangkah baiknya jika berhenti melakukan hal dengan terpaksa sekarang.

column2: Although orders from the kingdom have stopped, {nl}we are staying here because we are soldiers.{nl}The same holds true hor Horace. {nl}
column3: 비록 왕명은 끊겼지만, 저흰 군인이기 때문에 여기 남아있는 겁니다.{nl}호라스님도 마찬가지고요. {nl}
column4: Akhirnya perintah dari raja terputus, tetapi karena kami adalah tentara, maka tetap tinggal disini.{nl} Tuan Horas pun juga begitu. {nl}

column2: If someone doesn't do it, the kingdom will collapse.{nl}Our homes too, there will be no one left to protect our families.
column3: 누구라도 그렇게 하지 않으면 왕국은 무너지고 말 겁니다.{nl}고향도, 가족도 지켜줄 이 하나 남지 않게 되는 것이죠.
column4: Siapapun juga jika tidak melakukan seperti itu, maka kerajaan akan hancur.{nl} Tidak akan tersisa apapun dari Kampung halaman, keluarga untuk dijagai.

column2: Patient in the Tent
column3: 텐트 속의 환자
column4: Pasien di dalam Tenda

column2: Hurk... Don't talk to me.{nl}I feel like throwing up...
column3: 우욱.. 말걸지 마세요.{nl}토하고 싶어지니까..
column4: Uuhk.. Janganlah bicara.{nl} Karena ingin muntah rasanya..

column2: I shouldn't lie around in a time like this...
column3: 이렇게 누워 있을 때가 아닌데..
column4: Ini bukan saatnya untuk berbaring seperti ini...

column2: I thought... I was going to enter the goddesses' embrace.{nl}
column3: 아깐 정말.. 여신의 품으로 가는 줄 알았습니다.{nl}
column4: Tadi itu sungguh.. Kukira segalanya berjalan sesuai kehendak Goddess.{nl}

column2: Though, I learned something as a result.{nl}Some things that the monsters eat aren't always edible.
column3: 하지만 덕분에 한 가지 배웠죠. {nl}몬스터가 먹는다고 꼭 식용일 수는 없다는 것을요.
column4: Tetapi berkat itu aku telah belajar satu hal. {nl} Sesuatu yang dimakan oleh monster, belum tentu dapat dimakan.

column2: I'm planning to stay here until I receive contact from the kingdom.{nl}We need to rely on each other despite being cornered so the soldiers won't give up.
column3: 왕국에서 연락이 닿을 때 까지만이라도 계속 여기에 머무려고요.{nl}서로 기댈 구석이라도 있어야 병사들도 힘을 내지 않겠습니까.
column4: Aku bermaksud berada disini, sampai ada kontak dari kerajaan.{nl} Jika saling bertumpu satu sama lain, akan menjadi kekuatan bagi para prajurit.

column2: Although this place is known as an important strategic military point, {nl}there are not many soldiers around.{nl}This place is that harsh.
column3: 여긴 중요한 요충지라고 불리는 것 치곤 병사들이 적죠.{nl}그만큼 혹독한 곳입니다.
column4: Disini untuk suatu tempat yang disebut titik strategis yang penting, jumlah prajuritnya terlalu sedikit.{nl} Tempat ini sungguh keras.

column2: This place used to be a forced labor camp.{nl}I don't know how people worked in this extreme cold, {nl}but I personally would have survived well.
column3: 여긴 예전에 강제 노역장으로 쓰이던 곳이였어요.{nl}이렇게 추운 곳에서 무슨 노역을 했는지는 모르겠지만, 저라면 절대 착하게 살 겁니다.
column4: Disini dahulunya adalah tempat yang dipakai sebagai tempat kerja paksa.{nl} Aku tidak mengerti pekerjaan paksa apa yang dilakukan di tempat dingin seperti ini, Kalau aku pasti tidak betah.

column2: I've come here after hearing that the goddesses blessed the Order of the Tree of Truth...{nl}Though I only see the dead.
column3: 여신께서 진리의 나무 교단을 축복했단 소문을 듣고 여기까지 왔는데.. {nl}어째 망자들만 가득하네요.
column4: Aku datang sampai kesini setelah mendengar isu bahwa Goddess telah memberkati Organisasi Tree of Truth.. {nl} Kemarin hanya dipenuhi oleh mereka yang telah mati saja.

column2: I thought I would be able to find out the whereabouts of Goddess Zemyna, {nl}but this place is full of the dead...{nl}I've never seen something like this. We have to hurry and meet with Zemyna.
column3: 여기라면 제미나 여신의 행방을 찾을 수 있을까 했는데, 망자들만 가득하다니..{nl}이런 건 처음 봐요. 어서 제미나님을 찾아야 할 텐데요.
column4: Disini, kukira sepertinya dapat mencari jejak dari Goddess Zemyna, tetapi hanya dipenuhi oleh mereka yang telah mati..{nl} Ini pertama kalinya melihat hal itu. Harus bergegas mencari Goddess Zemyna.

column2: The dead have suddenly risen.{nl}The Bokor is going around destroying the coffins. What the hell is going on...
column3: 갑자기 망자들이 깨어나질 않나.{nl}웬 보코르가 관을 다 부수고 다니질 않나. 이게 대체 무슨 난리람?
column4: Mendadak Yang telah mati tidak terbangun.{nl}Kenapa Bokor tidak pergi setelah menghancurkan semua Peti mati. Kekacauan apa ini omong-omong?

column2: I've never seen this in my life.{nl}It was such a chaos on Medzio Diena, but those dead as well?{nl}It can't be...
column3: 묘지기 인생에 이런 건 처음 보는군.{nl}하긴 신수의 날 때도 난리도 아니였는데, 망자까지? {nl}아이고, 나 참..
column4: Ini pertama kalinya aku melihat hal ini, selama aku bekerja sebagai penjaga makam.{nl} Pada hari Medzio Diena semuanya sungguh kacau, sampai-sampai orang mati pun? {nl} Haduhh..

column2: I think those people in the Order are all scammers.{nl}I am certain that Zemyna would've never blessed this church.
column3: 아무리 생각해도 진리의 나무 교단은 사기꾼 같아요.{nl}제미나님이 이런 교단을 축복하셨을 리가 없어요.
column4: Dipikir bagaimana pun sepertinya Organisasi Tree of Truth adalah penipu.{nl} Tidak mungkin Goddess Zemyna memberkati organisasi seperti ini.

column2: Those people went crazy on the graves...{nl}I'm very embarassed to see Sigis.
column3: 결국 아무것도 모르고 제 멋대로 묘지를 헤집어 놓은 꼴이네요..{nl}시기스님 얼굴 보기가 참 민망해요.
column4: Akhirnya tanpa mengetahui apapun, menaruh batu nisan sesuai pengetahuan saja kan..{nl} Sungguh jadi malu melihat wajah tuan Sigis.

column2: The Divine Tree is not a symbol of disaster.{nl}It is the symbol of the great determination that will save us all.
column3: 신수는 재앙의 상징이 아닙니다.{nl}우리 모두를 구원해 주실 위대한 의지의 상징이지요.
column4: Medzio Diena bukanlah pertanda dari bencana.{nl} Itu merupakan pertanda akan keinginan hebat untuk menyelamatkan kita semua.

column2: There will soon be a day where you will recognize the grace of the Divine Tree.{nl}How about you join the Order of the Tree of Truth?
column3: 당신도 곧 신수의 은혜를 깨닫게 되는 날이 올 겁니다.{nl}저희 진리의 나무 교단에 입단하시는 건 어떻습니까?
column4: Kamu pun akan segera mendapat pengertian Rahmat Medzio Diena.{nl} Bagaimana jika kamu bergabung dengan organisasi  Tree of Truth  kami?

column2: Ahh... I... could not be saved...
column3: 아아.. 나는.. 구원받지 못했다..
column4: Aahhh..Aku… tidak dapat menerima penyelamatan..

column2: I was foolish... I was really foolish...
column3: 어리석었다.. 나는 참으로 어리석었다..
column4: Dasar bodoh.. Aku sungguh bodoh sekali..

column2: Do you believe in salvation?
column3: 자넨 구원을 믿나?{nl}
column4: Apakah kau percaya akan penyelamatan?{nl}

column2: Those who believe in the goddesses are fools. {nl}The Divine Tree, which still stands in the kingdom's capital, will save you.
column3: 여신을 믿는 건 어리석은 일이지. {nl}왕도에 우뚝 솟은 신수가 자넬 구원해 줄 것이네.
column4: Mempercayai Goddess adalah sesuatu yang bodoh kan.{nl} Medzio Diena yang berdiri di depan raja akan menyelamatkan engkau ya.

column2: You should't want salvation that easily.{nl}Think about what you've done for the Divine Tree before you {nl}request something from the Divine Tree.
column3: 구원을 쉽게 바라선 안 되네.{nl}신수께 뭔가 요구하기 전에 스스로가 신수를 위해 뭘 했는지 생각해 보게나.
column4: Tidak boleh mengharapkan keselamatan dengan mudah.{nl} Cobalah berpikir apakan yang telah dilakukan untuk Medzio Diena, sebelum diri sendiri meminta sesuatu kepadanya.

column2: The act of awakening the dead and disturbing their eternal rest is what they call the truth?
column3: 죽은 자를 깨워서 안식을 방해하는 것이 놈들이 말하는 진리더냐?
column4: Gangguan ritual dengan membangunkan yang sudah mati, adalah kebenaran yang mereka bicarakan?

column2: While I was alive, I managed the lands of the kingdom, {nl}yet they called me someone guilty of high treason.
column3: 살아생전에 왕국의 토지를 관리했던 나에게 대역죄인이라니 가당치도 않다.
column4: Tidak lucu menyebutku sebagai Penjahat, karena dahulu aku pernah menjagai tanah dari kerajaan selama hidupku.

column2: Of course I won!{nl}However, I said I dropped the necklace I recieved as evidence from the guy into the sea.{nl}
column3: 당연히 내가 이겼지! {nl}그런데 증거로 챙긴 그 녀석의 목걸이를 바다에 빠뜨리고 말았어.{nl}
column4: Tentu saja aku menang!{nl}Tapi aku jatuhkan necklace itu ke dalam laut sebagai bukti.{nl}

column2: Back then, I gave up because the sea was too deep...{nl}Even now I'm not sure if I can still find it.
column3: 그 땐 워낙 깊은 바다라 포기했지만.. {nl}지금이라면 찾을 수 있을지도 모르겠군.
column4: Lalu aku menyerah karena ternyata lautnya terlalu dalam...{nl}Tapi aku dapat mendapatkannya kembali.

column2: If I can find it, I think I will be able to deal a blow to those who says I am a bluff.{nl}It's near Kranto Coast. I recognized you as a Corsair, so you should be able to find it quickly.
column3: 그것만 되찾으면 내가 허세라는 녀석들에게 크게 한 방 먹일 수 있어.{nl}크란토 연안쯤일거다. 너는 내가 인정한 커세어니 금방 찾을 수 있겠지.
column4: Aku tidak menemukannya, kupikir akan kuhajar mereka yang meremehkanku.{nl}Didekat Kranto Coast. {nl}Kamu seorang Corsair yang sangat aku kenal, aku yakin kamu bisa menemukannya.

column2: A Centurion knows how to dedicate himself for the kingdom...{nl}He should know its honor.{nl}
column3: 센츄리온이라면 왕국을 위해 헌신할 줄 알며.. {nl}그것을 명예로 삼을 줄 알아야 하지.{nl}
column4: Centurion itu mengetahui bagaimana dia mendedikasikan diri pada negara...{nl}Itu adalah sebuah kehormatan.{nl}

column2: I am looking for the flags of a few soldiers who were annihilated on Medzio Diena.{nl}I want you to help me with this, for the honor of these soldiers.
column3: 나는 신수의 날 전멸한 몇몇 왕국군의 군단기를 찾고 있다.{nl}자네도 왕국군의 명예를 위해 이 일을 도왔으면 좋겠군.
column4: Aku mencari bendera para prajurit yang telah dibunuh di Medzio Diena.{nl}Aku ingin kamu membantu demi kehormatan para prajurit.

column2: I've heard that there were soldiers who lost contact at the Drill Ground of Confliction{nl}on Medzio Diena. We didn't expect them to be alive though...{nl}
column3: 신수의 날에 대립의 훈련장에서 연락이 끊긴 왕국군이 있다는 이야기를 들었다.{nl}그들이 생존해있길 바라는건 무리지만.. {nl}
column4: Aku dengar ada beberapa prajurit yang hilang kontak {nl}di arena latihan di Medzio Diena.{nl}Kita tidak terlalu berharap mereka masih hidup...{nl}

column2: At least we will be able to remember the dedicated loyalty the army had towards the kingdom.
column3: 적어도 그 부대가 왕국을 위해 바쳤던 충성심을 기억할 순 있겠지.
column4: Paling tidak kita mengerti apa arti kesetian para prajurit untuk kerajaannya.

column2: If you are a Doppelsoeldner, there is a task that you should do for the kingdom.{nl}
column3: 자네가 도펠죌트너라면 왕국을 위해 반드시 나서줘야 할 일이 있네.{nl}
column4: Jika kamu seorang Doppelsoeldner, ada tugas yang harus kamu kerjakan untuk kerajaan.{nl}

column2: I want to do it myself, but I'm doing some quiet work. {nl}I will be spotted easily.
column3: 내가 직접 나섰으면 하지만, 조용히 진행하고 있는 일이거든. {nl}너무 눈에 띄게 되지.
column4: Aku ingin melakukannya sendiri tapi secara diam-diam. {nl}Aku akan mudah dikenali.

column2: I appreciate you telling me that. {nl}Please look for Commander Ramin's delegate secretly. {nl}
column3: 그래 말해주니 고맙군. {nl}자네는 긴밀히 라민 장군의 사절을 찾아주게. {nl}
column4: Aku sangat menghargaimu akan hal ini. {nl}Carilah utusan Commander Ramin secara diam-diam. {nl}

column2: The last contact we had was receieved from Fasika Plateau.
column3: 파사카 협곡에서의 연락을 마지막으로 소식이 끊겼지.
column4: Kontak terakhir dia berada di Fasika Plateau.

column2: That's so unfortunate. They've probably been attacked by the demons.{nl}Anyways, you have all of my support now that you've {nl}become a valuable member of the Doppelsoeldners.
column3: 안타깝군. 아마 마족에에게 당한 것일 테지.{nl}어쨌든 이걸로 자네도 도펠죌트너의 중요한 일원이 되었으니 내가 적극 지원해 주겠네.{nl}
column4: Sayang sekali. Mungkin mereka diserang para demon.{nl}Kamu akan didukung penuh selama menjadi anggota dari Doppelsoeldner.

column2: Ah, please keep this a secret from the others.{nl}I will find another way to contact General Ramin.
column3: 아, 그리고 이 일은 다른 사람들에겐 절대 비밀로 해 두게.{nl}라민 장군께는 다른 방법으로 연락할 방법을 찾아야겠어.
column4: Ah, tolong jaga rahasia ini dari yang lain.{nl}Aku akan mencari cara lain untuk menghubungi General Ramin.

column2: It is recorded. {nl}This is good, I will pass this to Vaidotas.{nl}
column3: 확실히 기록되었네요. {nl}좋아요, 이건 제가 바이도타스에게 전해주도록 하겠어요.{nl}
column4: Ini direkam. {nl}Baguslah, akan kulaporkan pada Vaidotas.{nl}

column2: It is my turn to help you.
column3: 이제 제가 당신을 도울 차례군요.
column4: Giliranku membantumu.

column2: I don't know why, but there is a strong grudge swirling at Videntis Shrine.{nl}If you could get me that, I will lead you to a higher level.
column3: 무슨 일인지 몰라도 바이덴티스 신당엔 강한 원념이 소용돌이 치더군.{nl}그걸 구해온다면 널 더 높은 경지로 이끌어 주겠어.
column4: Aku tak tahu kenapa, tapi ada dendam yang membara di Videntis Shrine.{nl}Jika kamu bisa menjelaskan itu, aku akan membawamu ke level yang lebih tinggi.

column2: Ah, you've arrived at a good time.{nl}I am investigating the Crystal Mine, but the toxic gas is leaking out again.{nl}
column3: 아, 마침 잘 오셨습니다.{nl}수정광산을 조사하고 있는데, 유독가스가 다시 새어나오고 있더군요.{nl}
column4: Kamu telah datang.{nl}Aku sedang meneliti Crystal Mine, tapi sepertinya toxic gas bocor lagi.{nl}

column2: Good.{nl}Let's first create the neutralizer to neutralize the toxic gas.{nl}
column3: 좋습니다.{nl}일단 유독증기를 중화할 중화제부터 만들어 보도록 하지요.{nl}
column4: Bagus.{nl}Pertama-tama buatlah sesuatu untuk menetralisir toxic gas.{nl}

column2: First, I need you to get me the materials so we can prepare it.{nl}I'll write down the necessary materials and where you cand find them.
column3: 준비는 제가 할 테니 재료를 부탁합니다.{nl}필요한 재료와 위치는 제가 따로 적어 드리지요.
column4: Aku butuh beberapa bahan untuk persiapan.{nl}Akan kutuliskan bahan-bahan yang dibutuhkan serta lokasi untuk menemukan bahan tersebut.

column2: This will be enough.{nl}We were able to finish this quickly because of your help.{nl}
column3: 이 정도면 충분하군요.{nl}덕분에 일을 빨리 마칠 수 있을 것 같습니다.{nl}
column4: Ini sudah cukup.{nl}Berkat pertolongannmu semua akan selesai dengan cepat.{nl}

column2: It will take some time before we can extract the substances...{nl}In the meantime, I will teach you alchemy.
column3: 성분을 뽑아내는데 시간이 좀 걸릴 테니.. {nl}그 동안 새로운 연금술을 가르쳐 드리지요.
column4: Membutuhkan waktu untuk bisa mengekstrak zat ini...{nl}sambil menunggu, aku akan mengajarkan alchemy.

column2: You're here. Good.{nl}The last stage to becoming a Rogue... This is what you really want, right?{nl}
column3: 잘 왔어.{nl}로그의 마지막 단계.. 그걸 원하는거지?{nl}
column4: Kamu cukup hebat.{nl}Tahap terakhir untuk menjadi Rogue... Ini adalah hal yang benar-benar kamu inginkan, ya kan?{nl}

column2: To prove your skills as a Rogue...{nl}I have an idea that will also solve my problem.{nl}
column3: 마침 로그로서의 실력 검증도 할 겸.. {nl}내 문제도 해결할 수 있는 일석이조의 일이 있거든.{nl}
column4: Untuk membuktikan kemampuanmu sebagai Rogue...{nl}Aku punya usul yang juga bisa menyelesaikan masalah ini.{nl}

column2: The Scout Master and I used be the best friends.{nl}However, our relationship now is not as close as it used to be.
column3: 스카우트 마스터와 나는 한 땐 둘도 없는 친구였어.{nl}지금은 조금 어색해졌지만 말야.{nl}
column4: Dulu Aku dan Scout Master adalah sahabat dekat.{nl}Bagaimanapun, saat ini hubunganku dengannya tidak seperti dulu.

column2: In an effort to become closer, I want to give him a present...{nl}I want to give something that the Scout Master likes.{nl}
column3: 뭔가 선물이라도 주면서 관계를 되돌려 보려고 하는데..{nl}스카우트 마스터가 좋아할 만한 걸 만들어주고 싶거든.{nl}
column4: Agar lebih dekat, aku ingin memberi hadiah...{nl}Aku ingin memberikan sesuatu yang disukai oleh Scout Master.{nl}

column2: Are you prepared for what I am going to request of you?
column3: 그러니 내가 부탁하는 걸 좀 구해주지 않겠어?
column4: Kamu telah menyiapkan apa yang akan aku minta darimu?

column2: Good! Get me some pieces with floral fragrances on it from monsters at Alemeth Forest.{nl}All you have to do is secretly put those pieces into this pocket.{nl}
column3: 좋아. 알레멧 숲의 몬스터에게서 과일향이 나는 조각을 구할 수 있어.{nl}그걸 이 주머니에다가 몰래 담아오는 거야.{nl}
column4: Bagus! Bawakan aku floral fragrances dari para monsters di Alemeth Forest.{nl}Ini penting sekali! Kamu harus memasukan dalam kantung ini secara diam-diam.{nl}{nl}{nl}

column2: However, what if the monsters die...{nl}Unfavorable scents may get mixed unless you pull them out when they are alive.{nl}
column3: 하지만 몬스터가 죽어버리기라도 하면..{nl}좋지 않은 냄새가 배길 수 있으니까 숨이 붙어있을 때 꺼내야해.{nl}
column4: Tapi, bagaimana jika monsternya mati...{nl}aroma yang kurang baik mungkin akan bercampur kecuali kamu menariknya saat masih hidup.{nl}

column2: To give you a little hint, this is something you do behind their backs.{nl}Understood?
column3: 조금 힌트를 주자면 이런 일은 상대의 뒤를 잡는 게 기본이야.{nl}잘 알겠지?
column4: Sebagai petunjuk, kamu bisa menemui sesorang di belakang.{nl}Mengerti?

column2: You've collected enough of them as expected.{nl}By fulfilling this request, I can tell that you won't have a problem learning the last skill.
column3: 역시 내 기대대로 잘 모아왔군.{nl}그 정도라면 마지막 기술을 배우는 것도 문제 없을 거야.
column4: Kamu telah mengumpulkannya.{nl}Dengan menyelesaikan permintaan ini, aku bisa mengatakan kamu akan mudah mendapatkan skill terakhir.

column2: There are many people who have the same level of competence as you...{nl}
column3: 당신 수준이라면 이미 차고 넘치건만..{nl}
column4: Banyak orang yang memiliki kemampuan yang sama denganmu...{nl}

column2: Well, alright.{nl}Though, you need to understand that this will be very difficult for you {nl}if you want to learn this at your current level.{nl}
column3: 뭐, 좋소. {nl}당신 수준에서 가르침을 받을 만한 일이라면 그 대가도 쉽지 않다는 걸 알아 주시오.{nl}
column4: Baiklah.{nl}Perlu kamu ketahui bahwa ini akan membutuhkan banyak pengorbanan {nl}Jika kamu ingin mempelajarinya pada levelmu saat ini.{nl}

column2: I've been searching for the arrows that the first Fletcher Master created a long time ago.{nl}Those arrows were given to Lydia Schaffen as a present.{nl}I think they contain some sort of advanced technology.
column3: 난 예전부터 초대 플레쳐 마스터가 만든 화살을 찾고 있소.{nl}리디아 샤펜에게 선물해 줄 정도의 화살이니 거기에 담긴 기술은 보통이 아니겠지.{nl}
column4: Aku telah mencari Arrow yang diciptakan oleh Fletcher Master di masa yang lalu.{nl}Arrows itu diberikan pada Lydia Schaffen sebagai hadiah.{nl}Aku yakin Arrows itu memiliki kemampuan special.

column2: Recently, I've obtained useful information about the whereabouts of those arrows...{nl}There is a person who is able to identify the true value of those arrows.{nl}
column3: 최근에 그 소재에 대한 그럴듯한 정보를 들었는데..{nl}이 일을 시키려면 그 화살의 가치를 알아볼 수 있는 사람이어야 하지 않겠소.{nl}
column4: Saat ini aku sudah memilki informasi mengenai Arrows tersebut...{nl}Ada seseorang yang mampu menyebutkan nilai dari Arrows tersebut.{nl}

column2: I've heard they were at Galeed Plateau.{nl}However, they were used when facing some violent monster, so be careful.
column3: 갈르엣 평야라고 들었소.{nl}무언가 흉폭한 몬스터를 상대하는데 사용했다고 하니 주의하는 게 좋겠지.
column4: Kudengar Arrows itu ada di Galeed Plateau.{nl}Mereka menggunakannya untuk melawan monster-monster jahat, jadi berhati-hatilah.

column2: Oh. I've only seen it for a short period of time, but I can tell how amazing it is.{nl}I want to do some research on this arrow immediately, {nl}but I've made a promise with you, so that's the first thing I'm going to do.{nl}
column3: 오. 슬쩍 봐도 얼마나 굉장한지 알겠군.{nl}당장이라도 이 화살을 연구하고 싶지만, 자네와의 약속이 먼저겠지.{nl}
column4: Aku baru saja melihatnya sebentar, tapi aku melihat sesuatu yang luar biasa.{nl}Aku ingin segera meneliti Arrows ini, {nl}tapi aku sudah berjanji padamu, jadi aku akan melakukan ini dulu.{nl}

column2: Okay... Let's get started.
column3: 자.. 어디 천천히 시작해 봅시다.
column4: Oke … mari kita mulai.

column2: As a Falconer Master, I am always looking at different options to make Falconers stronger.{nl}Recently, I've been thinking how I can make those flying monsters of use to us.{nl}
column3: 응사 마스터로서 다양한 시도를 통해 응사들이 더욱 강해지는 방법을 찾고 있어.{nl}요즘 생각하고 있는 게 날아다니는 몬스터들을 써먹을 순 없을까 하는 것이지.{nl}
column4: Sebagai seorang Falconer Master, Aku selalu melihat hal yang berbeda untuk membuat Falconer lebih kuat.{nl}Saat ini, aku berpikir bagaimana caranya agar makhluk terbang ini bisa berguna buat kita.{nl}

column2: Of course I am satisfied with my partner, Rith..{nl}I think these attempts are helpful to Falconers.
column3: 물론 내 파트너 리쓰에게 만족하고 있지만.. {nl}이런 시도는 응사들에게도 도움이 될 수 있다고 생각해.
column4: Tentu saja aku sangat puas dengan partnerku, Rith..{nl}Kupikir percobaan itu sangat membantu bagi Falconer.

column2: When we tame a hawk, maybe we should feed it something?{nl}I don't have high expectations, but we better go there and try it.{nl}
column3: 매를 길들일 때 처럼 먹이라도 줘보면 되지 않을까?{nl}큰 기대는 하고 있지 않으니 일단 가서 시도라도 해보는게 좋겠어.{nl}
column4: Ketika kamu menangkap seekor Elang, mungkin harus memberinya umpan dulu?{nl}Aku tidak terlalu berharap, tapi mesti dicoba.{nl}

column2: I've placed some food for you to try it on at least three different types of monsters.
column3: 먹이는 넉넉히 넣어두었으니까 적어도 세 종류의 몬스터에게는 시도해봐.
column4: Aku sudah tempatkan makanan untuk kamu cicipi, setidaknya terdiri dari 3 macam monsters.

column2: Did we fail... {nl}I expected it though.{nl}
column3: 역시 실패했나.. {nl}아쉽지만 예상했던 거야.{nl}
column4: Apakah kita telah gagal... {nl}Aku sangat mengharapkannya.{nl}

column2: Regardless of the result, I should reward you for your effort.{nl}The biggest reward I can give to you would be teaching you new skills.{nl}What do you think?
column3: 결과야 어찌되었든 네 노력에는 보답해야겠지?{nl}새로운 기술 전수라면 내가 줄 수 있는 가장 큰 보상이라 생각하는데, 어때?
column4: Melihat hasilnya, aku pantas memberikan penghargaan untuk kerja kerasmu.{nl}Reward terindah buatmu adalah dengan mengajarkanmu skill baru.{nl} Gimana, oke gak?

column2: Shoot at an enemy and hit it...{nl}That's one of the basics of a Schwarzer Reiter.{nl}
column3: 확실하게 적을 쏘아 맞추는 것..{nl}자신이 좀 쏜다고 하는 슈바르츠라이터라고 말하려면 그건 기본인 셈이지.{nl}
column4: Arahkan tepat pada target lalu tembak...{nl}Itu salah satu dasar dari Schwarzer Reiter.{nl}

column2: So you want to learn new skills, huh? {nl}Hitting an enemy with our eyes closed? How does that sound?
column3: 게다가 새로운 기술을 배우고 싶다니.. {nl}적어도 어떤 적이든 눈 감고도 맞출 정돈 되어야 하지 않겠나.{nl}
column4: Jadi kamu ingin mempelajari skill baru ya? {nl}Menembak target dengan mata tertutup! Gimana menurutmu?

column2: Hahaha. However, we aren't blind. {nl}We shouldn't go that far, right?{nl}
column3: 하지만 우린 장님이 아니니 굳이 그럴 것 까진 없지.{nl}
column4: Hahaha. Bagaimanapun kita memang tidak buta. {nl}Kita tidak perlu sejauh itu, ya kan?{nl}

column2: I'm liking your confidence!{nl}I like it so much that we're going to put it to the test.
column3: 자신감은 마음에 드는군.{nl}하지만 입만 산 건 아닌 지 확인해 봐야겠어.{nl}
column4: Aku suka kepercayaan dirimu!{nl}Aku senang sekali memasukan ini ke dalam test.

column2: Your objective is to accurately hit the targets multiple times.{nl}If you're able to do that, I will acknowledge your skills.{nl}So... I'd say about 200 times? Personally I think thats quite easy.
column3: 적에게 실수없이 연속으로 명중시키고 온다면 인정하도록 하지.{nl}한 200번 정도..? 내가 생각해도 너무 쉽군.
column4: Target utamamu adalah dengan membidik sasaran dengan Akurasi yang tinggi secara berturut-turut.{nl}Jika kamu mampu melakukannya, aku akan memperhitungkan kemampuanmu.{nl}Jadi … gimana kalau dengan 200 kali? Sepertinya itu cukup mudah.

column2: I knew it wasn't a bluff! It was the confidence, am I right?!{nl}As promised, I will gladly become your teacher.
column3: 과연! 허세가 아니었어.{nl}그 정도 실력이라면 나도 가르치는 보람이 있지.
column4: Aku sadar ini bukan cuma gertakan! Ini kepercayaan diri, kan?!{nl}Seperti yang telah aku janjikan, aku bangga menjadi gurumu.

column2: The way of a true Monk...{nl}One should push oneself to extreme limits and endure the harsh training.{nl}
column3: 진정한 몽크의 길이란..{nl}자신을 한계까지 몰아세우는 혹독한 수련을 견뎌야 보이는 법이라오.{nl}
column4: Jalan untuk menjadi Monk sejati...{nl}Pertama-tama harus memiliki dorongan yang kuat pada diri sendiri untuk dapat melewati batas, dan mampu bertahan dalam kondisi seberat apapun.{nl}

column2: If you are willing to take the challenge, then we will start immediately.{nl}Talk to me once you are ready for it.
column3: 그대가 도전하겠다고 한다면 바로 시작하도록 하겠소.{nl}준비가 되었다면 대답해 주길 바라오.
column4: Jika kamu bersedia menerima tantangan, kita akan bisa memulainya segera.{nl}mengatakan padaku jika kamu telah siap.

column2: If I were you I'd hurry up.{nl}If you don't defeat enough enemies within the time limit, we'll start from the beginning again.
column3: 나와 이럴 게 아니라 서두르는 게 좋을 거요.{nl}제한 시간 내에 충분한 몬스터를 처치하지 못하면 처음부터 다시 셀 테니까.
column4: Cepatlah dan berhenti terus bicara padaku!{nl}Jika kamu tidak dapat melumpuhkan semua musuh dalam waktu yang telah ditentukan, aku akan menghitung dari awal lagi.

column2: Very good.{nl}Now is the time for you to learn something from me.
column3: 훌륭하오.{nl}그럼 이제 나에게 한 수 배우는 일만 남았군.
column4: Bagus sekali.{nl}Saatnya belajar sesuatu yang baru dariku.

column2: I know that you are ready to be a good Pardoner...{nl}But I'm kind of in big trouble.{nl}
column3: 당신이 훌륭한 파드너가 될 준비가 다 되었다는 건 알고 있지만..{nl}그보다 더 큰일이 있어서 말입니다.{nl}
column4: Aku tahu kamu mampu menjadi seorang Pardoner yang baik...{nl}Tapi sepertinya aku punya masalah besar.{nl}

column2: Well, those impious monsters ripped apart the book of offerings.{nl}Because of that, I can't proceed with my other tasks.{nl}
column3: 글쎄, 이 불경한 몬스터들이 제 헌금 장부를 다 찢어놓았어요.{nl}이것 때문에 지금 다른 업무를 보는 것도 힘이 들고요.{nl}
column4: Nah, monster-monster kurang ajar itu telah merusak book of offerings.{nl}Oleh karenanya aku tidak dapat melanjutkan langkah berikutnya.{nl}

column2: I will tell you the location if you can get me that first book.{nl}I think of you as a trustworthy person since we are close...
column3: 정 급하시다면 제가 장소를 알려 줄 테니 예비 장부를 가져와 주세요.{nl}이런 건 비밀이지만, 당신과 그동안의 인연도 있고 믿을만한 사람이라고 생각하고 있으니까요.
column4: Jika kamu mampu mendapatkan preliminary book itu, aku akan katakan dimana lokasinya.{nl} Kita sudah cukup akrab dan kupikir kamu orang yang bisa dipercaya...

column2: The first book is at Elkosh Abbey Hospital.{nl}
column3: 예비 장부는 엘고스 수도원 별관에 있어요.{nl}
column4: Preliminary book itu berada di Elkosh Abbey Hospital.{nl}

column2: In order to prevent someone from taking them, I've hidden them in the books...{nl}And I've prepared several fake books, so I want you to find them.
column3: 행여나 엉뚱한 사람들이 가져가지 못하도록 책 속에 숨겨두거나..{nl}가짜 장부도 여럿 놓아두었으니 잘 찾아 가지고 오세요.
column4: Untuk menghindari orang lain menemukannya, aku menyembunyikannya di suatu tempat...{nl}Aku juga menempatkan beberapa buku-buku palsu lainnya, jadi kamu harus menemukannya.

column2: This is the right place.
column3: 제대로 찾아오셨군요.{nl}급한 일은 처리했으니 이걸로 당신을 인정하겠습니다.
column4: Ini adalah tempat yang benar.

column2: Welcome.{nl}I am looking for someone who is willing to help me with my research.{nl}
column3: 마침 잘 오셨어요.{nl}안그래도 제 연구를 도와주실 분을 찾고 있었거든요.{nl}
column4: Selamat datang.{nl}Aku mencari seseorang yang bersedia membantu penelitianku.{nl}

column2: Four years have passed after Medzio Diena...{nl}The aftermath of this disaster hasn't gone down at all, instead it's grown larger.{nl}
column3: 신수의 날이 끝난 지가 벌써 4년이나 지났는데..{nl}재앙의 여파는 수그러들기는 커녕 점점 더 날뛰고 있습니다.{nl}
column4: 4 tahun telah berlalu sejak Medzio Diena...{nl}Efek dari bencana ini masih belum mereda, tapi malah semakin besar.{nl}

column2: Especially the plants that have grown so big turned into monsters and dealt a lot of damage.{nl}I am continuously doing research to resolve this issue.{nl}
column3: 특히 과다하게 자란 식물들이 몬스터로 변하면서 많은 피해를 끼치고 있어요.{nl}전 이걸 해결할 방법을 찾기 위해서 계속 연구 중이고요.{nl}
column4: Terutaman tumbuhan yang menjadi monster besar dan memberikan damage yang semakin besar juga.{nl}Aku terus meneliti untuk dapat menyelesaikan masalah ini.{nl}

column2: If you can help me with my research, I will teach you the next level of the Druid.{nl}I believe this will be an adequate assignment for you.
column3: 제 연구를 도와주신다면 드루이드의 다음 단계에 대해 가르쳐 드릴게요.{nl}당신에게도 이만하면 적당한 과제가 될 것 같군요.
column4: Jika kamu dapat menolongku, Aku akan mengajarkan level Druid berikutnya padamu.{nl}Aku yakin tugas ini cukup pantas buatmu.

column2: Please get me samples from the plants who have turned into monsters.{nl}You can obtain more samples the stronger the monster is.
column3: 몬스터가 된 식물들을 처치하고 표본을 구해 주세요.{nl}강한 몬스터일수록 더 많은 표본을 얻을 수 있을 겁니다.
column4: Tolong berikan aku contoh tumbuhan yang telah berubah menjadi monster.{nl}Kamu bisa mendapatkan contoh yang lebih banyak dari monster yang lebih besar.

column2: I know that my request was not easy to complete, but you've done it!{nl}These samples that you've brought are excellent and helpful in my research.{nl}As promised, I will help you since you helped me.
column3: 어려운 부탁이라 생각했는데, 훌륭한 표본들이네요.{nl}제 연구를 도와주셨으니 약속대로 당신을 돕도록 하죠.
column4: Aku tahu tugas ini cukup berat, tapi kamu telah melakukannya!{nl}Sampel-sampel yang kamu bawakan ini sungguh luar biasa dan sangat berarti untuk penelitianku.{nl}Seperti yang telah aku janjikan, aku akan mengajarkanmu.

column2: I know what business you have with me...{nl}That aside, we have something more important going on right now.{nl}
column3: 제게 어떤 용무가 있는지는 알고 있습니다만..{nl}지금은 그보다 더 중요한 일이 있습니다.{nl}
column4: Aku tahu urusan yang sedang kita jalani...{nl}Selain itu, kita memiliki hal lain yang lebih penting untuk dilakukan.{nl}

column2: Suddenly, the evil energy has become stronger in the place I used to look {nl}at using divine power. Using Clairvoyance doesn't even work anymore for me.{nl}
column3: 신성력으로 살펴보던 장소에 갑자기 사악한 기운이 강해지기 시작했습니다.{nl}결국엔 클레어보이언스마저 통하지 않기 시작했지요.{nl}
column4: Energi jahat secara tiba-tibah bertambah kuat.{nl}Dengan Clairvoyance pun masih tidak bekerja.{nl}

column2: I'm asking you if you could get rid of the evil energy that's lurking there?{nl}If you do, I promise you that I will help you reach the next level.
column3: 당신이 그 사악한 기운을 처리해 주실 순 없겠습니까.{nl}이것만 도와주신다면 오라클의 다음 경지에 닿을 수 있도록 약속드리겠습니다.
column4: Aku minta padamu untuk mengusir energi-energi jahat yang berkeliaran di sana?{nl}Jika kamu mampu, aku janji akan meningkatkan levelmu.

column2: The location is Galeed Plateau.{nl}Please put the Purification of Namott that I gave you to the area {nl}where the evil energy is strong.
column3: 문제가 되고 있는 곳은 갈르엣 평야입니다.{nl}제가 드린 정화의 나모트를 사악한 기운이 강한 곳에 세워 주시면 됩니다.
column4: Lokasinya di Galeed Plateau.{nl}Tempatkan Purification of Namott yang kuberikan ini di pusat energi jahat itu berada.

column2: I knew you were the right person to do this.{nl}As promised, I will lead you to the next level of the Oracle.
column3: 역시 당신에게 맡기길 잘했다는 생각이 드네요.{nl}약속드린대로 오라클의 다음 경지로 이끌어 드리지요.
column4: Aku tahu kamu orang yang tepat untuk ini.{nl}Sesuai janjiku, aku akan meningkatkan level Oraclemu.

column2: Good. Let's get started right away.{nl}
column3: 좋소, 바로 시작하겠소.{nl}
column4: Bagus. Mari kita mulai.{nl}

column2: You need to fight the monsters until the time limit expires.{nl}As you defeat stronger monsters, I will acknowledge that you've went through hard training..{nl}
column3: 제한 시간 내에 몬스터와 계속해서 전투를 해야하는 일이오.{nl}강한 몬스터를 처치할수록 힘든 수련을 했다고 인정해 주겠소.{nl}
column4: Kamu harus melawan para monster hingga limit waktu berakhir.{nl}Selama kamu bisa mengatasi monster-monster yang lebih kuat, aku akan akui kemampuanmu..{nl}

column2: If you don't defeat them within the time limit, you start from scratch. {nl}Be cautious.
column3: 만약 제한 시간 내에 해내지 못한다면 처음부터 다시 시작해야 하니 주의하시오.
column4: Jika kamu tidak berhasil mengalahkan semua monster dalam waktu yang ditentukan, kamu harus mengulangnya dari awal lagi. {nl}Perhatikan baik-baik.

column2: Dragoon Master
column3: 드라군 마스터
column4: Dragoon Master

column2: A Dragoon should never move too far away from an enemy when in danger.{nl}The Dragoon needs to have the courage to fight harder, better, faster, and stronger.
column3: 드라군이 적을 상대로 물러선다는 건 생각할 수도 없죠.{nl}특히 위기에 몰려도 더 강하게 몰아세울 수 있는 용기도 필요하고요.{nl}
column4: Seorang Dragoon tidak perlu bergerak terlalu jauh dari monster jika dalam bahaya.{nl}Dragoon butuh keberanian lebih, lebih kuat, lebih cepat dan lebih keras.

column2: We reject the courage of those who fight without skills.{nl}The path of the Dragoon is a difficult path.{nl}So if you've come here without a strong sense of determination, I suggest you leave now.
column3: 하지만 실력 없는 무모한 용기만 내세울 거라면 우리 쪽에서 거절합니다.{nl}결코 쉬운 길은 아니니 어설픈 마음으로 오셨다면 물러 나시지요.
column4: Kami tidak membutuhkan mereka yang berjuang tanpa skill.{nl}The path of the Dragoon itu adalah path yang sulit.{nl}Jadi, jika kamu datang kemari tanpa determinasi yang tinggi, sebaiknya kamu kembali saja.

column2: Alright, let's see if you really are worthy enough to become one of us.{nl}Show me your skills.{nl}
column3: 그렇다면 당신이 입만 산 건지, 진짜 실력자인지 확인해보도록 하지요.{nl}한 번 당신의 실력을 보여 주시죠.{nl}
column4: Oke, kita lihat sampai dimana kemampuan yang kamu miliki.{nl}Tunjukkan kemampuanmu.{nl}

column2: Your objective is to battle monsters and embrace the pain. Do not move away from them.{nl}That's the determination of a courageous Dragoon. {nl}So, attack and defeat the monsters even if you take damage from them. {nl}Good luck.
column3: 물러서지 말고 몬스터와 싸워 보세요.{nl}몬스터를 공격하고, 공격을 당하기도 하면서 처치하시라는 겁니다.{nl}당연히 혼자서 말이죠.
column4: Tujuanmu adalah bertempur melawan monster dan menghimpun rasa sakit. Jangan jauh-jauh dari para monster.{nl}Itu adalah determinasi dari Dragoon pemberani. {nl}jadi, hadapi semua monster dan tahan semua serangannya. {nl}Good luck.

column2: What's this? We don't want anyone with a careless mind.{nl}Since I like you, I am giving you another chance. {nl}Come on, show me your courage and your skills!
column3: 어설픈 마음가짐은 우리도 사양입니다.{nl}물러서지 말고 몬스터와 싸울 수 있는 용기와 실력을 보여 주세요.
column4: Apa ini? Kami tidak membutuhkan orang yang ceroboh.{nl}Karena aku menyukaimu, aku memberimu kesempatan. {nl}Ayo tunjukkan keberanian dan kemampuanmu!

column2: Excellent. You did good.{nl}From this day forward, I will acknowledge you as a member of the Dragoons.
column3: 훌륭하군요.{nl}좋습니다. 당신을 드라군의 일원으로 인정해드리도록 하죠.
column4: Mantappp. Kamu melakukannya dengan baik.{nl}Mulai hari ini dan seterusnya, aku mengakuimu sebagai anggota dari Dragoons.

column2: Are you interested in becoming a Templar?{nl}I can already tell that you're very smart for making this choice.{nl}Now, let me give you a walkthrough of what you need to be aware of.
column3: 템플러를 지망하시려는 겁니까.{nl}좋습니다. 몇 가지 알아두셔야 할 것부터 짚어 드리지요.{nl}
column4: Kamu tertarik menjadi Templar?{nl}Aku dapat menyebutmu cukup cerdas untuk menentukan sebuah pilihan.{nl}Sekarang biarkan aku menuntunmu untuk hal-hal yang  mesti kamu perhatikan dengan baik.

column2: A Templar is a leader to many people. We need people with strong leadership skills.{nl}Especially during these times, a Templar's leadership is the most likely required.{nl}
column3: 템플러는 많은 사람들을 이끌어야 합니다.{nl}이런 험난한 때일수록 당연히 지도력이 중요하겠지요.{nl}
column4: Templar adalah seorang pemimpin dari semua orang. Kami membutuhkan orang dengan jiwa kepemimpinan yang tinggi.{nl}Terutama pada saat-saat ini, kepemimpinan seorang Templar sangata dibutuhkan.{nl}

column2: Don't get me wrong, though. This is often misunderstood as 'authority'.{nl}No, I'm leaning more towards 'cooperation'.{nl}You should cooperate with your followers in order to maintain a group.{nl}
column3: 그렇다고 해서 권력과 착각하시면 곤란합니다.{nl}당신을 따르는 추종자들과 손발을 맞춰가야만이 조직을 유지할 수 있는 것이지요.{nl}
column4: Jangan salah mengartikan. Seringkali salah mengartikan 'kekuasaan'.{nl}Bukan, tapi lebih cenderung pada 'kerjasama'.{nl}Kamu harus mampu bekerjasama dengan para pengikutmu untuk dapat memaintain dengan baik kelompokmu.{nl}

column2: Do you understand what I am trying to tell you?{nl}With that being said, let's see your skills as a Templar.
column3: 제 말을 이해하시겠습니까?{nl}그렇다면 템플러로써의 재량을 한 번 보도록 하지요.
column4: Apa kamu mengerti apa yang aku coba jelaskan padamu?{nl}Dengan apa yang telah dijelaskan, mari kita lihat sampai dimana kemampuanmu sebagai Templar.

column2: A person in authority makes orders, but a Templar should make requests.{nl}Your task is to recruit five people and become their leader in that group.{nl}While being the leader of the group, you have to lead them for quite some time.
column3: 말에.. 권력자는 명령하지만, 템플러는 요청한다고 하지요.{nl}당신이 리더인 다섯 명의 파티를 모아 적당한 시간 동안 이끌어 보십시오.{nl}
column4: Seseorang yang berkuasa memberikan perintah, tapi seorang Templar memberikan permintaan.{nl}Tugasmu adalah mencari 5 orang pengikut dan memimpin mereka dalam satu grup.{nl}Selama menjadi Leader, kamu harus mampu memimpin kelompokmu dalam beberapa waktu kedepan.

column2: The fuel that drives people is the respect.{nl}So, to confirm if you possess this charm, I will put you up to the test.{nl}
column3: 사람을 이끄는 비료가 되는 것이 바로 존경입니다.{nl}당신에게 그런 매력이 있을지.. 이걸로 확인해 보겠습니다.{nl}
column4: Kunci untuk bisa mengendalikan orang lain adalah respect.{nl}Jadi, untuk memastikan kamu memilikinya, aku akan melakukan test padamu.{nl}

column2: Oh, I absolutely do not like to be deceived by tricks or anything like that.{nl}Recruit five people all by yourself and become the leader of the group.
column3: 비겁한 꼼수는 인정하지 않습니다.{nl}직접 다섯 명의 사람을 모으는 것은 물론이고, 당신이 파티의 리더여야만 의미가 있습니다.{nl}
column4: Ouw, aku benar-benar tidak suka dibodohi dengan trik-trik seperti itu.{nl}Rekrut 5 orang anggota oleh kamu sendiri dan jadilah pemimpin mereka.

column2: Well done.{nl}You are certainly much more charming than I expected.
column3: 수고하셨습니다.{nl}생각보다 인망있는 분이시군요.{nl}
column4: Well done.{nl}Ternyata kamu seorang yang lebih berkharisma dari yang aku kira.

column2: It can be tough to make other people follow you.{nl}The more people following you, the tougher it becomes.{nl}It's not easy, but a Templar with great respect and admiration can pull it off.
column3: 다른 사람들을 따르게 하는 것은 매우 힘든 일입니다.{nl}당신을 따르는 사람이 많아질수록 더 힘들겠지요.{nl}
column4: Bisa menjadi suatu kesulitan ketika orang mengikutimu.{nl}Semakin banyak pengikutmu, semakin besar kesulitannya.{nl}Memang tidak mudah, tapi Templar yang hebat dan respek yang tinggi bisa mengatasinya.

column2: I will tell you the things that a Templar must have knowledge in.{nl}I hope you will make wise and careful decisions in the future, so do not forget this.
column3: 템플러가 알아야 할 것들에 대해 알려드리겠습니다.{nl}앞으로도 절대 잊지 마시고 신중한 결정을 내릴 수 있길 바랍니다.
column4: Aku akan katakan sesuatu bahwa Templar harus memilki pengetahuan yang baik{nl}Kuharap kamu dapat memberikan keputusan yang baik dan bijaksana, jangan pernah lupakan itu.

column2: Warlock Master
column3: 워록 마스터
column4: Warlock Master

column2: We will take any measures by any means for the goddesses...{nl}That is the strict rule that we, Warlocks, must abide by.{nl}
column3: 여신을 위해서라면 수단 방법을 가리지 않는다.. {nl}그것이 바로 우리 워록의 철칙이지요.{nl}
column4: Kami akan mengambil tindakan apapun dengan cara apapun untuk para Goddesses...{nl}Itu adalah peraturan yang wajib bagi seorang Warlocks.{nl}

column2: There are many people who misunderstand our interpretations.{nl}A Warlock and its evil spirits are not equally contracted.{nl}We have to rule over them and able to control the evil spirits.{nl}
column3: 흔히들 착각하는게, 워록은 악령과 동등하게 계약한 게 아닙니다.{nl}악령 위에 군림하며 악령을 지배할 수 있어야 하지요.{nl}
column4: Banyak orang salah menginterpretasikan ini.{nl}Warlock dan Ilmu hitam tidak bisa disamaratakan.{nl}Kita harus mampu mengatur dan mengendalikan ilmu hitam ini.{nl}

column2: In order to do so, you need to possess strong magic able to rule and control the evil spirits.{nl}Unless... you want to end up consumed by them. {nl}
column3: 그러려면 악령을 지배하고 제어할 수 있는 강한 마력이 있어야 해요.{nl}악령에게 먹히고 싶지 않다면 말이지요.{nl}
column4: Untuk itu, kamu harus memiliki ilmu yang kuat untuk dapat mengatur dan mengendalikan ilmu hitam ini.{nl}Atau kamu akan menjadi sebaliknya, diatur dan dikendalikan ilmu hitam ini. {nl}

column2: Since you don't know these evil spirits as well as I do...{nl}I will give you a scroll that will wake them up.{nl}
column3: 아직 악령에 대해 잘 모를테니..{nl}악령을 깨우는 주문서를 드리지요.{nl}
column4: Selama kamu belum dapat mengenal ilmu hitam sebaik yang telah kami ketahui...{nl}Aku akan memberimu Scroll yang dapat membangkitkan mereka.{nl}

column2: Use this scroll on monsters at Valius' Eternal Resting Place{nl}to wake up the sleeping evil spirits.{nl}To add another part of this challenge, you need to defeat a monster and the evil spirits.
column3: 발류스의 영면지에 있는 몬스터에게 주문서를 사용하면 잠들어 있던 악령이 깨어날 겁니다.{nl}그 몬스터와 악령을 함께 제압하는 게 당신께 드릴 과제입니다.
column4: Gunakan scroll ini pada monster di Valius' Eternal Resting Place.{nl}Sebagai tambahan tantangan ini kamu harus mampu mengalahkan monster dan ilmu hitamnya.

column2: Get rid of the poison with poison. {nl}Anything else that is evil should be gotten rid of by the evil spirits. {nl}I am waiting for the day when we, the Warlocks, are not needed anymore.
column3: 독은 독으로 없애고 사악한 것들은 악령으로 없애는 것이지요.{nl}우리 워록이 있을 필요가 없는 그날이 오기를 바라고 있습니다.
column4: Singkirkan racun dengan racun. {nl}Segala sesuatu yang berbau ilmu hitam harus disingkirkan dengan ilmu hitam lagi. {nl}Aku menunggu waktu, dimana kita para Warlock sudah tidak dibutuhkan lagi.

column2: Excellent.{nl}This is much better than I had expected.{nl}
column3: 훌륭하군요.{nl}기대했던 것 이상이네요.{nl}
column4: Excellent.{nl}Ini lebih dari yang aku harapkan.{nl}

column2: From now on, you will tread the path of the Warlock. {nl}Oh, and please remember this...{nl}If you don't stand on top of them, you will be consumed by them...{nl}{nl}
column3: 당신은 이제부터 워록의 길로 들어서실 겁니다.{nl}꼭 기억해 두세요. 그들 위에 서지 않으면 잠식당하게 된다는 것을..{nl}{nl}
column4: Mulai sekarang kamu akan menjalani hari sebagai seorang Warlock. {nl}Ahh, ingatlah satu hal ini...{nl}Jika kamu tidak bisa menguasai mereka, maka kamu akan dikuasai oleh mereka...{nl}{nl}

column2: Featherfoot Master
column3: 페더풋 마스터
column4: Featherfoot Master

column2: I don't know how you found out about the curse of the Featherfoot, but...{nl}This curse should not be overused. Rather, it needs some detailed calculations.{nl}
column3: 우리 페더풋이 다루는 저주에 대해 어떻게 알고 오셨는지 모르겠지만.. {nl}저주란 건 자신의 마력만 믿고 남발하는 것 보단 치밀한 계산이 더 중요해요.{nl}
column4: Aku tak tahu bagaimana caranya kamu bisa mendapat Curse Featherfoot, tapi...{nl}Curse ini mestinya tidak digunakan terlalu berlebihan. Butuh perhitungan yang benar-benar matang.{nl}

column2: Of course, I can teach you if you still want to. However...
column3: 그래도 원하신다면 가르쳐드릴 테지만.. {nl}치밀하지 못한 저주가 불러올 화를 감당할 수 있을지, 그게 걱정이네요.
column4: Tentu saja aku bisa mengajarimu. Bagaimanapun...

column2: Since you don't know anything about the curse, I ask you to take these incantation tools.{nl}I told you that it requires detailed calculations before using the curse.{nl}
column3: 아직 저주술에 대해 잘 모르실테니 이 주술도구를 가져가세요.{nl}아까도 말씀드렸지만 잘 계산해서 저주를 내려야 좋은 효과를 볼 수 있어요.{nl}
column4: Selama kamu masih belum tahu tentang Curse ini, Aku memintamu untuk membawa mantra-mantra itu.{nl}Aku ingatkan kembali bahwa kamu harus benar-benar memperhitungkannya sebelum menggunakan Curse itu.{nl}

column2: Find out what there is to lose and what there is to gain...{nl}Use these incantation tools to cast the curse on a monster to find out.{nl}
column3: 무엇을 얻고 무엇을 잃는지..{nl}몬스터에게 이 주술도구로 저주를 걸어보면서 한 번 경험해 보세요.{nl}
column4: Cari tahu apa yang harus dilepas dan apa yang harus diperoleh...{nl}Untuk mencari tahu, gunakan mantra-mantra itu untuk melakukan Curse pada para monster.{nl}

column2: If you learn something here, you will become a great Featherfoot.
column3: 여기서 무언가 깨닫는 게 있다면 훌륭한 페더풋이 될 수 있을 거예요.
column4: Jika kamu belajar sesuatu dari sana, kamu akan menjadi seorang Featherfoot yang hebat.

column2: The curse should not be overused, but instead it requires some detailed calculations.{nl}Experience what the magic used by a Featherfoot is like with help of the tools.
column3: 저주란 건 자신의 마력만 믿고 남발하는 것 보단 치밀한 계산이 더 중요해요.{nl}주술 도구로 페더풋이 쓰는 마법이 어떤 건지 경험해 보세요.
column4: Curse ini tidak boleh berlebihan, harus dengan perhitungan yang matang.{nl}Mengalami apa yang sihir gunakan oleh Featherfoot itu sebuah alat yang membantu.

column2: Now, do you have a broader understanding of the Featherfoot's curse?{nl}You should not consider it like the curse that is used by Demon Lords like Naktis.{nl}
column3: 우리 페더풋이 다루는 저주가 어떤 것인지 이제 잘 아시겠지요.{nl}그렇다고 해서 나크티스 같은 마군주들의 저주와 같은 것이라고 치부하는 건 곤란해요.{nl}
column4: Sekarang, apakah kamu telah memiliki pemahaman yang lebih luas dari Curse Featherfoot ini?{nl}Kamu semestinya tidak membandingkan Curse ini seperti yang dilakukan Demon pada Naktis.{nl}

column2: The arrows of the curse shall only be used on the enemies of the goddesses.{nl}For us, that is our most important guideline. Please keep that in mind.
column3: 저주의 화살은 오로지 여신의 적에게만 사용해야 하는 것.{nl}그것이 우리 페더풋들에게 있어 제일 중요한 지침이니 꼭 기억해 주세요.
column4: Arrow of the curse semestinya digunakan untuk musuh-musuh Goddess.{nl}Bagi kami, itu adalah pedoman kami yang paling penting. Harap diingat.

column2: Cannoneer Master
column3: 캐노니어 마스터
column4: Cannoneer Master

column2: You enrolled to become a Cannoneer? Good choice, hotshot.{nl}
column3: 캐노니어를 지망하다니 보는 눈이 좀 있는데?{nl}
column4: Kamu mendaftar untuk  menjadi Cannoneer? Pilihan yang bagus, hotshot.{nl}

column2: Listen up! The most important attribute of the Cannoneer is firepower, a lot of it!{nl}If a Cannoneer cannot distinguish between aerial attacks and ground attacks, {nl}he or she isn't a valuable asset to the team!{nl}Enemies that are flying in the air should only be attacked by aerial attacks,{nl}and enemies that are on the ground should only be attacked by ground attacks.{nl}
column3: 캐노니어는 누가 뭐래도 역시 화력이지!{nl}하지만 대공공격과 대지공격을 잘 구분하지 못한다면 반쪽짜리일 뿐이야.{nl}날아다니는 적은 대공. 기어다니는 적은 대지. 조금 헷갈리지?{nl}
column4: Dengar baik-baik! Attribut terpenting dari Cannoneer adalah firepower!{nl}Cannoneer tidak dapat dibedakan antara aerial attacks dan ground attacks, {nl}Cannonner tidak begitu bernilai di dalam tim!{nl}Musuh yang terbang harus diserang menggunakan aerial attacks,{nl}dan musuh yang di tanah pun diserang menggunakan ground attacks.{nl}

column2: I figured you should know about this if you want to become a skilled Cannoneer, like me.{nl}What about it, hotshot? You interested?
column3: 이걸 먼저 잘 알아야 훌륭한 캐노니어가 될 수 있다고 할 수 있어.{nl}어때? 배워보겠어?
column4: Aku mau kamu bisa memahami hal ini jika ingin menjadi seorang Cannoneer hebat, sepertiku.{nl}Bagaimana, hotshot? Kamu tertarik?

column2: Good! Alright, hotshot. {nl}I can only assume that you will remember what I will teach you?{nl}
column3: 좋아. {nl}그럼 내가 가르쳐주는 걸 잘 기억했다고 치고..{nl}
column4: Bagus! Oke, hotshot. {nl}Aku yakin kamu akan mengingat apa yang akan aku ajarkan padamu?{nl}

column2: Do you have a paper and pen with you? Remember this.{nl}There are many types of enemies, but the ones that are flying in the air are all aerial-type.{nl}In contrast, the ones that are moving on the ground are considered a walking-type.{nl}
column3: 이것저것 있지만 기본적으로 날아다니는 몬스터는 비행형이야.{nl}반대로 땅에서 움직이는 건 보행형이지.{nl}
column4: Kamu punya kertas dan pulpen? Ingat ini.{nl}Banyak tipe musuh, dan diantaranya tipe musuh yang terbang disebut aerial-type.{nl}Sebaliknya, tipe musuh yang berada di atas tanah adalah walking-type.{nl}

column2: Alright, face against monsters with both these types.{nl}You need to understand how each enemy moves and which attacks are effective.
column3: 그 두 종류의 몬스터를 모두 상대해봐.{nl}어떤 적이 어떻게 움직이고 어떤 공격이 효과적일지 알아두는 건 중요한 공부니까.
column4: Okay, hadapilah monster-monster dengan kedua tipe tersebut.{nl}Kamu perlu memahami setiap gerakan monster disesuaikan dengan serangan yang diberikan agar efektif.

column2: The flying monsters are aerial-types and {nl}the ones that move on the ground are walking-types.{nl}Face against both types of monsters. Understood?
column3: 날아다니는 몬스터는 비행형, 땅에서 움직이는 몬스터는 보행형이야.{nl}그 두 종류의 몬스터를 모두 상대해봐. 알겠지?
column4: Monster-monster terbang merupakan aerial-types dan satunya lagi yang berkeliaran di atas tanah merupakan walking-types.{nl}Hadapai kedua tipe monster itu, mengerti?

column2: Good.{nl}Was this a good lesson? Am I a good teacher?{nl}
column3: 훌륭하군.{nl}공부는 좀 됐을까 잘 모르겠네.{nl}
column4: Bagus.{nl}Pelajaran yang menarik, kan? Apakah aku seorang guru yang menarik juga?{nl}

column2: Alrighty then! Theoretically, you should know all the logic about what I've taught you.{nl}It's time to put the theory into practice!{nl}The skills of a Cannoneer are not easy, so make sure to focus!
column3: 그럼 이론은 끝났다고 생각하고 바로 실기를 배워볼까?{nl}캐노니어의 기술은 쉽지 않으니까 한 눈 팔지 말고 잘 따라와.
column4: Oke berikutnya! Secara teori, kamu harus tahu semua logika tentang apa yang telah aku ajarkan.{nl}Saatnya mempraktekkan teori tersebut!{nl}Skill-skill Cannoneer tidak mudah, kamu harus fokus!

column2: Musketeer Master
column3: 머스킷티어 마스터
column4: Muskeeteer Master

column2: A Musketeer should know how to handle a rifle.{nl}Not many enemies can stand against simultaneous firing by well trained Musketeers.
column3: 머스킷티어라면 단연 장총 아니겠습니까.{nl}잘 숙련된 머스킷티어들이 퍼붓는 일제사격을 감당할 수 있는 적은 아무도 없지요.{nl}
column4: Seorang Muskeeteer harus tahu cara memegang rifle dengan benar.{nl}Tidak banyak musuh yang bisa menahan simultaneous firing yang ditembakkan oleh seorang Musketeer hebat.

column2: That is why marksmanship is really important.{nl}Finishing enemies before they come anywhere nearby is the start of marksmanship.
column3: 그렇기 때문에 사격술은 아주 중요합니다.{nl}적이 근처에도 오지도 못하게 끝장내 버리는 것이야 말로 사격술의 시작인 겁니다.
column4: Itulah kenapa marksmanship sangat penting.{nl}Menghabiskan musuh yang muncul dari segala penjuru adalah awal dari marksmanship.

column2: One of the basic aspects of marksmanship is to procure range.{nl}Give it a shot. Attack an enemy at maximum range.
column3: 사격술의 기본은 사거리 확보입니다.{nl}최대 사정거리에서 적을 공격해 보세요.{nl}
column4: Salah satu aspek dasar dari marksmanship adalah untuk menciptakan jarak.{nl}Tembakkan, dan lumpuhkan musuh dari jarak terjauh.

column2: It's not just extending the range, but to extend it up the {nl}maximum distance where you are able to shoot.{nl}I am going to put you to the test to see how well you perform.
column3: 거리를 조금 벌리는 정도가 아니라 당신이 공격할 수 있는 최대한 멀리 떨어지는 겁니다.{nl}얼마나 잘해낼 수 있는지 그걸로 평가하도록 하지요.
column4: Ini bukan sekedar memperlebar jangkauan, juga untuk memperpanjang{nl}jarak maksimum untuk bisa melakukan shoot.{nl}Aku akan mengujimu, sampai dimana kemampuanmu dalam hal ini.

column2: It's not just extending the range, but being able to extend it up the {nl}maximum distance where you are still able to shoot.{nl}If you want to become a Musketeer, you will accept my challenge.
column3: 거리를 조금 벌리는 정도가 아니라 당신이 공격할 수 있는 최대한 멀리 떨어져서 공격하세요.{nl}머스킷티어를 지망하려면 그 정도는 해내야지요.
column4: Ini bukan sekedar memperlebar jangkauan, juga untuk memperpanjang{nl}jarak maksimum untuk bisa melakukan shoot.{nl}Jika kamu ingin menjadi seorang Musketeer, kamu akan menerima tantanganku.

column2: Now that you know the basics of the Musketeer, it's time to put this in practice.{nl}Alright, let's teach you how to use a rifle!
column3: 그 정도면 기본은 되어 있군요.{nl}그럼, 장총의 사용법을 본격적으로 배워보시지요!
column4: Sekarang kamu sudah tahu dasar dari Musketeer, saatnya mempraktekkannya.{nl}Baiklah, mari kuajarkan cara menggunakan rifle!

column2: Plague Doctor Master
column3: 플레이그 닥터 마스터
column4: Plague Doctor Master

column2: Hm, how to describe Plague Doctors...{nl}It's a combination of the authority of the goddesses and the knowledge of humans.{nl}
column3: 플레이그 닥터로 말하자면.. {nl}여신의 신성한 권능과 인간의 지식이 융합된 결정체라고 할 수 있지요.{nl}
column4: Hm, the Plague Doctor Master adalah...{nl}Kombinasi antara kehendak Goddesses dan pengetahuan manusia.{nl}

column2: Enhancing the harmful effects even further and to cure allies who are hurt by these effects.{nl}To put it simply, we are an expert in harmful effects.
column3: 적에게 걸린 해로운 효과를 더 악화시키거나 효과에 당한 아군을 치료할 수 있지요.{nl}말하자면.. 해로운 효과의 전문가라고 할 수 있겠네요.
column4: Meningkatkan harmful effect, terlebih lagi juga untuk menyembuhkan orang yang terkena efek ini.{nl}Simpelnya sih kita ini adalah ahlinya dari harmful effect.

column2: Of course I am willing to teach you even if you are not in such a hurry.{nl}But before that, I want you to experience the harmful effect yourself.{nl}It'll be quicker that way, don't you agree?{nl}{nl}
column3: 그렇게 서두르시지 않아도 당연히 가르쳐 드릴 겁니다.{nl}하지만 그 전에, 해로운 효과들에 대해 직접 느껴보시는 게 더 빠를 것 같군요.{nl}
column4: Tentu saja aku mau mengajarkanmu meskipun kamu sedang tidak antusias.{nl}Tapi sebelumnya aku ingin kamu mempelajari harmful effect yang ada pada dirimu sendiri.{nl}Dengan cara itu akan lebih cepat, setuju kan?{nl}{nl}

column2: Use this mask on a poisoned monster at Coastal Fortress.{nl}And use it on a sleeping monster at Dingofasil District.
column3: 연안요새로 가면 중독을 사용하는 몬스터가 있지요.{nl}또한 딩고파실 지구에는 슬리프를 사용하는 몬스터도 있고요.{nl}
column4: Gunakan masker ini pada poisoned monster di Coastal Fortress.{nl}Dan gunakan ini pada sleeping monster di Dingofasil District.

column2: Go there and experience the effects of poison and sleep.
column3: 그 쪽으로 가셔서 중독과 슬리프를 직접 경험해 보고 오시지요.
column4: Pergilah dan pelajari efek dari poison and sleep.

column2: It is better to see it with your own eyes than hear about it.{nl}Getting used to it is the best way of learning.
column3: 듣는 것 보단 보는게 낫지요.{nl}하지만 겪어보는 게 제일 훌륭한 교육법이라고 생각합니다.
column4: Akan lebih baik untuk membuktikannya dengan mata kepala sendiri daripada mendengarnya dari orang lain.{nl}Bisa karena terbiasa itu adalah cara terbaik dari belajar.

column2: Wasn't it dangerous?{nl}If you don't do it, you won't be able to learn a thing.
column3: 위험하진 않으셨습니까?{nl}하지만 그러지 않으면 배울 수 없는 것도 있는 법이지요.{nl}
column4: Apa ini tidak berbahaya?{nl}Jika kamu tidak melakukan apa-apa, kamu tidak akan mendapatkan apa-apa.

column2: That kind of danger is reduced if you become a Plague Doctor.{nl}Now that you've personally experienced it... {nl}I don't have to repeat myself to emphasize the importance of it, right?
column3: 이제 플레이그 닥터에 입문하시면 그런 위험도 줄어들 겁니다.{nl}직접 당해봤으니 중요성은 더 강조하지 않아도 되겠지요?
column4: Segala bentuk bahaya akan berkurang jika kamu menjadi seorang Plague Doctor.{nl}Sekarang kamu telah memiliki pengalaman sendiri... {nl}Aku tidak perlu mengulang kembali untuk mengingatkanmu akan pentingnya hal ini, kan?

column2: Kabbalist Master
column3: 카발리스트 마스터
column4: Kabbalist Master

column2: Hey there. Are you also interested in numbers?{nl}I am quite surprised that you know about the Kabbalist. Not many people know about it.{nl}{nl}
column3: 당신도 숫자에 관심이 많으신가 보지요?{nl}카발리스트는 생소한 분야인데도 어떻게 용케 아시고 찾아오셨네요.{nl}
column4: Hey kamu! Apa kamu juga tertarik dengan angka?{nl}Aku agak kaget kamu tahu tentang Kabbalist. Tidak banyak orang yang mengetahuinya.{nl}{nl}

column2: Everything in this world can be expressed by numbers.{nl}In order to become a Kabbalist, you would need to understand every hidden number {nl}of all the substances that exist throughout this world.{nl}
column3: 이 세상의 모든 것은 숫자로 표현할 수 있지요.{nl}카발리스트가 되시려면 세상의 모든 물질에 숨은 수의 의미를 이해할 수 있어야 합니다.{nl}
column4: Segala sesuatu di dunia ini dapat diekspresikan dengan angka.{nl}untuk menjadi seorang Kabbalist, kamu perlu memahami tentang angka tersembunyi {nl}dari semua zat yang ada di dunia ini.{nl}

column2: But you are a newcomer...{nl}I have a great idea! Instead of explaining it to you, {nl}I want you to experience the wonder by yourself.
column3: 일단은 입문자이시니..{nl}고루한 설명보다는 직접 그 신비를 경험하시는 것도 좋은 방법이겠군요.
column4: Tapi kamu seorang pendatang baru...{nl}Aku punya ide bagus untuk menjelaskannya padamu, {nl}Aku ingin kamu mempelajari sebuah ketakjuban oleh dirimu sendiri.

column2: Take this crystal sphere with you to Nahash Forest. {nl}Once you are there, a number will appear.{nl}The number that you will see means a specific monster.{nl}
column3: 나하스 숲에서 이 수정구를 사용하시면 숫자가 나타날 겁니다.{nl}그 숫자는 특정한 몬스터를 의미지요.{nl}
column4: Bawa crystal sphere ini ke Nahash Forest. {nl}Setibanya di sana kamu akan menemukan sebuah angka.{nl}Angka yang akan kamu lihat mengartikan satu monster tertentu.{nl}

column2: The challenge is that you solve the secret of the number,{nl}and defeat the monster that the number will indicate.{nl}The clue is to think which part of the monster is indicated.
column3: 어떻게든 수의 비밀을 풀어서 숫자가 의미하는 몬스터를 처치하세요.{nl}그게 어떤 몬스터의 무얼 의미하는지는 직접 생각해 보셔야 하지만요.{nl}
column4: Tantangannya adalah apakah kamu berhasil memecahkan rahasia dari angka tersebut,{nl}dan kalahkan monster yang ditunjukkan oleh angka tersebut.{nl}Cluenya adalah memikirkan bagian mana dari monster yang ditunjukkan tadi.

column2: If you really don't know, you can always use the crystal sphere again.{nl}It will show another number of a monster for you to be able to find the rules quickly.
column3: 정 모르시겠거든 다시 수성구를 사용해 보세요.{nl}다른 몬스터의 수를 나타낼 테니까 규칙을 쉽게 알아낼 수도 있겠지요.
column4: Jika kamu benar-benar tidak mengetahuinya, kamu dapat menggunakan crystal spherenya lagi.{nl}Akan menunjukkan angka yang lain dari monster agar kamu mampu menemukan aturannya dengan cepat.

column2: At Nahash Forest, defeat the monsters indicated by the sphere.{nl}However, you have to find out which specific monster was indicated.
column3: 나하스 숲에서 수성구에 떠오른 숫자가 의미하는 몬스터를 처치하세요.{nl}그게 어떤 몬스터의 무얼 의미하는지 알아내는 게 당신이 풀어야 할 숙제입니다.
column4: Di Nahash Forest, kalahkan monster yang ditunjukkan oleh sphere.{nl}Tapi kamu harus menemukan dulu monster mana yang telah ditunjukkan.

column2: When you realize it, it's nothing special. But it is a duty of the Kabbalist to study on the process.{nl}If you keep trying, you will realize the meanings of the numbers.
column3: 깨닫게 되면 별 것 아니지만, 그 과정을 탐구하는게 바로 카발리스트예요.{nl}계속 정진하시면 숫자가 가진 더 많은 의미를 깨닫게 되실 겁니다.
column4: Saat kamu menyadarinya, ini bukanlah hal yang spesial. Tapi ini adalah tugas seorang Kabbalist untuk mempelajari suatu proses.{nl}Jika kamu terus mencoba, kamu akan menyadari arti dari angka-angka yang ada.

column2: In order to use more accurate and critical swordsmanship, {nl}you will need faster and more accurate attacks.{nl}The skills of a Fencer that you will learn from now on requires you to {nl}use such swordsmanship.{nl}
column3: 더 날카로운 검술을 구사하려면 빠르고 정확한 공격이 필요하죠.{nl}새로 배우게 될 펜서의 기술은 바로 그런 날카로운 검술을 자유자재로 구사할 수 있어야 해요.{nl}
column4: Untuk lebih meningkatkan accurate dan critical swordsmanship, {nl}kamu membutuhkan serangan yang lebih cepat dan lebih akurat.{nl}Skill Fencer yang akan kamu pelajari sekarang adalah syarat yang dibutuhkan dalam swordsmanship.{nl}

column2: Your determination to learn is good, but...{nl}You must be first competent enough.
column3: 배우려는 의지는 좋지만.. {nl}일단 실력이 뒷받침되어야겠죠?
column4: Determinasimu untuk belajar cukup baik, tapi...{nl}Kamu harus cukup kompeten terlebih dahulu.

column2: Good.{nl}When you go right from here, there is a pole to practice your swordsmanship.{nl}
column3: 좋아요.{nl}여기서 오른쪽으로 가면 검 연습대가 있어요.{nl}
column4: Bagus.{nl}Jika kamu pergi ke arah kanan dari sini, kamu akan menemukan sebuah tonggak yang bisa kamu gunakan untuk melatih swordsmanshipmu.{nl}

column2: When the light reflects off from the pole, attack the pole accurately.{nl}You should not attack it too late nor when the light doesn't shine.{nl}
column3: 검 연습대의 빛이 반짝일 때, 정확하게 검 연습대를 공격하세요.{nl}너무 늦거나 빛이 반짝이지 않을 때 공격하면 안되겠죠?{nl}
column4: Ketika cahaya memantul dari tonggak itu, serang tonggak itu dengan akurat.{nl}Kamu tidak boleh terlambat menyerang, sekalipun saat cahayanya tidak bersinar.{nl}

column2: I can only let go three time.{nl}If you make mistakes more than three times, then you should do it again from the beginning.
column3: 봐주는 건 세 번까지예요.{nl}만약 세 번이나 실수하면 다시 처음부터 하도록 하겠어요.
column4: Aku hanya mampu melakukannya 3 kali.{nl}Jika kamu melakukan kesalahan selama 3 kali, kamu harus mengulanginya dari awal lagi.

column2: You should also possess some sense of rhythm.{nl}Every move in swordsmanship emphasizes the importance of smoothness.{nl}
column3: 어느정도 리듬감도 있어야겠네요.{nl}모든 검술은 선에서 선으로 자연스럽게 움직이는 것이 중요하니까요.{nl}
column4: Kamu juga harus memiliki sense of rhythm.{nl}Setiap gerakan swordsmanship menekankan pada kelembutan.{nl}

column2: Your level of swordsmanship has increased a lot.{nl}I am glad to see you progressing.{nl}
column3: 검 실력이 정말 많이 늘으셨네요.{nl}성장하시는 모습을 보니 저도 기뻐요.{nl}
column4: Level swordsmanship telah meningkat pesat.{nl}Aku bangga melihat progresmu.{nl}

column2: Since you are that competent, you will have no problem in learning new skills.{nl}I will teach you each movement slowly.
column3: 그 정도 실력이면 새로운 기술도 문제 없이 배우실 수 있겠어요.{nl}동작 하나부터 천천히 가르쳐 드릴게요.
column4: Selama kamu mampu, kamu tidak akan kesulitan mempelajari skill-skill baru.{nl}Aku akan mengajarimu setiap gerakan dengan perlahan.

column2: Shinobi Master
column3: 시노비 마스터
column4: Shinobi Master

column2: So you've finally decided become a Shinobi?{nl}Well, although I'd promised to teach you...{nl}
column3: 드디어 시노비가 될 마음이 생긴거야?{nl}뭐, 가르쳐 준다고 장담하긴 했지만..{nl}
column4: Jadi kamu telah memutuskan untuk menjadi Shinobi?{nl}Well, meskipun aku berjanji untuk mengajarkanmu...{nl}

column2: Even if I teach you, there is the issue of whether or not you can do it.{nl}What do you think? Are you prepared?
column3: 내가 가르쳐준다고 해서 네가 할 수 있을지는 또 다른 문제거든.{nl}어때. 마음의 준비는 단단히 된 거지?
column4: Jika memang aku mengajarkanmu, ada hal yang harus dipenuhi untuk membuktikan apa kamu layak atau tidak.{nl}Bagaimana? Sudah kamu persiapkan?

column2: Defeat an enemy and move out safely.{nl}That is one of the basics of the Shinobi.{nl}
column3: 적을 처치하고 안전하게 빠져나가는 것.{nl}치고 빠지기야 말로 시노비의 기본이라고 할 수 있지.{nl}
column4: Kalahkan monster dan keluarlah dengan selamat.{nl}Itu salah satu dasar dari Shinobi.{nl}

column2: After defeating the monsters at Ruklys Hall, secure your safety immediately.{nl}You shouldn't take any damage from other monsters. {nl}Hide and avoid the attacks from other monsters.
column3: 루클리스 전당에서 몬스터를 처치하고나서 곧바로 안전을 확보해 봐.{nl}그 동안 다른 몬스터에게 공격 받지 않고 일정 시간동안 요리조리 피해 숨는 거지.
column4: Setelah mengalahkan para monster di Ruklys Hall, selamatkan dirimu segera.{nl}Kamu mungkin akan terkena serangan para monster. {nl}Berlindung dan hindari serangan-serangan para monster.

column2: If you get used to this, you will be able to walk out safely {nl}after defeating the target in any dangerous location.{nl}If one puts himself into a danger every time when defeating monsters,{nl} even ten lives won't be enough.
column3: 이게 익숙해지면 어떤 위험한 곳에서도 목표를 처치하고 유유히 빠져나올 수 있을 거야.{nl}적을 처치하느라 매번 자신도 위기에 빠진다면 목숨이 열 개라도 모자랄 걸?
column4: Jika kamu telah terbiasa, maka kamu akan melangkah dengan aman {nl}setelah mengalahkan monster di setiap tempat berbahaya.{nl}Jika seseorang menempatkan dirinya dalam bahaya setiap kali mengalahkan monster,{nl}…bahkan 10 nyawapun tidak akan pernah cukup.

column2: Bravo.{nl}I admit that I didn't expect you to be this talented.{nl}
column3: 제법인데?{nl}가볍게 해본 말인데 이 정도일 줄은 몰랐어.{nl}
column4: Bravo.{nl}aku mengakui bahwa ternyata kamu sangat berbakat.{nl}

column2: I always welcome a talented lad like you.{nl}Congratulations on becoming an offical Shinobi.
column3: 이런 인재라면 언제든지 환영이야.{nl}정식으로 시노비가 된 걸 축하해.
column4: Aku selalu menerima seseorang yang berbakat seperti kamu.{nl}Selamat, kamu resmi menjadi seorang Shinobi.

column2: I still remember Medzio Diena. The horrors...{nl}First, my allies escaped. Now I'm all alone...
column3: 신수의 날은 아직도 기억해.{nl}처음에는 동료들도 함께 빠져나왔어.{nl}지금은 나 혼자지만..
column4: Aku masih ingat peristiwa Medzio Diena. Mengerikan...{nl}Pertama sahabat-sahabatku pergi, kedua aku sendirian sampai sekarang...

column2: It is not just a form to make while using Ninjutsu.{nl}It must be required in order to activate the Ninjutsu.
column3: 인법을 사용할 때 인을 맺는 동작은 폼으로 하는 게 아니야.{nl}인법을 발동하기 위해 반드시 필요한 부분이라고.
column4: Ini bukan hanya bentuk saat menciptakan Ninjutsu.{nl}Ini adalah syarat yang harus dipenuhi untuk menjalankan Ninjutsu.

column2: We should first reduce the fever.{nl}A long time ago, Horace told me that the spotted mushrooms {nl}of the Blue Lapasapes reduces fevers, so let's test it out.
column3: 우선은 저 열부터 해결해야 할 것 같습니다.{nl}예전에 호라스님께서 푸른 라프세이프의 얼룩 버섯이 열을 내린다 하셨으니 시험해 보지요.
column4: Pertama kita harus mengurangi hawa panasnya.{nl}Pada waktu itu, Horace pernah mengatakan tentang spotted mushrooms {nl}of the Blue Lapasapes mengurangi panas, jadi mari kita coba.

column2: Umm... Isn't it the mask of a Siaulav?{nl}
column3: 저.. 그건 혹시 샤울라브의 가면이 아닙니까?{nl}
column4: Umm... Bukankah ini mask of a Siaulav?{nl}

column2: That's right. Many of our allies were attacked by Blue Siaulavs.{nl}I feel like collecting their masks and burn them in front of their graves.{nl}
column3: 맞군요. 푸른 샤울라브에게 당한 동료가 한 둘이 아닙니다.{nl}녀석들의 가면이라도 모아 동료들의 무덤 앞에서 태워버리고 싶은 심정입니다.{nl}
column4: Benar sekali. Banyak sekali sahabat-sahabat kita yang diserang Blue Siaulavs.{nl}rasanya seperti mengumpulkan mask-mask mereka dan membakarnya di depan kuburan mereka.{nl}

column2: So can't you give me those masks?
column3: 그래서 그런데 그 가면들을 제게 주실 수 없겠습니까?
column4: Bisakah kamu membawakan mask-mask itu padaku?

column2: Thanks.{nl}I hope the resentment of our allies are reduced by this.
column3: 감사합니다.{nl}이것으로 동료들의 원한이 조금이라도 풀린다면 좋겠군요.
column4: Terima kasih.{nl}Kuharap dengan ini dendam sahabat-sahabat kita akan berkurang.

column2: I want to calm the spirits of our allies by burning their masks.
column3: 녀석들의 가면이라도 태워 동료들의 영혼을 달래주고 싶습니다.
column4: Aku ingin menenangkan mereka dengan cara membakar mask-mask mereka.

column2: It seems hard
column3: 왠지 어려울 것 같다고 한다
column4: Sepertinya sulit

column2: I am not confident enough
column3: 자신없다고 한다
column4: Aku kurang percaya diri.

column2: I can do it
column3: 무엇이든 맞출 수 있다고 한다
column4: Aku bisa melakukannya

column2: I don't want to do it
column3: 왠지 부담스러우니 거절하자
column4: Aku tidak mau melakukannya

column2: I will start right away
column3: 바로 시작하겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan segera memulainya

column2: I will go find the book
column3: 장부를 찾아오겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan pergi menemukan bukunya

column2: I will return next time
column3: 다음에 다시 오겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan kembali lain waktu

column2: The Bravery That Never Backs Down [Dragoon Advancement]
column3: 물러서지 않는 용맹함[드라군 전직]
column4: The Bravery That Never Backs Down [Dragoon Advancement]

column2: Shouldn't be a problem
column3: 문제될 것 없다고 한다
column4: Bukan masalah

column2: I wish to avoid the difficult path
column3: 어려운 길은 피하고 싶다고 한다
column4: Aku berharap bisa melewati path yang sulit

column2: Basic Leadership [Templar Advancement]
column3: 기본은 리더쉽[템플러 전직]
column4: Basic Leadership [Templar Advancement]

column2: It seems too hard
column3: 너무 어려운 것 같다고 한다
column4: Sepertinya terlalu sulit

column2: The Power That Even Controls Evil Spirits [Warlock Advancement]
column3: 악령조차도 지배하는 힘[워록 전직]
column4: The Power That Even Controls Evil Spirits [Warlock Advancement]

column2: I am ready
column3: 각오하고 왔다고 한다
column4: Aku sudah siap

column2: I will quit since I am scared
column3: 두려우니 그만두겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan berhenti jika aku takut

column2: The Power Imbued In The Curse [Featherfoot Advancement]
column3: 저주에 깃든 힘[페더풋 전직]
column4: The Power Imbued In The Curse [Featherfoot Advancement]

column2: You better back off
column3: 물러서는 게 좋을 것 같다
column4: Sebaiknya kamu mundur

column2: From Ground to Air, From Ground to Ground [Cannoneer Advancement]
column3: 지대공 지대지[캐노니어 전직]
column4: From Ground to Air, From Ground to Ground [Cannoneer Advancement]

column2: I will learn it
column3: 배워보겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan mempelajarinya

column2: Procuring Distance [Musketeer Advancement]
column3: 사거리 확보[머스킷티어 전직]
column4: Procuring Distance [Musketeer Advancement]

column2: I'll do it, I understand
column3: 이해했으니, 과제를 받겠다고 한다
column4: Aku akan melakukannya, aku mengerti

column2: It doesn't seem to fit for me
column3: 나와는 잘 안맞는 것 같다고 한다
column4: Tidak terlihat pas buatku

column2: Detrimental Effects [Plague Doctor Advancement]
column3: 해로운 효능[플레이그닥터 전직]
column4: Detrimental Effects [Plague Doctor Advancement]

column2: I want to learn for sure
column3: 꼭 배우고 싶다고 한다
column4: Tentu aku mau mempelajarinya

column2: A World Composed of Numbers [Kabbalist Advancement]
column3: 숫자로 이루어진 세상[카발리스트 전직]
column4: A World Composed of Numbers [Kabbalist Advancement]

column2: I want to experience it
column3: 경험해보고 싶다고 한다
column4: Aku akan mempelajarinya

column2: I decline complicated things
column3: 복잡한 건 거절한다고 한다
column4: Aku menolak hal-hal yang rumit

column2: Timing Attacks [Fencer Advancement]
column3: 공격은 타이밍[펜서 전직]
column4: Timing Attacks [Fencer Advancement]

column2: In Secret [Shinobi Advancement]
column3: 눈치채지 못하게[시노비 전직]
column4: In Secret [Shinobi Advancement]

column2: I will think about it for a moment
column3: 잠시 생각 좀 해보곘다고 한다
column4: Aku akan memikirkannya dulu

column2: Honoring Allies
column3: 동료들을 기리며
column4: Honoring Allies

column2: Defeat monsters and obtain a piece of Legwyn's seal
column3: 몬스터를 처치해서 르귄가의 인장 조각 수집
column4: Kalahkan para monster dan dapatkan piece of the seal of Legwyn

column2: The Corsair Master wants to obtain the Great Pirate Vladislovas's necklace, which he had won before and used as a proof of victory. Look for the necklace at Krantos Coast, which used to be a sea.
column3: 커세어 마스터는 과거 자신이 싸워 이겼던 대해적 블라디슬로바스의 목걸이를 되찾아 승리의 증거로 쓰고 싶어 합니다. 과거 바다였던 크란토 연안에서 블라디슬로바스의 목걸이를 찾아 보세요.
column4: Corsair Master menginginkan necklace of the Great Pirate Vladislovas yang pernah ia menangkan dan sebagai bukti kemenangannya. Carilah di sekitar Cranto Coast yang dulunya adalah sebuah lautan.

column2: The Doppelsoeldner Master told you that he lost contact with the envoy from Pasaka Plateau that he was to meet. Look for the whereabouts of the envoy to find out what happened.
column3: 도펠죌트너 마스터는 자신과 만나기로 한 사절이 파사카 협곡에서 연락이 끊겼다고 합니다. 무슨 일이 생긴 것인지 사절의 행방을 찾아보세요.
column4: Doppelsoeldner Master mengatakan bahwa dia telah kehilangan kontang dengan utusan dari Pasaka Plateau yang ingin bertemu dengannya. Cari tahu keberadaan para utusan itu dan apa yang telah terjadi.

column2: Defeat the monster to obtain the relic that possesses a strong grudge
column3: 몬스터를 처치하여 강한 미련이 느껴지는 유품 수집
column4: Kalahkan monster untuk mendapatkan relic tersebut.

column2: The Necromancer Master wants to obtain the relic that possesses a strong grudge. Defeat the monsters at Videntis Shrine to obtain the relic that possesses a strong grudge.
column3: 네크로맨서 마스터는 강한 원념을 지닌 유품을 갖고 싶어 합니다. 바이덴티스 신당의 몬스터를 처치해서 강한 미련이 느껴지는 유품을 구해오세요.
column4: Necromancer Master menginginkan relic yang terkandung di dalamnya rasa dendam yang besar. Kalahkan para monster di Videntis Shrine untuk mendapatkan relic tersebut.

column2: Collect the materials for the neutralizer
column3: 중화제 재료 수집
column4: Kumpulkan bahan-bahan untuk neutralizer

column2: Vaidotas told you that in order to neutralize the toxic gas in the Crystal Mine, you should make a neutralizer. Obtain digested soil from Alemeth Forest, lime powder from Cranto Coast, and charcoal powder from Nahash Forest.
column3: 바이도타스는 수정광산에서 새어나오는 유독가스를 중화하기 위한 중화제를 만들어야 한다고 합니다. 알레멧 숲에서 소화된 흙을, 크란토 연안에서 석회 가루를, 나하스 숲에서 숯가루를 모아오세요.
column4: Vaidotas mengatakan kalau untuk menetralisir toxic gas di Crystal Mine, kamu harus menciptakan neutralizer. Dapatkan digested soil di Alemeth Forest, lime powder di Cranto Coast and charcoal powder di Nahash Forest.

column2: You've obtained all materails for the neutralizer. Return to Vaidotas.
column3: 중화제의 재료를 모두 모았습니다. 바이도타스에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengumpulkan semua bahan untuk membuat neutralizer. Kembali ke Vaidotas.

column2: Obtain %s from monsters at Alemeth Forest
column3: 알레멧 숲의 몬스터에게서 %s
column4: Dapatkan %s  dari para monster di Alemeth Forest

column2: Obtain %s from monsters at Nahash Forest
column3: 나하스 숲의 몬스터에게서 %s
column4: Dapatkan %s  dari para monster di Nahash Forest

column2: Obtain %s from monsters at Cranto Coast
column3: 크란토 연안의 몬스터에게서 %s
column4: Dapatkan %s  dari para monster di Cranto Coast

column2: Use the pocket behind the monsters and collect the pieces that possess a fruity fragrance
column3: 몬스터의 뒤에서 주머니를 사용하여 과일향이 나는 조각 수집
column4: Gunakan pocket behind the monsters untuk mengumpulkan potongan-potongan yang mengandung fruital fragrance

column2: The Rogue Master wants to give a gift to the Scout Master to restore their relationship. Use the pocket behind the monsters at Alemeth Forest and collect the pieces that possess a fruity fragrance.
column3: 로그 마스터는 한 때 친했던 스카우트 마스터와 소원해진 관계를 아쉬워하며 관계 회복을 위해 선물을 주고자 합니다. 알레멧 숲에 있는 몬스터의 뒤에서 주머니를 사용하여 과일향이 나는 조각을 모아오세요.
column4: Rogue Master ingin memberikan hadiah pada Scout Master untuk memperbaiki hubungan mereka. Gunakan pocket behind the monsters di Alemeth Forest dan kumpulkan potongan-potongan yang mengandung fruital fragrance.

column2: You've collected all pieces that possess a fruity fragrance. Return to the Rogue Master.
column3: 과일향이 나는 조각을 모두 모았습니다. 로그 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengumpulkan potongan-potongan itu. Kembalilah pada Rogue Master.

column2: The Fletcher Master wants to look for the arrows that the first Fletcher Master created for Lydia Schaffen. Find the arrows of the first Fletcher Master from Galeed Plateau.
column3: 플레쳐 마스터는 초대 플레쳐 마스터가 리디아 샤펜을 위해 만들어 주었다는 화살을 찾고 싶어합니다. 갈르엣 평야에서 초대 플레쳐 마스터의 화살을 찾아오세요.
column4: Fletcher Master menginginkan arrows yang diciptakan oleh Fletcher Master pertama untuk Lydia Schaffen. Temukan Arrows tersebut di Galeed Plateau.

column2: The Schwarzer Reiter Master wants to see if you can hit the enemies consecutively. Hit the enemies 200 times consecutively.
column3: 슈바르츠라이터 마스터는 어떠한 적이든 확실하게 맞출 수 있는 실력을 보겠다고 합니다. 일반 몬스터를 상대로 공격을 200회 연속 확실하게 명중시키세요.
column4: Schwarzer Reiter Master ingin melihat jika kamu dapat mengenai musuh secara berturut-turut. Tembak musuh dengan tepat sebanyak 200 kali secara beruntun.

column2: Without a single mistake, you successfully landed all attacks consecutively. Return to the Schwarzer Reiter Master.
column3: 실수 없이 연속으로 공격을 모두 명중시켰습니다. 슈바르츠라이터 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu berhasil menembak musuh dengan tepat secara beruntun tanpa ada yang gagal. Kembali ke Schwarzer Reiter Master.

column2: Defeat the number of monsters within the time limit
column3: 제한 시간 내에 몬스터 목표량만큼 처치
column4: Kalahkan semua monster dalam waktu yang telah ditentukan

column2: The Monk Master told you that you can grow as a monk after enduring harsh training. Defeat enough monsters within 20 minutes of time limit. Defeating a strong monster will be acknowledged as you complete the harsh training. If the time limit expires, you will start again from the beginning.
column3: 몽크 마스터는 혹독한 수련을 해야만 몽크로서 성장할 수 있다고 합니다. 제한시간 20분 내에 충분한 몬스터를 처치하세요. 강한 몬스터일수록 혹독한 수련으로 인정되며 제한시간이 경과하면 다시 처음부터 해야합니다.
column4: Monk Master mengatakan jika kamu bisa berkembang sebagai seorang Monk apabila dapat bertahan dalam latihan yang keras. Kalahkan monster secukupnya dalam waktu 20 menit. Dengan mengalahkan monster yang lebih kuat kamu akan lebih diakui telah menyelesaikan latihan yang keras. Jika waktu habis, kamu akan mengulangnya dari awal lagi.

column2: You've successfully completed the training. Return to the Monk Master.
column3: 무사히 수련을 종료했습니다. 몽크 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah menyelesaikan latihan. Kembali pada Monk Master.

column2: The Pardoner Master told you that the book which you have is ripped up, so it is useless now. Get the first book that the Pardoner Master hid at Elkosh Abbey Hospital.
column3: 파드너 마스터는 자신이 가진 장부가 찢어져서 쓸 수 없게 되었다고 합니다. 엘고스 수도원 별관에 파드너 마스터가 숨겨둔 예비장부를 찾아와 주세요.
column4: Pardoner Master mengatakan bahwa buku yang kamu miliki saat ini robek dan tidak bisa digunakan kembali. Dapatkan preliminary yang disembunyikan Pardoner Master di Elkosh Abbey Hospital.

column2: Collect the samples of Plant-type monsters
column3: 식물 몬스터의 샘플 수집
column4: Kumpulkan sampel dari monster Plant-type

column2: Set the Namott of Purification at Galeed Plateau
column3: 갈르엣 평야에 정화의 나모트 설치
column4: Pasang Namott of Purification di Galeed Plateau

column2: The Oracle Master told you that the evil energy has grown stronger recently so her abilities are being disturbed by it. Go to Galeed Plateau where the energy is especially stronger and place the Namott of Purification.
column3: 오라클 마스터는 최근 사악한 기운이 강해져서 자신의 능력이 방해받고 있다고 합니다. 특히 사악한 기운이 강한 갈르엣 평야에 가서 정화의 나모트를 설치하세요.
column4: Oracle Master mengatakan saat ini energi jahat sedang kuat, sehingga sedikit mengganggu kemampuannya. Pergilah ke Galeed Plateau dimana pusat energi jahat itu berada dan pasang Namott of Purification.

column2: Talk with the Dragoon Master
column3: 드라군 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara pada Dragoon Master

column2: Talk with the Dragoon Master at Istora Ruins.
column3: 이스토라 유적지에 있는 드라군 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Dragoon Master di Istora Ruins.

column2: Attack the monsters alone, defeat them or shoot them
column3: 혼자서 몬스터를 공격, 처치하거나 피격
column4: Menyerang monster sendiri, kalahkan atau tembak mereka

column2: The Dragoon Master told you that you would need stronger courage and competence without backing off from enemies. Attack the monsters, defeat them, while also taking damage from them.
column3: 드라군 마스터는 적을 상대로 물러서지 않고 더 강하게 몰아세우는 용기와 실력이 필요하다고 합니다. 몬스터를 공격하고 처치하거나 공격을 당하기도 해보세요.
column4: Dragoon Master mengatakan bahwa kamu membutuhkan keberanian dan kompetensi yang lebih untuk tidak mundur dari pertempuran. Serang para monster, kalahkan mereka dan terima serangan dari mereka.

column2: Report to the Dragoon Master
column3: 드라군 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan pada Dragoon Master

column2: It seems that you've shown enough competence. Return to the Dragoon Master.
column3: 이 정도면 충분히 실력 검증을 마친 것 같습니다. 드라군 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Sepertinya kamu telah menunjukkan kompetensimu dengan baik. Kembali pada Dragoon Master.

column2: Talk to Knight Commander Uska in Klaipeda
column3: 클라페다에 있는 기사단장 우스카와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada  Knight Commander Uska di Klaipeda

column2: Maintain 5 people in a party for 5 minutes as a leader
column3: 5인 파티의 리더로 파티를 5분간 유지
column4: Organisir 5 orang dalam sebuah party dan menjadi leader selama 5 menit

column2: The Templar Master wants your leadership. Create a party consisting of 5 people including you as the leader and maintain the party for 5 minutes.
column3: 템플러 마스터는 리더쉽을 요구하고 있습니다. 자신을 포함하여 다섯 명의 파티를 만든 뒤 자신이 리더인 상태로 파티를 5분간 유지하세요.
column4: Templar Master ingin melihat jiwa kepemimpinanmu. Buat party dengan jumlah anggota 5 orang termasuk kamu dan jalankan party tersebut selama 5 menit.

column2: You've led the 5 person party successfully. Return to Knight Commander Uska.
column3: 다섯 명의 파티를 순조롭게 이끌었습니다. 기사단장 우스카에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu berhasil mengorganisir sebuah party yang berjumlah 5 orang. Kembali ke Commander Uska.

column2: Talk with the Warlock Master
column3: 워록 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara pada Warlock Master

column2: Talk to the Warlock Master in Mokusul Chamber.
column3: 모크슬 묘실에 있는 워록 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Warlock Master di Mokusul Chamber.

column2: Defeat the monsters whose evil sprits have awakened
column3: 악령이 깨어난 몬스터 처치
column4: Kalahkan para monster yang telah dibangkitkan oleh spirit jahat

column2: The Warlock Master told you that you should possess enough magical power to control the evil spirits. Use the scroll to the monsters at Valius' Eternal Resting Place to awaken their evil spirits and defeat them.
column3: 워록 마스터는 악령을 지배할 수 있을 만한 마력이 있어야 한다고 합니다. 발류스의 영면지에 가서 악령을 깨우는 주문서로 몬스터에 붙은 악령을 깨운 뒤 몬스터를 처치하세요.
column4: Warlock Master mengatakan bahwa kamu harus memiliki kekuatan magis yang cukup untuk bisa menguasai spirit jahat. Gunakan scroll pada monster di Valius' Eternal Resting Place untuk membangkitkan spirit jahat dan memusnahkannya.

column2: Report to the Warlock Master
column3: 워록 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan kembali pada Warlock Master

column2: You've defeated all monsters whose evil spirits have awakened. Return to the Warlock Master.
column3: 악령을 깨운 몬스터를 모두 처치하였습니다. 워록 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengalahkan semua monster yang telah dibangkitkan spirit jahat. Laporkan kembali pada Warlock Master.

column2: Talk with the Featherfoot Master
column3: 페더풋 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara pada Featherfoot Master

column2: Talk with the Featherfoot Master at Mokusul Chamber.
column3: 모크슬 묘실에 있는 페더풋 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Featherfoot Master di Mokusul Chamber.

column2: Cast a curse on the monsters using the Incantation Tools
column3: 주술도구를 사용해서 몬스터에게 저주 걸기
column4: Berikan efek curse pada para monster dengan menggunakan mantra

column2: The Featherfoot Master has asked you to experience the curse spell. Use the Incantation Tools on the monsters to cast a curse on them.
column3: 페더풋 마스터는 저주술에 대해 경험해보라고 합니다. 주술도구를 몬스터에게 사용해서 저주를 내려보세요.
column4: Featherfoot Master memintamu mempelajari curse spell. Gunakan mantra pada monsters untuk memberikan curse pada mereka.

column2: Report to the Featherfoot Master
column3: 페더풋 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan kembali pada Featherfoot Master

column2: I fully understood what the curse spell is like. Return to the Featherfoot Master.
column3: 저주술이란 어떤 것인지 확실히 알았습니다. 페더풋 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Aku telah mengerti sepenuhnya tentang apa itu curse spell. Kembali pada Featherfoot Master.

column2: Talk with the Canonneer Master
column3: 캐노니어 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Canonneer Master

column2: Talk with the Canonneer Master at the Inner Fortress District.
column3: 내성곽지구에 있는 캐노니어 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Canonneer Master di Inner Fortress District.

column2: Defeat Flying-type and Walking-type monsters
column3: 비행형과 보행형 몬스터 처치
column4: Kalahkan monster-monster Flying-type dan Walking-type
