column2: The Cannoneer Master told you that Cannoneers are adept at both aerial attacks and ground attacks. In order to use both attacks efficiently, you better search for the targets for each attack. Defeat both a flying-type monster and a walking-type monster.
column3: 캐노니어 마스터는 캐노니어는 대공 공격과 대지 공격에 모두 뛰어나다고 합니다. 두 종류의 공격을 효과적으로 사용하기 위해서는 각각의 공격을 사용할 대상에 대해 알아보는 게 좋다고 합니다. 대공 공격을 해야하는 비행형 몬스터와 대지 공격을 해야하는 보행형 몬스터를 모두 상대해보세요.
column4: Cannoneer Master mengatakan bahwa Cannoneers mengadopsi aerial attacks dan ground attacks. Untuk mengefektifkan kedua serangan tersebut, kamu mesti memilih target terlebih dahulu sesuai tipenya. kalahkan kedua tipe monster tersebut.

column2: Report to the Canonneer Master
column3: 캐노니어 마스터에게 보고
column4: Canonneer Master

column2: You've studied enough on Flying-type monsters and Walking-type monsters. Return to the Canonneer Master.
column3: 비행형 몬스터와 보행형 몬스터를 충분히 공부했습니다. 캐노니어 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah mengalahkan monster-monster Flying-type dan Walking-type. Kembali ke Canonneer Master.

column2: Talk with the Musketeer Master
column3: 머스킷티어 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara pada Musketeer Master

column2: Talk with the Musketeer Master at the Inner Fortress District
column3: 내성곽지구에 있는 머스킷티어 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Musketeer Master di Inner Fortress District

column2: Attack the monsters from the maximum distance
column3: 최대 사정거리에서 몬스터 공격
column4: Serang monster dengan jarak terjauh

column2: The Musketeer Master told you that in order to use a rifle, you need to procure the shooting distance. Since you won't be able to attack enemies close ranged properly, attack the enemies from a long distance.
column3: 머스킷티어 마스터는 총을 사용하기 위해서는 사거리 확보가 필수라고 합니다. 가까운 적은 제대로 공격할 수 없기 때문에 사거리를 확보하고 적을 공격하는 훈련을 위해 최대 사거리에서 몬스터를 공격하세요.
column4: Musketeer Master mengatakan bahwa untuk menggunakan rifle, kamu butuh jarak tembakan. Karena kamu tidak bisa menyerang musuh jarak dekat dengan maksimal, Serang musuh dengan jarak terjauh untuk hasil maksimal.

column2: Report to the Musketeer Master
column3: 머스킷티어 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan pada Musketeer Master

column2: It seems that you've completed the assignment well. Return to the Musketeer Master.
column3: 과제를 무사히 완수한 것 같습니다. 머스킷티어 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Tampaknya kamu telah menyelesaikan tugas dengan baik. Kembali pada Musketeer Master.

column2: Talk with the Plague Doctor Master
column3: 플레이그 닥터 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Plague Doctor Master

column2: Talk with the Plague Doctor Master at Istora Ruins.
column3: 이스토라 유적지에 있는 플레이그 닥터 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Plague Doctor Master di Istora Ruins.

column2: Experience Poison and Sleep
column3: 중독과 슬리프 경험
column4: Berlatih Poison dan Sleep

column2: The Plague Doctor told you that in order to cure the detrimental effects or use them, you should understand the effects well. Experience Poison at Coastal Fortress and Sleep at Dingofasil District.
column3: 플레이그 닥터 마스터는 해로운 효능을 치료하거나 이용하기 위해서는 해로운 효능 자체를 잘 알고 있어야 한다고 합니다. 연안요새에서 중독, 딩고파실 지구에서 슬리프를 경험해보세요.
column4: Plague Doctor mengatakan bahwa untuk menyembuhkan detrimental effects atau untuk menggunakannya, kamu harus benar-benar ngerti tentang efek yang ditumbulkannya. Berlatihlah tentang Poison di Coastal Fortress dan tentang Sleep di Dingofasil District.

column2: Report to the Plague Doctor Master
column3: 플레이그 닥터 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan pada Plague Doctor Master

column2: You've gained enough experience on Poison and Sleep. Return to the Plague Doctor Master.
column3: 중독과 슬리프에 대해 많은 경험을 쌓았습니다. 플레이그 닥터 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah banyak belajar tentang Poison dan Sleep. Kembali ke Plague Doctor Master.

column2: Talk with the Kabbalist Master
column3: 카발리스트 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Kabbalist Master

column2: Talk with the Kabbalist Master at Istora Ruins.
column3: 이스토라 유적지에 있는 카발리스트 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Kabbalist Master di Istora Ruins.

column2: Defeat the monster indicated by the number displayed on the crystal sphere
column3: 수성구에 나타난 숫자가 의미하는 몬스터 처치
column4: Kalahkan monster sesuai angka yang tertera pada crystal sphere

column2: The Kabbalist Master told you that in order to become a Kabbalist, you should be able to understand all the numbers hidden in all properties of the world. Use the crystal sphere that has appeared at Cranto Coast and defeat the monster which the number on the sphere indicates.
column3: 카발리스트 마스터는 카발리스트가 되려면 세상의 모든 물질에 숨은 수의 의미를 이해할 수 있어야 한다고 합니다. 크란토 연안에서 수성구를 사용하여 수성구에 나타난 수가 의미하는 몬스터를 처치하세요.
column4: Kabbalist Master mengatakan bahwa untuk menjadi seorang Kabbalist, kamu harus mengerti tentang semua angka yang tersembunyi dari semua benda di dunia ini. Gunakan crystal sphere yang muncul di Cranto Coast dan kalahkan monster dengan angka yang telah ditunjukkan oleh sphere tersebut.

column2: Report to the Kabbalist Master
column3: 카발리스트 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan pada Kabbalist Master

column2: You've discovered what the crystal sphere indicates. Return to the Kabbalist Master.
column3: 수성구가 몬스터의 무엇을 의미하는지 알아냈습니다. 카발리스트 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah berhasil menemukan apa yang ditunjukkan crystal sphere. Kembali pada Kabbalist Master.

column2: Talk with the Fencer Master at the Forest of Prayer.
column3: 기원의 숲에 있는 펜서 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara dengan Fencer Master di Forest of Prayer.

column2: Hit the practice pole of Fencers at right times
column3: 펜서의 검 연습대에 타이밍 맞춰 공격
column4: Serang practice pole of Fencers pada waktu yang tepat

column2: The Fencer Master wants you to attack at the right moments. Move to the practice pole and attack when the pole shines. If you make three mistakes, you start anew.
column3: 펜서 마스터는 정확한 순간에 공격하는 순발력을 요구하고 있습니다. 펜서의 검 연습대로 가서 검 연습대에 빛이 반짝이는 순간에 맞춰 공격해보세요. 세 번 실수하면 다시 처음부터 해야 합니다.
column4: Fencer Master ingin agar kamu menyerang pada momen yang tepat. Gerakkan practice pole dan serang ketika pole bersinar. Jika kamu melakukan kesalahan, kamu harus mengulangnya kembali.

column2: You've completed the training. Return to the Fencer Master.
column3: 검 연습대 훈련을 마쳤습니다. 펜서 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah  menyelesaikan latihan. Kembali pada Fencer Master.

column2: Talk with the Shinobi Master.
column3: 시노비 마스터와 대화
column4: Bicara dengan Shinobi Master.

column2: Talk with the Shinobi Master at Mesafasla.
column3: 메사파슬라에 있는 시노비 마스터와 대화하세요.
column4: Bicara pada Shinobi Master di Mesafasla.

column2: After defeating monsters, run away for 10 seconds without being attacked
column3: 몬스터 처치 후 공격당하지 않고 10초간 도망
column4: Setelah mengalahkan para monster, kaburlah dalam waktu 10 detik tanpa terkena serangan

column2: The Shinobi Master told you that you need an ability to escape safely without being detected by other enemies after defeating the target. Defeat the monster at Ruklys Hall and reach safety without being attacked by other monsters for 10 seconds.
column3: 시노비 마스터는 목표물을 처치한 뒤 다른 적에게 들키지 않고 안전하게 빠져나갈 수 있는 능력이 필요하다고 합니다. 루클리스 전당에서 몬스터를 처치한 뒤 다른 몬스터에게 공격당하지 않고 10초 동안 안전을 확보하세요.
column4: Shinobi Master mengatakan bahwa kamu membutuhkan kemampuan untuk melarikan diri dengan aman tanpa terdeteksi musuh setelah mengalahkan suatu monster. Kalahkan monster di Ruklys Hall dan pastikan kamu tidak terkena serangan monster saat kabur dalam waktu 10 detik.

column2: Report to the Shinobi Master
column3: 시노비 마스터에게 보고
column4: Laporkan pada Shinobi Master

column2: You've completed the assignment of the Shinobi Master. Return to the Shinobi Master.
column3: 시노비 마스터의 과제를 훌륭하게 수행했습니다. 시노비 마스터에게 돌아가세요.
column4: Kamu telah menyelesaikan tugas dari Shinobi Master. Kembali pada Shinobi Master.

column2: Activate only the designated shrines
column3: 지정된 신단만을 활성화
column4: Jalankan hanya di shrine yang telah ditunjuk

column2: When you activate one of the shrines of Romiva Magic Circles, one other shrine will also react. Use it to activate the shrine which Gormen has told you. If you forgot to which shrine to activate, check the memo which Gormen has given to you. The memo can only be checked when you activate the shrine.
column3: 로비마 마법진 중 하나의 신단을 활성화시키면 양 옆의 다른 신단이 동시에 반응한다고 합니다. 이를 이용해서 고먼이 알려준 제단을 활성화하세요. 만약 어떤 신단을 활성화해야 하는지 잊었다면 고먼이 건네준 쪽지를 다시 확인하세요. 쪽지는 신단을 조작할 때만 확인할 수 있습니다.
column4: Saat kamu menjalankan salah satu shrines of Romiva Magic Fields, maka yang lainnya akan berreaksi. Gunakan ini untuk menjalankannya seperti apa yang diminta Gormen. Jika kamu lupa shrine mana yang harus dijalankan, periksa catatan yang telah diberikan Gormen. Catatan itu hanya bisa dibuka saat kamu menjalankan shrine.

column2: Baskez told you that him and his colleagues would be able to withstand the severe cold if they had the hairy leathers of Lepusbunny Assassin. Hunt for Green Lepusbunny Assassins and bring back their hairy leathers.
column3: 바스케즈는 레푸스버니 암살자의 털가죽이면 자신과 동료들이 추위를 버틸 수 있다고 합니다. 초록 레푸스버니 암살자를 사냥하고 그 털가죽을 가져다 주세요.
column4: Baskez mengatakan bahwa dia dan kawan-kawannya akan mampu bertahan dalam cuaca dingin jika mereka memiliki hairy leathers of Lepusbunny Assassin. Burulah Green Lepusbunny Assassin dan bawakan hairy leathersnya.

column2: You've collected enough food. Hand them over to Supply Officer Ronda.
column3: 부탁받은 양의 식량을 모았습니다. 서둘러 보급병 론다에게 전달하세요.
column4: Makanan yang dikumpulkan sudah cukup. Berikan pada Supply Officer Ronda.

column2: Collect the spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes.
column3: 푸른 라프세이프의 얼룩 버섯 수집
column4: Kumpulkan spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes.

column2: Ades wants to cure a magician who is sick with fever. Collect the spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes known for curing fever.
column3: 스토가스 분대장 아데스는 고열로 몸져 누운 마법사를 치료하고 싶어합니다. 해열 작용이 있다는 푸른 라프세이프의 얼룩 버섯을 모으세요.
column4: Ades ingin menyembuhkan magician yang sedang sakit flu. Kumpulkan spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes yang dikenal bisa menyembuhkan flu.

column2: You've collected enough spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes. Hand them over to Stogas Squad Commander Ades.
column3: 푸른 라프세이프의 얼룩 버섯을 충분히 모았습니다. 스토가스 분대장 아데스에게 전해 주세요.
column4: Spotted mushrooms of Blue Lapasapes yang dikumpulkan sudah cukup. Berikan pada Stogas Squad Commander Ades.

column2: Mortimer seems to be interested in the masks. Talk with Mortimer.
column3: 고원병사 모티머는 당신이 가지고 있는 샤울라브 가면에 관심이 있는 것 같습니다. 고원병사 모티머와 대화해 보세요.
column4: Mortimer sepertinya tertarik dengan masks. Bicara dengan Mortimer.

column2: Collect the masks of Blue Siaulavs
column3: 푸른 샤울라브 가면 수집
column4: Kumpulkan masks of Blue Siaulavs

column2: Mortimer wants to resolve the resentment of the soldiers by burning the masks of Blue Siaulavs. When you obtain the masks while hunting for Blue Siaulavs, hand them over to Mortimer.
column3: 고원병사 모티머는 푸른 샤울라브들의 가면을 태워 동료들의 원한을 풀고 싶다고 합니다. 푸른 샤울라브들을 사냥하다 가면을 얻게 되면 모티머에게 전해주세요.
column4: Mortimer ingin menenangkan jiwa para prajurit dengan membakar semua masks of Blue Siaulavs. Jika kamu telah mendapatkan mask dari Blue Siaulavs, berikan semua pada Mortimer.

column2: You better give the masks of Blue Siaulavs to Soldier Mortimer. Give them to Mortimer.
column3: 푸른 샤울라브 가면은 고원병사 모티머에게 주는 게 좋겠습니다. 고원병사 모티머에게 전해주세요.
column4: Berikanlah semua masks of Blue Siaulavs pada Soldier Mortimer. Berikan pada Mortimer.

column2: Oh, hello? It's been a long time since I've seen an outsider.{nl}My name is Gatre, and I help Sarma with research here.{nl}
column3: 어라? 외지인은 정말 오랜만이네요.{nl}전 이곳에서 사르마씨의 연구를 돕고 있는 가트레라고 해요.{nl}
column4: Oh, halo. Tampaknya sudah cukup lama sejak terakhir aku melihat orang asing.{nl}Namaku Gatre, Aku membantu penelitian Sarma disini.{nl}

column2: Sarma is trying to restore Alemeth Forest to its original state.{nl}The fruits here have become inedible after they grew to enormous sizes you see.{nl}
column3: 사르마씨는 이 알레멧 숲을 다시 원래대로 되돌리는 연구를 하고 계세요.{nl}이 일대 과일나무들이 갑자기 커진 뒤로 절대 먹을 수 없게 되어버렸거든요.{nl}
column4: Sarma berusaha untuk memulihkan Alemeth Forest ke kondisi sebelumnya.{nl}Buah-buahan disini sudah tidak dapat dimakan lagi semenjak menjadi raksasa.{nl}

column2: At least we're managing to get by after Sarma came here to help out.{nl}He promised that I won't have to starve as long as I help him with his research...{nl}I owe him so much.{nl}
column3: 그래도 사르마씨가 오시고 나서부턴 간신히 입에 풀칠은 하고 있어요.{nl}연구를 도와주면 굶을 일은 없게 해 주신다고.. 정말 고마운 분이시지요.{nl}
column4: Setidaknya proyek kami sediki berhasil setelah dibantu Sarma.{nl} Dia berjanji bahwa aku tidak akan kelaparan selama kubantu dia dengan penelitiannya...{nl}Aku berhutang budi padanya.{nl}

column2: The only problem is that the research is being delayed by {nl}monster attacks that are becoming more frequent these days.{nl}I just had a bunch of research materials stolen by monsters as well.{nl}
column3: 다만 요즘 들어서 몬스터들이 자꾸 습격하는 바람에 연구가 제대로 진행이 안 되고 있어요.{nl}저도 조금 전에 연구 재료를 몬스터에게 몽땅 빼앗겨 버렸거든요.{nl}
column4: Masalah satu-satunya adalah penelitian ini tertunda karena {nl}serangan monster yang semakin sering belakangan ini.{nl}Kupikir ada juga pasti materi penelitian yang turut dicuri oleh monster itu.{nl}

column2: I was told that they are very important to his research... This is worrying.
column3: 중요한 재료이니 잘 관리하라고 하셨는데.. 걱정이예요.
column4: Dia bilang materi tersebut sangatlah penting untuk penelitiannya… Aku jadi khawatir.

column2: Could you really do that?{nl}Then... Could you retrieve the research material from the monsters at Angis Trail?{nl}
column3: 정말 그래주실건가요?{nl}그렇다면.. 엔가레 오솔길에서 몬스터들에게 빼앗긴 연구 물품을 부탁드릴게요.{nl}
column4: Benarkah kau bisa melakukannya?{nl}Maka… Maukah kau mengambil kembali materi penelitian dari monster pada Angis Trail?{nl}

column2: The monsters around here are too fierce for me to handle.{nl}Just turn around and run if you happen to think they're too dangerous.
column3: 여기 몬스터들은 너무 사나워서 저는 손 쓸 생각도 못하거든요.{nl}당신도 혹시 위험해지면 뒤도 돌아보지 말고 도망치세요.
column4: Monster disini terlalu ganas bagiku untuk kuatasi.{nl}Selamatkan dirimu bila kau merasa keadaan menjadi semakin berbahaya.

column2: Wow, you've actually retrieved all the materials!{nl}I knew you were kind, but I guess I underestimated your skills.
column3: 와, 정말 되찾아주셨군요!{nl}그냥 친절한 분이라고만 생각했는데, 정말 실력이 좋으시네요.
column4: Wow, kau sungguhan mengambil kembali semua bahan penelitian!{nl}Aku tahu kalau kau baik, namun tampaknya aku menganggap remeh skillmu.

column2: Um... I know this may sound rude, but could you help me a bit more?{nl}It's a really simple task, but I can see myself getting robbed by monsters again...{nl}
column3: 저.. 염치없게 들리시겠지만, 조금만 더 도와주실 수 있을까요?{nl}정말 간단한 일이지만, 제가 나섰다간 또 몬스터에게 빼앗길 게 눈에 선해서요..{nl}
column4: Um... Aku tahu bahwa ini tidak sopan mengingat kau baru kembali{nl}namun bisakah aku minta tolong kembali?{nl}Sebetulnya sepele, namun tampaknya aku dijarah oleh monster lagi....{nl}

column2: You just have to tidy up the research materials you've retrieved {nl}in the Tidying Chest at the Temporary Research Facility.{nl}I'm sure I can be at ease with someone of your skill doing it... Would it be too much to ask?
column3: 가져오신 연구 물품을 간이 연구 시설에 있는 정리 상자에 정리해 주시는 거예요.{nl}당신 실력이라면 마음 놓을 수 있을 것 같은데.. 어떻게 안될까요?
column4: Kau cukup merapikan bahan penelitian yang telah kau peroleh {nl}pada Tidying Chest di Temporary Research Facility.{nl}Aku yakin orang dengan kemampuan sepertimu pasti mudah melakukannya... Keberatan tidak?

column2: Thank you so much!{nl}I'll give you the instruction manual so don't forget {nl}to check the last part before you start tidying up.{nl}
column3: 정말 감사합니다!{nl}여기 설명서를 드릴테니 정리 전에 마지막 부분을 읽어보세요.{nl}
column4: Terimakasih banyak!!{nl}Akan kuberikan instruction manual-nya agar kau tak lupa {nl}Periksa bagian terakhir sebelum kau mulai merapikan.{nl}

column2: There is a strict order to tidying it...{nl}So, don't forget to read it thoroughly!
column3: 아무렇게나 정리하면 안 되니까.. {nl}반드시 꼭! 읽어보셔야 해요.
column4: Terdapat peraturan yang ketat dalam merapikannya….{nl}Jadi, jangan lupa baca dengan seksama!

column2: Thank you so much.{nl}I'm glad I asked you for help.
column3: 정말 고마워요.{nl}당신에게 부탁하길 잘했네요.
column4: Terimakasih banyak.{nl}Aku bersyukur bahwa kaulah yang kupinta tolong.

column2: It seems as if I am in a daze because of the monster attacks.{nl}I think I discarded invaluable research materials while I was tidying them up.{nl}
column3: 제가 요즘 몬스터들의 습격 때문에 정신이 없었나봐요.{nl}연구 자료를 정리하다가 그만 버리면 안 되는 연구 자료를 버린 것 같아요.{nl}
column4: Tampaknya aku dalam kondisi linglung pasca serangan monster.{nl}Kupikir aku tak sengaja membuang bahan penelitian penting disaat kucoba merapikannya.{nl}

column2: The discarded documents should be gathered at Menka Knoll... Could you look for them?{nl}I can't manage to get there because of the increase in monsters.{nl}
column3: 멘카 둔덕에 버린 문서들을 모아놨을텐데.. 좀 찾아봐 주시겠어요?{nl}요즘 그곳에 몬스터들이 많아서 저는 갈 수가 없거든요.{nl}
column4: Dokumen yang terbuang seharusnya kini berada di Menka Knoll… Bisakah kau mencarinya?{nl}Aku tak sanggup kesana karena banyaknya jumlah monster.{nl}

column2: I'm sure that you'll be able to find them if you take a close look at the {nl}discarded documents there.{nl}
column3: 가서 버려진 문서들을 꼼꼼하게 찾아보면 찾을 수 있을 거에요.{nl}
column4: I'm sure that you'll be able to find them if you take a close look at the {nl}discarded documents there.{nl}

column2: The documents you need to find is the Research Material List for Alemeth Forest.{nl}
column3: 찾아 주셔야 할 연구 자료는 알레멧 숲 연구 재료 목록표에요.{nl}
column4: Dokumen yang kau perlu cari adalah daftar materi penelitian untuk Alemeth Forest.{nl}

column2: You can leave the rest of the documents behind.{nl}Please check carefully not to get them mixed up with anything else.{nl}
column3: 다른 문서는 그대로 두고 그것만 가져와 주시면 돼요.{nl}헷갈리면 안 되니 반드시 꼼꼼하게 읽어보세요.{nl}
column4: Kau dapat meninggalkan dokumen lainnya.{nl}Harap periksa dengan seksama jangan sampai tertukar dengan yang lainnya.{nl}

column2: Did you check them carefully?{nl}
column3: 잘 읽어보고 가져오셨나요?{nl}
column4: Sudah kau periksa dengan hati-hati?{nl}

column2: It seems like you've brought the correct documents.{nl}Go see Sarma after you give me the documents.{nl}
column3: 제대로 찾아오셨네요.{nl}그건 저에게 주시면 되고 사르마 씨한테 한번 가보세요.{nl}
column4: Tampaknya kau telah membawakanku dokumen yang tepat.{nl}Temui Sarma setelah kau memberikan dokumennya.{nl}

column2: I think he's kept an eye on your skills.{nl}I think he wants to ask you something after seeing you help me out.
column3: 아마 당신의 실력이 눈여겨 보신 것 같아요.{nl}저를 도와주시는 모습을 보더니 부탁하고 싶은 게 있다고 하시더라고요.
column4: Kupikir dia memerhatikan kemampuanmu.{nl}Tampaknya dia ingin memintamu berbuat sesuatu setelah melihat bagaimana kau membantuku.

column2: Sarma
column3: 사르마
column4: Sarma

column2: Ah, greetings.{nl}I assume you've heard of me from Gatre.{nl}
column3: 오오, 반갑네.{nl}나에 대해선 가트레에게 잘 들었겠지.{nl}
column4: Ah, salam.{nl}Aku berasumsi bahwa kau telah mengetahui tentangku dari Gatre.{nl}

column2: I've been keeping a close eye on you since you helped Gatre.{nl}At first I was merely curious of an outsider here, but you seem to be quite talented.
column3: 자네가 가트레를 돕는 걸 유심히 지켜봤네.{nl}처음엔 이런 곳에 웬 외지인인가 했는데 실력이 상당하더군.{nl}
column4: Aku telah memerhatikanmu semenjak kau membantu Gatre.{nl}Pada awalnya hanya keingintahuanku mengapa ada orang asing disini, namun tampaknya kau sangat berbakat.

column2: As you may be well aware of, it is hard to do any research because of the monsters.{nl}I think I'll be able to finish my research if you help me out a bit.{nl}
column3: 알다시피 몬스터들의 방해로 연구가 어려운 상황이어서 말야.{nl}자네가 조금만 도와준다면 내 연구를 무사히 완성시킬 수 있을 것 같아.{nl}
column4: Seperti yang kau duga, sulit melakukan penelitian disini karena banyaknya monster.{nl}Kupikir aku dapat menyelesaikan penelitian ini bila kau membantuku sedikit..{nl}

column2: It's for the wellbeing of the people here so I beg that you help out.{nl}Of course I shall pay handsomely when the research is finished.
column3: 이 곳 사람들을 위한 일이니 부디 도와주게.{nl}물론 연구가 끝나면 섭섭치 않게 보답하도록 하겠네.
column4: Penelitian ini demi kesejahteraan orang-orang disini jadi kumohon bantuanmu.{nl}Tentunya akan ada imbalan yang menantimu bila penelitian ini rampung.

column2: I thank you.{nl}My first request is for you to gather the blood of Green Eldigos.{nl}
column3: 이거 참 고맙군.{nl}그럼 먼저 초록 엘디고의 혈액을 구해주게.{nl}
column4: Aku berterima kasih.{nl}Permintaan pertamaku adalah tolong kumpulkan darah dari Green Eldigos.{nl}

column2: I need to extract the blood from a live Green Eldigo for my research, but that's no easy task.{nl}I'll give you some Tranquilizer Powder to knock {nl}the Green Eldigos out and bring some blood back.
column3: 연구에 쓰려면 살아있는 초록 엘디고에서 뽑아내야 하는데 쉽지 않은 일이어서 말이지.{nl}마취 가루를 줄테니 이걸로 초록 엘디고를 마취시키고 혈액을 뽑아오면 되네.
column4: Aku butuh ekstrak dair darah Green Eldigo yang masih hidup untuk penelitianku., namun itu bukan hal yang mudah.{nl}Kuberikan kau serbuk bius untuk membius {nl}para Green Eldigos dan bawalah darah mereka kemari.

column2: So, how did it go?{nl}
column3: 어때, 할만하던가?{nl}
column4: Jadi, bagaimana?{nl}

column2: Very good. Excellent.{nl}With the skills you've shown me, I think I can be confident in assigning you more tasks.{nl}
column3: 정말 훌륭하군. 훌륭해.{nl}이 정도 실력이라면 다른 일도 충분히 맡길 수 있겠어.{nl}
column4: Sangat bagus. Sempurna.{nl}Dengan kemampuan spertimu, aku yakin dapat menyerahkanmu tugas dengan tanggung jawab yang lebih berat.{nl}

column2: I'll go to the Forest of Prayer Entrance and prepare for the final experiment.{nl}You can go and gather the ingredients needed for the last experiment.{nl}
column3: 나는 기원의 숲 입구로 가서 최종 실험에 필요한 준비를 하고 있겠네.{nl}자네는 최종 실험에 필요한 재료를 모아와 주게.{nl}
column4: Aku akan pergi ke pintu masuk Forest of Prayer dan menyiapkan eksperiman terakhir.{nl}Kau dapat pergi lebih dahulu dan kumpulkan bahan yang diperlukan untuk eksperiman terakhir.{nl}

column2: Gatre has the list for the ingredients I need for the final experiment so you can get it from him.{nl}I have faith in you.
column3: 최종 실험에 필요한 재료 목록은 가트레가 가지고 있으니 그에게 받아 오면 될 거야.{nl}자네만 믿겠네.
column4: Gatre memegang daftar bahan yang diperlukan untuk eksperimen terakhir, pintalah padanya.{nl}Aku yakin pada kemampuanmu.

column2: Sarma said that he needed all of the ingredients on the list?{nl}
column3: 사르마씨가 재료 목록표에 있는 재료를 모아오라고 했다고요?{nl}
column4: Sarma bilang ia butuh bahan yang berada dalam daftar?{nl}

column2: Oh no, it seems as if he's already beginning the final experiment!{nl}We have to find more evidence before it's too late.{nl}
column3: 이런, 벌써 마지막 실험을 하려는 모양이에요!{nl}더 늦기 전에 증거를 더 찾아봐야겠어요.{nl}
column4: Oh tidak, tampaknya ia sudah memulai eksperiman terakhirnya!!{nl}Kita harus menemukan bukti lebih sebelum semuanya terlambat.{nl}

column2: It would be strange to not collect the ingredients without proper evidence.{nl}Collect the listed ingredients since you can't risk him suspecting anything.{nl}
column3: 아직 확실한 증거도 없는데 재료를 모으지 않겠다고 할 수는 없겠지요.{nl}의심받으면 안되니까 일단 재료 목록표에 적힌대로 재료를 모아가세요.{nl}
column4: Akan aneh bila kau tidak mengumpulkan bahan tanpa bukti yang cukup.{nl}Kumpulkan bahan yang tercantum pada daftar ini agar dia tidak mencurigaimu.{nl}

column2: Why don't we gather some evidence together since Sarma seems to be absent.{nl}I know just what to look for.
column3: 마침 사르마씨가 자리를 비웠으니 증거도 같이 모아보도록 하죠.{nl}마침 생각나는 것이 있군요.
column4: Mengapa kita tidak mencoba mengumpulkan bukti bersama, tampaknya Sarma sedang tidak ada{nl}Aku tahu apa yang harus dicari.

column2: There are research notes from a person that used to help Sarma's experiments.{nl}His name was Boldas... and is in a coma because of an unfortunate accident.{nl}
column3: 예전에 사르마씨의 실험에 참여했던 사람이 만들었던 연구 일지가 있어요.{nl}볼다스씨라고.. 불의의 사고로 의식불명이 되었지요.{nl}
column4: Terdapat beberapa catatan penelitian dari orang yang biasa membantu eksperimen Sarma.{nl}Namanya adalah Boldas… dan kini dia dalam koma karena sebuah kecelakaan.{nl}

column2: Sarma had those notes until he lost them in a monster attack.{nl}Come to think of it, I think Sarma was especially nervous about losing those notes.{nl}
column3: 그 연구자료를 사르마씨가 갖고 있었는데 몬스터의 습격으로 잃어버리고 말았어요.{nl}생각해보면 그 때 사르마씨가 특히나 더 불안해 했었던 것 같아요.{nl}
column4: Sarma memiliki catatan yang hilang saat ia diserang oleh monster.{nl}Kalau diingat, waktu itu Sarma sangat terguncang saat tahu ia kehilangan catatan tersebut.{nl}

column2: There may be important information in those notes.{nl}He lost the notes towards the Juice Collection Site, so try searching that area first.{nl}
column3: 어쩌면 그 일지 안에 중요한 정보가 들어 있을지도 몰라요.{nl}과즙 채집장에서 잃어버렸으니 그 쪽을 찾아 주세요.{nl}
column4: Mungkin ada informasi sangat penting dalam catatan tersebut.{nl}Dia kehilangan catatan itu disekitar Juice Collection Site, jadi coba cari disitu deh.{nl}

column2: Don't forget the listed ingredients either.{nl}I'll do what Sarma asked in order to avoid suspicion.
column3: 재료 목록표에 적힌 재료도 잊지 마시고요.{nl}전 의심받지 않도록 사르마씨가 부탁한 일을 마치고 있을게요.
column4: Jangan lupa untuk mencari bahan yang ada di daftar.{nl}Aku akan melakukan yang dipinta Sarma untuk menghindari kecurigaan.

column2: Do you have all of the ingredients?{nl}
column3: 재료는 다 모아왔나?{nl}
column4: Apa kau sudah dapat semua bahannya?{nl}

column2: Hmm. There seems to be something missing...
column3: 음. 뭔가 부족한데..{nl}
column4: Hmm. Tampaknya masih ada yang kurang...

column2: Ah! It seems that it's missing from the list.{nl}I thought I had written everything down, but mistakes where made...{nl}
column3: 이런! 재료 목록표에 하나가 빠져있었군.{nl}분명히 적어뒀었던 것 같은데, 이런 실수를..{nl}
column4: Ah! Sepertinya memang tidak tercatat dalam daftar.{nl}Kukira sudah tercatat semuanya, tampaknya terjadi kesalahan...{nl}

column2: I'm sorry, but could you go get some fermented fruit tree sap from Gatre?{nl}I can't proceed with the experiment without it.
column3: 미안하지만, 다시 가트레에게 가서 과일 나무 숙성액 좀 받아오게.{nl}반드시 필요한 재료거든.
column4: Maaf, bisakah kau ambil getah buah yang terfermentasi dari Gatre?{nl}Aku tak dapat memulai eksperimen tanpa itu.

column2: Sarma told you that he needed fermented fruit tree sap right?{nl}
column3: 사르마씨가 과일 나무의 숙성액을 가져오라고 그러셨죠?{nl}
column4: Sarma bilang kau butuh getah buah yang terfermentasi kan?{nl}

column2: He really has come close to finishing the experiments.{nl}You see, I had removed the sap from the list on purpose.{nl}
column3: 정말 마지막 단계에 가까워졌네요.{nl}사실은 제가 미리 목록표에서 과일 나무의 숙성액을 빼놓았거든요.{nl}
column4: Dia sungguh hampir menyelesaikan eksperiment tersebut.{nl}Jadi, memang sengaja kuhapus getah itu dari daftar.{nl}

column2: By the way, how does Sarma's research seem to you?{nl}Did you find anything suspicious in the research notes?
column3: 그보다 당신이 보기엔 사르마씨의 연구는 어떤가요?{nl}연구 일지에서 뭔가 의심스러운 이야기는 없었나요?
column4: Omong-omong, bagaimana penelitian Sarma menurutmu?{nl}Apa kau menemukan sesuatu yang mencurigakan di catatan penelitian?

column2: I think that's a good idea.{nl}We might be able to find some clues as to what Sarma is really up to.
column3: 그게 좋겠어요.{nl}어쩌면 연구의 진짜 목적이 무엇인지 단서를 찾을 수 있을지도 모르니까요.
column4: Kupikir itu ide cemerlang.{nl}Kita mungkin dapat menemukan petunjuk atas modus sebenarnya dari Sarma.

column2: That was written in the notes?{nl}I'll need to take a look at the notes myself.{nl}
column3: 그런 이야기가 적혀있었어요?{nl}저도 연구 일지를 한번 봐야겠네요.{nl}
column4: Itu yang tertulis dicatatan?{nl}Aku harus melihat catatannya langsung.{nl}

column2: Oh my...{nl}If these notes are true, then Sarma definitely has other plans for his research.
column3: 이럴수가.. {nl}이 일지대로라면 사르마씨가 뭔가 다른 속셈이 있는 것이 틀림없어요.
column4: Ya ampun...{nl}Bila catatan ini benar, berarti Sarma sungguhan memiliki rencana terselubung atas penelitiannya.

column2: But the matter still stands that we don't have any actual proof.{nl}I'll look for some solid evidence if you can manage to stall the experiments for a bit.{nl}
column3: 하지만 여전히 심증만 있지 확실한 물증이 없다는 건 변함 없어요.{nl}일단 시간을 조금만이라도 벌어 주시면 그 사이에 제가 확실한 증거를 찾아볼게요.{nl}
column4: Masalah sebenarnya kita tidak memiliki bukti aktual.{nl}Akan kucari barang bukti yang sempurna bila kau bisa membuatnya menunda eksperimennya walaupun hanya sebentar.{nl}

column2: Take something that is similar to the sap in order to ruin Sarma's experiment.{nl}Meanwhile, I'll check all of his research documents.{nl}
column3: 사르마 씨에게 과일나무 숙성액과 비슷한 재료를 가져가서 실험을 망쳐주세요.{nl}그 사이에 저는 사르마 씨의 연구 자료를 몰래 확인해볼게요.{nl}
column4: Ambillah sesuatu yang mirip dengan getah untuk menggagalkan eksperimen Sarma.{nl}Sementara itu, akan kuperiksa semua dokumen penelitiannya.{nl}

column2: I'm going to give you some aged fruit tree sap.{nl}Go to the research material warehouse and find a chemical that looks like this.{nl}
column3: 여기 과일 나무의 숙성액을 드릴게요.{nl}연구 자재 창고에서 이것과 똑같이 생긴 약품을 찾아오시면 돼요.{nl}
column4: Ini, ambillah getah buah yang sudah basi.{nl}Pergilah ke gudang bahan penelitian dan temukan kimia yang tepat seperti ini.{nl}

column2: He has to mix all the ingredients before commencing the last stage anyways.{nl}So he won't be able to tell them apart as long as they look similar.
column3: 어차피 마지막 작업을 하기 전에 모든 재료를 섞어버리거든요.{nl}그러니 겉으로 보기에 차이만 나지 않으면 쉽게 눈치채지 못할 거예요.
column4: Dia harus mencampur semua bahan sebelum memasuki tahap akhir penelitiannya kok.{nl}Jadi ia tak akan bisa membedakannya asalkan bentuknya serupa.

column2: Is this water from... near Pelke Shrine Ruins?
column3: 이건 펠케 신전터였던가.. 그 인근에서 떠온 물이군요.{nl}
column4: Apakah ini air dari…dekat Pelke Shrine Ruins?

column2: I've heard that something bad happened there...{nl}Well, I suppose it will be alright.
column3: 그곳에서 안 좋은 일이 있었다곤 들었는데..{nl}뭐, 괜찮겠죠.
column4: Kudengar ada sesuatu yang buruk terjadi disana...{nl}Yah, kuharap semuanya kan baik saja.

column2: Take this to Sarma since they look almost identical at a glance.{nl}I'll take a peek at his research documents and try to find out his true purpose.
column3: 겉으로 보기에는 똑같아 보이니 이제 이걸 사르마 씨에게 가져가 주세요.{nl}저는 사르마 씨의 자료를 몰래 살펴보고 연구 목적을 알아볼게요.
column4: Bawa ini ke Sarma karena mereka sangat identik bila dilihat sekilas.{nl}Akan kuintip dokumen penelitiannya dan coba mendeduksi tujuan aslinya.

column2: Be careful just in case.{nl}I'll get to you as soon as I find something.
column3: 혹시 모르니 조심하세요.{nl}뭔가 단서를 발견하면 바로 찾아갈게요.
column4: Berhati-hatilah.{nl}Akan kukabari kau seketika kutemukan sesuatu.

column2: What took you so long in bringing me one more ingredient?{nl}
column3: 그거 하나 가져오는데 왜 이렇게 오래 걸리는 건가?{nl}
column4: Mengapa lama sekali untuk membawakanku hanya satu bahan?{nl}

column2: Well, it seems as if you've brought the proper ingredient.{nl}This is the last stage of the experiment.
column3: 어쨌든 제대로 가져온 모양이군.{nl}이제 마지막 단계일세.
column4: Yah, sepertinya kau telah membawakanku bahan yang sesuai.{nl}Ini adalah tahap terakhir dari eksperimen.

column2: Now all that is left is to put this on the Transmutation Magic Circle and add magic.{nl}I've set it so that anyone can power it with magic, so you shouldn't have trouble. {nl}Now go and power the magic circle.
column3: 이제 이 재료를 연성 마법진에 올리고 마력을 주입하는 것만 남았네.{nl}누구라도 할 수 있도록 준비해 두었으니 자네가 가서 마법진을 작동시키게.
column4: Kini tinggal memasukan semua ini kedalam Transmutation Magic Circle dan tambahkan sedikit magic.{nl}Sudah kubuat sedemikian rupa jadi siapapun dapat mengaktifkannya dengan magic, jadi kau pun takkan masalah.{nl}Sekarang pergi dan atkfikanlah magic circle tersebut.

column2: T-That's... because I have other things to do.{nl}I have to leave records of the experiment and observe the situation you see.{nl}
column3: 그.. 그건 나는 따로 일이 있어서 그렇지.{nl}연구에 대한 기록도 남겨야 하고 상황을 지켜봐야 하는 것 아니겠나.{nl}
column4: I-Itu… Karena aku harus melakukan hal lain.{nl}Aku harus mencatat jalannya eksperiman pasca mengamati situasi yang kau alami.{nl}

column2: Now stop stalling and go power up the Transmutation Magic Circle.{nl}All you have to do is put the ingredients on the circle {nl}and emancipate the magic from the tombstone.{nl}
column3: 아무튼 괜한 소리는 하지 말고 어서 가서 연성 마법진을 작동해주게.{nl}연성 마법진에 혼합된 재료를 올리고 비석의 마력을 해방시키면 되는 간단한 일이야.{nl}
column4: Sekarang berhenti mengusikku dan nyalakan Transmutation Magic Circle.{nl}Yang harus kau lakukan adalah letakkan bahan pada lingkaran {nl}dan kerahkan magic dari tombstone.{nl}

column2: But remember that the magic in the tombstone can only be emancipated from the front.
column3: 다만 비석의 마력은 정면에서만 해방하도록 되어 있으니 꼭 염두해 두도록.
column4: Tapi ingat, magic dari tombstone hanya dapat di kerahkan dari depan.

column2: Has the liquid properly been created?{nl}
column3: 제대로 용액이 만들어졌나?{nl}
column4: Apakah liquidnya telah berhasil diciptakan?{nl}

column2: Ahah.{nl}It seems that I finally have results for this research.
column3: 오오. {nl}드디어 이 연구의 결실이 맺어진 것 같군.
column4: Hahah.{nl}Tampaknya pada akhirnya kau memeroleh hasil dari penelitian ini.

column2: Now all I have to do is check to see if the liquid has the intended effect.{nl}
column3: 이제 만들어진 용액이 효과가 있는지 확인만 해보면 되겠어.{nl}
column4: Kini yang harus aku lihat adalah apakah cairannya memiliki efek yang diinginkan.{nl}

column2: Thanks to you, I've been able to get the research, which had been progressing slowly, this far.{nl}With this, we'll be able to restore the enlarged fruit trees back to normal.{nl}
column3: 그동안 더뎠던 연구를 여기까지 진행할 수 있었던 건 다 자네 덕일세.{nl}이제 이 용액이면 거대해진 과일 나무들을 전부 되돌릴 수 있을 거야.{nl}
column4: Terimakasih karenamu, aku jadi berhasil merampungkan penelitian yang selama ini berjalan lambat.{nl}Dengan ini, kita kan dapat memulihkan buah yang membesar kembali normal.{nl}

column2: How about you spray the liquid onto the trees yourself since you've helped me so far?{nl}If it has been properly made, it will make the trees go back to their original states.
column3: 여기까지 온거 자네가 직접 이곳의 풀에 용액을 뿌려보는 건 어떤가.{nl}제대로 만들어졌다면 식물들이 원래 크기로 돌아가는 효과가 나타날 것이네.
column4: Bagaimana jika kau coba semprotkan sendiri cairan ini pada pohonnya karena kau telah membantuku selama ini?{nl}Bila ramuan ini tercipta dengan sempurna, maka para pepohonan itu akan segera pulih ke bentuk asalnya.

column2: Here, I'll give you some of the liquid.{nl}We'll be able to see if it has any effect immediately.{nl}
column3: 여기 실험 용액을 조금 나눠주겠네.{nl}이 정도만 뿌려봐도 효과가 있는 지 바로 알 수 있지.{nl}
column4: Ini, ambillah cairannya.{nl}Kita akan dapat melihat efeknya segera.{nl}

column2: Try spraying it on the Pile of Leaves just ahead of you.{nl}You'll be able to see something quite interesting.
column3: 이 앞에 있는 풀더미에 한번 뿌려보게.{nl}아마 재밌는 장면을 볼 수 있을 거야.
column4: Cobalah semprotkan pada tumpukan daun yang berada di depanmu.{nl}Kau akan dapat melihat sesuatu yang menarik.

column2: I'm sorry.{nl}I wasn't able to catch Sarma.{nl}
column3: 미안해요.{nl}안타깝게도 사르마를 놓쳐버렸어요.{nl}
column4: Maafkan aku.{nl}Aku tak berhasil menangkap Sarma.{nl}

column2: Thankfully, the liquid wasn't created as Sarma planned.{nl}Even though he seems to think that it is perfect.{nl}
column3: 그나마 다행인 건 사르마가 원하던 용액은 제대로 만들어지지 않았다는 거네요.{nl}사르마는 완성된 것으로 착각하고 있는 것 같지만요.{nl}
column4: Syukurlah, cairan tersebut tidak bekerja seperti yang direncanakan Sarma.{nl}Meskipun tampaknya ia mengira bahwa cairan itu sudah sempurna.{nl}

column2: Sarma's original plan was to create monsters that he could command.{nl}Thankfully, they don't seem to listen to him since we switched the ingredients a bit.{nl}
column3: 원래 사르마의 목적은 자신이 부릴 수 있는 몬스터를 만들어내는 것이었어요.{nl}다행히 우리가 용액을 미리 바꿔놨기 때문에 사르마의 명령을 제대로 듣지 못하는 모양이지만요.{nl}
column4: Tujuan utama Sarma adalah untuk menciptakan monster yang dapat ia perintah sesuka hati.{nl}Syukurlah, mereka tidak mematuhi Sarma karena kita telah menukar bahan dasarnya.{nl}

column2: I'll go looking for Sarma.{nl}Even though the liquid is a failure, it's still quite dangerous.
column3: 저는 도망친 사르마를 찾아봐야겠어요.{nl}아무리 실패한 용액이라고는 해도 위험한 건 틀림없으니까요.
column4: Akan kucari Sarma.{nl}Meskipun cairan ini gagal, tetap saja berbahaya.

column2: I hope that the hidden items will be found and used by whomever sees this inside the pot.{nl}There is another pot at the Old Camp that shows the location of the hidden items.
column3: 누구라도 항아리 안에 숨겨둔 이 글을 본다면 숨겨둔 물건을 찾아 써 주길 바란다.{nl}물건이 있는 곳을 적어둔 항아리는 오래된 캠프에 하나 더 있다.
column4: Kuharap benda yang disembunyikan akan ditemukan dan digunakan oleh siapapun yang melihat isi didalam pot ini.{nl}Terdapat pot lain di Old Camp yang menunjukan lokasi dari benda tersembunyi lainnya.

column2: Monster attacks have been too frequent lately.{nl}That's why Sarma's research is also being delayed.
column3: 요즘 몬스터들의 습격이 너무 잦아졌어요.{nl}그래서 사르마씨의 연구도 진행이 어려운 상태죠.
column4: Serangan monster menjadi terlalu sering belakangan ini.{nl}Maka itu penelitian Sarma juga tertunda.

column2: Don't forget to read the last part of the instruction manual.
column3: 설명서의 마지막 부분을 꼭 읽어보세요.
column4: Jangan lupa untuk membaca bagian terakhir dari instruction manual.

column2: It will be hard to find the documents at Menka Knoll if you don't read them carefully.{nl}There's a lot of documents that are actually being disposed there as well.
column3: 멘카 둔덕에 있는 문서들은 잘 읽어보시지 않으면 찾기 힘들 거예요.{nl}정말로 버려야 할 다른 문서들도 많이 섞여 있으니까요.
column4: Akan menjadi sulit untuk menemukan dokumen pada Menka Knoll bila kau tak membaca mereka dengan hati-hati.{nl}Banyak dokumen yang.. Yah memang dibuang disana.

column2: I've put my whole life's achievements on restoring Alemeth Forest to its original state.{nl}This research must succeed.
column3: 알레멧 숲을 예전 모습으로 다시 되돌리는 데에 내 인생을 걸었어.{nl}이 연구는 꼭 성공해야 하네.
column4: Telah kuabdikan seluruh hidupku demi memulihkan Alemeth Forest ke kondisi asalnya.{nl}Penelitian ini harus sukses.

column2: Anyone would be upset about losing their notes.{nl}But Sarma... seemed to be much more than upset at the loss.
column3: 일지를 잃어버리면 당황하지 않을 사람은 없지요.{nl}하지만 그 때의 사르마씨의 모습은.. 뭔가 많이 불편해 보였어요.
column4: Siapapun pastinya akan kesal bila kehilangan catatannya.{nl}Tapi Sarma… sepertinya lebih dari sekedar kesal.

column2: The contents of those notes might prove to be important evidence.
column3: 그 연구 일지의 내용에 따라서 중요한 증거가 될 수도 있어요.
column4: Isi dari catatan tersebut mungkin akan menjadi bukti yang sangat penting.

column2: If you do get caught, just say that it was a simple mistake.{nl}The important thing is to buy us some more time.
column3: 만약 들키더라도 잘 몰라서 실수했다고 둘러대세요.{nl}중요한 건 시간을 버는 거니까요.
column4: Bila kau tertangkap basah, bilang saja kalau kau cuma keliru.{nl}Hal yang penting adalah untuk memberi kita waktu lebih.

column2: First, help Sarma with his experiments.{nl}I'll try to find some evidence in the meantime.
column3: 일단 사르마 씨의 실험을 도와주고 계세요.{nl}그 사이에 저는 증거를 찾아볼게요.
column4: Pertama-tama, bantulah eksperimen Sarma.{nl}Akan kucoba temukan bukti pada waktu itu.

column2: The magic from the tombstone must be emancipated from the front.{nl}The front is the side with the letters on it, so be careful.
column3: 마력을 가두는 비석은 반드시 앞에서 마력을 해방해야해.{nl}글자가 적힌 쪽이 앞쪽이니 주의하게.
column4: Magic dari tombstone harus di kerahkan dari depan.{nl}Bagian depannya adalah bagian yang ada tulisannya, hati-hati ya.

column2: It is finally time for my research to come to fruition...
column3: 드디어 연구의 결실을 맺을 때가 되었군..
column4: Akhirnya sampailah diriku di penghujung penelitianku yang berbuah manis…

column2: I had merely panicked a bit because of the sudden attack.{nl}I am not frightened of such monsters!
column3: 아깐 기습 때문에 방심했을 뿐.{nl}저런 몬스터 따위 하나도 겁나지 않습니다!
column4: Aku hanya sedikit panik karena serangannya mendadak.{nl}Aku tidak takut dengan monster seperti itu!

column2: I'm conducting research in order to restore the forest to its original state.{nl}Those fruits are inedible you see...
column3: 이 숲을 원래대로 다시 돌리는 연구를 하고 있어요.{nl}저 과일들은 절대 먹을 수 없는 과일들이거든요..
column4: Aku sedang melakukan penelitian untuk memulihkan hutan ini ke kondisi aslinya.{nl}Buah-buahan itu tak bisa dimakan soalnya...

column2: It was hard getting a chance to talk to you because of Sarma.{nl}Now, I can tell you everything since he's gone.
column3: 사르마씨의 눈치를 살피느라 너무 힘들었어요.{nl}이젠 자리를 비웠으니 마음껏 얘기할 수 있겠군요.
column4: Sulit untuk mencari kesempatan berbicara denganmu karena keberadaan Sarma.{nl}Kini bisa kuceritakan semuanya padamu karena ia sedang pergi.

column2: I can't believe he was researching how to control monsters...{nl}I'm having a hard time believing how a person could even {nl}think of doing so even after witnessing it with my two eyes.
column3: 몬스터를 마음대로 만들어서 조종하려는 연구였다니..{nl}어떻게 사람이 그런 짓을 생각했다는 것 자체가 보고도 믿기지가 않네요.
column4: Sulit dipercaya ia sedang meneliti bagaimana cara mengendalikan monster...{nl}Sungguh sulit dipercaya orang sebaik dia bisa {nl}berpikir untuk berbuat seperti itu bahkan setelah melihat dengan kedua mataku sendiri.

column2: They've all left because the fruits were inedible even though they were so large.{nl}But how could you turn your back on your hometown?
column3: 크기만 컸지, 먹지도 못하는 과일 때문에 모두가 떠나버렸어요.{nl}하지만 어떻게 고향을 버릴 수 있겠어요?
column4: Mereka telah pergi karena buah-buahannya tak bisa dimakan meskipun sebesar itu.{nl}Tapi tak ada seorangpun yang sanggup melupakan kampung halamannya, kan?

column2: What do you think the real purpose for Sarma's research is?{nl}I just hope that I'm worrying over nothing...
column3: 사르마씨 연구의 진짜 목적이 뭘까요.{nl}사실 전 제가 착각한 것이길 바라고 있어요..
column4: Apa menurutmu tujuan sebenarnya dari penelitian Sarma?{nl}Aku hanya berharap bahwa ini hanya sekedar prasangka buruk, bukan kenyataan...

column2: The villagers all believed in Sarma and his research...{nl}How could he do such a thing?
column3: 우리 마을 사람들은 사르마씨를 믿었었는데..{nl}어떻게 그럴수가 있죠?
column4: Penduduk desa percaya pada Sarma dan penelitiannya...{nl}Setega itukah dia berbuat seperti ini?

column2: You're an outsider that I haven't seen before.{nl}I don't know what you're doing here, but please don't interrupt my research.
column3: 처음 보는 외지인이군.{nl}이런 곳에 무슨 일인진 몰라도 연구에 방해는 말아 주게.
column4: Kau adalah orang asing yang tak pernah kulihat sebelumnya.{nl}Aku tak tahu apa yang kau perbuat disini, tapi tolong jangan usik penelitianku.

column2: Everything is going as planned except for those monsters.{nl}They're hindering my research so much that it's become more than a mere nuisance.
column3: 다 좋은데 저 망할 몬스터만 없었으면 딱 좋겠군.{nl}저것들 때문에 연구 속도가 너무 느려서 아주 골치가 아프다네.
column4: Semuanya berjalan sesuai renacana kecuali monster-monster itu.{nl}Mereka membuatku menunda penelitianku hingga taraf yang membuatku kzl.

column2: I wish to show you the research once it's complete.{nl}Of course I will show it to Gatre who's been helping me all along as well.
column3: 연구가 완성된다면 자네에게 꼭 보여주고 싶군.{nl}아, 물론 날 계속 곁에서 보조해준 가트레에게도 말이지.
column4: Aku harap bisa segera memamerkan hasil penelitianku padamu seusai semuanya rampung.{nlTentu saja akan kuberitahu Gatre yang telah banyak membantuku selama ini.

column2: At last, the day that my research reaches fruition has come...{nl}It is a relief that I was able to receive help from someone as able as you.
column3: 드디어 이 연구가 완성될 날이 오다니..{nl}자네같은 훌륭한 조력자가 나타나줘서 정말 다행일세.
column4: Akhirnya, penghujung penelitianku yang membuahkan hasil telah tiba...{nl}Sungguh bantuan dan kehadiranmu sangat membantuku.

column2: Necromancer Lemija
column3: 네크로맨서 레미야
column4: Necromancer Lemija

column2: Adomas is late...{nl}Where could he be?
column3: 아도마스가 늦네.. {nl}어딜 간 거지?
column4: Telat sekali si Adomas ini...{nl}Dimana ya dia?

column2: Where have Adomas and Faustas gone to when we have so much to do...{nl}Have you seen any Necromancers around here by any chance?
column3: 할 일은 산더미인데 대체 아도마스는 파우스타스랑 어딜 갔담..{nl}혹시 이 주변에서 네크로맨서 못보셨나요?
column4: Kemanakah perginya Adomas dan Faustas disaat kerjaan sedang banyak...{nl}Apa kau melihat Necromancer lain disekitar sini?

column2: It would have been hard even if we all worked together...{nl}But now, doing so is impossible.
column3: 아무리 열심히 일해도 힘든데..{nl}이젠 열심히 일할 수 조차 없게 되었어.
column4: Bahkan bila semuanya ada disini pekerjaan ini akan tetap sulit...{nl}Kalau sekarang sih, jelas tidak mungkin.

column2: That Lord Lieutenant... He deserves to be attacked by monsters just like them.{nl}I'm only holding back because the mayor is too.
column3: 대리인 녀석.. 저런 녀석은 몬스터에게 똑같이 당해도 싸요.{nl}촌장님이 참고 있으니까, 저도 참고 있는 거라고요.
column4: Lord Lieutenant itu... Dia lebih dari sekedar pantas untuk diserang monster seperti mereka.{nl}Aku hanya sanggup bertahan karena Mayor juga bersabar.

column2: The goddesses are so merciless...{nl}I had only started to collect coral after giving up fishing for a living...
column3: 여신께선 정말 가혹하세요..{nl}어부 일도 그만두고 시작한 산호 채집 일인데..
column4: Goddess sungguh tanpa ampun...{nl}Aku hanya baru memulai untuk mengumpulkan coral setelah memutuskan berhenti memancing untuk hidup…

column2: I think everyone is shocked by the Lord Lieutenant.{nl}Well... At least I'm glad that things turned out alright in the end.
column3: 영주 대리인의 행각에 다들 충격이 큰 것 같아요.{nl}뭐.. 이제라도 일이 잘 풀려서 다행이네요.
column4: Kurasa semua orang pasti terkejut tentang Lord Lieutenant.{nl}Yah… setidaknya aku bersyukur bahwa semuanya berakhir dengan baik.

column2: Just look at them.{nl}They were attacked by monsters trying to gather tributes...{nl}It's just so wrong.
column3: 이 사람들 좀 봐요.{nl}어떻게든 공물을 마련해 보겠다고 하다가 몬스터에게 당했죠.. 정말 답답해요.
column4: Lihatlah mereka.{nl}Mereka diserang oleh monster disaat mereka mencoba mengumpulkan sesajen...{nl}Rasanya.. Salah pokoknya.

column2: I'll be fine as long as I get some proper rest thanks to the first aid.{nl}You've been a great help.
column3: 응급처치는 했으니 푹 쉬기만 하면 이제 가뿐히 나을 거예요.{nl}정말 많은 도움이 되었습니다.
column4: Aku akan baik saja setelah beristirahat yang cukup, ini semua karena pengobatan pertama darimu.{nl}Kau sungguh telah menolong.

column2: It's just pathetic.{nl}We don't even have basic amenities, but we're worrying about making tributes...
column3: 참 한심하죠.{nl}이렇게 기본적인 것도 모자른데, 공물까지 걱정해야 했으니..
column4: Menyedihkan.{nl}Tata krama saja kami tak punya, lantas malah menghawatirkan tentang membuat sesajen…

column2: That Lord Lieutenant will bring the wrath of the goddesses upon himself soon enough.{nl}He not only tried to get more tributes for himself, but also disgraced the lord.
column3: 저 대리인이라는 사람은 아마 큰 벌을 받을 겁니다.{nl}공물을 더 받아먹으려는 것도 모자라 영주님 얼굴에 먹칠까지 했으니까요.
column4: Cepat atau lambat Sang Lord Lieutenant akan diberi azab oleh Goddess.{nl}Dia tak hanya mencoba mengumpulkan sesajen demi dirinya sendiri, namun juga mencoreng nama para Goddess.

column2: There is nothing more important to a merchant than credibility.{nl}I need to acquire the necessary coral in time... but it seems like I'm in trouble.
column3: 상인에겐 신용만큼 중요한 것도 없지요.{nl}기한 내에 산호를 구해 가야 하는데.. 거 참 곤란하게 되어버렸어요.
column4: Tak ada yang lebih penting dari pedagang selain kredibilitas.{nl}Aku perlu mendapatkan coral yang dibutuhkan dengan segera... Tampaknya aku dalam masalah.

column2: I've heard. You've dealt with the terrifying monster that the Lord Lieutenant summoned.{nl}I wish that someone like you was in our merchant alliance.
column3: 이야기 들었어요. 영주 대리인이 불러낸 엄청난 몬스터를 처치하셨다고요.{nl}당신 같은 사람이 우리 상단에 있다면 얼마나 좋을까요.
column4: Kudengar, kau berhasil mengatasi monster mengerikan yang di-summon oleh Lord Lieutenant.{nl}Kuharap orang sepertimu adalah bagian dari Merchant Alliance kami.

column2: Don't stray too far from here if you can help it.{nl}The monster density increased so much that it's too dangerous.
column3: 왠만하면 여길 벗어나지 마세요.{nl}몬스터 수가 갑자기 크게 늘어나서 위험합니다.
column4: Jangan menyasar terlalu jauh dari sini bila kau bisa.{nl}Jumlah monster sungguh meningkat pesat makanya kini sangat berbahaya.

column2: I never would've thought that my colleagues were also in league with the Lord Lieutenant...{nl}My head's still numb when I think of all those years we've served together.
column3: 영주 대리인 뿐만 아니라 동료들까지 한패였을 줄이야..{nl}함께 근무한 세월이 얼마나 긴데, 뒤통수가 얼얼합니다.
column4: Aku tak pernah menyangka kawan-kawanku merupakan komplotan Lord Lieutenant...{nl}Kepalaku jadi keram bila ingat tahunan masa bakti yang kami lalui bersama.

column2: Please stay here where it's safe, if possible.{nl}There's no way for us to help if you stray too far away from here.
column3: 왠만하면 안전한 곳에 머물러 주십시오.{nl}여길 나가시면 몬스터에게 당하셔도 저희가 도울 방법이 없습니다.
column4: Kumohon tetaplah disini karena lebih aman, kalau bisa.{nl}Sulit bagi kami untuk menolongmu bila kau pergi terlalu jauh dari sini.

column2: We're going to transport that Lord Lieutenant to the lord soon.{nl}I doubt that he'll get off easy...
column3: 저 영주 대리인은 저희가 나중에 영주님께 호송할 겁니다.{nl}아마 웬만한 벌로는 넘어가기 힘들겠지요..
column4: Kami akan membawa Lord Lieutenant kepada lord segera.{nl}Jangan harap dia bisa lepas tangan dengan mudah..

column2: Please refrain from going too far away because there has been an increase of monsters.{nl}We won't be able to guarantee your safety due to our orders.
column3: 몬스터가 엄청나게 불어났으니 깊숙한 곳으론 웬만하면 들어가지 마세요.{nl}명령 때문에 저희가 안전을 보장해 드리기가 어렵습니다.
column4: Usahakan menghindari pergi terlalu jauh karena ada peningkatan jumlah monster.{nl}Kami tak dapat menjamin keselamatanmu.

column2: An outsider helped out with something that we should have done ourselves...{nl}This is shameful.
column3: 저희가 응당 나서서 해결했어야 할 일인데 외지인이 해결하다니..{nl}정말 면목 없습니다.
column4: Orang asing membantu kami akan hal yang seharusnya kami lakukan sendiri...{nl}Memalukan.

column2: Do you think I won't do anything after all of this humility? Wait and see. {nl}I'll show the merchant alliance and the refugees here who gets the last laugh some day!
column3: 내가 이런 꼴을 당하고도 가만있을 줄 알아?{nl}두고 봐라. 언젠간 상단 녀석들은 물론이고 여기 난민들까지 싹 다 혼쭐을 내줄 테니까!
column4: Kau pikir aku tak akan melakukan apapun seusai dipermalukan seperti ini?  Tunggu saja. {nl} Akan kutunjukan bahwa merchant alliance dan pengungsi disini yang akan tertawa terakhir!

column2: This guy, he still seem to be delusional.{nl}Does he really not know what situation he is in?
column3: 이 사람, 아직도 정신을 못차렸네요.{nl}자기가 무슨 상황에 처했는지 아직도 모르는 걸까요?
column4: Orang ini masih saja terus berdelusi.{nl}Apakah dia masih belum sadar sedang berada disituasi apa dia kini?

column2: It's all gone upside down because of that Lord Lieutenant and a few soldiers.{nl}I'm certain that they'll make inquiries into us as well.
column3: 저 대리인이랑 병사 몇 명 때문에 발칵 뒤집어지게 생겼어요.{nl}보나마나 저희에게도 조사가 시작될 게 뻔하니까요.
column4: Semuanya menjadi porak poranda karena Lord Lieutenant dan beberapa prajuritnya.{nl}Aku yakin mereka akan menanyai kami juga.

column2: Merchant Alliance Worker
column3: 상단 일꾼
column4: Merchant Alliance Worker

column2: It was nice having a bit of a rest, but we weren't quite at ease either.{nl}I guess we can finally go to the customers.
column3: 그 동안 쉬어서 좋긴 했는데, 마음이 불편한 건 저희도 마찬가지였죠.{nl}이제야 거래처로 갈 수 있겠군요.
column4: Menyenangkan memang bila dapat istirahat meski sebentar, tapi kami tetap saja resah.nl}Kurasa akhirnya kita bisa pergi ke kustomer.

column2: I haven't been working here long, but that is a sight to behold.{nl}An ocean without any water... I've never seen anything like it.
column3: 전 신참이라 잘은 모릅니다만, 정말 별 일이 다 있군요.{nl}물이 전부 싹 빠진 바다라니요.. 이런 광경은 처음 봅니다.
column4: Aku belum lama bekerja disini, namun sungguh pemandangan yang luar biasa.{nl}Lautan tanpa air…. Tak pernah kulihat yang seperti ini.

column2: I've heard that coral is really popular.{nl}I think it's said to be used in very expensive medicines... {nl}How much do you think it will cost?
column3: 산호라는 게, 그렇게 귀하다지요?{nl}아주 비싼 약에 쓰이는 것 같던데.. 도대체 얼마나 할까요?
column4: Kudengar coral tersebut sangatlah populer.{nl}Aku pernah dengar katanya itu digunakan untuk obat-obatan yang sangatlah mahal... {nl}Kau pikir bisa laku berapa?

column2: I guess anything can happen when the world is in such disarray.{nl}He's lucky the people here are gentle, he'd be thoroughly beaten if it was back where I'm from.
column3: 세상이 뒤집어지니 정말 별 일이 다 있군요.{nl}여기 사람들이 순해서 망정이지, 제 고향이였으면 아마 여신 품으로도 못 갈 정도로 맞았을 겁니다.
column4: Apapun bisa terjadi didunia yang tengah kacau ini..{nl}Dia beruntung orang-orang disini sangatlah ramah, dia akan habis dikeroyok masa kalau dikampungku.

column2: What's going on?{nl}There are people willing to work and soldiers to protect them, {nl}yet we can't get the coral because of monsters?
column3: 도대체 무슨 일이래요?{nl}일할 사람도 있고 병사도 있는데, 몬스터 때문에 산호를 캘 수가 없다니요.
column4: Apa yang terjadi?{nl}Orang-orang sudah siap bekerja, para prajurit juga siap melindungi. {nl}tapi kita tak bisa mendapat coral hanya karena monster?

column2: This used to be the bottom of the sea, but they say {nl}that all the water was drained after Medzio Diena.{nl}It's quite a sight don't you think?
column3: 여긴 원래 바다 밑바닥이였던 곳인데, 신수의 날 때문에 물이 쑥 빠졌다고 하네요.{nl}정말 엄청나죠?
column4: Tempat ini dulunya dasar laut, tapi kata mereka {nl}Semua air menjadi kering pasca Medzio Diena.{nl}Pemandangannya lumayan kan?

column2: It's chilling to think that the Lord Lieutenant was the reason we weren't able to gather coral.{nl}I'm glad it's over now. All's well that ends well as they say.{nl}
column3: 그 동안 산호를 못 캐던 게 다 영주 대리인 때문이었다니, 참 소름돋네요.{nl}이제라도 잘 되었죠. 어쨋든 잘 풀리면 좋은 게 좋은 것 아니겠어요?{nl}
column4: Merinding rasanya bila tahu Lord Lieutenant adalah alasan utama kami tak dapat mengumpulkan coral.{nl}Aku bersyukur ini smeua telah berakhir. Semua yang baik kan berakhir baik.{nl}

column2: People like us have never even held a sword before, so all we can do is to envy your skills.{nl}Isn't it impressive that our leader found out that it {nl}was the Lord Lieutenant who was behind all of this?
column3: 우리 같은 사람들은 검 한번 잡아 본 적 없는 사람들이라 당신 실력이 그저 부럽기만 하네요.{nl}게다가 우리 단장님도 참, 영주 대리인이라는 걸 알아내다니 정말 대단하지요?
column4: Orang-orang seperti kami tak pernah memegang senjata sebelumnya, jadi yang dapat kami lakukan hanyalah iri akan kemampuanmu.{nl}Luar biasa bukan bahwa pemimpin kami yang mengetahui bahwa {nl}Lord Lieutenant-lah yang menjadi dalang dibelakang semua ini?

column2: It is said this steel-barred window was moved to Kalejimas a long time ago.{nl}Quite a dready object from the Kadumel Era.{nl}
column3: 아주 오래 전에, 칼레이마스로 옮겨지던 철창이라고 합니다.{nl}카듀멜 국왕 시절의 암울한 물건이죠.{nl}
column4: Katanya jendela berteraliskan baja ini dipindahkan ke Kalejimas dahulu sekali..{nl}Peninggalan yang mengerikan dari masa Kadumel.{nl}

column2: It's a shame about what happened to Faustas... But his crimes cannot be forgiven.{nl}He murdered... he murdered Adomas.
column3: 파우스타스의 사연은 참 안타깝지만.. 그래도 죄는 용서받을 수 없어요.{nl}동료를.. 아도마스를 살해했으니까요.
column4: Memalukan atas apa yang terjadi pada Faustas... Namun kejahatannya tak dapat dimaafkan.{nl}Dia telah membunuh… dia membunuh Adomas.

column2: I'm planning on carrying out the rest of the mission.{nl}I'll have to tell the master about what happened... But I don't feel too comfortable.
column3: 남은 임무는 제가 마저 이어가려고 해요.{nl}네크로맨서 마스터님께는 사실대로 보고 드려야겠지만.. 마음이 너무 무겁네요.
column4: Aku berencana untuk meneruskan sisa dari misi ini.{nl}Akan kuberitahu master atas apa yang terjadi… Namun aku tak merasa cukup nyaman.

column2: Search for the Monk
column3: 수도사 수색
column4: Searching for the Monk

column2: It seems as if returning to the annex is out of the question.{nl}Look for the monk that's trapped in the principal building.
column3: 별관으로 돌아가는 것은 무리인 것 같다.{nl}본원에 갇혀있다는 수도사를 찾아보자.
column4: Tampaknya keluar dari annex sedikit mustahil.{nl}Carilah monk yang terperangkap di principal building.

column2: You have found a labeled reagent bottle in a pile of leaves.{nl}
column3: 수풀 사이에서 라벨이 붙어있는 시약병을 찾았다.{nl}
column4: Kau menemukan labeled reagent bottle di tumpukan daun.{nl}

column2: Base reagent. Nahash Sample.
column3: 기초 시약. 나하스 샘플.
column4: Base reagent. Nahash Sample.

column2: {nl}Look for the reagent's owner.
column3: {nl}시약의 주인을 찾아보자.
column4: {nl}carilah sang pemilik reagent.

column2: A tent that appears to have been attacked by monsters... Check to see what happened?
column3: 몬스터에게 습격받은 듯한 텐트.. 무슨 일이 있었는지 살펴볼까?
column4: Tenda yang tampaknya sedang diserang monster... Periksa apa yang terjadi?

column2: Missing Lucienne
column3: 사라진 루시엔
column4: Missing Lucienne

column2: Lucienne is missing!{nl}It seems as if she has gone to the Ownerless Reclaimed Land to use the reagent.
column3: 루시엔이 사라졌다!{nl}시약을 사용하러 주인 없는 개간지로 간 것 같다.
column4: Lucienne menghilang!{nl}Tampaknya dia pergi ke Ownerless Reclaimed Land untuk menggunakan reagent.

column2: Searching past the Wall
column3: 벽 너머 수색
column4: Searching past the Wall

column2: It seems as if only Dominikas can pass through the black wall.{nl}Dominikas seems to be hiding something beyond the wall and lying about it.{nl}Search past the wall.
column3: 검은 벽은 도미니카스만 넘나들 수 있다는 것 같다.{nl}도미니카스가 뭔가 검은 벽 너머에 숨겨두고 거짓말을 하고 있는 것 같다.{nl}벽 너머를 수색해보자.
column4: Tampaknya hanya Dominikas yang dapat menembus tembok hitam.{nl}Dominikas seperti menyembunyikan sesuatu dibalik tembok dan berbohong akan hal itu.{nl}Carilah dibalik tembok.

column2: Elgos Monk
column3: 엘고스 수도사
column4: Elgos Monk

column2: I'm so... hungry...
column3: 배가.. 너무 고파..
column4: Aku.. Sangat lapar…

column2: Starved
column3: 굶주림
column4: Starved

column2: It seems as if there is nothing more to eat.
column3: 더 이상 먹을 수 있는 음식이 없는 것 같다.
column4: Tampaknya tak ada lagi yang bisa dimakan

column2: Lucienne Winterspoon
column3: 루시엔 윈터스푼
column4: Lucienne Winterspoon

column2: Thank you so much for saving me!{nl}Whew, I was in a tight spot with my tent being attacked and all.
column3: 구해줘서 정말 고마워!{nl}어휴, 텐트도 습격당하고 하마터면 정말 큰일 날뻔했지 뭐야.
column4: Terimakasih telah menyelamatkanku!{nl}Whew, tadinya aku dalam kondisi yang sulit setelah tendaku terkena serangan.

column2: Oh, my name is Lucienne Winterspoon by the way.{nl}I am a member of the Winterspoon family which is renown for its alchemical prowess.{nl}
column3: 아, 나는 루시엔 윈터스푼이라고 해.{nl}연금술의 종주 가문인 윈터스푼가에 속해있어.{nl}
column4: Oh, omong-omong namaku Lucienne Winterspoon.{nl}Aku adalah anggota dari Winterspoon family yang terkenal dengan kemampuan alchemicalnya.{nl}

column2: Vaidotas. Do you know him?{nl}The Alchemist Master, Vaidotas, is my cousin.
column3: 바이도타스. 알지?{nl}알케미스트 마스터 바이도타스가 내 사촌 오빠야.
column4: Vaidotas. Kau kenal dia?{nl}Sang Alchemist Master, Vaidotas, dia sepupuku.

column2: Have you heard that Vaidotas was kidnapped by the Vubbes?{nl}I mean, he's the Alchemist Master... {nl}I think I was more ashamed of the kidnapping than he was.{nl}
column3: 혹시 바이도타스가 부베에게 납치 당했었다는 얘기 들었어?{nl}명색이 알케미스트 마스터인데 듣는 내가 다 부끄럽더라니까.{nl}
column4: Kau pernah dengar kan Vaidotas diculik sama Vubbe?{nl}Maksudku.. Dia kan Alchemist Master kan ya... {nl}Sungguh aku rasa aku yang lebih menanggung malu sebagai keluarganya ketimbang dia.{nl}

column2: That's why I've decided that I should take his place.{nl}Don't you think it's obvious that I'm more suitable for the position?{nl}
column3: 그래서 내가 그 자리를 이어받기로 결심했어.{nl}누가 봐도 알케미스트 마스터 자리는 나에게 더 잘 어울리잖아?{nl}
column4: Oleh karena itu aku memutuskan harusnya aku yang menggantikannya.{nl}Merupakan hal yang jelas kan kalau aku lebih pantas darinya?{nl}

column2: The family elders are holding me back though.{nl}Would you believe that they're saying that they can't {nl}acknowledge my skill without distinct research results!{nl}
column3: 문제는 가문의 어른들이야.{nl}뚜렷한 연구 성과가 없이는 내 실력을 인정해줄 수 없다지 뭐야!{nl}
column4: Meskipun begitu, tetua di keluarga menahan keputusanku ini.{nl}Percaya gak sih kamu kalau mereka tak dapat mengakui  {nl}kemampuanku tanpa hasil penelitian yang luar biasa!{nl}

column2: That's why I came here.{nl}I'm trying to do some research on why the regions near Nahash Forest{nl}received less damage than other places on Medzio Diena.{nl}
column3: 그래서 여기에 왔어.{nl}신수의 날에 여기 나하스 숲이 주변 지역보다 피해를 적게 받은 이유를 연구하려고.{nl}
column4: Oleh karena itu aku kemari.{nl}Aku tengah melakukan penelitian mengapa region dekat Nahash Forest{nl}kerusakannya tidak separah tempat lain saat Medzio Diena.{nl}

column2: But I've been unable to make much headway because there are so many monsters.{nl}It turns out that the only reason it was damaged less is because the bedrock is more solid.{nl}
column3: 그런데 막상 와 보니까 몬스터만 넘쳐나고 별 성과는 없었어.{nl}나 참, 알고 보니까 그냥 지반이 튼튼해서 피해를 덜 입은 거였더군.{nl}
column4: Namun aku tak bisa menjelajah lebih lagi karena banyaknya monster.{nl}Tampaknya satu-satunya alasan kerusakannya tidak parah karena datarannya lebih keras.{nl}

column2: Then I discovered something amazing in Nahash Forest!{nl}There was an enormous plant rooted to the Ownerless Reclaimed Land, you see.{nl}
column3: 그러다가 나하스 숲에서 엄청난 걸 발견해냈지!{nl}주인 없는 개간지에 웬 말도 안되게 거대해진 식물이 뿌리를 박고 있었다니까?{nl}
column4: Kemudian aku menemukan sesuatu yang luar biasa di Nahash Forest!{nl}Terdapat tumbuhan yang besar dan berakar di Ownerless Reclaimed Land.{nl}

column2: I thought it was perfect for my experiments because it wouldn't react to most substances.{nl}Think about it! Making a reagent that can get rid of such a large plant.{nl}
column3: 웬만한 약품에는 반응도 안하는게 딱 내 실험 상대로 적합하겠다 싶었지.{nl}생각해봐! 그 거대한 식물을 없애버릴 시약을 만들 수 있다고 말야. {nl}
column4: Kupikir ini akan menjadi eksperimen yang sempurna karena itu tidak bereaksi pada banyak jenis substansi.{nl}Pikirkan deh! Membuat reagent yang dapat menyingkirkan tumbuhan se-raksasa itu!{nl}

column2: I'll be able to restore damaged regions like Orsha or the Thorn Forest back to normal...{nl}It might even open a path to being able to prevent a second Medzio Diena from happening.{nl}
column3: 오르샤라던가 가시숲처럼 거대 식물에 피해입은 지역도 되돌릴 수 있을 거고..{nl}더 나아가서 또 신수의 날이 벌어진다 해도 충분히 막을 수 있는 길이 열리는 거야.{nl}
column4: Aku akan dapat memulihkan region yang hancur seperti Orsha atau Thorn Forest kembali normal...{nl}Bahkan membuka kemungkinan untuk mencegah kejadian Medzio Diena terjadi kembali.{nl}

column2: Don't you think that the family elders will also acknowledge me as well?
column3: 게다가 연구가 완성된다면 가문에서도 날 인정해 주지 않겠어?
column4: Apa menurutmu dengan ini tetua di keluargaku akan dapat mengakui kemampuanku?

column2: The problem is that the over abundant monster population is hindering my research.{nl}There should be less monsters if I could get to Pamesti Village...{nl}
column3: 문제는 이 숲에 넘쳐나는 몬스터가 내 실험을 자꾸 방해한다는 거야.{nl}파라메스 마을까지만 가면 그래도 몬스터가 좀 줄어들텐데..{nl}
column4: Masalahnya, populasi monster yang kelewat banyak mengganggu penelitianku.{nl}Seharusnya jumlah mereka akan berkurang bila kita sudah sampai ke Pamesti Village...{nl}

column2: Of course. You seemed to be quite skilled back there...{nl}I'm sorry, but could you get me to Pamesti Village?{nl}
column3: 그렇지. 너 아까 보니까 정말 실력이 좋던데.. {nl}미안하지만, 파라메스 마을까지 데려다 주지 않을래?{nl}
column4: Tentu saja, kau kelihatan sangat kuat...{nl}Maaf, tapi.. Bisakah kau antar aku ke Pamesti Village?{nl}

column2: I promise I won't forget you if you help me out this time after I become the Alchemist Master!
column3: 이번 일만 도와준다면 알케미스트 마스터가 되더라도 절대 널 잊지 않을게!
column4: Aku janji takkan melupakanmu bila kau pernah membantuku nanti disaat aku menjadi Alchemist Master!

column2: Thanks! You've brought me to the village safely.{nl}Now I have to get ready for the experiments again.
column3: 고마워! 덕분에 안전하게 마을까지 잘 왔네.{nl}이제 다시 실험 준비를 해야겠어.
column4: Trims! Kau telah mengantarku ke village dengan aman.{nl}Kini aku harus bersiap untuk bereksperimen kembali.

column2: ...Oh! Whoops!{nl}I must have dropped my base reagent somewhere {nl}while I was running away from the testing tent...{nl}
column3: ..아! 큰일났다!{nl}아까 실험 텐트에서 도망치다가 기초 시약을 어디 떨어뜨렸나봐..{nl}
column4: ...Oh! Ups!{nl}Tampaknya aku menjatuhkan base reagent-ku entah dimanae {nl}Mungkin saat aku sedang kabur dari tenda penelitian…{nl}

column2: I can't do any more experiments without it, what a stupid mistake.{nl}What should I do...
column3: 그게 없으면 실험을 계속 할 수가 없는데, 정말 바보같아.{nl}이걸 어떡한담..
column4: Aku tak dapat bereksperimen lagi tanpa itu, sungguh kesalah an bodoh.{nl}Apa yang harus kulakukan…

column2: Yes! That's it!{nl}How on earth did you get a hold of it?{nl}
column3: 맞아! 그거야!{nl}그걸 네가 어떻게 가지고 있는거지?{nl}
column4: Iya! Itu barangnya!{nl}Kok bisa ketemu sih?{nl}

column2: Oh... I must have dropped it in the tent I was conducting experiments in.{nl}It's a relief to have it back. Thank you so much. You're absolutely the best!
column3: 아.. 내가 실험하던 텐트에 들렀었구나.{nl}진짜 다행이다. 정말 고마워. 넌 진짜 최고야!
column4: Oh... Terjatuh di tenda saat aku bereksperimen ya.{nl}Rasanya lega karena itu sudah kembali. Terimakasih banyak ya. Kamu canggih banget sih!

column2: Now I have to collect the remaining ingredients.{nl}I can get most of the herbs on my own, but I don't think I can take on the Blue Spion by myself...{nl}
column3: 이제 남은 재료를 모아야 해.{nl}웬만한 약초는 내가 구할 순 있는데, 푸른 스피온은 제압할 자신이 없어..{nl}
column4: Kini aku harus mengumpulkan bahan lain yang tersisa.{nl}Aku bisa saja mendapatkan tumbuhan lainnya sendiri, tapi sepertinya sulit untuk menghadapi Blue Spion...{nl}

column2: So do you think that you could get some Spion Tree Leaves for me?{nl}I'll try to gather the other herbs in the meantime.
column3: 그래서 그런데, 나 대신 스피온의 나뭇잎을 좀 구해주지 않을래?{nl}나는 그 사이에 다른 약초들을 모아볼게.
column4: Jadi dapatkah kau mengambilkan Spion Tree leave untukku?{nl}Sembari kau melakukannya aku akan mengumpulkan herb lainnya.

column2: Thanks a lot.{nl}Let's meet up back here once we've finish gathering the ingredients.
column3: 정말 고마워.{nl}그럼 각자 재료가 모이면 여기서 다시 만나자.
column4: Terimakasih banyak.{nl}Mari bertemu setelah kita rampung mengumpulkan bahannya.

column2: You're back earlier than I expected.{nl}I hope you didn't have too hard a time dealing with the Blue Spion.
column3: 생각보다 일찍 왔네.{nl}푸른 스피온 상대하느라 힘들었지? 고생했어.
column4: Kau kembali lebih awal dari yang ku duga.{nl}Aku harap kamu tidak kesulitan berurusan dengan Blue Spion.

column2: Now all I have to do is to mix the reagent with these ingredients.{nl}The only problem is that the monsters seem to be attracted to the smell of the reagent.{nl}
column3: 이제 재료로 시약을 배합하기만 하면 돼.{nl}문제는 몬스터들이 시약 냄새만 맡으면 달려든다는 거야.{nl}
column4: Sekarang yang perlu ku lakukan ialah mencampur reagent dengan bahan-bahan tersebut.{nl}Satu-satunya yang menjadi masalah ialah para monster tampaknya tertarik dengan bau reagent ini.{nl}

column2: Could you deal with any monsters that happen to come near me while I mix the reagent?{nl}So that I can focus entirely on mixing the reagent.
column3: 혹시 내가 시약을 배합하는 동안 몬스터가 오면 날 지켜줘.{nl}내가 시약 배합에만 집중할 수 있게.
column4: Bisakah kamu mengatasi para monster yang datang mendekat ketika aku mencampur reagent?{nl}Sehingga aku bisa fokus sepenuhnya ketika mencampur reagent.

column2: It's finally finished! Thank you so much. {nl}I couldn't have dreamed of finishing the reagent without your help!
column3: 드디어 완성이야!{nl}정말 고마워. 너 아니었으면 시약을 완성하는 건 꿈도 못꿨을거야!
column4: Akhirnya selesai! Terima kasih banyak.{nl}Saya tidak bisa membayangkan menyelesaikan reagent ini tanpa bantuanmu!

column2: Now all that's left is to test the reagent.{nl}Luckily, I've seen an appropriate vine near the Herb Broker Tent.{nl}
column3: 이제 완성한 시약을 시험해보는 일만 남았어.{nl}마침 약초꾼 텐트에서 적당한 나무 덩굴을 봐 둔게 있지.{nl}
column4: Sekarang sisanya ialah tinggal menguji reagent.{nl} Untungnya, aku pernah melihat sebuah pohon merambat yang cocok di dekat Herb Broker Tent.{nl}

column2: Tree vines don't usually grow in Nahash Forest, but that place seems to be the exception.{nl}Strange isn't it? It almost seems like someone is raising them there.{nl}
column3: 나하스 숲 어디에도 나무 덩굴은 자라지 않는데 유독 거기에만 자라고 있더라고.{nl}이상하지? 마치 누군가 일부러 키우고 있는 것 처럼 말이지.{nl}
column4: Tanaman rambat tidak biasanya tumbuh di Nahas Forest, namun tempat itu tampaknya menjadi pengecualian.{nl} Aneh bukan? Itu tampak seperti seseorang telah membesarkan mereka di sana.{nl}

column2: It just doesn't seem right just like that enormous plant.{nl}
column3: 아무리 생각해도 그 거대한 식물처럼 정상은 아닌 것 같단 말야.{nl}
column4: Itu hanya tampak tidak normal seperti tanaman yang sangat besar itu.{nl}

column2: Well whatever the case, that tree vine seems to be perfect to test the reagent on.{nl}How about doing the last experiment together since we've crafted the reagent together?
column3: 뭐 어쨌든 그 나무 덩굴이 시약을 시험해보기엔 딱인 것 같아.{nl}우리가 같이 완성한 시약인데, 마지막까지 같이 확인해보지 않을래?
column4: Yah apa pun itu, yang tanaman rambat itu tampaknya sempurna untuk menguji reagent ini.{nl}Bagaimana bila kita melakukan percobaan terakhir bersama-sama karena kita telah membuat reagent ini bersama-sama?

column2: Did you see that? The vine grew and then crumbled!{nl}It's a success! Our reagent actually worked!
column3: 봤어? 덩굴이 커졌다가 바스라지는 거!{nl}성공이야! 우리가 만든 시약이 성공한거라고!
column4: Apakah kamu melihatnya? tanaman rambat tumbuh dan kemudian hancur!{nl} Ini sukses! reagent kita benar-benar bekerja!

column2: I can't believe that I completed a reagent without the help of Vaidotas...{nl}I'm so happy. The next Alchemist Master will be me when I show the family this reagent!{nl}
column3: 바이도타스 도움 없이 내가 시약을 완성시키다니..{nl}너무 기뻐. 이것만 있으면 차기 알케미스트 자리는 내 거야!{nl}
column4: Aku tidak percaya aku telah menyelesaikan reagent tanpa bantuan Vaidotas...{nl} Saya sangat senang. Alchemist Master berikutnya pastilah aku ketika aku menunjukkan kepada keluargaku reagent ini!{nl}

column2: So. Let's go the the Ownerless Reclaimed Land. {nl}I'm sure that we'll be able to get rid of the enormous {nl}plant there and stop the plants from expanding further.
column3: 자. 어서 주인 없는 개간지로 가자. {nl}이 시약이라면 거대 식물을 없애버릴 수 있을 거고 그럼 식물 폭주도 막을 수 있을 거야.
column4: Kalau begitu. Mari kita pergi ke Ownerless Reclaimed Land.{nl}Aku yakin kita dapat menyingkirkan{nl}tanaman besar di sana dan menghentikan meluasnya tanaman itu lebih lanjut.

column2: Alchemist Master
column3: 알케미스트 마스터
column4: Alchemist Master

column2: Lucienne Winterspoon...{nl}May I ask how you came to learn of the name of that troublemaker?{nl}
column3: 루시엔 윈터스푼이라..{nl}그 사고뭉치 이름은 어떻게 알고 오셨는지요?{nl}
column4: Lucienne Winterspoon...{nl} Bolehkah saya bertanya bagaimana kamu mempelajari nama dari pengacau itu?{nl}

column2: What? You've brought me a reagent that she made in Nahash Forest?{nl}Please give that to me. What has she concocted up this time...{nl}
column3: 네? 그 아이가 나하스 숲에서 만든 시약을 가져오셨다고요?{nl}이리 보여 주세요. 이번엔 또 무슨 사고를 치려고..{nl}
column4: Apa? Kamu telah membawakanku reagent yang ia buat di Nahas Forest?{nl} Tolong berikan padaku. Apa yang ia ramu kali ini...{nl}

column2: ...Oh dear. {nl}Did you perhaps test this reagent? {nl}
column3: ..맙소사. {nl}이 시약 시험은 해본 겁니까? {nl}
column4: ...Oh{nl} Apakah kamu telah menguji reagent ini?{nl}

column2: This reagent accelerates plant growth.{nl}The plant will crumble if it doesn't have the strength to withstand it but if it does...{nl}
column3: 이건 식물 폭주를 촉진하게 되어 있어요.{nl}식물이 그 힘을 버티지 못하면 바스라지겠지만, 버텨낼 만한 힘이 있다면..{nl}
column4: Reagent ini mempercepat pertumbuhan tanaman.{nl} Tanaman akan hancur bila tidak memiliki kekuatan untuk bertahan dari itu, tapi bila bisa bertahan...{nl}

column2: We don't have time for this.{nl}Knowing Lucienne, she might have already gone to use the reagent somewhere.{nl}
column3: 이러고 있을 때가 아니에요.{nl}루시엔 성격이면 이미 시약을 사용하러 갔을지도 모릅니다.{nl}
column4: Kami tidak punya waktu untuk hal ini.{nl}Mengenai Lucienne, ia mungkin telah pergi untuk menggunakan reagent itu di suatu tempat.{nl}

column2: I'll give you this counteragent. Please hurry and give this to Lucienne.
column3: 제가 만든 중화제를 드릴테니 이걸 어서 루시엔에게 전해주세요.
column4: Saya akan memberikanmu counteragent ini. Tolong cepat dan memberikan ini kepada Lucienne.

column2: What took you so long?{nl}You said you'd ask Vaidotas didn't you?
column3: 뭘 꾸물거리는 거야.{nl}바이도타스에게 물어보고 오겠다면서?
column4: Apa yang membuatmu begitu lama?{nl} Kau bilang akan bertanya kepada Vaidotas bukan?

column2: Having a healthy amount of scholarly ambition is something to be commemorated.{nl}But passion past her skills is not good for Lucienne.
column3: 학구열이 뛰어나다는 건 분명히 좋은 일입니다.{nl}하지만 실력을 따라가지 못하는 열정은 루시엔에게 독이에요.
column4: Memiliki ambisi akan ilmu pengetahuan adalah sesuatu yang bagus.{nl} Namun hasrat yang melampaui kemampuannya tidaklah baik untuk Lucienne.

column2: ...Okay. I guess I was wrong this time.{nl}Something bad could have happened without Vaidotas' help.{nl}
column3: ..그래. 이번엔 내가 틀렸어.{nl}바이도타스의 도움이 없었으면 더 큰일이 났을지도 모르지.{nl}
column4: ...Baik. Saya rasa saya memang salah kali ini.{nl} Sesuatu yang buruk bisa terjadi tanpa bantuan dari Vaidotas.{nl}

column2: That doesn't mean that I've lost to Vaidotas though!{nl}Don't you know that failure is the mother of success?{nl}
column3: 그렇다고 내가 바이도타스에게 진 건 아니야!{nl}실패는 성공의 어머니라는 말 알아?{nl}
column4: Itu tidak berarti bahwa saya sudah kalah dari Vaidotas!{nl}Tahukah kamu bahwa kegagalan adalah awal dari kesuksesan?{nl}

column2: I've failed miserably this time so I'm going to get a great breakthrough soon!{nl}
column3: 나는 대실패를 했으니까 대성공을 하게 될거라고!{nl}
column4: Aku telah gagal total kali ini jadi aku akan segera mencari terobosan besar secepatnya!{nl}

column2: There's no time for this.{nl}I think I can do the rest of the experiments by myself.{nl}
column3: 이러고 있을 시간이 없어.{nl}이제 남은 실험은 나 혼자서도 할 수 있을 것 같아.{nl}
column4: Tak ada waktu untuk ini.{nl} Saya rasa saya bisa melakukan eksperimen lainnya sendiri. {nl}

column2: Farewell then. I thank you for all the help you've given me. {nl}I never forget my debts, so I will repay it one day by helping you.
column3: 그럼 이만. 그래도 여태껏 도와줘서 정말 고마웠어. {nl}난 도와준 은인은 절대 잊지 않으니까 언젠간 꼭 내 도움을 받을 일이 있을 거야.
column4: Sampai Jumpa. Terima kasih atas semua bantuan yang telah kamu berikan padaku.{nl} Saya tidak pernah melupakan hutang ini, saya akan membayarnya suatu hari nanti dengan membantumu.

column2: No... Wait...{nl}Why is Vaidotas being brought up in this?!{nl}
column3: 아니.. 잠깐만..{nl}여기서 바이도타스 얘기가 왜 나와!{nl}
column4: Jangan... Tunggu... {nl} Mengapa Vaidotas disangkutpautkan dalam hal ini?!{nl}

column2: It's me who succeeded in the experiment, so why should Vaidotas get to see this?{nl}I've mixed this reagent, so why should Vaidotas...{nl}
column3: 실험에 성공한건 난데 왜 이걸 바이도타스에게 보여주겠다는 거야?{nl}이건 내가 완성한 것이거든? 바이도타스 따위한테 이걸..{nl}
column4: Akulah yang berhasil melakukan eksperimen, jadi mengapa Vaidotas harus melihat ini?{nl} Saya sudah mencampur reagent ini, jadi mengapa harus Vaidotas...{nl}

column2: Is it because the vine we tested it on grew a bit?{nl}What does that have to do with anything. It's gone thanks to my reagent!{nl}
column3: 설마 아까 덩굴이 잠깐 크게 자라났던 것 때문에 그래?{nl}그게 무슨 상관이야. 덩굴은 내 시약 덕분에 이미 사라졌는 걸!{nl}
column4: Apakah karena tanaman rambat yang kita uji tumbuh sedikit?{nl} Apa hubungannya itu dengan hal lainnya. Itu hancur berkat reagent-ku!{nl}

column2: ...If it bothers you that much, you go by yourself.{nl}I don't want to go. Do as you please.
column3: ..그게 그렇게 신경쓰이면 너 혼자 갔다와.{nl}나는 가기 싫어. 마음대로 해.
column4: ...Jika itu membuatmu begitu khawatir, Kamu pergilah sendiri.{nl}Aku tidak ingin pergi. Lakukan sesukamu.

column2: Even though it's a bit infuriating, but Vaidotas took {nl}a look at my reagent's ingredients and mix ratio.{nl}It seems that I should have used Spion Teeth instead of the leaves.{nl}
column3: 조금 분하지만, 바이도타스가 내 시약 성분을 분석해서 배합 재료와 비율을 봐줬어.{nl}알고 보니 스피온의 나뭇잎이 아니라 이빨이더라고.{nl}
column4: Meskipun sedikit kesal, Vaidotas mengambil serta{nl} melihat bahan dari reagent dan rasio penyampurannya.{nl} Sepertinya aku harus menggunakan Spion Teeth bukan Leaves.{nl}

column2: I can get the rest of the materials, but Spions are still to much for me...{nl}Could you get me some Spion Teeth?
column3: 다른 재료는 다 내가 구할 수 있는데 역시 스피온은 만만치 않아..{nl}나 대신 스피온의 이빨 좀 부탁해도 될까?
column4: Aku bisa mendapatkan bahan lainnya, tetapi Spions masih terlalu sulit bagiku...{nl} Bisakah kamu mendapatkan Spion Teeth untukku?

column2: Well... It would be nice if this mix ratio succeeds..{nl}It will mean that Vaidotas is wrong if it fails so...{nl}
column3: 뭐.. 이 배합 비율로 성공하면 좋은 거고..{nl}실패해도 바이도타스가 틀린 거니까..{nl}
column4: Nah... Akan menyenangkan jika rasio penyampuran ini berhasil..{nl} Itu berarti Vaidotas salah jika ini gagal... {nl}

column2: It would seem rude to not proceed with the experiment when he's being so considerate...
column3: 이렇게 까지 신경 써주는데 안 해보는 것도 예의가 아닌 것 같고..
column4: Tampaknya tidak sopan bila tidak melanjutkan ke tahap eksperimen ketika ia begitu penuh antusias…

column2: Thanks. {nl}I'm going to humiliate Vaidotas after succeeding and improving the reagent!
column3: 고마워. {nl}꼭 성공한 다음에 여기에 개량을 거쳐서 바이도타스의 코를 눌러줄 거야!
column4: Terima kasih.{nl} Aku akan mempermalukan Vaidotas setelah berhasil dan mengembangkan reagent ini!

column2: Are you planning on going elsewhere?{nl}Hm... Well then...{nl}
column3: 혹시 다른 곳으로 갈 생각이야?{nl}흠.. 그렇다면..{nl}
column4: Apakah kamu berencana untuk pergi ke tempat lain?{nl}Hm... Baiklah...{nl}

column2: I took a look at the soil from a farm on the Ownerless Reclaimed Land, and it was superb.{nl}I think that if I plant some experimental herbs there, they'll do well.{nl}
column3: 주인 없는 개간지에 밭을 보니까 토질이 엄청 좋더라고.{nl}거기에 실험용 약초 씨앗을 심으면 잘 자랄 것 같아서 말야.{nl}
column4: Aku melihat tanah dari sebuah peternakan di Ownerless Reclaimed Land, dan itu luar biasa.{nl}Saya rasa jika saya menanam beberapa tumbuhan eksperimental di sana, mereka akan tumbuh dengan baik.{nl}

column2: I'll give you the herb seeds. {nl}Could you plant them if you happen to pass by the Ownerless Reclaimed Land?{nl}Come on, you can help me out just a bit more can't you?
column3: 내가 약초 씨앗을 줄게. {nl}지나가는 길에 주인 없는 개간지를 지나게 되면 씨앗을 심어주지 않을래?{nl}그 정돈 해줄 수 있잖아?
column4: Aku akan memberikan benih tanaman obat.{nl} Bisakah kamu menanamnya jika kamu kebetulan melewati Ownerless Reclaimed Land?{nl} Ayolah, kamu dapat membantuku sedikit, bukan?

column2: I wouldn't have been able to get this far with the research without you.{nl}Even though I don't want to admit it, V-Vaidotas helped as well...
column3: 네가 없었다면 이번 실험은 여기까지 오지도 못했을거야.{nl}그리고 바.. 바이도타스도.. 분하지만 인정할 건 인정 해야겠지..
column4: Aku tidak akan bisa sampai sejauh ini melakukan penelitian tanpa bantuanmu.{nl} Meskipun saya tidak mau mengakuinya, V-Vaidotas juga membantu…

column2: Villager Nella
column3: 마을 주민 넬라
column4: Villager Nella

column2: Thank you for saving us at the monastery.{nl}I can't imagine what that swindler would've done to us if it wasn't for you...{nl}
column3: 수도원에서 저희를 구해주셔서 정말 감사했어요.{nl}당신이 아니었으면 그 사기꾼에게 속아서 어떻게 되었을지..{nl}
column4: Terima kasih karena telah menyelamatkan kami di monastery.{nl}AKu tidak bisa membayangkan apa yang penipu akan lakukan kepada kami kalau tidak ada dirimu...{nl}

column2: Still, the swindler's incantation seems to be having a bit of an effect.{nl}We haven't been attacked by monsters for a while.{nl}
column3: 그래도 그 사기꾼의 주술이 효과가 있긴 한가봐요.{nl}적어도 몬스터에게 공격을 받진 않고 있으니 말이예요.{nl}
column4: Namun, mantranya tampak memberikan sedikit efek.{nl} Kami tidak diserang oleh monster untuk sementara waktu.{nl}

column2: Well, that doesn't mean that we can live in harmony with the monsters.{nl}We also don't know when we'll be attacked by the monsters again because the incantation's effect will wear off later.{nl}
column3: 뭐, 그렇다고 해서 몬스터랑 함께 공존할 수는 없는 노릇이죠.{nl}언제 주술이 풀려서 다시 공격을 받을지도 모르는 일이고요.{nl}
column4: Nah, itu bukan berarti kita dapat hidup selaras dengan monster.{nl} Kami juga tidak tahu kapan akan diserang oleh monster lagi karena efek mantra akan hilang nantinya.{nl}

column2: Could you help deal with the monsters near the town?{nl}It'll be much safer if you could help out a little.
column3: 혹시 마을 주변 몬스터를 처리하는데 도움을 주실 수 있나요?{nl}당신이 도와주신다면 더 안전해질거에요.
column4: Bisakah kamu membantu menangani monster di dekat kota?{nl} Itu akan jauh lebih aman jika kamu bisa membantu sedikit.

column2: The village has been totally destroyed while we were trapped at the monastery.{nl}Well this... I suppose it was our own fault for getting tricked like that.
column3: 수도원에 가있는 사이에 마을이 허허벌판이 되어버렸네요.{nl}이거 참.. 속은 저희가 멍청했죠.
column4: Desa telah hancur total sementara kami terjebak di monastery.{nl}Hmm... aku kira itu adalah kesalahan kami sendiri karena tertipu seperti itu.

column2: Thank you.{nl}Oh, I don't think you'll have to worry about the rest of the monsters.{nl}
column3: 감사합니다.{nl}아, 나머지 몬스터는 걱정 안하셔도 돼요. {nl}
column4: Terima kasih.{nl}Oh, aku rasa kamu tidak perlu khawatir mengenai para monster lainnya.{nl}

column2: Lucienne Winterspoon said that she'll craft us monster repellant while she stays here.{nl}I hope you'll stay safe on your travels.
column3: 루시엔 윈터스푼님께서 여기 머무시는 동안 몬스터를 쫓는 약을 만들어주신다고 했거든요.{nl}모쪼록 몸 조심하시길 바랄게요.
column4: Lucienne Winterspoon mengatakan bahwa ia akan membuatkan kami ramuan anti monster sambil menetap di sini.{nl}Aku harap kamu akan tetap aman di setiap perjalananmu.

column2: Welcome. Brother.{nl}Have you come to be redeemed by us of the Tree of Truth?{nl}
column3: 어서 오십시오. 형제여.{nl}혹시 저희 진리의 나무 교단에 구원 받으러 오셨습니까?{nl}
column4: Selamat datang. Saudaraku.{nl} Apakah kamu datang untuk menjadi salah satu dari Tree of Truth?{nl}

column2: If so, welcome.{nl}I was just educating the believers of our creed.{nl}How about you join us for a moment.
column3: 그렇다면 잘 오셨습니다.{nl}마침 신도들에게 교리를 전하고 있었거든요.{nl}잠시 함께해 보시는 건 어떻습니까.
column4: Jika ya, Selamat datang.{nl} Aku mengajari para believer mengenai keyakinan kami.{nl} Bagaimana denganmu, mau ikut bergabung dengan kami sejenak.

column2: Good. {nl}Now, I shall begin the sermon.{nl}
column3: 좋습니다. {nl}설교를 시작하도록 하겠습니다.{nl}
column4: Baik.{nl}Sekarang, saya akan memulainya.{nl}
